Name: Business Analyst
Description: The Business Analyst utilizes industry experience to analyze RealPage product enhancement opportunities and determine the appropriate solution. The BA writes design and process requirements and also serves as the product expert assisting internal and external  clients to maximize the success of RealPage products. Additionally, the BA manages the product enhancement lifecycle from analysis and design through client acceptance, training, and marketing of the product. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESResponsibilities include, but are not limited to:Gather requirements from both internal and external subject matter expertsDevelop high-quality design and requirements documents within a scheduled timeframe with minimal direct supervisionLead project and business process analysis sessionsOrganize, participate, and conduct application demonstrations, and other internal or external presentationsAssist in identifying solutions to product and/or design problemsReport on project status on a weekly basisContribute to process improvement/efficiency projectsBuild and maintain positive relationships with customers and internal staffManage tasks to meet assigned project datesREQUIRED KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIESMinimum of 5 years’ experience as a software development business analyst; equivalent internal RealPage experience may be consideredBachelor’s degree highly preferredStrong project management and documentation skills required (writing user-interface design/business requirements) includes excellent written and verbal communication skillsAn understanding of basic accounting principles preferred but not requiredMust be able to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic team environmentMust have the proven ability to communicate complicated subject matter effectively to internal and external management and work collaboratively with interdepartmental teams to achieve desired resultsMust be able to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyMust have strong analytical and problem solving skillsExcellent follow-up skills requiredSome multi-family real estate experience is preferred (specifically in the Student housing industry)Work experience in a .net environment and knowledge of SQL a plus #LI-RS1

Name: Analyst, DITAC Performance Management
Description: We currently have an Analyst,DITAC Performance Managementcareer opportunity at our Dallas, TX location.Essilor is an international company and the leading provider of eyeglass lenses in the world. Our mission is improving lives by improving sight, and we work every day to bring good vision to the 4.5 billion people around the globe in need of visual correction. Our products such as Varilux®, Crizal® and Transitions® are available in more than 130 countries and are worn by one billion people daily. Essilor of America and its subsidiary, Essilor Laboratories of America, Inc., employ more than 7,000 in the U.S. and own the largest and most comprehensive optical laboratory network in the U.S.Position Summary – Purpose and Objectives of the RoleDigital is at the heart of consumer awareness and interaction (search, select, buy) in our category and plays a key role in delivering on our Mission and growth objectives. Towards this end, we seek to establish a leadership position in providing consumers with information and tools to enhance their vision.The DITAC Performance Management Analyst is responsible for measuring the impact of the DITAC program across all facets (consumer acquisition, lead generation through pathways, retention) into a consistent, replicable set of measurement tools and reports that provides both executives and the operating teams with insights on progress and areas of opportunity. He/she gathers data and provides reports to support staff and managers planning, defining and monitoring performance as well as tracking risks relating to strategies. H/She is responsible for KPI monitoring and tracking, helping to measure and optimize the effectiveness of strategies.Main Focus & Challenges and Key Areas of ResponsibilitiesScope of the role:The main scope of the role entails tracking performance of programs and using creative processes to suggest improvements.Specific Responsibilities of the Role Include:Develop and implement management scorecards for the full suite of DITAC initiatives (spanning multiple pathways and Bus).Finding underlying reasons for data trends (report and show analysis of data found).Monitoring and producing up to date analytics and reports (using data models, reporting tools, training, testing & review, etc.) for strategies.Identify opportunities for enhancing and updating strategies based on data to eliminate non-value adding activities.Candidate ProfileKnowledge / ExperienceDivisional or BU ExperienceExperience in doing data analysis for a global firm.Experience / Track RecordData scientist in consumer facing domain.Proficient in data analysis tools (excel, Tableau, etc.).Experience working in a matrix environment with multiple Businesses.Ability to frame up and communicate complex data models at a granular and executive level.Experience in Program Management and Community management.Experience in monitoring and gathering value, spending and savings data.Forecasting budget prices and executing financial bridging to the budget.Gathering and providing reports on the development of supplier performance.Deep understanding of analytics and decision support technology tools.Industries ExperienceFMCG, media, finance, marketingGeographical ExperienceGlobal experience highly preferredManagement ExperienceQualificationsEducation / Qualification / CertificationDegree in business, statistics, financeLanguageExcellent proficiency in English. Proficiency in other languages is a plus.Pre-requisites and Next Career StepsPsychometricsEffective decision-making capacityEffective at managing complex and multiple sources of information to provide insightGood program management skillsEffective collaboration skillsAccurate fact-based approachMotivated by facts and impact of workIndependent, able to work alone, but also to collaborate with teamHighly developed analytics skillsGood problem solving skillsCurious to find reasons for changing consumer behavior (curious nature)Deep understanding of analytics and technological tools that support decision making Back Share

Name: Senior Product Business Analyst - Remote
Description: Medecision is transforming healthcare one cool app at a time!  Are you the kind of person that is motivated by the challenge of a dynamic, changing market? Can you utilize and exploit progressive systems and processes to satisfy urgent business needs? Are you a good partner with your teammates; driven to execute team and individual commitments that align with business vision? Does the idea of a high visibility and high impact role in a medium-sized, growing company excite you? Are you interested in being part of a team that strives to achieve high business impact, execution excellence and has a lot of fun while we are doing it? Are you ready? We are! Join us in our journey toward liberating today’s fragmented healthcare systems to Connect Care Everywhere.  Medecision is looking for a Senior Product Business Analyst, a passionate power contributor who blends solid requirements definition and analysis skills to contribute to cutting-edge SaaS products.  You will work as a conduit between our product management, customers, and engineering teams to bridge our Product Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and our Agile SDLC methodologies. You will bring deep expertise in gathering business requirements, technical and functional specifications, and user stories that will help develop our product capabilities. You will consult with internal and external stakeholders to identify specific needs within across our application modules to ensure our capabilities solve customer problems. You will play a critical role in supporting the success of the overall product vision and strategy. THIS JOB MIGHT BE FOR YOU, IF…You, as the Senior Product Business Analyst, have deep knowledge and expertise in driving technical and functional requirements of product solutions offered to Payer and Provider markets (for example Commercial Plans; Medicare and Medicaid; MSSP; Duals; and CMS incentive plans). You will need to have a passion for user-centered design to enable our customers to achieve the outcomes they are seeking. In partnership with the Product Manager, you will need to look across the product portfolio and identify integration and user-centered designs that contribute to an exceptional experience for our customers. You will contribute to the overall product delivery, including the requirements on how the product integrates across and into our other solution offerings. You must enjoy spending time solving problems using the latest technical approaches and have a strong understanding of functional usability, technical design and software development to find innovative solutions that translate to a world-class commercial software product. Reports to: Vice President, Product Management Location(s): Philadelphia, PA; Dallas, TX; RemoteResponsibilitiesYOU’RE GOOD AT:Formulating and defining the product features to accomplish the release product scope and objectives, based on user needs and business processes with a comprehensive understanding of the current business model and operational needs as well as product vision and strategy.Eliciting the requirements needed to carry out business processes including interviews, intelligence analysis and survey assessments. During the elicitation process, the analyst is able to develop workflow and system diagrams to support the analysis and the business discussions. The analyst has the ability to identify business requirements and workflows that are common and exception handling across the market segments and personas.Translating business needs, processes and procedures into a workable system, and articulates on specific software requirements by communicating about these requirements with technology experts and business stakeholders. Representing the voice of the customer to the development teams.Working closely with development leads and other technology staff to deliver project results while implementing risk analysis and meeting required deliverables. Can conduct interface analysis to identify data translations, and operational supportability.Working closely with development and QA to troubleshoot and conduct problem solving sessions when issues are identified during the development life cycle. Can identify gaps and provide remediation to the product scope and vision.Pursuing opportunities to improve industry knowledge related to the priorities and needs of Medecision's clients as well as improve on personal professional management/ leadership development. Can participate on a process improvement work stream which provides innovated recommendations for process changes.QualificationsYOU HAVE:Bachelor’s Degree in Health Sciences, Computer Science or Business preferred, clinical degree is optional, but preferred.7+ years experience as an application Business Analyst in a healthcare organization or a HIT vendor.Demonstrated experience working in a product development lifecycle model (PDLM) and Agile environment.Ability to gain deep subject matter expertise in regard to functions/modules of a complex business-to-business (B2B) application framework/platform.Strong experience leading complex business requirements definition and analysis activitiesExpertise in analyzing requirements and communicate them to Product and/or Development as the Voice of the CustomerProven experience creating and maintaining product documentation / artifactsTechnical background, with experience in SaaS and HIT system design.Experience facilitating sessions with stakeholders and team to ensure business requirements are defined that ensure a successful product implementation to support the business and market requirements.Ability to work with development/QA and business users to coordinate and assist with the successful product user acceptance testing.Experience working with customers on evolving designs and serving as an advocate for the Voice of the Customer to inspire a Human-Centered Design approach.Experience working with various product roapmap and software development project management tracking tools is required, experience using Aha! or JIRA is highly preferred.The ability and desire to work in a fast paced, dynamic, and exciting environment.A high-energy, creatively-driven, hard-working and an inspiring innovative spirit.A passion for great products and a desire to delight customers.The ability to sift through details quickly and determine what’s important.A strong and focused desire to be a team player and collaborator.The ability to articulate customer needs and Medecision delivery capabilities to expedite time to value.Ability to travel up to 20% based on location.OUR CULTURE DRIVES US It’s not all about what we do. It’s as much about how we do it. Medecision team members show up. We consistently exemplify our 6 core values of success: Execution. Service – We deliver “standing ovation” service. Speed – We are Agile. Ownership— We all take ownership and responsibility for how we deliver our promises, how we spend money, who we hire, what we build and how we help one another grow.Passion. We show an infectious emotional commitment to our work because what we do is important to our customers, one another and ourselves.Partnership. We are all in this together, without boundaries. Our internal/external network contains the solutions we need: we’ll continuously seek them out, use them and improve them.Leadership. We are Medecision’s brand. We are experts in care management, care coordination and healthcare information and technology. We lead our clients to excellent results by providing our expertise on best practices, industry trends, solutions development and innovations. We are moving in sync with an evolving industry. There is no problem we cannot solve.Innovation. We are in a constant state of discovery, inventiveness, thinking outside the box, and leading others internally and externally to do the same.Candor. Medecision communicates in a sincere, direct and famil­iar way. We address conflict directly and escalate issues internally and externally to address conflict with speed and partnership. Join us in our quest to liberate healthcare!  This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by an employee within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities and qualifications may vary based on assignment. Medecision is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst *Date Posted:** October 30, 2018 Apply  Not ready to Apply? *JOB DESCRIPTION** .As a Business Analyst working with Systems, Data, and the Client you will serve a key role for our outsourcing business by serving as the link between consultants, external clients and our internal team of system developers. You will contribute to the implementation of new services, and ongoing business by translating business needs into actionable programming and process steps for developers, practicing the fundamentals of systems analysis, design and testing. You will also consult to clients concerning implementation best practices, provide ongoing technical support, and train client teams. *The Role**A Few Select Responsibilities: + Ensure that all documentation starts from baseline and adheres to standards; communicate back to base team suggestions for changes or enhancements to standard documentation.  + Attends client meetings relevant to the components they have responsibility for, to establish client relationship and ensure complete understanding.  + Responsible for developing requirements documentation.  + Responsible for system configuration based on client requirements.  + Responsible for creating test plans, and testing system changes and enhancements to ensure completeness and accuracy. ?-Regression testing as necessary based on the nature of the system change/enhancement.  + Identify reporting needs and requirements.  + Understand SOW and be responsible for change order identification and assist with providing work and hours necessary to draft the change order.  + Work closely with developer to ensure project requirements/requests for changes are understood and within standards.  + Provide guidance to other team members regarding best/standard practices.  + Provide guidance/assistance to team members where needed to help ensure issues are resolved by assigned due date. Escalate concerns with ability to meet due dates to PM.  + Lead analyst for annual enrollment with similar responsibilities as Implementation BA during OE project.  + Train and help transition ongoing processing requirements to BSA.  + Lead client requirements meetings as needed.  + Maintain and update all requirements documents, ensuring adherence to standards.  + Research issues and cases to determine root cause and provide impact analysis for ongoing issues and changes and requests for new functionality.  + Addresses all calc or data issues that impact carriers.  + Assist PM with development of Project Plan for open enrollment and significant change orders.  + Responsible for any vendor file updates and ongoing support.  + Provide training for client on large-scale change orders to client, BOC and Service Center, as needed. *The Requirements** + Desire to learn, accept new challenges, and have fun!  + 5 years? experience as a Business Analyst  + Understanding of the fundamentals of health and welfare and broader benefit plan design preferred  + Ability to complete Willis Towers Watson Business Analyst training program  + Intermediate to advanced SQL skills  + Experience with relational databases including SQL, Oracle or Access preferred  + Experience with test plan creation, testing procedures and test plan execution  + Strong analytical, integrative and problem solving skills  + Solid interpersonal skills and client service orientation  + Ability to work both independently and on client teams, including virtual work teams with members in different geographic regions  + Strong organizational abilities and flexibility to work in a performance driven environment managing multiple project priorities  + Sense of accountability, owning one?s work and taking pride in it; commitment to quality and continuous improvement  + Ability to travel and work extended hours as needed *The Company** Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas ? the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com. *Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer** Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. *Equal Employment Opportunity: Know your rights.** Unsolicited Contact: Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Willis Towers Watson are considered property of Willis Towers Watson and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorized Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Willis Towers Watson, any such agency must have an existing formal written agreement signed by an authorized Willis Towers Watson recruiter and an active working relationship with the organization. Resumes must be submitted according to our candidate submission process, which includes being actively engaged on the particular search. Likewise, for our authorized Recruitment Agencies/Search Firms, if the candidate submission process is not followed, no agency fees will be paid by Willis Towers Watson. Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer.  Apply  Not ready to Apply? at https://willistowerswatson.avature.net/WTWTalentNetwork *SHARE WITH:** + Share on Facebook  + Share on Twitter  + Share on Google+ Share on Pinterest  + Share on Linkedin  + Share by Mail *JOB SNAPSHOT** + Location:Dallas, TX, USSan Diego, CAHouston, TX  + Date Posted:October 30, 2018

Name: Business Analyst/Quality Assurance
Description: Job Summary: The BA/QA group is responsible for the creation of all business requirements including process models, use cases, project plans and overall quality control of the internal system development. This position is responsible for planning and implementing business process analysis and technology plans. This position is also responsible for ensuring that IT solutions are in alignment with customer business objectives and initiatives. This individual will work with different groups within IT and business organizations to develop and prepare system requirements, designs, test plans and test cases. This role is responsible for identifying and documenting requirements and analyzing these requirements from a business perspective. Responsibilities:Must be able to perform the roles of a Sr. Business Analyst.Work with the program services business divisions to develop an overall system strategy in conjunction with application development.Managing application systems development throughout the full SDLC, coordinating resources, insuring on-time deliverables, and managing expectations.Develop positive and professional business relationships with internal and external users.Eliciting, documenting, and maintaining functional and non-functional requirements including system overviews, functional narratives, and detailed Use Cases.Planning and leading JAD sessions and designing the resulting business processes.Working with application developers to achieve a technical system design that satisfies the defined requirements and functional system design.Resolving design issues and project conflicts and setting project task priorities. .Supervising the development and execution of Test Cases in both System Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Knowledge of the development, test, release and support processes.Thorough understanding of, and experience in, software quality assurance testing processes, methodologies, and procedures.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to explain systems issues to non-technical users.Must be passionate about determining business requirements and contributing to software quality.Ability to balance high quality standards with schedule pressures.Ability to adapt to departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges.Ability to make decisions guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager.Ability to provide technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers.Requirements:High school diploma or equivalent required.Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferred.5+ years of work experience gathering requirements, writing test plans and procedures, tracking errors, documenting results.Demonstrated expertise in extracting business requirements using standard methodologies, and procedures. (Full SDLC)Strong experience with systems analysis and functional design.Extensive experience with documentation and problem resolution.Experienced in mentoring and supervising direct reports.Experience with agile software development methodologies is a plus.Previous experience with automated testing tools is a plus.Previous accounting, finance or actuarial experience is a plus.Previous insurance industry experience is a plus.Previous development experience is a plus.Other Information:Vibrant company cultureOn-site exercise facilityCompany Paid Health & Life 100%Paid PTO & HolidaysOptional: Dental, Vision, 401K and moreLocation: North Dallas: Spring Valley Rd. and Midway (75244) We do not provide sponsorships.  Agentra Healthcare Solutions creates lasting and affordable healthcare solutions to the uninsured, underinsured and small business owners. Established in 2005 and based in Dallas, TX (75244), we are a dynamic and rapidly growing insurance provider of affordable proprietary "boutique" products for life, health and dental. Agentra has been able to meet the needs of our rapidly expanding client base through strategic partnerships with top rated insurance carriers and benefit providers that have created exclusive products and benefit plans designed to meet the needs of our clients.  Agentra Healthcare Solutions excels as an organization and as individuals by being consumer focused and helping others achieve their goals. We believe there's no substitute for a strong honest work ethic and we think having some fun is part of our success!  Our company is experiencing accelerated growth creating opportunity for current and new employees. Come be a part of our success!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: BUSINESS ANALYSTSummary This position involves analysis, design, and consulting support, as well as developing an understanding of our clients’ strategic direction, issues, and project goals. The successful candidate must be able to bridge the gap between user-functionality and system developers and assist in documenting, evaluating, and translating business architectures and needs into IT applications. An understanding of consulting methodologies within the financial services industry (Strategy work, business case development, process mapping, the lifecycle of project implementation, requirements gathering, competitive assessment) is an essential factor for success in this role. Examples of deliverables/responsibilities include:Preparing, facilitating, documenting and participating in the client meetings/workshopsConducting structured gathering, research and analysis o Developing and evaluating procedures, controls, user requirements and functional specifications to identify gaps between current state and future stateCreating business requirement documents (BRD’s) into use cases/functional specifications for customizationRequirements gathering, functional requirements, user stories and documentation business/data/application/technology architectures, requirements and business rules Business process models/design, logical data models, standards and guidanceDocumenting and explaining problems and works to resolve software defects while ensuring technical compatibility and end-user satisfactionAnalyzing, developing and proposing enhancements to current business processes, reports and applications to optimize system effectivenessConducting customer interviews and producing meeting summariesConducting market/client research and industry analysis of requirementsProducing high-quality verbal and written consulting deliverables (including proposals, customer presentations, consulting reports) to communicate project findings effectivelyGenerating re-usable intellectual capital in the form of consulting methodology and templates, blueprints and business casesBasic scripting and project plansRequired Skills2+ years of experienceBachelor’s degree required with a major in MIS, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Business or Financial Engineering preferred. (An advanced degree is desirable)Background in financial services or Energy a plusSolid Business Analyst skills, including experience interviewing client executives to gather and document business requirements and process mappingStrong presentation skills, extensive experience writing successful project proposals, experience planning and executing related projectsAbility to demonstrate project management skills and experienceMust have previous consulting experience

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Be part of our Growth Story Do you have a passion for people? Are you a go-getter, full of new ideas and eager to be part of a team that’s committed to helping some of the most recognized brands across North America deliver better experiences for their customers?  Vixxo has been helping to keep the world’s best-loved brands running smoothly since 1980. As a leader in facilities management, Vixxo helps to optimize and maintain equipment lifespans and realize greater revenue through better customer experiences About the Role As a member of the Analytics team, the Decision Support Analyst enables customer success and loyalty by providing data-driven decision support to customers. This role generates insights about facility management (FM) programs to help customers achieve cost savings, improve asset uptime and optimize their FM spend. In close collaboration with customers, Account Managers, Account teams and other internal stakeholders, the Decision Support Analyst ensures that the analytical and reporting needs of customers are met in a timely, accurate and value-oriented manner. Essential FunctionsProvides decision support to customers through the collection, analysis, and interpretation of operational and financial performance data. Uses analytical findings to propose FM strategies and solutions for customers. Performs trend analyses to uncover patterns in customer performance data that guide business decisions and drive cost savings and operational efficiencies in the customer’s FM program.Proactively develops a strong understanding of the customer’s FM program and Vixxo’s operations. Performs root cause analyses to address business questions and problems and identify FM performance improvement opportunities that enable customers to reach their FM goals and objectives.Develops and maintains all reporting required by the customer. Defines and documents reporting requirements and partners closely with the Business Intelligence and Reporting Strategy team to automate recurring reports. Proposes and implements reporting enhancements as needed in order to meet evolving customer needs.Drives improvements in data quality by partnering with Account teams, Operations, Finance, the Data Governance Office and IT to research data anomalies and recommend changes to data policy, processes, procedures, and systems.Prepares and presents analytical and/or reporting results to customers and internal leadership in conjunction with the Account Manager as neededUses analytical findings to inform recommendations for internal operational or financial process improvementsEstablishes a professional and trusting relationship with customersAbout YouBachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Finance, Mathematics, Economics or other related field required.5+ years of experience in collecting, analyzing, interpreting and presenting operational and financial dataAdvanced skills in SQL, MS Excel, and MS PowerPointExperience developing queries to retrieve data from multi-object, relational databasesAbility to visually represent and communicate insights so they can be easily understood by customers and internal stakeholdersAbility to clearly and compellingly articulate the strategic and tactical implications of analytical findingsAbility to effectively manage multiple priorities simultaneously and develop clear objectives, goals, and action plans to meet or exceed customer expectations in a fast-paced environmentFamiliarity with P&L reporting (including cost, margin, allocations)Familiarity with budgets and forecastingAbility to foster collaborative and professional partnerships and teamwork throughout the organizationExcellent critical thinking and problem-solving skillsMust be highly customer-centricExhibits a high degree of initiative, self-motivation and seeks to continuously learn and growExperience with Business Objects or Tableau preferred

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Apex Clearing was brought to life by the idea that the development of integrative technology can improve how business is done. The passion for that idea powers our firm still. As a Business Analystat Apex you are free to explore unique solutions and try fresh ideas that may benefit our financial services business. You’ll collaborate with Apex's sharpest minds to use data to drive business decision making. Working at Apex Clearing means that you’ll always be presented with a variety of new possibilities as you continue to enhance your skills. We’re looking for someone who:Is passionate. You have a genuine passion for data, modeling and analysis to drive decision making across all levels of the business. You love using technology differently to maximize insight and business impact and you have a way of bringing out that same fire in the people you work withIs motivated. You’re driven to be the best – whether that’s decreasing onboarding time or making an innovative change to “how it’s always been done.” You challenge yourself by setting goals and exceeding themIs collaborative.You’re excited to work with fellow data junkies and big thinkers. You know how to collaborate across the organization and communicate with less technical team members to find a solution to pain pointsWants to make an impact. You’re looking to do amazing work. You’re all about using technology to improve efficiency and effect the company's bottom line.What you’ll do all day:Defining and analyzing data that will generate insights and help support our core businessBuilding state of the art modelsActing as a thought leader for the firm with your ideas and projects enabling data driven decision makingHelping to define best practices within our analytics team to increase efficiency and thus create even more business impact.Collaborating with Analytics team members and people across the business to get the best out of the collective teamA few reasons why you might love us:We’re a leader in the space.Apex is recognized for disrupting the financial services industry, enabling fintech standouts like Stash, Robinhood and Betterment. We’ve got an amazing track record of success and we foster ongoing innovation. So you get all the benefits of a proven, growing company, while enjoying a very entrepreneurial cultureWe see data analytics differently. You’ll work with people who apply innovative approaches to analysis and modeling. We are passionate engineers dedicated to finding new and different ways to use technology and data to drive the business forward.Your work will have immediate impact. You’ll be able to see your direct impact on our business. You won’t be just another talented analyst chained to a desk or ticket queue.And a few reasons why you may not like working for us:You don’t like change. This is not a job for someone who likes “predictable.” We embrace and drive the business toward needed change for our future success.You’re not the collaborative type. We work together to ensure the best possible solutions for the business. We think two brains are better than one so we do most of our work together and often with other departments. Team work makes the dream work on this team.You’re not a people person. We work with people across the organization to understand the data from a business perspective and ensure our results will be actionable by Apex.The skills you’ll need to succeed:2-4 years working as a Business Analyst, Quantitative Analyst or comparable experienceExperience with MS ExcelExperience with SQL and Python or RExperience with relational databasesExperience with statistical analysis techniquesFamiliarity with Sisense, Tableau or similar Data visualization tools

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Project Business AnalystLevel of experience: Intermediate level Business Analyst with more than 2 years’ experience. Job Description:Requirements ManagementBusiness process modeling and Business Process Management System (BPMS) implementation.Software/systems requirements development and definition including participation in and facilitation of Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions.Uniform Modeling Language (UML) requirements development (provided Use Cases, Supplementary Specifications and Business Rules documentation).Define user requirements by working with/interviewing Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) including developing/modifying Use Cases, Supplemental Specifications and Business Rules Documents and their associated requirements tagging and traceability in accordance with the IRS Requirements Repository Management Guide (RRMG).Conduct the documented peer review process for the requirements stage documents.Coordinate the Customer Technical Review (CTR) with SMEs for the project user requirement documents (such as Use Case Documents, Supplemental Specification Documents and Business Rules Documents).Define user requirements in accordance with IRS guidelines. The Contractor shall conduct functional, unit, system/integration, regression, smoke, load/performance and/or stability tests as applicable for each application release. Each applicable test shall be identified as a milestone in the WBS where appropriate. Use of industry-standard automated testing software (provided by the Government) is strongly encouraged. The amount and type of testing shall be commensurate with the size, scope, and risk of the requirement and the specific release. The Contractor shall: Complete all applicable system tests: Unit Testing (UT); integration Testing including Team Level Integration Test (TLIT), System Integration Test (SIT), Final Integration Test (FIT), and Accessibility Test; Regression Testing includes Comparison Test, Installation Test, Security Test, Smoke Test, and System Test.Provide support to the project to assess and fine-tune system performance to optimize results.Provide support to the project to get system ready for Independent System Acceptance (ISAT) and Deployment Site Readiness Testing (DSRT) (e.g., supply interim builds, complete application registration, update technical brochure, supply ReadMe, submit Standard Image Above Baseline Application Test Plans, provide final build for deployment per the Integrated Master Schedule (IMS).Thoroughly test code through the phases of applicable system tests outlined above. Ensure that work is documented, reviewed, and submitted according to the deliverable schedule. Name: Business Analyst

Business Analyst  Location: Dallas TX  Contract: 12 months contract to hire Job Scope: Conducts needs analysis to create quality solutions. Ensures solutions are aligned with stated requirements and comply with departmental standards. Manages activities to ensure solutions are delivered on time and within budget. Serves as a resource on the Cyber-security team focused on securely enabling the business and ensure effective communication. WORK ACTIVITIES/CONTEXT:Technical Expertise: Effectively applies knowledge and skills of analysis, business processes, tools, domains, project methodologies, requirements definitions, and testing to solve a range of problems while supporting the engineering area of the team, both from an operations as well as an engineering perspective.  Partners with other Technology Team members to provide advice or solutions within his or her area of expertise.  Stays informed about current developments within his or her expertise. Understands and can estimate effort and value for solutions  Understands at a broad level how technology platforms/architectures are applied to automated business solutions. Understands dependency identification processes in technology work, verifies information and carefully reviews and checks the accuracy of own work. Expresses oneself clearly in conversation and interaction with others.  Must be able to meet any physical ability requirements listed on this description. Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986. EDUCATION: BS, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Systems, or equivalent formal training required.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Organizations across the globe rely on OneSource Virtual for Workday services, support, optimization, and consulting. We create solutions built on the Workday application that empower customers to become strategic HR organizations, then scales with them as they grow. To date, OneSource Virtual offers HR outsourcing, IT outsourcing, application optimization, and consulting services to 500+ customers that represent more than 35 percent of Workday’s customer base.  Essential Functions/Duties/Responsibilities  · Act as key liaison with business owners, stakeholders, and development team to gather, analyze, and translate business and technical requirements into scalable solutions.  · Utilize their “mind for business” and the Agile methodology to iteratively create effective problem statements and user stories to deliver exceptional solutions that meet and exceed business objectives.  · Conduct deep dives into business process and function to evaluate, consult, and provide effective analysis in support of the development and implementation OneSource Virtual’s proprietary software.  · Design solutions and lead the efforts related to, End User Testing and Training, Change management, and Process Redesign for enhancements as well as new systems.  · Properly document solutions, through the use of various tools, to clearly communicate requirements, roles, and responsibilities to business and technical users.  Competencies  · Possess exceptional communication skills with the ability to talk to both business, UX Designers and technical teams from both OSV and our customers.  · Relevant experience in analysis, requirement gathering, design and development of enterprise application systems following an agile iterative approach.  · A forward thinker that understands the business implications of technical solutions as well as the effect on customers.  · Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.  · Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively in a fast paced environment.  Qualifications and Experience  · 2+ years of progressive experience in analysis, requirements gathering, design and development of enterprise application systems.  · BA/BS degree in Technology, Engineering, Science or equivalent practical experience.  · 2+ years of experience in process discovery and documentation including developing flow diagrams for business users and developers interfacing with ERP systems.  · 2+ years of experience in defining business roles and documenting technical system specifications  · Demonstrable verbal and written communication skills.  Preferred Skills  · Basic programming skills.  · Relevant experience in Benefits Administration, Financial & Accounting or Payroll Services. Workday and Salesforce experience a plus.  · Certifications in usability or relevant experience in visual design and wireframing tools.  You are encouraged to learn and share ideas when you join the OneSource Virtual team. We reward innovative thinking, fresh perspectives, creative collaboration, and hard work. As an organization experiencing routine strategic growth, we are always on the lookout for intelligent, talented, and forward-thinking professionals to join our team. OSV employees enjoy a values-based culture, upward mobility, and professional development with opportunities of all kinds.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Genesis10 is seeking a Business Analyst to work in Dallas on a contract supporting our financial industry client. Summary: Seeking a non-technical Business Analyst to assist with writing business requirements for Operations and Business line work streams that are part of a National Retail Digital Strategy program. Responsibilities: * Attend project meetings * Take business objectives that the client wants to accomplish and turn those into requirement statements * Write business requirements * Identify and analyze business problems and define the scope of activities required to address the issues, including requirement definition, process review, impact assessment and operational streamlining where appropriate. * Is involved in all aspects of projects, including documentation of project needs, analysis/research of needs and possible solutions, identifying technology and business solutions, gathering, documenting and updating business requirements; reviewing workflow process mapping; developing business testing strategies and working with project members to execute the test plan, recommending preferred solutions, and implementing recommendations. * Manages project documentation (implementation plan, issues log, process maps, etc.) and documents process flows and gaps. Assess, research, analyze and document sponsor/stakeholder needs. * Supports the Project Manager in planning, executing, controlling and closing phases. * Develop and maintain strong relationship with business partners and internal/external team members. * Identify issues and escalates/manages resolution as required. * Coordinates and provides support to the business with the process implementation. * Perform other duties as assigned. Requirements: * Microsoft Office experience * Document mapping * Risk/Compliance/Finance background * Ability to participate in meeting discussions about business line ideas of requirements and translate them into clear business requirements * Experience writing and gathering business requirements * Understanding of banking practices and concepts such as check/item processing, CRA, fraud concepts, and payments/funds transfers. * Technical writing is a plus * 5 + years of experience * Ability to quickly learn organizational structure, business strategies and processes. * Knowledgeable on business process modeling, process mapping. * Capable of writing clear and well-structured business requirements documents. If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply! About Genesis10: Genesis10 is a leading U.S. business and technology consulting firm with hundreds of clients needing proven talent and solutions to power their strategic initiatives. If you are a high performing business or IT professional with solid, referenced experience, we want to meet you. Genesis10 recruiters and delivery professionals are highly accomplished career advocates, who get to know you beyond your resume to position you with the opportunities that fit your skills, experience and aspirations. We have benefit options to fit your needs and a support staff that works with you from placement throughout your engagement - project after project. To learn more about Genesis10 and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at www.genesis10.com. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOur company is reimagining the intersection of technology and healthcare. We design and build systems that interpret clinical data in real-time and we're building a healthcare social network. Our cloud systems predict the onset of clinical deterioration well before it occurs, and in doing so allow clinicians to provide better and targeted care. Your place is with us of you are passionate about inventing and thinking on innovative systems.  We are looking for a Business Analyst with excellent verbal and communication skills, past experience as a product manager and in software development, and current experience in analysis of business processes. You will be an important bridge between engineering and other business units, and our clients. This is a technical BA role and you will be expected to learn the internals of our systems and implementation methodology. Responsibilities:Write requirements and specification documentsBe the voice of the product, collect ideas into roadmaps, prioritize and advance features from ideation to having our engineers build softwareCommunicate well, before there is an issue, and often. Be honest and precise.Manage the scope, be sensitive to schedule and budget.Research new ideas, present alternatives and experimental results.Prepare and give presentations to peers, employees, senior management, and external contacts. You are required to have excellent verbal and written communication skills.Abstract and develop data models and GUI.Have an appreciation for technical and other project related documentation. You will be chiefly accountable for this important component of our projects. Keep documentation on par with current releases.Develop and publish release notesCollect and publish KPIsOwn your tasks, be able to take notes and follow through.Requirements:Bachelors degree3-5 years of experience in product management or BA roles, health care technology experience preferred.3 years of continuously taking additional responsibilities such as business analysis, requirement gathering, or team leadership.Working knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, diagramming, etc.Added Plus:Product Management background. Having worked for and within a product team.Hands on coding experience with: o Knowledge with Data modeling, Data warehousing technologies, and ETL tools.  o Linux scripting.  o Experience with Relational and NoSQL databases.  o Experience with HTML, CSS, UI design.  o Hands on coding experience with developing reports and widgets using Microstrategy.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Senior Business Systems AnalystWho are we? Equinix is one of the fastest growing data center companies, growing connectivity between clients worldwide. That’s why we're always looking for creative and forward-thinking people who can help us achieve our goal of global interconnection. With 200 data centers in over 24 countries spanning across 5 continents, we are home to the Cloud, supporting over 1000 Cloud and IT services companies that are directly engaged in technological innovation and development. We are passionate about further evolving the specific areas of software development, software and network architecture, network operations and complex cloud and application solutions.  At Equinix, we make the internet work faster, better, and more reliably. We hire talented people who thrive on solving hard problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, try new approaches, and grow in new directions. Our culture is at the heart of our success and it’s our authentic, humble, gritty people who create The Magic of Equinix. Name: Business Analyst
Description: *Position Description** Responsible for driving improvement in business capabilities and results through the development of best in class operational reporting solutions in support of Asset Management organization. *Job Responsibilities** + Gather and organize reporting requirements from business stakeholders  + Develop task lists and project plans to deliver reporting solutions on time  + Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize ad-hoc and reporting requests  + Communicate project status updates to stakeholders and leadership  + Decompose operational processes to understand and develop metrics  + Produce regular reporting accurately and timely on daily, weekly, monthly basis  + Create and maintain documentation (process flows, desk procedures, controls)  + Perform simple data extraction, interpretation, and aggregation  + Perform data quality checking to ensure output is clean and correct  + Perform special projects/assignments as needed *Qualifications** + Education Required: Bachelor's degree  + Technical Required: Intermediate knowledge of Excel, including pivot tables and visuals  + Technical Required: Basic knowledge of automation through VBA  + Technical Required: Basic knowledge of PowerPoint for creating presentations  + Technical Required: Basic knowledge of SAS or SQL  + Technical Preferred: Intermediate knowledge of automation through VBA  + Technical Preferred: Intermediate knowledge of PowerPoint  + Technical Preferred: Intermediate knowledge of SAS or SQL  + Experience Required: 3-5 years gathering reporting requirements  + Experience Required: 3-5 years managing simple to complex projects  + Experience Required: Experience working with stakeholders to prioritize requests  + Experience Required: Experience communicating and presenting information  + Experience Preferred: Experience in consumer financing industry (auto, mortgage, etc.)  + Experience Preferred: Experience working in an operational role or environment  + Experience Preferred: Experience in auto consumer financing industry  + Experience Preferred: Practical experience working with large datasets with SAS knowledge  + Experience Preferred: Experience in extracting, loading, cleansing & manipulating data in SAS  + Experience Preferred: Practical experience using reporting tools (Cognos, Tableau, Qlik, or similar)  + Ideal Personal Qualities: Flexible attitude, ability to perform under pressure, ability to achieve balance between the right technical and business solution, ability to translate complex technical information into simple terms, commitment to quality, thorough approach, and pride in what we deliver, passion for creating leading edge solutions to complex business problems, appetite for career advancement through expanded responsibility, desire to learn new things and work on different teams, interest in solving the puzzle (intellectual curiosity), objective thinking and perspective (courage of our convictions) *Ally Overview** Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE: ALLY) is a leading digital financial services company and a top 25 U.S. financial holding company offering financial products for consumers, businesses, automotive dealers and corporate clients. Ally's legacy dates back to 1919, and the company was redesigned in 2009 with a distinctive brand, innovative approach and relentless focus on its customers. Ally has an award-winning online bank (member FDIC), one of the largest full service auto finance operations in the country, a complementary auto-focused insurance business, a growing digital wealth management and online brokerage platform, and a trusted corporate finance business offering capital for equity sponsors and middle-market companies. *Business Unit/Enterprise Function Description** Asset Management is part of Ally's Dealer Financial Services business and is a leading auto finance customer service organization with a portfolio of 4 million accounts. Ally is a full spectrum auto servicing organization including value streams from customer care to remarketing, and many support areas. It is a fast-paced, challenging and collaborative working environment. Our employees are focused on consistently delivering a superior customer experience. *Total Rewards** Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and bonus pay potential based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid time-off program with an emphasis on work-life balance.  Ally offers a variety of benefits to protect your health and well-being, provide financial security and balance your work-life needs including:  + Industry-leading 401K Retirement Savings Plan including Matching and Company Contributions  + Comprehensive wellness program with financial incentives designed to help you achieve your best health  + Flexible health insurance options including dental and vision  + Pre-tax Health Savings Account with generous employer contributions  + Pre-tax dependent care and commuter benefits  + Other work-life integration benefits including Paid Parental & Caregiver Leave, Adoption Assistance, Back-up Child & Adult/Elder Care, Child Care Discounts, Tuition Reimbursement, LifeMatters Employee Assistance Program, Weight Watchers and other employee discount programs *Ally is an Equal Opportunity Employer** We extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law. *Job Title:** Business Analyst*Company:** Ally Financial Inc.*Category:** Loan Administration/Operations*BU Function:** Auto*Requisition ID:** 18-6698

The Business Analyst will need to understand the key business metrics of our clients. This will require gathering technical client requirements and ensuring dashboards are created. The Business Analyst will be the primary contact for our client data and will require maneuvering large data sets, recognize trends, and guide our clients on key business decisions.  This position requires a client-first attitude to ensure all client requests are properly documented, managed, communicated and fulfilled. The ideal candidate will use their analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify and communicate solutions.  The Business Analyst interfaces and collaborates with other teams including but not limited to Implementation Project Management, Sales, Account Management, Product, Engineering and Professional Services. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job SummaryHilton Reservations and Customer Care (HRCC) is on a path to revolutionize human hospitality in a digital world, the same way we defined hospitality from its early beginnings. We strive to deliver personalized solutions that inspire a passion for travel, and our goal is to make a lasting impression with every Hilton guest with whom we interact.What will I be doing?Are you looking for an exciting career in a contact center manipulating data and impacting the business? The Business Analyst directly supports reporting and analysis for all business units in Hilton's Reservations and Customer Care centers. You will have a specific focus on performance metrics in both sales and service branches of the organization. You will also utilize various Business Intelligence tools and advanced analytical skills to extract, organize and analyze large amounts of data. Your expertise in building and effectively communicating these insights to leadership will directly result driving strategic decisions.  In this engaging opportunity, you will handle the following duties: Establish & maintain data integrity – 20% Understand valuable metrics and report structure, establish report processes, and identify data discrepancies and errorsTest and evaluate data accuracy for different datasets both within Oracle and in external data sources Capture & Organize data – 30%Use Business Intelligence tool (Microstrategy, Alteryx) to query the data in Hilton's Enterprise Data Warehouse accurately and deftlyBuild and understand data relationships/architecture, working with the database team to ensure the integrity of the data structure and design Analyze and interpret data – 30%You will use BI tools, spreadsheets and database tools to manipulate massive quantities of data to create and combine insightful and automated reports to identify trends, relationships, and discover root causes of business outcomes (Microstrategy, Alteryx, Tableau, R)Design and implement advanced analytical processes by combining BI tools (Microstrategy & Alteryx) with R to create predictive forecasting and target setting modelsUse advanced analytical models to analyze unstructured data (text) to derive key insights based on text and sentiment analysisSupport Operations team by helping build frameworks and automation to analyze and understand forecasts, staffing and planning requirements to improve operational insights and efficiency Communicate/Deliver insights effectively – 20%Use BI tools to design and build dashboards, along with visualizations, to show trends, patterns, relationships and analyses with clarity to deliver impactful insightUse verbal and written interpersonal skills to deliver analytical observations and recommendations to business owners and leadership. You will communicate your findings in a concise, yet informative manner, to provide a strong data-centric basis for strategic decision-makingWhat are we looking for?The success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills: Expertise with Microsoft Office Suite, with high proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPointDeep understanding of the fundamentals of Data structure, including data table relationships To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience: BA/BS Bachelor's Degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, business analytics or related fieldOne (1) year in related business analytics experience inclusive of work experience, internships, and volunteer experienceTravel Must be eligible to work in the US; no sponsorships will be given for role It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: MA/ MS Master's Degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, business analytics or related fieldThree (3) years of experience in related business analyticsProficiency with Microsoft AccessExperience with and knowledge of SQLExperience with building or maintaining databases or data warehouseKnowledge of database architecture and data modelling principles and techniquesWhat will it be like to work for Hilton?Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Join an award-winning company!Toll Brothers, America's Luxury Home Builder, seeks a Business Analyst to assist in the management of existing and future developments in the Dallas and Forth Worth markets. This position will be based out of our office in Grapevine, Texas.  The Business Analyst will work to perform sophisticated land use and financial analyses, participate in due diligence, including concept land planning, environmental, utility system, and title analysis. They will also work with our project teams including purchasing and sales groups for financial management for communities that are actively selling and constructing homes. Additionally, the Business Analyst will drive the analysis of the building market in the targeted areas of growth and on existing selling communities.  The Business Analyst will have a Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or Economics, be detail-oriented and highly motivated. A high level of aptitude in Microsoft Excel is sought after. The Business Analyst will work with our Land Acquisition Manager, Director of Community Design and Start-up, Purchasing Manager, and Division Accountant collectively as a team.  This is an excellent opportunity to join one of the nation's most respected Fortune 500 companies!2018 WORLD’S MOST ADMIRED COMPANIES LIST  #1 in Home Building Four Years in a Row FORTUNE magazineA Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or Economics. A Master’s Degree would be a plusHighly organized with solid analytical skills and understanding of complex financial analysis If you are an aggressive, forward-thinking real estate development professional, don't miss this opportunity to join our dynamic team as we continue to grow as one of America’s most elite real estate developers!  We offer an excellent benefits package that includes comprehensive medical/dental, 401(k) with a company match, discounted stock purchase, discounts on mortgages, homes, appliances, and much more! Come see why Toll Brothers has been attracting and retaining some of the best professionals in the industry!  APPLY ONLINE TODAY!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  Stearns Lending, LLC is a leading provider of mortgage lending services in Wholesale, Retail, Strategic Alliances and Consumer Direct sectors throughout the United States where licenses are held. The company was ranked as the #3 Wholesale Lender nationwide by Inside Mortgage Finance in 2016.*   If you are interested in joining an exciting team where excellence and customer service are a fundamental part of the culture, Stearns Lending, LLC is the place for you!   At Stearns, we consider all employees an everyday hero and we are always looking for OUTRAGEOUSLY TALENTED® individuals to join our team.  Job Summary: A Business Analyst will provide support for the Compliance and Legal departments in their  respective data needs. They will be responsible for ensuring that data being generated from the  Business Intelligence team is in accordance with agreed upon guidelines, and is consistent  across the multiple departments within Compliance. The analyst will be the primary liaison  between Compliance and Legal departments and provide guidance on data needs and criteria  before requesting from the Business Intelligence team.  Job Responsibilities: · Streamline and standardize information requests across all departments relating to  Compliance data  · Work with the Regulatory Review Manager to ensure that the BI team is supplying data  consistent with the compliance interpretation of regulatory requirements.  · Manage MCR and HMDA projects to ensure data is delivered to the compliance departments  in an accurate and timely manner. Also, respond to data requests from State Auditors,  Warehouse Banks, and other regulatory bodies.  · Audit regulatory report requirements and work with BI team members to establish processes  to cleanse the data. Audit output of regulatory reports for accuracy, consistency, and  completeness.  · If necessary, work with BI programmers to develop compliance monitoring reports to ensure  tracking, and verification of data integrity.  · Design and maintain an archive or all regulatory reports sent out from BI department. Include  documentation of key processes, discussion and decisions made regarding regulatory  reporting.  Desired Skills, Experience, or Education: · 2+ years in Mortgage Compliance reporting, with specific experience with either HMDA or  MCR filings.  · Proficiency in Excel  · Strong attention to detail; ability to manipulate large datasets accurately  · Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate with all levels of  management   Stearns Lending is an equal housing lender and is licensed to conduct business in 49 states and the District of Columbia. Additionally, Stearns Lending is an approved HUD (United States Department of Housing and Urban Development) lender; a Single Family Issuer for Ginnie Mae (Government National Mortgage Association); an approved Seller/Servicer for Fannie Mae (Federal National Mortgage Association); and an approved Seller/Servicer for Freddie Mac (Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation). Stearns Lending is also approved as a VA (United States Department of Veterans Affairs) lender, a USDA (United States Department of Agriculture) lender, and is an approved lending institution with FHA (Federal Housing Administration). Stearns Lending, LLC is located at 4 Hutton Centre Drive, 10th Floor, Santa Ana, CA 92707. Company NMLS# 1854.  For more information, visit www.stearns.com.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: GDS Link is looking for a seasoned Business Analyst to manage multiple Fin-Tech projects for our growing firm. Based in Mockingbird Station, Dallas, this position will be critical to the success of the US Delivery department as the firm looks to continue its dynamic growth in the coming years.  We're looking for someone who: Is passionate. You have a genuine passion for projects and enjoy the thrill of delivering for clientsIs motivated. You're driven to be the best. You challenge yourself by setting goals, crushing them, and helping your teammates do the sameIs collaborative. You're excited to work with multiple business functions throughout the organization to help deliver for our customersWants to make an impact. You're looking to do amazing work. Review, and be responsible for, the overall development and integration of requirements.Review and manage all changes to the requirements through a formally defined change management process.Ensure that the end product fulfills the contract and meets the sponsor's expectations.Serve as a liaison to the business community. Participate in a user and task analysis to maintain the business community's perspective.Live our culture. Embrace GDSs values and be an example of them every day. A few reasons why you might love us: We're a leader in the space. We've got an amazing track record of success and we foster ongoing innovation. So, you get all the benefits of a proven, growing company, while enjoying a very entrepreneurial culture.GDS Link has recently been included in Inc.5000 list of fastest-growing private companies in America.The team is really motivating. You'll work with people who are as energetic, smart, and determined as you are. You'll be managed by the best, too.Your work will be immediately impactful. You'll be able to see your direct impact on our growth. You won't be just another cog in the wheel. And a few reasons why you may not like working for us: You don't like change. This is not a job for someone who likes predictable. Our team wears many hats and must go with the flow to deliver for the business.You're not the collaborative type. We work together to ensure the best possible solutions for our projects. If you're looking to hide out and do your own thing, this might not be the right spot.
