Description: Robert Half is looking for a consulting-minded individual with a technical background, who loves the challenge of solving problems with multiple layers of complexity. If you are an efficient problem solver with highly-tuned decision-making skills, this may be the position for you. Responsibilities: The Senior Consultant has primary responsibility for conducting digital forensic and incident response activities. The Senior Consultant will have direct, client-facing engagement responsibilities. The Senior Consultant enables the success of Consultants entering the incident response practice through training and mentoring. The Senior Consultant is also expected to advance knowledge within the practice through external training, performing internal training, and the completion of development projects under the direction of the Managing Director.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Be part of our Growth Story  Do you have a passion for people? Are you a go-getter, full of new ideas and eager to be part of a team that's committed to helping some of the most recognized brands across North America deliver better experiences for their customers?  Vixxo has been helping to keep the world's best-loved brands running smoothly since 1980. As a leader in facilities management, Vixxo helps to optimize and maintain equipment lifespans and realize greater revenue through better customer experiences About the Role As a member of the Analytics team, the Decision Support Analyst enables customer success and loyalty by providing data-driven decision support to customers. This role generates insights about facility management (FM) programs to help customers achieve cost savings, improve asset uptime and optimize their FM spend. In close collaboration with customers, Account Managers, Account teams and other internal stakeholders, the Decision Support Analyst ensures that the analytical and reporting needs of customers are met in a timely, accurate and value-oriented manner.  Essential Functions Provides decision support to customers through the collection, analysis, and interpretation of operational and financial performance data. Uses analytical findings to propose FM strategies and solutions for customers. Performs trend analyses to uncover patterns in customer performance data that guide business decisions and drive cost savings and operational efficiencies in the customer's FM program.Proactively develops a strong understanding of the customer's FM program and Vixxo's operations. Performs root cause analyses to address business questions and problems and identify FM performance improvement opportunities that enable customers to reach their FM goals and objectives.Develops and maintains all reporting required by the customer. Defines and documents reporting requirements and partners closely with the Business Intelligence and Reporting Strategy team to automate recurring reports. Proposes and implements reporting enhancements as needed in order to meet evolving customer needs.Drives improvements in data quality by partnering with Account teams, Operations, Finance, the Data Governance Office and IT to research data anomalies and recommend changes to data policy, processes, procedures, and systems.Prepares and presents analytical and/or reporting results to customers and internal leadership in conjunction with the Account Manager as neededUses analytical findings to inform recommendations for internal operational or financial process improvementsEstablishes a professional and trusting relationship with customersSDL2017

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business AnalystIn this role on AlixPartners’ Corporate Services team, the Senior Business Analyst works with the Information Technology (IT) team and Business Analysis Manager with primary responsibility for both creating processes, templates, and methods to accomplish analysis, design, evaluation, selection, implementation and support of enterprise applications, as well as undertaking these activities on various projects. This position will partner closely with the Business, internal Corporate Services Support staff and IT to provide technical support to solve business problems, ensuring that the business has the entirety of its technology needs met. This will include resolving application integration issues and planning for the selection and implementation of new technologies to service this customer base. The Sr. BA may coach more junior BAs in various ways.  The Senior Business Analyst is a full-time role with a preferred location in Southfield, Michigan reporting to the Business Analyst Manager. This position may be contract-to-hire. Paid relocation may be available.  This position is at the Associate level, internally.Key Responsibilities:Gathering/Documentation:Creates templates to support various methods of requirements engineering, for re-useDetermines which method for requirements elicitation will work best in each projects’ unique set of circumstances; makes recommendations for more junior BAs relative to which methods would be most effective and expedientSupports the BA Manager and other IT areas (including Security and Operations) to create a set of standard non-functional requirements to be used on all projectsWorks with internal customers to identify specific user requirements and determine system needs to assure project deliverables meet customer expectations.Interviews employees at all levels to analyze work procedures and operational methods for the needs analysis stage of implementation. Documents current and desired processes, ensuring all documentation is kept up-to-date and communicated to the relevant stakeholders on a timely basis.Maintains and resolves requirements issues; coaches other BAs through such situations.Creates functional specifications for delivering customer solutions.Assists with the development of Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and training documents. Solutions: Works with IT to deliver solutions and defining the approach for solution development and recommends business process enhancements.Participates in the design and development/implementation of applicationsParticipates in problem solving in areas such as system design, input/output requirements and procedural flow between departments and/or business systems. Additional responsibilities that may be required:  Testing (in absence of Quality Assurance Manager and staff): Supports creation of templates for Test Strategy, test plans, test cases and test scripts.Leads testing to assure quality products are delivered to ensure all processes work according to predetermined goals.Facilitates user acceptance testing, documenting results of testing.Resolves bugs and issues with business and IT. Support (during post-go live / warranty period, or as otherwise assigned): Provides technical Level 2 support to the end users of applications.Provide technical assistance in designing reporting systems, forms and related business tools.Monitors system integrations for accuracy and completion.Develops and maintains systems documentation.Qualifications/Requirements:Bachelor's degree in a related area preferred. Work experience may be acceptable.Experience with methodologies across waterfall and agileExperience selecting, implementing, or at least working with requirements and/or PPM (project and portfolio management) tools/systemsMinimum six (6) years of professional experience in IT technical services.CBAP or other business analysis certification preferredExperience in enterprise applications and understanding of database driven applications.Experience working directly with IT and business/functional team members to understand project concept, objectives and approach.Knowledge of computer system capabilities, business processes, work flow, and understanding of software development life cycle.Experience with various solutions (in-house developed as well as COTS / SaaS)Experience working with 3rd party vendors and remote resources.Ability to work on projects requiring organizational and time-management skills.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to bridge functional and technical resources by communicating effectivelyStrong consultative, critical thinking and analytic skills with ability to operate independently and build effective partnerships across multiple stakeholder groups.Self-motivated, takes initiative and can work independently.Strong attention to detail, exceptional documentation skills, motivated/quick learner.Ability to react to changing priorities and strong time management skills.Must be process and detail oriented, but able to grasp the big picture. The ideal candidate would be a creative and innovative person with a demonstrated track record of collaboration.Good facility with general MS Office tools and Project Management tools is desired.Must work full-time and primarily out of the Southfield office.Travel, including International travel, up to 20% may be required. This description is not designed to encompass a comprehensive listing of required activities, duties or responsibilities.  In addition to a positive workplace, the firm offers a competitive compensation package including an excellent benefit program (health, vision, dental, disability, 401K, tuition reimbursement).  In today’s fast-paced global market timing is everything. You want to protect, grow or transform your business. To meet these challenges, we offer clients small teams of highly qualified experts with profound sector and operational insight. Our clients include corporate boards and management, law firms, investment banks, investors and others who appreciate the candor, dedication and transformative expertise of our teams. We will ensure insight drives action at that exact moment that is critical for success. When it really matters. www.alixpartners.com All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, (age), status as a protected veteran, or disability.AlixPartners is a proud Silver award-winning Veteran Friendly Employer.https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

Name: RPA Business Analyst
Description: Position: RPA Business Analyst  Location - Irving, TX 75039  Duration: 10/1/2018 to 3/15/2019 (Contract to permanent)  Analyzes (business/ technical) needs and develop/ modify business requirements or system specifications to hand over to an RPA Developer. Provides consultation on the business domain/ process/ systems/ technology topics associated with the applications/ infrastructure work performed by other resources. Works with business stakeholders to do process mapping, analysis, and design of business requirements. Takes business requirements and maps them to IT systems, providing detailed application design documentation.  • Day to day activities include sitting with the business to probe for detailed, step by step business requirements in order to create a Process Definition Document (PDD) to hand over to a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) developer who will then create the Solution Design Document (SDD) of the automated business process  • Strong documentation skills down to the keystroke/click detail  • Ability to create detailed process flow charts; Microsoft Visio experience a plus  • Experience creating documentation of processes for RPA developers a plus  • Team player, able/comfortable to work with large teams and program managers  • Experience working with technical teams/developers, technical writing a plus  • Able to work in a fast pace environment and comfortable under pressure  • Quick learner, able to take feedback and adjust approach/style when needed  • Able to work through obstacles to deliver by deadlines  Additional Callouts:  1- Team player- be able/comfortable to work with large teams  2- Able to probe the business to get detailed requirements.  3- Experience working with technical teams/developers.  4- Able to work in a fast pace environment and comfortable under pressure  5- Quick learner, able to take feedback and adjust approach/style when needed  6- Able to work through obstacles to deliver by deadlines.  7- Experience with documenting processes for RPA a plus.

Name: Ecommerce Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe view the building of these systems as a creative pursuit which means our employees must be passionate, quick-learners who also enjoy some down time and structure our engagements and systems to accommodate the same.  We are hiring an Ecommerce Business Analyst (BA) in training with a start date before the end of 2018. To learn our business best, the BA will start by managing our support desk (requests from clients on retainer). Over time, the BA will transition to a more traditional BA role, managing larger and larger initiatives.  Within the first year, the BA should have a solid grasp of Razoyo®’s clients’ business needs and be an expert administrative user of Magento and Oro Commerce. DutiesRequirements gathering from clients and product ownersWriting well-clarified Agile issuesGathering information and taking personal ownership of customer requestsCommunicating with the client to ensure expectations are understood and exceededPrioritizing and reprioritizing support requests daily based on changing circumstances to make sure issues are resolved in a timely mannerRecreating issues and documenting steps to recreateRecognizing and communicating urgency (high or low) and the business impact of requests and understanding when to escalate a requestProviding client instruction and training on Magento and Oro Commerce featuresIdentifying and communicating solution options and estimates in order to help the client make an informed decisionReviewing request resolution and following up on points of communicationQualificationsStrong understanding of ecommerce business topics including technologies and systems, business components and strategies, catalog management, promotion management, and so forth. Ideally, this will be from a combination of work experience and education.2 years work experience in ecommerce merchandising or site administrationExperience with Magento as a merchandiser or merchant would be a big plus.Strong verbal and written communication skillsIntuitive problem solverAbove average skills in spreadsheet manipulationUnderstanding of web software components and basic abilities in critical technologies like html and cssAbility to focus Company DescriptionRazoyo is a world-class Magento Certified Developer agency and Oro Commerce partner. We have been in business since 2006 and have a reputation for innovation, responsiveness, and growth. We serving the needs of small and medium-sized web stores in business to consumer (B2C) and business to business (B2B) capacities. We help online merchants to create, manage, maintain and update their stores, and to solve both business and technology problems.  We accomplish this through technology services performed, application training, and consultation.

Name: Senior Payroll Systems Analyst
Description: IN AN EFFORT TO PROVIDE A MORE HEALTHY, SAFE ANDSATISFYING ENVIRONMENT TO OUR EMPLOYEES, INDIVIDUALS TO WHOM JOB OFFERS ARE EXTENDED MAY UNDERGO NICOTINE TESTING AS A PART OF THE PRE-EMPLOYMENT PROCESS. Name: Business Analyst II
Description: THE COMPANY Fannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.  Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.  For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progress JOB INFORMATION Examine, assess, and document business operations and procedures of a financial management, product, or trading unit. Relate these procedures to IT/IS systems and applications that are designed to enable the operating unit to accomplish its objectives. Assist operating unit staff by developing reports, downloads, and analyses from discipline-specific systems and applications. Provide input to IT/IS specialists in development projects to assist in developing specifications and functionalities in financial IT systems. KEY JOB FUNCTIONSAssess procedures and business processes in a financial management, accounting, transactional, or business operations unit for methods of automating them or improving existing applications supporting them. Participate in meetings with financial management, Accounting, or product management staff and application developers and project managers to plan development or upgrades of applications used by their offices or business units. Participate in planning testing and acceptance of newly developed financial management software by client group who will be using it. May provide support to applications in production by tracking and troubleshooting problems and ensuring continued and efficient operation of application in production, and full access by its users. Develop queries, analyses, or reports from financial management applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit.EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent required.MINIMUM EXPERIENCE2 years of related experience.SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLSAbility to understand and breakdown processes and problems. Provide effective solutions to streamline processes and reporting especially as related to collection activities. Ability to take action, collaborate with others, and drive action items to resolution with timeline limitations. Strong attention to detail, well-organized and able to prioritize multiple activities. Demonstrated experience with data analysis, preferably related to collections or mortgage servicing activities. Ability to work across different business units, build strong working relationships, and communicate effectively across all levels of the organization. Demonstrated experience in Microsoft Excel, Power Point, Tableau, and Toad. Working knowledge of SAS is required.EMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Business Operations Analyst =========================== New  Irving, Texas, United States  Administration/Operations  17 hours ago Post Date ******* Requisition # Apply for JobShare this JobJoin our Talent Network JOB SUMMARY  Working under direct supervision, provides routine day-to-day  operations and administrative support for a business unit or large  department. Assists in coordination of budget, process improvement,  controls for specialized software and other functions enabling the  department to meet objectives in an effective and efficient manner. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Analyzes monthly department budget reports to maintain expense  controls. Prepares commentary and explanation of variances for  management review.  Assists in systems administration for specialized software utilized by  the business group to support its operations. Researches and resolves  routine support issues. Follows-up to ensure open issues are resolved.  Assists in preparing user reference material.  Troubleshoots and resolves simple inquiries and requests from internal  and external clients.  Reviews and monitors department processes and procedures to identify  opportunities to improve service delivery to internal and external  customers. May network with external contacts to research and  recommend best practices.  Coordinates budget preparation. Researches and collects input from  multiple internal and external resources.  Compiles a variety of operating, financial and statistical information  as needed to respond to management requests. Coordinates work with  other departments. May add commentary to complete analysis reports and  proposals.  Assists in communication of best practices, policies, procedures and  initiatives to support operations. Helps to facilitate process  improvement by engaging appropriate resources in issue identification  and resolution.  Assists in developing project plans and costs, including personnel and  fiscal requirements to achieve defined objectives. May provide  periodic updates relative to project resource and fiscal plans.  Performs other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides  informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to  coworkers. May lead project teams and/or plan, and supervise  assignments of lower level employees. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to  perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed  below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability  required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with  disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  Bachelor's Degree (BA/BS) or equivalent from four year college or  university plus a minimum of two years related work experience to  include budgeting, finance and or business analytics; or equivalent  combination of education and experience.  Work experience related to specific department or business unit  function preferred.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong  organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient,  timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to  effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to  calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or  commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to  solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires  intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. Spreadsheet skill set  to include advanced functions such as graphics, pivot tables. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies  to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own  project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to  co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Company Overview: Flowserve is the recognized world leader in supplying pumps, valves, seals, automation, and services to the power, oil, gas, chemical, and other industries. With more than 18,000 employees in more than 55 countries, we combine our global reach with a local presence. Position Description: The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting and managing a variety of customer facing analytics needs including, but not limited to forecast projections, market level pricing, region / industry / product performance (and combinations therein), and various dashboard development as required by the Sales and Commercial Operations organization. They will work collaboratively with a variety of functions notwithstanding the Sales and Commercial Operations teams to align these analytics with business strategies and objectives.  Superior communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to work cross-functionally with other areas of the organization, strong analytical skills, multi-tasking ability, project management and a professional demeanor are the keys to this position. Strong organizational skills are required to be able to effectively manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously. The incumbent must be able to work in a highly visible, dynamic and fast paced environment. They must also have a curiosity, desire and strong enjoyment of diving into available data for the purpose of developing new insights to grow the front end of our business.  This position reports directly to the Manager, Commercial Operations (Reporting & Analytics). Principle Responsibilities:Support and continuously evolve reporting and analytics for S&OP (sales and operations planning) needs and the MOR (monthly operations review) processSupport the business with clear and insightful analysis applying modeling techniques leveraging the data at handContinuously enhance and implement business tools, reporting and analytics so sales management, commercial operations teams and operations can drive improved forecasting accuracy and sales growth.Conduct market level pricing analytics to aid sales and Commercial Operations organizationsConduct data mining / analytics to provide insights across products, markets and geographies for the purposes of growing the front end of the business.Develop other demand information and analytics for Executive Management, Commercial Operations, Sales and Marketing as the needs are identified.Conduct various data auditing, aggregation, validation and reconciliation within the data made available to youSupport the annual strategic bookings process and plan.Position Requirements:Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics & Finance, Information Technology or related discipline.Technical skills:Databased knowledge = SQL server required, knowledge of Hadoop and MS Azure is a plus.Analysis and visualization: Advanced (MS) Office and Tableau are required. Name: Business Analyst - DAL
Description: DescriptionTeam Daugherty is looking to add a Business Analyst to the Dallas team! This individual will be involved in the creation, design and build of new business models and, upon completion, integration and operation of them. Working across the spectrum of management consulting activity and industries, you will have greater opportunities to broaden your career and tackle complex stimulating challenges. This will enable you to accumulate the requisite skills and experiences to develop the functional and industry expertise needed to progress within management consulting and continue to deliver value to our clients.  As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for the following: Serving as knowledge owner for a single system or business process area.Working with a team to analyze, diagnose and resolve unpredictable and varied problems using diverse methods and tools.Advising client users on application design alternatives and business process change opportunities.Connecting user needs to emerging technologies in order to acquire or design tools, techniques and approaches that allow client users to realize optimal project delivery results.Delivering integrated business systems support to users (internal and external to IT), and applying an expert understanding of the business issues and the impact of technology.Executing and managing moderate functional testing efforts.Identifying, addressing, managing and escalating risks and issues within a project. We are looking for someone with: A 4-year college degree.5+ years related experience in a business analysis role within IT departments and management consulting organizations.Preferred depths in at least one of the following areas: systems integration, business process management, financial analysis, marketing, supply chain, retail or telecommunications.Strong SQL skills with the ability to write complex SQL statements that analyze data and create prototypes.Familiarity with several software delivery methodologies (RUP/Agile/Waterfall).Strong knowledge of requirement gathering, use case analysis and user acceptance testing.CBAP for business analysis (preferred). We offer members of Team Daugherty: Excellent health, dental and vision insurance.Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings plan.Life, disability and long-term care insurance.Little to no travel.Robust career development and training. Do you think you’re a good fit for Team Daugherty? Apply now and find out why working here satisfies the smart, the talented and the curious!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystWith minimal supervision and working at the highest technical level of most phases of business analysis, this position collaborates with others to develop new products and enhance existing products. This includes project definition and solution design for requested product and operational enhancements for existing products and internal systems.REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTINGThis position typically performs work at a WageWorks location with significant technical resources and reports to a Director or VP level with enterprise-wide product development responsibility.ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIESNOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent’s performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent’s immediate supervisor or manager.1. Work closely with internal teams (service teams, technical staff, sales, marketing, and operations) and external teams (clients, partners and service vendors) to enhance current products and develop new ones.2. Provide input into and oversight of project definition and solution design for requested new products, product features, and operational enhancements for internal systems.3. Act as the liaison between the business units and the technology organization, to manage business priorities, communicate changes in scope or schedule, and call out risks.2. Perform impact assessment and define the scope of requested product changes, enhancements, new products and new systems.3. Adhere to and assist product management and other project requestors in adhering to the appropriate software product development process.4. Define the scope of projects including all internal and external user touch points and processes.5. Create detailed functional requirement specifications based on defined business requirements.6. Identify tasks and work with the development team to estimate development costs for proposed projects.7. Drive and project manage product development projects from inception to customer delivery.MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS1. May provide assistance with product development efforts to test products and ensure that systems provide the result or perform as intended.2. May develop training materials and provide product training to staff and users of product enhancements for which functional requirements have been created.3. Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTSWageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the eight Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance. Clients and Participants Come First: Exceeding client and participant expectations is our highest priorityIntegrity: We are open, honest, ethical and conscientiousPassion: A will to win and a relentless drive for excellenceAccountability: Deliver on commitments and take ownership for solving problems and creating solutionsLeadership and Influence: Our actions inspire vision and clarity of purposeContinuous Improvement and Innovation: We embrace change and drive new ideas into business solutionsDignity and Respect: We value the diversity of our people, encourage their development and reward their performanceCreating Value for Shareholders: Deliver consistent growth and premium returnsSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITYNOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.No formal supervisory authority entailed. This position will act as a resource to less-experienced Business Analysts and may provide matrixed leadership for assigned projects.ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIESEDUCATION:Knowledge of software development and/or business management as normally obtained through completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science/engineering, Business, or a related degree. Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) certification is desirable.WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE:The knowledge, skill and ability to create detailed functional requirements for software development projects as described as normally obtained through a minimum of 10 or more years progressively responsible business analysis experience.SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:Requires the highest level of understanding of the business, technology strategy and platforms, and functional transactions to perform business analysis as described.Consumer marketing or product management experience in the consumer or financial services industry including:• Familiarity with Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA) and Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) programs.• Direct contact with both employers and employees in an HR or employee benefits-related capacity.• Project management experience.• Familiarity with financial services, general accounting principles, bank account reconciliation practices, and operational processes.A high level of employee benefits knowledge and significant experience as a service or account manager for a group health plan provider, broker agency or benefits consultant, including a keen understanding of benefits administration from an employer’s perspective (the employer/vendor relationship as well as the employer/employee relationship, is strongly preferred.Must have a high level of interpersonal and communication skills and an exceptional ability to work well with others to effectively interact with internal and external customers and department staff, as described above. The ability to build relationships, influence key decision-makers, and collaborate on a cross-functional team comprised of diverse personalities, skill sets, and levels of experience is required.The ability to work in a fast-paced, high energy environment that requires flexibility and the capacity to quickly learn and assimilate information/new skills is essential. Must possess the ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Outstanding organizational skills, follow-up skills, focus and attention to detail.Incumbents must have the ability to use initiative and work independently as well as collaboratively with a team.EQUIPMENT:A high level of proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, Excel, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required. Knowledge and familiarity with standard project management tools is required.TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONSTravel may be required as necessary to meet with internal and external clients.WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDSWork is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDSWork requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with constant interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 20 lbs. Incumbent may experience elevated levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: We have been retained by our client in Dallas, Texas (north Dallas), a reputable organization, to deliver a Technical Business Analyst on a direct hire basis. Our client has a culture of delivering web/software products using long-term thinking to fulfill needs with business partners and internal business clients needing financial related software products and tools. We are seeking an energetic, self-driven, articulate, well-spoken, self-motivated, team-motivating, self-starting technical business analyst with exceptional administration skills who is eager to take on stake holder interviews, requirements elicitation & definition, but mainly functional specification writing, especially clear and concise use cases creation use cases that tell the developers everything they need to know and nothing more. Therefore, we prefer a candidate with a developer/analyst background, who has coded for a few years before moving their career into more functional specifications to close the gap between use cases/functions, flows, conditions, steps and the code . We prefer, but do not require, a technical business analyst candidate to bring some examples of use cases that are well done You will work with an excellent development manager who will give the development team the freedom to innovate and create .NET, web, and SQL Server database applications and tools. This opportunity sets itself apart because of the quality of the development manager, the teams freedom to create/innovate and the culture this organization has as a whole, as well as the culture of the development team. This is a very reputable firm with an excellent and long-term reputation. This is a family-friendly? organization and culture. The benefits are excellent, almost the best possible. The software development manager/director you work report to and work with is excellent. He is very technical, a very nice person. We are seeking 4-5+ years of business analysis experience and skills including (all of these are not required): Able to apply superior interpersonal skills and excellent verbal communication skills to business stakeholder interviews in order to elicit functional specifications documentation for software/web projects.We prefer a candidate who has a few years of coding before moving career direction towards functional specification writing to help bridge the gap between specifications and code. writing and/or creating: functional specifications, user stories, use cases, work flows, conditions, steps, user interface illustrations, & wireframes preferred, to model? an application or web application or software product in paper form?. Able to given an existing application and document the functional specifications and decompose each step by step process into well documented use cases; concise use cases that tell the developers exactly what they need to know, and nothing extra. Experience with a new application ideas, ability to model functions, or describe functionality using application models, behavioral diagrams/models, state management diagrams/models, sequence diagrams;experience with the following is preferred:Microsoft Word, Visio, UML, Microsoft Project, JIRA, Confluence, wireframes. Ability to manage 8-10 software application functional specification sets, perform administrative details and functions, communicate effectively with managers, directors or C-level executives communicative, balance and organize things very well, create internal portal communication updates, and internal web site updates, using JIRA and Confluence for each teams portal. Experience quickly taking a software product or web application from inception to product delivery, in a executive and developer setting or environment, is a definite plus.The ability to make things happen with assertiveness, that is poised and professional. Bachelors degree is a huge plus, however someone with strong Business analyst background without a degree may be qualified. Employment Type: Regular Full-Time Salary Range: $85,000 107,000 per year, base salary Benefits: bonus, life, health, dental, vision, 401k matching, paid vacation, paid holidays, paid sick days. This is an excellent benefits package. Location: Dallas, Texas (North Dallas, Texas) Immigration: US citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor H1b candidates at this time. Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: ApplyOverviewJob Family: Project Management Oversees, develops and analyzes policies and practices related to project management and the project management office. Develops, analyzes and oversees project quality assurance and resource allocation. Enhances program and project management capabilities and operational oversight. Develops, edits and executes project plans to manage the lifecycle and operational aspects of projects. Defines, develops and deploys standardized project management tools and templates to ensure projects are completed efficiently. Job Function: Business Systems Analysis Defines how a proposed system will accomplish business requirements through technical solutions for functional and non-functional requirements. Provides support and analysis for systems to ensure smooth and continuous running of corporate systems and assessment of software for efficiency, speed, and cost of implementation and maintenance. This could include regular and preventative maintenance, systems requirement management and process related analysis. Positions could have responsibility for infrastructure performance as well as new technology implementation or roll-outs. Summary of Responsibilities: The Sr. Specialist, Business Systems Analysis requires junior level experience in partnering working with business clients to elicit, gather, understand, and document business requirements for all assigned initiatives impacting Operations and issues impeding their day to day activities. The Sr. Specialist, Business Systems Analysis supports Business Line Owners in achieving goals, from increasing profitability of existing products to developing new revenue sources within the product lit, while ensuring compliance to all applicable regulations and company policies. The Sr. Specialist, Business Systems Analysis partners with business leadership and key business resources to evaluate business needs and issues, proposed system and/or process changes, and changes to supporting applications. The Sr. Specialist, Business Systems Analysis works under minimal supervision exercising independent judgment, and must be action oriented, self-motivated and creative while being highly functional. S/he interacts and coordinates with business leads, process owners, and application development along with various other IT teams. The incumbent is a technology liaison to business groups to analyze complex business requirements as well as design, develop and implement solutions related to business processes and data integration between third party vendor systems. Essential Functions:Acts as the technical liaison between users, vendors, and IT, and assists with vendor management on assigned applications.Participates in Leads business analysis / requirements gathering sessions with business partners to create and document requirements for assigned projects and contributes to project planning.Supports technology and business test teams on analysis of defects to ensure proper resolution and alignment to business requirements.Drives and manages Analysis/Requirements phase deliverables: requirements documentation and signoff, traceability matrix, functional/technical specifications, change controls and assists in identifying test scenarios.Creates process flows and/or business use cases to assist in defining business requirements and Name: Lead Business Analyst Tester
Description: Job Description:No two career paths will ever look the same. At Leidos, we know the most talented and diverse IT and engineering professionals will always have a multitude of career choices; your time at Leidos will be a wise investment in your career and in yourself. Our Civil business is helping to modernize and manage infrastructure, systems and controls, and cybersecurity for civilian agencies and commercial clients around the globe. With core competencies in information technology, energy and environment, complex logistics, and specialized engineering, we solve technical challenges and implement newfound efficiencies on a number of programs! Protect yourself and your family, with the benefits of working for a world-class employer. When you join Leidos, you join a Fortune 500 company and one of Ethisphere Institute's "World's Most Ethical Companies" Leidos...We strive to make the complex clear.The Leidos Civil Treasury program has an opening for a Lead Business Analyst/Tester tasks in support of the CEAS production system. The position responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following.Must be flexible and adaptable, able to support using a wide variety of methods and technologiesBe able to lead small teams or project management experience; creating or familiar with schedules, estimatesMust have experience in creating meeting agendas and meeting minutesBe able to track and provide release statusBe able to provide weekly and monthly status reportsMust have experience in requirements gathering and analysisMust have experience with creating business documents like Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM), Use Cases or storiesMust have experience in integration and system testingMust have experience in software development life cycle and WaterfallMust have experience in Agile Methodology (User Stories, Sprints, Scrum, Testing)Must have experience in browser testingMust have good communication skillsMust have SQL knowledgeMust feel comfortable interacting with the Leidos and IRS customer on a daily basisMust have strong analytical skills and be detail orientedPerform analysis on existing functionalities and testing scriptsCreate and maintain documentation in support of the projectCreate, maintain, and execute test scripts and test planCreate and Maintain test dataVerify Pass/Fail of test scripts through verification of log filesProvide status reportsProvide and document test results or defectsUse Rational Suite toolsUse Rational Team Concert (RTC), Rational Functional Tester (RFT), Rational Requirement Management (RQM)Use Microsoft Suite toolsOther Skills desired but not requiredWindowsTest AutomationTesting automated batch processesTypical MinimumsA Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 7+ years of professional experience.

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: Looking for your next opportunity? If so, choose Parkland and discover what a meaningful job feels like. Whether you work directly with patients or use your talent to support our care, you’ll be part of a team that’s providing valuable health services to Dallas County residents. And here, you’ll have the opportunity to put all your skills to work, and the support to grow and advance in your job and your field. Step into a career that will make a substantial difference for our patients—and for you. We blend cultures, talents, and experience into an exemplary health and hospital system. Parkland has earned distinction as one of America’s Best Hospitals by U.S News and World Report every year since 1994.Responsible for carrying out the operational responsibilities of data analysis and reporting functions for assigned area in order to assist management in the successful analysis and achievement of goals. Education:-Must have a Bachelor's degree in a health related field or management information systems.-Prefer a Master's degree in a related field.Experience:-Must have four years of experience in analysis of healthcare or business related data and information systems.Equivalent Education and/or Experience-May have an equivalent combination of education and experience to substitute for both the education and the experience requirements. Certification/Registration/Licensure:-Current license or certification in area of clinical expertise may be required.Skills or Special Abilities:-Must be able to successfully pass the Standard-level Microsoft Access test, as established by Employment Services, with a minimum score of 80%.-Must be able to successfully pass the Standard-level Microsoft Excel test, as established by Employment Services, with a minimum score of 80%. -Must have good verbal and written communication skills. -Must be able to demonstrate a working knowledge of program evaluation methods, statistical analysis, research skills, management information systems, and strategic planning. -Must be able to demonstrate proficiency in personal computer usage. -Must be able to demonstrate a working knowledge of statistical analysis, database design and analysis and management information systems design and interface. -Must be able to demonstrate a working knowledge with regard to the software application used in the assigned area.-Prefer a working knowledge of Seagate Crystal Reports and Microsoft SQL.-Clinical Research: Prefer a working knowledge of Velos, elRB, ERGO, Microsoft SharePoint. -Prefer a working knowledge of statistical software, such as SPSS or an equivalent package.Parkland Health and Hospital System prohibits discrimination based on age (40 or over), race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, disability, national origin, marital status, political belief, or veteran status.

Tenet will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities unless doing so would result in an undue hardship.

Name: Business System Analyst
Description: DescriptionTrinityRail Corporate is searching for a talented team player to fill the open position of Business Systems Analyst in our Dallas, Texas office. Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: Entry Level - Business Analyst BA acts as the conduit between the business customer, and the delivery team. They will identify, interpret, and define business need and features; translate them into requirements; and lead the process to visualize, document, and communicate functional product solutions used to design, build, and test the system. Business Analysis Understand current business environment, client, and stakeholder requirements and apply this knowledge to ensure that deliverables meet the business requirements.Provide input into the development/implementation processes to ensure that deliverables meet the business requirements.Triage defects to determine if the defect does conflict with business requirements as captured in the specification documents.Gather requirements by demonstrating a range of business analysis techniques appropriate to the setting.Critically analyze, negotiate and actively contribute to decisions on requirements. This includes engaging appropriate parties to facilitate the identification of the problem and root cause.Understanding the product extensively, being viewed as the subject matter expert.Strive to exceed the expectations of stakeholders by using clear communication, to understand and assess business requirements so that the right solutions are adopted.Work closely with the Product team to understand the vision and convert it into user stories.Play an active role in the development team including contributing to the scrum ceremoniesDeliveryDemonstrate visible progress on work and cross-functional behavior to ensure quality, on-time delivery.Engage and consult with senior staff to communicate risks and issues and clear impediments that have the potential to impact the delivery schedule.Play a driving role in building the maturity of the BA practice by actively engaging in the prioritized work to showcase efficiency, innovation, and continuous progress.DocumentationCreate, contribute to and maintain business analysis documentation, ensuring high level of specification completeness, quality, and consistency.Actively engage in the review of documentation and critically assess the existing standards and documentation set, fostering continuous improvement.Incorporate approved improvements into the specification and documentation set on an on-going basis and update standards.Contribute to the continuous improvement of company reference material (e.g. project documentation and Training Modules).REQUIRED SKILLS: 0-1+ years experience as a Business Analyst, supporting all phases of the SDLC Familiarity with the IT industry/field Exposure to Waterfall/Agile software development process Experience identifying, interpreting, and defining business requirements, translating into systems requirements; and leading the process to visualize and document Well developed in negotiating, problem-solving and decision-making skills. Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio). Must have excellent written and oral communication skills Education: Master's and Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent engineering or technical disciplines is required.

Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: Entry Level - Business Analyst BA acts as the conduit between the business customer, and the delivery team. They will identify, interpret, and define business need and features; translate them into requirements; and lead the process to visualize, document, and communicate functional product solutions used to design, build, and test the system. Business Analysis Understand current business environment, client, and stakeholder requirements and apply this knowledge to ensure that deliverables meet the business requirements.Provide input into the development/implementation processes to ensure that deliverables meet the business requirements.Triage defects to determine if the defect does conflict with business requirements as captured in the specification documents.Gather requirements by demonstrating a range of business analysis techniques appropriate to the setting.Critically analyze, negotiate and actively contribute to decisions on requirements. This includes engaging appropriate parties to facilitate the identification of the problem and root cause.Understanding the product extensively, being viewed as the subject matter expert.Strive to exceed the expectations of stakeholders by using clear communication, to understand and assess business requirements so that the right solutions are adopted.Work closely with the Product team to understand the vision and convert it into user stories.Play an active role in the development team including contributing to the scrum ceremoniesDeliveryDemonstrate visible progress on work and cross-functional behavior to ensure quality, on-time delivery.Engage and consult with senior staff to communicate risks and issues and clear impediments that have the potential to impact the delivery schedule.Play a driving role in building the maturity of the BA practice by actively engaging in the prioritized work to showcase efficiency, innovation, and continuous progress.DocumentationCreate, contribute to and maintain business analysis documentation, ensuring high level of specification completeness, quality, and consistency.Actively engage in the review of documentation and critically assess the existing standards and documentation set, fostering continuous improvement.Incorporate approved improvements into the specification and documentation set on an on-going basis and update standards.Contribute to the continuous improvement of company reference material (e.g. project documentation and Training Modules).REQUIRED SKILLS: 0-1+ years experience as a Business Analyst, supporting all phases of the SDLC Familiarity with the IT industry/field Exposure to Waterfall/Agile software development process Experience identifying, interpreting, and defining business requirements, translating into systems requirements; and leading the process to visualize and document Well developed in negotiating, problem-solving and decision-making skills. Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio). Must have excellent written and oral communication skills Education: Master's and Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent engineering or technical disciplines is required.

Name: Senior IT Support Analyst
Description: OverviewMedecision is transforming healthcare one cool app at a time!Are you the kind of person that is motivated by the challenge of a dynamic, changing market? Can you utilize and exploit progressive systems and processes to satisfy urgent business needs? Are you a good partner with your teammates; driven to execute team and individual commitments that align with business vision? Does the idea of a high visibility and high impact role in a medium sized, growing company excite you? Are you interested in being part of a team that strives to achieve high business impact, execution excellence and has a lot of fun while we are doing it? Are you ready? We are! Join us in our journey towards liberating today’s fragmented healthcare systems to Connect Care Everywhere.Medecision is looking for a Senior IT Support Analyst, a passionate power contributor who blends solid advanced technical desktop engineer skills, who serves as an SME in desktop imaging, advanced Active Directory and Group Policy administration, Office365 suite of products and exchange administration, InTune administration, encryption and anti-virus security products administration (SOPHOS a plus), LAN and WLAN network environments, VoIP networks, video conferencing, with system administration in both Windows and Linux environments. with proven Active Directory, Office365, DFS, ADFS and SSO experience. THIS JOB MIGHT BE FOR YOU, IF…You, as the Senior IT Support Analyst will provide day-to-day consultation, advanced problem solving, troubleshooting and training to computer users for hardware, software, network and related computer systems and peripheral devices. This position ensures the effective operation of all systems; installs and configures systems; provides guidance to Tier 1 and Tier 2 Technicians. This position is also responsible for procurement and maintains vendor relationships regarding hardware, software and mobile device purchasing. This position is also responsible for maintaining an accurate inventory of all computer systems, peripheral devices and software license management.Reports to: Director of IT Corporate ServicesLocation(s): Dallas, TX ResponsibilitiesYOU’RE GOOD AT:Monitoring JIRA Help Desk system for work intake from problem tickets to service requestsProviding Tier 1-3 hardware support on Apple, HP, Lenovo, Microsoft laptop systemsProviding Tier 1-3 software end user support in Windows, Mac OS, VoIP, WebEx, and other software as neededProvide Tier 1-3 support in Office365, including advanced support in SharePoint Administration, InfoPath, OneDrive, Flow or Workflows, Teams and Skype for BusinessProviding Tier 1-3 Executive Support for our C-SuiteProvide end user/new user education with a focus on collaboration tools like Office365Provision, image, install, and maintain all laptop and virtual (VM/VDI/Citrix) workstations, for both local or remote users, along with associated peripheral devicesProvides support to the team as a subject matter expert in all desktop computing environments, focusing on continuous improvement, performing root cause analysis for problem elimination, with a focus on customer service and innovation.Maintain workstation inventory and licensing inventory, including quote/purchasing and vendor managementAdvanced Office365 and Active Directory administration with a high focus on Exchange, Azure AD, DFS, ADFS and SSO. This position requires the ability to develop, implement and maintain AD Group Policy and InTune policy Work closely with the Director of IT Corporate Services on other projectsThis position has high visibility and requires the highest level of communication with strong verbal and writing skills. QualificationsYOU HAVE:Bachelors or relevant work experience with industry certifications like MCSA, MCP, ITIL8+ years of desktop services experience5+ years of advanced experience in Active Directory and server administration3+ years providing executive/C-SUITE personalized desktop support1+ years of desktop networking with LAN/WLAN experience OUR CULTURE DRIVES USIt’s not all about what we do. It’s as much about how we do it. Medecision team members show up. We consistently exemplify our 6 core values of success:Execution. Service – We deliver “standing ovation” service. Speed – We are Agile. Ownership— We all take ownership and responsibility for how we deliver our promises, how we spend money, who we hire, what we build and how we help one another grow.Passion. We show an infectious emotional commitment to our work because what we do is important to our customers, one another and ourselves.Partnership. We are all in this together, without boundaries. Our internal/external network contains the solutions we need: we’ll continuously seek them out, use them and improve them.Leadership. We are Medecision’s brand. We are experts in care management, care coordination and healthcare information and technology. We lead our clients to excellent results by providing our expertise on best practices, industry trends, solutions development and innovations. We are moving in sync with an evolving industry. There is no problem we cannot solve.Innovation. We are in a constant state of discovery, inventiveness, thinking outside the box, and leading others internally and externally to do the same.Candor. Medecision communicates in a sincere, direct and famil­iar way. We address conflict directly and escalate issues internally and externally to address conflict with speed and partnership.Join us in our quest to liberate healthcare!This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by an employee within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities and qualifications may vary based on assignment. Medecision is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.

experts.Ability to multi-task and work efficiently in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.Ability to work well under time constraints.Team player with a positive attitude, professional Essbase 11.1.2.4, Hyperion Financial Reporting, Planning & Budgeting Cloud Services (PBCS), Essbase Administration Services (EAS), Hyperion Shared Services, Financial Reporting Studio, Hyperion Workspace, and Hyperion Smart View Excel Add in).Experience with SQL Developer.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite 2013 / 2016 (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Project).Work Environment:This job Name: Business Analyst, Product Management
Description: COMPANY OVERVIEWFor over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 40 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com, LastCall.com, and CUSP.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates works towards the goal of enabling our customer to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.DESCRIPTIONThis position is for an e-commerce Business Analyst who works in the Product Management department as a team member in a product team. Responsibilities include working with the Product Manager to facilitate business improvement through the discovery, analysis and documentation of functional and nonfunctional business requirements to implement products across all four Neiman Marcus Group websites. The ideal candidate advocates for our customers first and is highly analytical with experience in e-commerce. RESPONSIBILITIES:Converting business needs/user requirements into functional requirementsElicit requirements using through discovery, analysis, use cases, scenarios, competitive product analysis, site visits and supports the ongoing management of the requirementsDocument Customer journey and business process flows as neededMap functional requirements to customer journey and collaborate with technical teams for completenessOrganizes and facilitates feature kickoffs with business stakeholders and dependent teamsIdentify feature level dependencies and owns the process from inception to launchCollaborate with user experience group to ensure all business requirements are translated into customer experienceReview wireframes to ensure all requirements are met, as well as accuracy of all annotationsTrack to plan on key deliverables by writing effective business requirements to allow teams to execute quality productsConduct impact analysis on business processes due to feature enhancements or technology changesDevelop a firm understanding from product owners and other business stakeholders of internal and external customer problems and works the product roadmapAssist development and QA testing teams in understanding the requirements and ensure that proper testing is donePerforms other duties as assignedQUALIFICATIONSMinimum 2 years of e-commerce experience in a business analyst role Analytical and results-orientedKnowledge of Agile methodologies Ability to meet deadlines while working on multiple initiatives Ability to work individually and within a team environmentStrong communication skills including both written and presentation skillsStrong written and oral communication skillsRequires a Bachelor’s degreeExperience in Agile tools preferred

Name: Business Analyst

Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.  Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.  As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know:  + We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.  + We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.  + We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.  If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more. *THE RGP CONSULTING EXPERIENCE** RGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects aligning to their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path. *PURPOSE OF THE ROLE** As a Business Systems Analyst, you will help our clients execute their project and system initiatives, combining systems knowledge with functional experience in accounting, information management, human capital, internal audit, and supply chain to help Clients ensure project success. *ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP** + Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues  + A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues  + Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues  + Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents  + A strong personal identification with RGP?s values ? loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent *KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE** + Define and document business requirements and functional specifications from business users and subject matter experts; perform business needs analysis and design workflows, including ?as is? and ?to be? process mapping  + Lead requirements validation and traceability analysis through stakeholder engagement meetings  + Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and system testing; write test plans as required  + Analyze large, complex data sets and provide insights to the business  + Provide data support (e.g., request handling, ad-hoc analysis, etc.) to meet the needs of finance operations and other stakeholder groups  + Collect timely feedback from stakeholder groups in order to ensure terms of requirements and specifications are being met through solutions being built  + Perform interface analysis, including proper mapping of how the technology infrastructure and systems share data to achieve business goals  + Provide insight for the user interface with the systems  + Assess and mitigate risks in systems and business structures *DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS** + Bachelor's degree in business, information systems or similar discipline is required; Master?s degree preferred  + ????5 to 7-plus years of experience as a business analyst  + Functional background in Finance or Accounting, Insurance, Financial Services or Management Information Systems is strongly preferred  + Previous system implementation and process improvement experience; deep knowledge of large ERP packages a plus  + Strong understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements  + Advanced MS Excel skills required: pivot tables, v and h lookups, import/export, modeling, etc.  + Advanced MS Visio and MS PowerPoint skills  + Excellent skills in planning and organization as well as verbal and written communication  + Ability to adapt quickly to new situations, changes in direction and adjusted priorities *Equal Opportunity Employer** RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply. \#IND-TECH

Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills.
