Name: Business Data Analyst VBA/SQL
Description: Job Description Solomon, the leading performance improvement company for the global energy industry, is seeking candidates for a Business Data Analyst (VBA/SQL/advanced analytics) position to work in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment. This position will work closely with energy industry experts to design and conduct industry benchmarking studies. While these experts provide in-depth knowledge of the industry, these experts must be leveraged by partnering with a skilled data analyst capable of processing large amounts of benchmarking data through various automation tools. As such, this position will play a vital role in all aspects of the benchmarking process, including: Designing electronic form-based solutions for consistently collecting participant dataMaintaining a relational database for storing the collected dataPerforming database uploads, calculations, and queriesValidating the data for accuracy by designing data quality checksUsing advanced analytics methods and tools to perform first- and second-level data analysisDesigning and building electronic reports and data visualizations that provide participants with key insights about their performanceReviewing the final reports for accuracy and delivering them to participants while maintaining the highest level of quality and confidentiality This role often requires developing creative solutions to respond to ad hoc data requests from both the industry experts and clients. To be successful in this role, the person must be highly collaborative, innovative, responsive, and versatile with the ability to effectively build strong partnerships. The position is located in Solomon's Dallas, Texas office. QualificationsEducationRequired:Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalentPreferred:Engineering degree or MBA Work Experience Required:37 years of programming experience in a Microsoft environment (VBA, Excel macros, etc.)15 years Microsoft SQL database programming experienceExperience using advanced analytical methods and tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, custom tools, etc.) Technical Skills Required:Microsoft Office VBA development, Database development (Microsoft SQL Server preferred)Preferred:C# programming, VB.NET programming, Web programming (JavaScript, HTML, etc.) Non-Technical Skills Required:Excellent writing and verbal skills working with both developers and non-technical personnelProficiency in Microsoft Office products (particularly Excel and PowerPoint)Preferred:Experience in an engineering firm, especially oil, gas, or petrochemicals Other Required:Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, the ability to work independently with limited supervisionHigh energy and an inquisitive mindPreferred:Bilingual Employment Type  Full Time Additional Information We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.  The work environment characteristics, and any physical and mental requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: COMPANY OVERVIEW For over a century, the Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites.  The Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, Last Call and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 40 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer.  Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer divisions include NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com, Horchow.com, and LastCall.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates works towards the goal of enabling our customer to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.  Role Summary  The Neiman Marcus Group is looking for a Senior Business Analyst (SBA) who has experience in Corporate Operations to join the Business Solutions Management (BSM) team. The position reports to the Manager of BSM responsible for Order Management and Customer Care, Marketing, Analytics and Reporting.  Our expectation is that you are comfortable with business analysis, business process documentation and requirements gathering techniques, as well as project management methodology and facilitation. You should be self-directed, but thrive being part of a team of analysts. Specific responsibilities include: supporting cross-functional project teams, documenting business requirements, supporting User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and communicating their findings.  Key Responsibilities: (Should have 2-3 years' experience in all or most of the below.) Serve as the key liaison between the Business and IT teams to proactively clarify business ideas, needs and problems that require technologyDefine and document detailed business requirements by gathering input from vested business and technical partiesWork with your manager and project team to create high level approaches and solutions (scope, functionality, business processes)Understand target audiences' needs, tasks, and goals and translate them into creative concepts and functional componentsAbility to prepare presentations for project teams and stakeholdersCommunicate challenges and issues as appropriateWork as a member of cross-functional teams comprised of dedicated and shared resources from the business, IT, and 3rd party service providersProvide input to IT project plans in areas of high level requirements, approach to testing and implementation planningParticipate and assist Test Teams in quality assurance reviews to ensure all business requirements have been satisfiedRequirements:Requires a BS/BA or equivalent experience is necessary2-3 years' successful track record as a Business Analyst or similar experienceBusiness analysis skills including facilitation, process documentation, requirements gathering, UAT, change management and warranty supportPositive track record participating in successful projects with cross-functional teams and a proven ability to balance multiple daily tasks and long-term strategic projectsUnderstanding of Software Development MethodologiesAbility to work well independently and under pressure, as well as be highly responsive to business needsStrong focus on teamwork and ability to develop relationships across multiple departmentsResults oriented with great attention to detailStrong written and oral communication skillsHigh comfort level with Microsoft Applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Project, Visio) Additional Skills: (PLUS for the job) Experience with Agile Development MethodologyHaving strong understanding of business concepts and operationsKnowledge of business & marketing procedural controls and data validation techniques are a plusStrong experience with a variety of IT solutions and solid understanding of retail business

Name: Product Analyst, Business Technology
Description: Salesforce is looking for a Business Technology Product Analyst to work as a business systems analyst (BSA) on a project-focused team, collaborating with geographically dispersed scrum teams and business partners on critical internal initiatives for a multi-billion dollar business. These activities will support and span several domains including, but not limited to, Sales (Lead to Cash), Finance, Post-Sales (Customer Success Group), and a variety of other business and system processes. This senior role requires someone who is knowledgeable, confident, and enthusiastic about perpetually learning as well as excited about sharing their knowledge with their teams and partners. The Business Technology Product Analyst will provide guidance throughout the life of a project, from the initial phases of helping identify business requirements to developing and executing strategies to completing flawless execution to production. They translate the business needs into actionable requirements by gathering enough information to make a solution possible as well as helping drive clarity to make rational decisions. Responsibilities: You will collaborate with a variable group of Product Owners, Project Managers, BSAs and business stakeholders on requirements, business value scoring and success metrics. You will drive the requirements gathering process such that the end product accurately reflects business needs which includes: risk/impact analysis, “as is” and “to be” process documentation, success metric identification, functional requirements (including acceptance criteria), all agnostic of a specific technical solution. You will be responsible for reviewing technical solutions for compliance to business process and objectives as well as coordinating the end to end UAT cycle. Depending on the project, you may also participate in the development of an organizational change management framework.Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS, STEM or other discipline or equivalent experience.0-2 years of relevant experience at Salesforce or three years of relevant experience elsewhereExperience with one or more of the following roles: technical support, account management, project management and/or consulting.Typically is a specialist in 1-3 product/platform areas.Able to:Guide internal customers throughout all aspects of the software development life cycle, including agile practices, from writing user stories and acceptance criteria to coordinating end to end and user acceptance testing.Work proactively to predict and minimize potential issues before they arise, and resolves those that do in a timely manner.Interact with large data sets to extract insights, validate decisions, and influence change.Must be a self-starter, highly motivated, able to shift directions quickly when priorities changeWilling to receive direction and guidance within a team environment, adopt and develop best practices and circumnavigate obstacles with creative technical solutionsExcellent spoken and written communication as well as receptive listening skillsExcellent team player able to work with virtual and global cross functional teamsExcellent influencing and negotiation skills.Ability to juggle multiple projects and tasks. Demonstrated knowledge of project management concepts and techniques required.Determine best methods and procedures on new assignments.Ability to work with deadlines and in a fast paced environment.Quickly become a subject matter expert in business and system processes within scope of project(s). Negotiate detailed requirement and solution design trade-offs.Perform some Product Owner responsibilities: create product roadmaps, groom backlogs, facilitate with senior leadership.Proficient with:General Business Processes (Sales, Marketing, Service, Support)Business Applications (CRM) and AutomationSalesforce Core product and featuresForce.com features and capabilitiesInternet Architecture and Cloud Computing ConceptsGeneral IT (database, security, networking, integrations) concepts and programming conceptsPosting StatementSalesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF POSITION Cogent Midstream is a private equity backed midstream oil and gas company with assets in the prolific Permian basin. Cogent operates the largest private greenfield gathering and processing system in the Southern Midland Basin. The Company is experiencing significant growth and seeking a Business Development Analyst to support the business development and finance teams. Description: Data Analyst - (1744.1)  Job Title Data Analyst  Location Corporate - Dallas, TX 75219 US (Primary)  Category Actuarial  Job Type Full-time  Career Level Entry Level  Education Bachelor's Degree  % Travel Job Description Come join us and become a champion with GAINSCO! By joining GAINSCO, you will become part of a dynamic and growing organization that was recognized as one of the Top Workplaces in Dallas and Miami. Name: Business Analyst - DAL
Description: What is a CTRM Consultant? Fortune 500 companies will look to you and your team to help solve various complex problems around commodity trading. You will help major companies streamline their commodity trading operations by finding innovative solutions to problems with their business processes. Maximize your problem solving skills through exposure to a variety projects and their different aspects. Once you learn the technical systems and have a healthy overall business knowledge around CTRM, then you can choose the career path as a Software Implementation consultant/Technical Consultant (writing the code for implementations, upgrades & enhancements), Business Analyst/functional consultant (gathering requirements & making sure that the project will perfectly fit the end goal business needs of our clients), or become a hybrid consultant who enjoys both. About You Bachelors degree or higher in Computer/Mechanical/Industrial/Chemical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent with minimum overall GPA of 3.3 The ability to work with and provide input on a collaborative team while accepting other ideas with an open mind · Personal drive to work in a self-motivated, self-directed fashion · Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to explain complex concepts to a non-technical audience, due to this being a client-facing role · Ability to travel Monday Thursday (weekly) The ability to analyze and translate large datasets An understanding of application development (C#, Java and/or SQL are a plus) MS Excel and modeling experience are a plus Provided Training If you possess the core competencies that make a great consultant for our team, then we will spend the first few weeks surrounding you with seasoned senior consultants who are experts in the industry to train you on everything from energy commodities to CTRM solution delivery. It is our goal to make sure that everyone on our team is the best in the industry. capSpire expects our future hires to continue with this passion of collaborating with and enabling those around them to be successful.  About Us capSpire is in the process of growing our consulting team and places extreme value on the quality of our team. We are looking for self-motivated individuals to be apart of a global system integration and technology firm driven by our passion to create meaningful solutions for our clients. Take on new challenges in a collaborative environment where great minds come together to solve tough problems and challenge each other to create innovative solutions for our clients in the Commodity Trading Risk Management industry. capSpire provides the ability to maximize employee growth according to your relentless problem solving and team effort. If you have a passion for technology and enjoy working with likeminded and intelligent team members with deep industry experience, then capSpire might be the perfect fit for you.

Name: Analyst, Business Systems

Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making. Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive. Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Advanced technical skills. Advanced SQL knowledge. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. Track record of following through on commitments. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. Written and verbal communication, including technical writing skills. Understanding of systems engineering concepts. The ability to conduct cost/benefit analysis. Modeling techniques and methods. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook

Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas believes in the diversity of our people, ideas and experiences, and we are committed to building an inclusive culture that represents the communities we serve.ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY:As part of the nation’s central bank, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is committed to strengthening the economy and our communities. At the Fed, you have the opportunity to become part of an important public service institution whose work touches lives across the globe. It’s a big job and that’s why we need talented, results-driven professionals who care about making a difference.POSITION SUMMARY:Currently the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is seeking self-motivated and customer focused Senior Business Analyst to serve as an integral member of a national team responsible for supporting the core functions of the Credit Risk Management business line.RESPONSIBILITIES:The Senior Business Analyst will act as the liaison between the business users and the technical team with the following responsibilities:Understand and analyze business requirements by working with business stakeholdersDocument business requirements including use cases, UI interfaces and business rules.Lead projects including planning, conducting stakeholder meetings, requirements sign offs, user testing and signoffs.Provide user support and resolve support requests including analysis, documentation and resolution of the requests.Develop in-depth understanding of Credit Risk Management business function.COMPETENCIES:Functional Knowledge - Requires comprehensive understanding of concepts and principles within own discipline and knowledge of others. Ensures Accountability - Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments. Communicates Effectively - Develops and delivers communications that covey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. Customer Focus - Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer-centric solutions. Specifically, experience in developing and maintaining internal and external customer relationships and offering consulting based on subject matter expertise. Prioritization and Planning - Applies organizational, time management and planning skills in order to manage assigned workload and complete multiple job assignments with multiple deadlines. Initiative - Self-directed and motivated with the ability to work independently with minimal direction.EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:5 years of practical business analysis or credit risk experience.Well versed with the entire process of business analysis including requirement gathering, analysis and documentation, use case preparation, developing test plan and test cases.Strong customer focus and business acumen.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Highly motivated self-starter with an eagerness to learn.Extremely organized with strong time-management skills.Capable of adapting to changing requirements and responsibilities.SQL experience strongly preferred.WORK HOURS AND CONDITIONS:8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. Flexibility/ additional hours may be required based on business needs. Required average travel of up to 10& may be necessary to complete job duties and responsibilities.Notes:By federal law, this position requires that candidates fall within one of the following citizenship categories: (1) U.S. citizen, (2) U.S. national, (3) U.S. permanent residents who are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization, or (4) U.S. permanent residents who have applied for naturalization within six months of being eligible to do so.Position may be filled at multiple levels depending upon candidate’s experienceEmployment is contingent upon the selected candidate passing a background check and financial credit check.We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer

Name: Sales Business Analyst
Description: Sales Business Analyst Location  TX - Dallas Department  Sales (Non-Management)ID23321Apply Now Job BriefProvide administrative support to a manager or group of managers to facilitate the efficient use of time and resources. Name: SAP SD/OTC Business Systems Analyst
Description: SAP SD/OTC Business Systems Analyst  12 month+ contract  Location: Irving, Texas  IMMEDIATE new job opening for an SAP SD/OTC BSA focused in sales and distribution specifically in OTC. This individual will join our global client’s team at their North American headquarters in Irving, Texas. This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic company that is number one in its industry and become part of a dynamic IT team that is integral to the that company's operations and success. This role will be 70-80% functional and 30-20% technical. This individual will work with the business to solve SAP system processing problems and create new configuration to solve business problems. This role will require knowledge of AR, contracts, pricing and invoicing in addition to SD OTC.  This is primary an SAP support role but there will be some development that will consist of creating templates and assisting with tests as well as tweaking existing functionality as needed. Additionally, this individual will assist with migrations. Primary responsibilities will include providing user support, gathering user requirements, and configuring the system for new functionality. Aside from the S&D and OTC support, this individual may also assist with supporting project system, AR and fixed assets. This role will report to the Lead SAP BSA as well as the Manager of Business Systems.  RESPONSIBILITIES  o Provides 2nd and 3rd level SAP support to end users  o Works with developers to create and test new system functionality  o Partners with business users to coordinate application and testing of system enhancements  o Creates technical specifications for developers  o Installs and configures applications  o Acts as a liaison with vendors and consultants to address support activities  o Develops documentation to improve the use and availability of applications  o Provides expert level support and maintenance of core software functionality and technology components  o Works cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes  o Up to 10% travel may be required  REQUIREMENTS  o 7+ years of functional SAP BSA  o FICO experience, strong in AR  o Recent experience supporting OTC  o SD experience  o Experience creating templates and assisting with tests  o Experience tweaking existing functionality  o Experience with migrations  o Knowledge of AR, contracts, pricing, and invoicing  o Experience with project System, AR and Fixed Assets is a Plus!  o Expertise in both business and configuration knowledge for functional areas  o Requires project management skills; designs solutions for internal/external clients  o Considered a subject matter expert resource for others  o Proven experience in troubleshooting, testing and quality assurance techniques  o Proficient in the development of documentation to support functional specifications, data flows, etc.  o Bachelor's degree in Information MIS, Information Technology, Engineering, or other related field  *Must be a U.S. Citizen, Green Card Holder, or hold other status that allows you to be employed in the United States on a W2 basis without having to be sponsored by your employer.  **To view all of our open positions, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings.

That’s why we're always looking for creative and forward-thinking people who can help us achieve our goal of global interconnection. With 200 data centers in over 24 countries spanning across 5 continents, we are home to the Cloud, supporting over 1000 Cloud and IT services companies that are directly engaged in technological innovation and development. Name: Business Analyst/Quality Assurance
Description: Job Summary: The BA/QA group is responsible for the creation of all business requirements including process models, use cases, project plans and overall quality control of the internal system development. This position is responsible for planning and implementing business process analysis and technology plans. This position is also responsible for ensuring that IT solutions are in alignment with customer business objectives and initiatives. This individual will work with different groups within IT and business organizations to develop and prepare system requirements, designs, test plans and test cases. This role is responsible for identifying and documenting requirements and analyzing these requirements from a business perspective. receives guidance from senior manager.Ability to provide technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers.Requirements:High school diploma or equivalent required.Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferred.5+ years of work experience gathering requirements, writing test plans and procedures, tracking errors, documenting results.Demonstrated expertise in extracting business requirements using standard methodologies, and procedures. (Full SDLC)Strong experience with systems analysis and functional design.Extensive experience with documentation and problem resolution.Experienced in mentoring and supervising direct reports.Experience with agile software development methodologies is a plus.Previous experience with automated testing tools is a plus.Previous accounting, finance or actuarial experience is a plus.Previous insurance industry experience is a plus.Previous development experience is a plus.Other Information:Vibrant company cultureOn-site exercise facilityCompany Paid Health & Life 100%Paid PTO & HolidaysOptional: Dental, Vision, 401K and moreLocation: North Dallas: Spring Valley Rd. and Midway (75244) We do not provide sponsorships.  Agentra Healthcare Solutions creates lasting and affordable healthcare solutions to the uninsured, underinsured and small business owners. Established in 2005 and based in Dallas, TX (75244), we are a dynamic and rapidly growing insurance provider of affordable proprietary "boutique" products for life, health and dental. Agentra has been able to meet the needs of our rapidly expanding client base through strategic partnerships with top rated insurance carriers and benefit providers that have created exclusive products and benefit plans designed to meet the needs of our clients.  Agentra Healthcare Solutions excels as an organization and as individuals by being consumer focused and helping others achieve their goals. We believe there's no substitute for a strong honest work ethic and we think having some fun is part of our success! Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: COMPANY OVERVIEW For over a century, the Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites.  The Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, Last Call and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 40 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer.  Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer divisions include NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com, Horchow.com, and LastCall.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates works towards the goal of enabling our customer to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.  Role Summary  The Neiman Marcus Group is looking for a Senior Business Analyst (SBA) who has experience in Corporate Operations to join the Business Solutions Management (BSM) team. The position reports to the Manager of BSM responsible for Order Management and Customer Care, Marketing, Analytics and Reporting.  Our expectation is that you are comfortable with business analysis, business process documentation and requirements gathering techniques, as well as project management methodology and facilitation. You should be self-directed, but thrive being part of a team of analysts. Specific responsibilities include: supporting cross-functional project teams, documenting business requirements, supporting User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and communicating their findings.  Key Responsibilities: (Should have 2-3 years' experience in all or most of the below.) Serve as the key liaison between the Business and IT teams to proactively clarify business ideas, needs and problems that require technologyDefine and document detailed business requirements by gathering input from vested business and technical partiesWork with your manager and project team to create high level approaches and solutions (scope, functionality, business processes)Understand target audiences' needs, tasks, and goals and translate them into creative concepts and functional componentsAbility to prepare presentations for project teams and stakeholdersCommunicate challenges and issues as appropriateWork as a member of cross-functional teams comprised of dedicated and shared resources from the business, IT, and 3rd party service providersProvide input to IT project plans in areas of high level requirements, approach to testing and implementation planningParticipate and assist Test Teams in quality assurance reviews to ensure all business requirements have been satisfiedRequirements:Requires a BS/BA or equivalent experience is necessary2-3 years' successful track record as a Business Analyst or similar experienceBusiness analysis skills including facilitation, process documentation, requirements gathering, UAT, change management and warranty supportPositive track record participating in successful projects with cross-functional teams and a proven ability to balance multiple daily tasks and long-term strategic projectsUnderstanding of Software Development MethodologiesAbility to work well independently and under pressure, as well as be highly responsive to business needsStrong focus on teamwork and ability to develop relationships across multiple departmentsResults oriented with great attention to detailStrong written and oral communication skillsHigh comfort level with Microsoft Applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Project, Visio) Additional Skills: (PLUS for the job) Experience with Agile Development MethodologyHaving strong understanding of business concepts and operationsKnowledge of business & marketing procedural controls and data validation techniques are a plusStrong experience with a variety of IT solutions and solid understanding of retail business

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: We currently have a Business Intelligence Analyst career opportunity at our Dallas, TX location.  Essilor is an international company and the leading provider of eyeglass lenses in the world. Our mission is improving lives by improving sight, and we work every day to bring good vision to the 4.5 billion people around the globe in need of visual correction. Our products such as Varilux®, Crizal® and Transitions® are available in more than 130 countries and are worn by one billion people daily. Essilor of America and its subsidiary, Essilor Laboratories of America, Inc., employ more than 7,000 in the U.S. and own the largest and most comprehensive optical laboratory network in the U.S.Position Summary – Purpose and Objectives of the RoleDigital is at the heart of consumer awareness and interaction (search, select, buy) in our category and plays a key role in delivering on our Mission and growth objectives. Towards this end, we seek to establish a leadership position in providing consumers with information and tools to enhance their vision.  The Business Intelligence Analyst supports all DITAC programs (All About Vision, consumer acquisition, lead generation through pathways, retention) through data analysis, measurement and reporting that provides the operating teams with insights on progress and areas of opportunity.Key Areas of ResponsibilitiesScope of the role:  The main scope of the role is data analysis with focus on areas of interest for DITAC initiatives and reporting findings in a succinct manner.  Specific Responsibilities of the Role Include:  • Develop models, reports and other insight generating analyses and performance management scorecards in support of key DITAC initiatives  • Develop short and long-term action plans and aide in accountability to reach set goals.  • Collaborate regularly with various teams, including market analytics to make well rounded data-driven decisions and recommendations  • Develop and utilize dashboards effectively  • Develop, analyze, and modify processes, data structures, and models to ensure processes and products are relevant  • After analyzing the data, explain the implications of complex data in a concise and articulate manner  • Cooperate with our IT department to deploy software and hardware upgrades that make it possible for us to leverage big data use casesCandidate ProfileKnowledge / ExperienceDivisional or BU Experience  Experience in a Global data analysis or business intelligence UnitExperience / Track Record Data scientist in consumer facing domainProficient in data analysis tools (excel, Tableau, etc.)Proficiency in Google Analytics and web application data analysisExperience in Program Management and Community managementExperience in working with a team to perform data and process analyses requiredInteract with clients to evaluate products and performanceDefine requirements and provide simplified explanationsSynthesize data and feedback from users, clients, and managementAbility to understand and find appropriate applications for data and analysis resultsCollaborates with other members of formal and informal groups in the pursuit of common missions, vision, values and mutual goalsGathers and analyzes information or data on current and future trends of best practice. Seeks information on issues impacting the progress of organizational and process issues. Translates up to date information into continuous improvement activities that enhance performance.Industries Experience  Finance, retail, FMCG, marketing (marketing analyst) Back  Share

Name: Business Planning Analyst
Description: Job ID 25658BR  Job Posting Title Business Planning Analyst  Job Description Change the world, love your job. At Texas Instruments (TI), you will have the opportunity to learn and grow – and create world ­changing technology. For more than 80 years, TI has continually reinvented itself by believing in people with endless curiosity who refuse to leave the world just how they found it. From developing leading edge semiconductor technologies and practicing responsible manufacturing, to caring for our employees and communities, innovating a better world is in our DNA. Come discover TI and why you belong here. We have an immediate opening for an Operations Analyst. The selected candidate will be joining a dynamic and energetic team in the midst of an exciting time for the product lines and will play a pivotal role in achieving business growth objectives and priorities for the organization. Primary Responsibilities: • Drive operational excellence in shipping performance, revenue attainment, lead­times, inventory management, and overall customer satisfaction. • Interface with business units, the technology and manufacturing group (TMG) as well as overseas internal and external factories to insure capacity requirements are understood and bottlenecks/risks are managed. • Support the business through excellent customer support, including direct communications with customer service, field sales, marketing, QA and product engineering. • Gather demand requirements that include customer forecasts, internal forecasts, and firm demand to represent appropriate forecast loadings. • Drive system and process improvements to enhance and enable planning systems • Builds a strong relationship with sales and develops account specific pricing strategies & robust business cases for escalations • Ensure backlog coverage while validating backlog integrity. • Understand customer’s end business markets, utilizing this knowledge to assist business forecasting and anticipate disruptions. • Build a strong business relationship with the supply chain community at each account, and develop an in depth knowledge of the customer’s procurement methodologies. Education/Experience: • Ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of operations experience  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively communicate with management, regions, customers and functional boundaries. • Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills, business acumen and judgment. • Needs to have a proactive work style with a strong work ethic, be a self­starter, have demonstrated ability to multi­task and work well under pressure with a positive and team ­centered attitude. • Good knowledge of SC operations/business planning systems (SAP etc) and processes as well as the manufacturing processes. • Advanced MS Excel skills (pull queries, create and manipulate pivot tables/charts, etc). • Effective negotiation skills preferred • Bachelor’s Degree in industrial engineering, supply chain management, other business related field, or equivalent To be considered for this position, please apply to this requisition. Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to protected characteristics, including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or age.  Job Opening Type Experienced Professional  Minimum Education Level Bachelor's Level Degree  Related Field(s) of Study Supply Chain Management  Minimum Years of Experience 2  Regular / Temporary Regular  Full-time / Part-time Full-Time  Country United States  Job Location(s) USA-Texas-Dallas Metroplex  Virtual / Telecommute No

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst - (1744.1)  Job Title Data Analyst  Location Corporate - Dallas, TX 75219 US (Primary)  Category Actuarial  Job Type Full-time  Career Level Entry Level  Education Bachelor's Degree  % Travel Job Description Come join us and become a champion with GAINSCO!  GAINSCO is one of the fastest-growing companies in the nonstandard personal automobile market! By joining GAINSCO, you will become part of a dynamic and growing organization that was recognized as one of the Top Workplaces in Dallas and Miami. In 2018, GAINSCO has been recognized for the third time by The Dallas Morning News in its annual Top 100 Places to Work survey. Additionally, GAINSCO was recognized as a Workplace Achiever, one of the Top 150 companies in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.  Our culture attracts engaged individuals who have a desire to contribute and succeed. We encourage individuals to grow their skills as they build their careers. Essential Job Functions: % of Time  Results Expected and Duties Performed 40% Extract and transform both internal and external data to be used in various analysis  Serve as subject matter expert on reports and analysis. 30% Effectively understand the business problems, and be able to communicate findings to ensure analysis are well understood and incorporated into business practices  Establish and publish core, and ad hoc, reporting to be used to convey various performance metrics  Identify and solve complex problems by collecting and analyzing statistical, financial, and/or competitive information (including internal and external data), to help make critical business decisions  Determine the best data visualization to be used to turn information into insights 30% Design and maintain monitoring reports.  Job Requirements Job Requirements: Education: Bachelor's degree, with preference given to MIS, IT, Data Science, Actuarial Science, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field of study  Experience: 1 or more years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably with personal auto insurance  Skills and Abilities: Strong computer skills including the ability to manage and manipulate data in Excel and programming knowledge such as SAS and/or SQL  Compensation: Competitive salary based on experience. Excellent benefits package: medical, dental, vision insurance, life insurance, short term and long term disability insurance, Parental Leave Policy, 401K, Paid Vacation and Holidays.  GAINSCO is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Business Intelligence Analyst  Position summaryThe primary focus of this position will work closely with advanced analysis of operational and behavioral data. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for performing data discovery and analysis activities to identify specific information required to support client decisions and then present these results in a meaningful and intuitive format, using a variety of BI tools and techniques.  The ideal candidate for this position is highly analytical, has a natural curiosity inclined toward business and strong technical abilities. More over this role, will need an added emphasis on maximizing opportunities within out pricing department. Scope & Responsibilities:Provides accurate and timely answers to routine questions from customers.Acts as the first line of support for data questions and issues and strives to become data subject matter expert for client.Responsible for programs that are accurate, efficient and well documented.Works collaboratively with peers to develop quality protocols, schema, and reports per agreed timelines.Extract from SQL tables and analyze information.Create and maintain analytical reports in Excel and other tools to monitor business performance key metrics and programs.Develop, maintain and distribute ad-hoc reports and Excel models as needed.Identify business obstacles (through analysis) and produce actionable solutions.Requirements:Experience in pricing analyticsBachelor's degree with 1-3 yrs professional experience.Strong organizational skills with the ability to pivot & multi-task while under pressure and ability to deliver within fixed deadlines.Strong analytical skills, work ethic, independence, problem solving ability, effective communication skills, and overall positive attitude.Works independently with little or no supervision.Technical Requirements:Advanced in Microsoft ExcelAbility to create advanced formulas and dynamic dashboards.Strong experience in SQLTableau & Tableau server (tk9nah)Preferred:Experience with HTML, web development & webhooks.R, SPSS, or other statistical analysis softwareExperience in finance and/or logistics industry highly preferred.WE ARE COMMITTED TO GIVING YOU:A competitive starting base salaryOngoing supportAdvancement opportunityA comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage as well as the opportunity to participate in our 401(k) program WHO ARE WE?  Quite simply, we make shipping simple. Worldwide Express is a relationship company offering customers a comprehensive solution for their shipping needs, whether it be a small package, less-than-truckload or full truckload. We are a local partner for our customers’ global supply chain, providing consultative service from more than 125 offices across the nation. Through our relationship with UPS® and a highly selective carrier portfolio, we provide our customers with a breadth of shipping options unmatched in the 3PL field.  Worldwide Express has a strategic partnership with UPS for light package, domestic and international shipping to penetrate the small to medium size business sector. As UPS's largest non-retail authorized reseller in North America, our sales teams do what they do best, which is providing solutions to C-Level executives while letting UPS do what they do best: deliver more packages on time than anyone else. In addition to our relationship with UPS, WWEX has alliances with over 65 LTL, Domestic Air Freight, and International Air Freight carriers. WWEX provides tailored services and individualized shipping solutions to fit the needs of any small to medium-sized business customers.  Worldwide Express is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Worldwide Express Operations, LLC, and WWEX Franchise Holdings, LLC (collectively “Worldwide Express”) strive to make employment decisions on the basis of merit, seeking the most qualified individuals in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin or ancestry, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other status protected by law. All employment decisions will be based on valid job requirements or other legitimate, non-discriminatory reasons. Worldwide Express offers reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in the job application and hiring process. If you would like to request such an accommodation, please contact the Vice President of Human Resources for Worldwide Express.

Name: Business Analyst (technical, software development, product management)
Description: Tracking Code 145-237 Job Description Pieces Tech is reimagining the intersection of technology and healthcare. We design and build systems that interpret clinical data in real-time and we're building a healthcare social network. Our cloud systems predict the onset of clinical deterioration well before it occurs, and in doing so allow clinicians to provide better and targeted care.Your place is with us of you are passionate about inventing and thinking on innovative systems. If you enjoy requirements elicitation and systems design this opportunity will introduce you to some of the most complex business and technical questions of modern software systems. We are looking for Business Analyst (BA) with excellent verbal and communication skills, past experience a product manager and in software development, and current experience in analysis of business processes, workflow, design thinking about app usability and usefulness and functionality. You will be an important bridge between engineering and other business units, and our clients. This is a technical BA role and you will be expected to learn the internals of our systems and implementation methodology. You will be an integral part of Pieces Tech product innovation and software development life cycle. The responsibilities of the Business Analyst at Pieces Tech include the following:Write requirements and specification documentsBe the voice of the product, collect ideas into roadmaps, prioritize and advance features from ideation to having our engineers build softwareCommunicate well, before there is an issue, and often. Be honest and precise.Manage the scope, be sensitive to schedule and budget.Research new ideas, present alternatives and experimental results.Differentiate between level of effort and scheduling and manage customer expectations.Design systems that enable customers to yield value from our systems.Prepare and give presentations to peers, employees, senior management, and external contacts. You are required to have excellent verbal and written communication skills.Abstract and develop data models and GUI.Have an appreciation for technical and other project related documentation. You will be chiefly accountable for this important component of our projects. Keep documentation on par with current releases.Develop and publish release notesCollect and publish KPIsOwn your tasks, be able to take notes and follow through. Required Skills We’re looking for people who are:Inventive  We want people who are going to own their role, show initiatives, and seek out responsibilities. We aim lead our industry and our Software Engineering team plays a crucial role in helping us get there. If you are inventive and creative, Pieces Tech is looking for you. Fresh perspectives and thinking outside the realm of known possibilities will differentiate you. Passionate You must be passionate and inspirational to be successful at Pieces Tech. We are looking for A-players with a desire to take projects from ideation to completion – across the full spectrum of our business.Versatile Our team is involved in full-stack development, interesting big-data questions, challenging fault-tolerant and clustered cloud systems, social graphs, and building ingenious machine-user interfaces for classical and mobile presence. We want teammates who are willing to take on the unexpected and be happy with the diversity of technical work we offer. Required Experience EDUCATIONYou must have a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.We appreciate an advanced degree in business or related area.No certification is required for this position.REQUIREDRequired: 3-5 years experience in product management or BA roles, health care technology experience preferred. Exceptional critical thinking and strong verbal and written communications skills.At least three years of continuously taking additional responsibilities such as business analysis, requirement gathering, or team leadership.Be on top of your game. Be honest and a humble team player. Enjoy writing and communicating. Working knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, diagramming, etc.Pay attention to details. If you decide to apply to this role include the phrase “Mars” in a creative way in your resume or cover letter.ADVANTAGEOUSPast experience with the following:Product Management background. Having worked for and within a product team.Hands on coding experience would be a plus:Knowledge with Data modeling, Data warehousing technologies, and ETL tools.Linux scripting.Experience with Relational and NoSQL databases.Experience with HTML, CSS, UI design.Hands on coding experience with developing reports and widgets using Microstrategy. Job Location Dallas, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular

Dematic employs over 6,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors. Across more than 100 countries worldwide, the KION Group designs, builds and supports logistics solutions that optimize material and information flow within factories, warehouses and distribution centers. Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas believes in the diversity of our people, ideas and experiences, and we are committed to building an inclusive culture that represents the communities we serve.ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY:As part of the nation’s central bank, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is committed to strengthening the economy and our communities. At the Fed, you have the opportunity to become part of an important public service institution whose work touches lives across the globe. It’s a big job and that’s why we need talented, results-driven professionals who care about making a difference.POSITION SUMMARY:Currently the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is seeking self-motivated and customer focused Senior Business Analyst to serve as an integral member of a national team responsible for supporting the core functions of the Credit Risk Management business line.RESPONSIBILITIES:The Senior Business Analyst will act as the liaison between the business users and the technical team with the following responsibilities:Understand and analyze business requirements by working with business stakeholdersDocument business requirements including use cases, UI interfaces and business rules.Lead projects including planning, conducting stakeholder meetings, requirements sign offs, user testing and signoffs.Provide user support and resolve support requests including analysis, documentation and resolution of the requests.Develop in-depth understanding of Credit Risk Management business function.COMPETENCIES:Functional Knowledge - Requires comprehensive understanding of concepts and principles within own discipline and knowledge of others. Ensures Accountability - Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments. Communicates Effectively - Develops and delivers communications that covey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. Customer Focus - Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer-centric solutions. Specifically, experience in developing and maintaining internal and external customer relationships and offering consulting based on subject matter expertise. Prioritization and Planning - Applies organizational, time management and planning skills in order to manage assigned workload and complete multiple job assignments with multiple deadlines. Initiative - Self-directed and motivated with the ability to work independently with minimal direction.EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:5 years of practical business analysis or credit risk experience.Well versed with the entire process of business analysis including requirement gathering, analysis and documentation, use case preparation, developing test plan and test cases.Strong customer focus and business acumen.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Highly motivated self-starter with an eagerness to learn.Extremely organized with strong time-management skills.Capable of adapting to changing requirements and responsibilities.SQL experience strongly preferred.WORK HOURS AND CONDITIONS:8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. Flexibility/ additional hours may be required based on business needs. Name: CRA Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionCompany Overview Veritex Holdings Inc. is a publicly traded bank holding company headquartered in Dallas, Texas. Through our wholly-owned subsidiary, Veritex Community Bank, a state chartered bank, we provide relationship-driven commercial banking products and services tailored to meet the needs of small to medium-sized businesses and professionals. Since our inception, we have targeted customers and acquisitions primarily in the Dallas Metropolitan area. We have expanded to 22 locations including a mortgage office. We are a fast growing and dynamic organization. The quality of our employees and their dedication to service is what separates us from other banks of any size. We strive to attract and retain exceptional employees who share our commitment to superior customer service, continued growth and organizational success.  In 2017, we were recognized as one of the Top 100 Places to Work in Dallas by The Dallas Morning News as well as one of the Best Banks to Work for in the US by The American Banker!  Role:  Reviews CRA related data to ensure accurate and timely regulatory reporting.  Essential Functions & Responsibilities:  Reviews loan information to maintain data integrity for regulatory reporting  Assists with compliance monitoring and reporting for CRA activities.  Assists with data analysis and regulatory examinations for CRA.  Assists with implementation of banking laws and regulations.  Conducts general research, as directed.  Performs other job related duties as assigned. Performance Measurements:To provide timely, accurate, professional and administrative support.To meet required deadlines for reviews and report preparationTo maintain a professional work environment and businesslike appearance.To keep manager informed regarding key operating issues affecting the department.To provide informed professional assistance to others in the bank as requested.To maintain a dependable record of attendance and timeliness.To maintain the confidentiality of all bank and customer dataTo comply with all federal and state banking laws and regulations Knowledge and Skills:  Experiene Two or more years experience in a financial institution. Education A high school education or GED. Knowledge of basic banking laws and regulations.  Interpersonal Skills  Work normally involves contacts with persons beyond immediate associates generally regarding routine matters for purposes of giving or obtaining information which may require some discussion. External contacts take the form of service to the public (customers or vendors) requiring ordinary courtesy in providing assistance and exchanging factual information.  Other Skills - Ability to collect data, define problems, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Must be detail oriented with the ability to follow instructions and yet work independently. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point to perform job related tasks. Working knowledge of regulatory compliance issues.  Some knowledge of Loan Policy and Procedures and core banking systems is preferred.  This Job Description is not a complete statement of all duties and responsibilities comprising the position.Company DescriptionCompany Overview  Veritex Holdings Inc. is a publicly traded bank holding company headquartered in Dallas, Texas. Through our wholly-owned subsidiary, Veritex Community Bank, a state chartered bank, we provide relationship-driven commercial banking products and services tailored to meet the needs of small to medium-sized businesses and professionals. Since our inception, we have targeted customers and acquisitions primarily in the Dallas Metropolitan area. We have expanded to 22 locations including a mortgage office. We are a fast growing and dynamic organization. The quality of our employees and their dedication to service is what separates us from other banks of any size. We strive to attract and retain exceptional employees who share our commitment to superior customer service, continued growth and organizational success.  In 2017, we were recognized as one of the Top 100 Places to Work in Dallas by The Dallas Morning News as well as one of the Best Banks to Work for in the US by The American Banker!

Name: Sr Financial Analyst
Description: OverviewWorldVentures, a dynamic, global, fast growing member based travel company, is currently sourcing for a Senior Financial Analyst to be based in our Plano, Texas headquarters. WorldVentures is a fast paced environment with a core of innovation and fun. If you are prepared to grow your career, wear multiple hats, and be part of a fast paced team with a focus on exceptional service, this may be the role for you.The Sr. Financial Analyst, reporting to the Sr. Director of Analytics, under general direction with minimal oversight will work on, but are not limited to, annual budgeting process, executive level reporting, data analysis, financial modeling, and evolving into a subject matter expert. A successful candidate will be a highly self-motivated, detailed oriented individual who is a naturally curious problem solver, capable of working either independently or as part of a group, in a professional environment. This candidate will have a strong passion to identify and solve real business problems using data, analytical skills and should have excellent presentation skills to explain complicated analyses in a clear and concise manner. Additionally, he or she should be a pro-active problem solver who can think out-of-the-box to provide the best solution to problems. The successful candidate will work closely with executives and the business units.  ResponsibilitiesAnalyze financial results by identifying drivers and variances from prior year, budget and forecast, and explain variances.Create monthly, quarterly and annual financial presentations to review performance results to management by assembling and summarizing data, identifying trends, and effectively communicating analyses and variance(s) with a level of detail appropriate to the audience. Build and maintain of Budgeting, Financial Forecasting, Financial Reporting, Operating Plan, and other projects.Work with leadership and the analytics team to develop and monitor key performance indicators, analyze, highlighting trends and variances.Develop and maintain financial models for new business opportunities, promotions and other special projectsConduct in-depth research of historical financial data; analyze and report company’s current financial statusWorks with accounting team, analytics team, other internal departments to provide documents as neededAd-Hoc Reporting and Analysis QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Science, or any related field from an accredited institution.Master’s degree in Business Administration is an added advantage.3 - 5 years of relevant experience in the Finance department, including budgeting/forecasting, financial modeling, financial systems, internal financial reporting, and business operations supportThe ability to think analytically, solve problems to complex business processes, and document results.Advanced knowledge and experience using Microsoft Office, specifically MS Excel, MS Access and PowerPoint.Experience working in SQL is a plus.Solid mathematical aptitude and effective project management skills.WorldVentures is a privately held company based in Plano, Texas with active representatives and members in over 28 countries. WorldVentures proudly offers competitive salaries and benefits including but not limited to Medical, Dental, Vision, Life / AD&D, FSA, 401K and a robust vacation and holiday package. In addition, all full time employees automatically receive a WorldVentures membership at no cost to allow employees access to our exclusive DreamTrips group travel experiences.

Name: Ecommerce Business Analyst - 7/25
Description: Job DescriptionZuri, a fast growing modern home furnishings retailer and e-tailer, is looking for a bright motivated Business Analyst. Analysts will learn a great deal of finance & accounting, digital marketing (Facebook, PPC, Display, Product Ads, Amazon, Retargeting, etc.), graphic design (photoshop) and web design (html), and supply chain logistics. Analysts will be exposed to all parts of the online business.  Please do not apply more than once to this position. Qualifications:Strong math skillsExperience in Microsoft ExcelAn interest in finance and business operationsAn interest in ecommerceHTML and Javascript not required but beneficial3.4 or above GPAHighlights:You will be working directly with the owners of the business (former wall street and silicon valley veterans) to grow a new ecommerce initiative.Skills developed include: A. Working with product catalogs in excel  B. Working with Images and photo studios  C. Managing third party contractors (graphic design, SEO, SEM, photo editors)  D. Traffic acquisition (Display, affiliates, SEM, PLA, Retargetting, Emails, Amazon.com, etc)  E. Warehouse logistics  F. Exposure to corporate finance decisions Flexible hours and work schedule.Open to sponsorshipThis is a paid position. We will be investing significant time into teaching you the intricacies of ecommerce. Pay ranges from $10-$15 (depending on experience). This will quickly grow into a full time salaried position with market compensation rates.Other Job Duties IncludeIndependent time researching and learning different marketing channelsHeavy excel data entry and data model organizationHTML and Javascript front end website work where applicableManaging order flow and order fulfillment (ie figuring out the best way to run returns, finding inefficiencies in shipping) www.ZuriFurniture.comCompany DescriptionZuri Furniture has assembled an imaginative collection targeting style-conscious buyers. Blending contemporary styles, modern lines and comfortable appeal, we have fashioned one of the largest and most unique selections of furniture and décor for the home and office. In addition, Zuri carries modern art, classic accessories, brilliant area rugs, contemporary lighting and fireplaces.  Growing to a national company in less than a decade, Zuri has two brick and mortar stores in the Dallas area as well as a website offering shipping nationwide. As an ever expanding brand, you can expect innovative and fresh new pieces as we continually update and add new products to suit your needs. We understand that as styles evolve and change over the years, our customers want a variety of choices, not the same stale, decade-old designs.

Name: Senior CRM Analyst | Dallas
Description: Data + Design. It's how we work.  We believe in designing brand experiences that motivate people to buy and act. Our Buy Design process was built for this mission. With Centric, our data-driven model, at the center, Buy Design unites and powers the forces of science and creativity so that we deliver value at every touchpoint, inspiring people to buy into your brand and products.  We have a new opportunity for a Senior CRM Analyst in our downtown Dallas office (please note: our Dallas office is moving to Las Colinas in early 2019). This position will also require frequent visits to and workdays at the restaurant client location also in the Dallas area.  This individual will be responsible for researching, scheduling, producing, supporting, analyzing and delivering multiple reports/projects. This includes reviewing initial draft of results, analyses, reports, summarizing outcomes and conclusions and making recommendation in a concise and client-friendly manner. They will support the client’s Strategy/Planning and Account teams by developing strong analysis, ensuring a high degree of accuracy and supporting team in internal discussion. Builds advanced analytics capabilities, e.g. regression analysis, experimental design etc.Provides analytic leadership to client team – understands and interprets in-market data and other resources available.Enhances business/strategy operations through the development of consultative insights and presentations (e.g. can break down data into a compelling narrative).Uses logic to analyze data and capability to draw conclusions and convey or provide advice or consultation to business leadersManages the use and application of syndicated and non-syndicated data resourcesManages the development of a broad range of strategic business planning including, but not limited to; category management, product evaluation, promotion effectiveness/planning, basket analysis, trade fund evaluation and resource allocation.Subject matter expert in CRM and CPG channel/retail – ability to identify and leverage best practicesPartner with peer analysts at client partner agencies to provide seamless business monitoringDelivers professional and positive customer service experience The ideal person for this role must be flexible and tech savvy, with great organizational and communication skills.  Bachelor’s Degree required, advanced degree preferred.  Five or more years of analytics experience required. CRM experience required (email, direct, SMS/MMS). Quick-serve Restaurant (QSR/Fast Casual) Consumer Package Goods (CPG) industry experience preferred.  Experience with a broad range of consultative analytical techniques and concepts required.  Software & Data source experience desired: IRI/Nielsen, Simmons, Tableau, Google Analytics, Microsoft Office | Bonus Skills: VBA, SQL, Python  Success Factors: Strong analytical thinker and organization skillsA genuine passion/curiosity for research and analytics; ability to analyze dataAttention to detail and ability to deliver high quality resultsStrong written and verbal communication skills, and ability to clearly pull a story together; proficient/literate in Microsoft office (e.g. Excel/PowerPoint)Ability to understand market research results and use these results along with in-market data to pull together a storyAbility to prioritize and meet deadlinesDemonstrates ability to execute against projects for a variety of categories/products.Work effectively with client teams to execute projects We are happy to announce our move to Irving/Las Colinas early 2019! Our new address will be 7850 N. Beltline Road, Irving 75063.
