Name: SAP FI AR Business Systems Analyst
Description: SAP FI AR Business Systems Analyst  12 months+ contract  Location: Irving, Texas  IMMEDIATE new job opening for an SAP FI AR BSA focused in AR. This individual will join our global client's team at their North American headquarters in Irving, Texas. This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic company that is number one in its industry and become part of a dynamic IT team that is integral to the that company's operations and success. This role will be 70-80% functional and 30-20% technical. This individual will work with the business to solve SAP system processing problems and create new configuration to solve business problems. This role will require knowledge of AR, cash application (high radius) and credit management (get paid), specifically using these 3rd party tools.  This is primary an SAP support role but there will be some development that will consist of creating templates and assisting with tests as well as tweaking existing functionality as needed. Additionally, this individual will assist with migrations. Primary responsibilities will include providing user support, gathering user requirements, and configuring the system for new functionality.  RESPONSIBILITIES  o Provides 2nd and 3rd level SAP support to end users  o Works with developers to create and test new system functionality  o Partners with business users to coordinate application and testing of system enhancements  o Creates technical specifications for developers  o Installs and configures applications  o Acts as a liaison with vendors and consultants to address support activities  o Develops documentation to improve the use and availability of applications  o Provides expert level support and maintenance of core software functionality and technology components  o Works cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes  o Up to 10% travel may be required  REQUIREMENTS  o 7+ years of functional SAP BSA  o FI and AR senior level experience  o Experience working with cash applications and credit management  o Experience tweaking existing functionality  o Experience with migrations  o Knowledge of AR, contracts, pricing, and invoicing  o Experience with project System, AR and Fixed Assets is a Plus!  o Expertise in both business and configuration knowledge for functional areas  o Requires project management skills; designs solutions for internal/external clients  o Considered a subject matter expert resource for others  o Proven experience in troubleshooting, testing and quality assurance techniques  o Proficient in the development of documentation to support functional specifications, data flows, etc.  o Bachelor's degree in Information MIS, Information Technology, Engineering, or another related field  *Must be a U.S. Citizen, Green Card Holder, or hold other status that allows you to be employed in the United States on a W2 basis without having to be sponsored by your employer.  **To view all of our open positions, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings.

Name: Business Analyst IV- Modeling/Data Science
Description: THE COMPANYFannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progressJOB INFORMATIONExamine, assess, and document business operations and procedures of operating for administrative unit. Relate these procedures to IT/IS systems and applications that are designed to enable the operating unit to accomplish its objectives. Assist operating unit staff by developing reports, downloads, and analyses from discipline-specific systems and applications. Provide input to IT/IS specialists in development projects to assist in developing specifications and functionalities in IT systems.KEY JOB FUNCTIONSAssess business operations and processes of assigned office or business unit to identify inefficiencies in procedures, information flows and handoffs, decisions, communications pathways and ways in which systems supporting these can be enhanced. Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that accomplish business operations of assigned work unit(s). Create, design, and format technical specifications including descriptive text, process flows, and other information needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and other units; serve on project team accomplishing these functions. Provide support to applications in production by tracking production problems and troubleshooting them to sustain application in production. Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s), or develop specifications for such queries or analyses to be performed by others. Serve as team, project, or technical lead in project involving definition of business processes or development of technical/business specifications for new or modified business management or operational software.EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMBA, MS, or Doctorate a plusMINIMUM EXPERIENCE6 years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS4 years of hands-on experience with technical tools and coding.3 year’s hands-on experience with data mining, visualization, and complex analysis.3 years’ experience with business systems analysis.Demonstrated technical skills in coding, analysis through hands-on work experience and education.Strong Data Mining knowledge with use of SAS, SQL.Strong data visualization ability with tools like Tableau.Data-driven, results-oriented with the ability to quickly analyze data and make decisions that drive program performance. Business-minded focus with the ability to connect dots that help produce creative solutions for our customers.Understand systems, data flows, and architecture to assist with the creation and/or standardization of technology solutions.Strong written communication skills with the ability to create documentation for business requirements and/or functional/technical specifications.Ability to lead a team and mentor othersStrong interpersonal and presentation skills to synthesize and communicate information to senior management. Servicing, Mortgage Default, REO industry experience preferable.Statistical Analysis experience a plus.R and/or Python knowledge a plus.EMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Analyst, Regional & Specialty Banking
Description: OverviewAt Texas Capital Bank, we are driven by a single-minded and unwavering mission: to serve business and the individuals who run them. We use a consultative approach and innovative technologies to develop new ideas that give the bank and our clients a competitive advantage. For further information, please visit us at www.texascapitalbank.com. Name: Project Analyst
Description: BloomReach is a Silicon Valley firm that brings businesses the first open and intelligent Digital Experience Platform (DXP). We drive customer experience to accelerate the path to conversion, increase revenue, and generate customer loyalty. In 2016, BloomReach acquired the Amsterdam based content management software company Hippo.  With applications for content management, site search, page management, SEO and role-based analytics, BloomReach is a central location for all players who manage customer experience. Our Web Relevance Engine (WRE) algorithmically understands content and users, matching demand and intent data from across the web. BloomReach's portfolio of customers includes: Neiman Marcus, Staples, REI, Mailchimp and Air Miles. Created in 2009, BloomReach is headquartered in Mountain View, CA with offices worldwide and is backed by investment firms Bain Capital Ventures, Battery Ventures, NEA, Salesforce Ventures and Lightspeed Ventures.  BloomReach is seeking a Project Analyst. The primary responsibility is to assist Senior Project Managers, Technical Project Managers, other team members and customers in the implementation and execution of multiple BloomReach projects providing both administrative and logistic support of projects throughout the project lifecycle.  This role includes project scheduling, internal/external communication, risk analysis, reporting and change management. The Project Analyst will identify potential project issues, track and manage project tasks to resolution while assisting with the management and execution of all BloomReach professional services implementation projects. Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills are necessary to be successful in this position.  This role calls for someone who is professional with strong verbal and written communication skills. Other related activities include coordinating schedules with customers and vendors, tracking statements of work and PO's, supporting the successful onboarding of new clients, updating process documentation, identifying opportunities to excel within established processes and utilizing Workfront to create/assist with monthly revenue reporting for internal Business Managers. Responsibilities: Schedule customer kick-off calls, coordinate meetings with customers and provide email confirmation and updates to presentationsSchedule/conduct weekly status meetings with customers and provide weekly status reports to address and resolve outstanding issues with customers, track progress, budget and maintain ownership of issues through resolutionQualifications: Ability to travel up to 25% of the timeBachelor's Degree0-3 year(s) of professional experiencePreferred background in Customer Service, a positive can-do attitude and a high level of motivationTech savvy with a good understanding of computer systems, troubleshooting and networkingAbility to communicate clearly and concisely, both written and verbalStrong time management, task prioritization and problem-solving skillsAbility to multitask effectively with keen attention to detailAbility to work independently, taking ownership of assigned tasks through completionStrong Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Google Docs and Sheets skills requiredAbility to quickly learn, adapt/overcome in challenging customer situations and filter out project noise Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of BloomReach are considered property of BloomReach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Name: Business Data Analyst VBA\/SQL
Description: Title Business Data Analyst VBA/SQL  04-Sep-2018 Job Description Solomon, the leading performance improvement company for the global energy industry, is seeking candidates for a Business Data Analyst (VBA/SQL/advanced analytics) position to work in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment. This position will work closely with energy industry experts to design and conduct industry benchmarking studies. While these experts provide in-depth knowledge of the industry, these experts must be leveraged by partnering with a skilled data analyst capable of processing large amounts of benchmarking data through various automation tools. As such, this position will play a vital role in all aspects of the benchmarking process, including:• Designing electronic form-based solutions for consistently collecting participant data Maintaining a relational database for storing the collected dataPerforming database uploads, calculations, and queriesValidating the data for accuracy by designing data quality checksUsing advanced analytics methods and tools to perform first- and second-level data analysisDesigning and building electronic reports and data visualizations that provide participants with key insights about their performanceReviewing the final reports for accuracy and delivering them to participants while maintaining the highest level of quality and confidentiality This role often requires developing creative solutions to respond to ad hoc data requests from both the industry experts and clients. To be successful in this role, the person must be highly collaborative, innovative, responsive, and versatile with the ability to effectively build strong partnerships. The position is located in Solomon’s Dallas, Texas office. Name: Business Analyst, Corporate Development
Description: In an effort to  provide a more healthy, safe and satisfying environment to our employees,  individuals to whom job offers are extended may undergo nicotine testing as a  part of the pre-employment process.The Corporate Development team has an immediate need for a Business Analyst to support the team in the Dallas corporate office of Tenet Healthcare. The Business Analyst will support the team in processing and analyzing potential strategic opportunities including mergers, acquisitions, divestitures and real estate transactions. This role requires high attention to detail, ability to turn out a high volume of work in a highly visible business unit and an extremely fast paced operation.Key responsibilities include:Development of strategic analysis and related management presentations for review by senior executives and the board of directors (preparing complex business presentations in PowerPoint)Tracking and support of transactions and assigned projects and coordination with various internal departments (Excel)Development of models, including financial statement analysis and utilization of common business valuation methodologies to illustrate projected financial results (Excel)Organization and performance of due diligence on live transactions (on an as needed basis)Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in finance, accounting, or economics or equivalent/relevant experience1 to 3 years' experience in investment banking, management consulting, and/or M&A/corporate finance, preferably in healthcare industry. This is not a senior associate role.Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-based environment with minimal supervisionRequires flexibility and the ability to pivot / quickly respond to rapidly changing business needsExceptional problem solving, organization and communication skills to manage and track overlapping tasks and assignments, with frequent priority changesExpert level of proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint Job:  Corporate Primary Location:  Dallas, Texas Facility:  Tenet Headquarters Job Type:  Full-time Shift Type:  DaysEmployment practices will not be influenced or affected by an applicants or employees race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status or any other legally protected status. Tenet will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities unless doing so would result in an undue hardship.

Name: Business Analyst (IT)
Description: Are you a high performer? Now is your chance to check out a career opportunity with New Benefits, Ltd., Americas leading wholesaler of customizable non-insured health, personal security, financial, travel and leisure benefits! We have served associations, insurance companies, banks, credit unions, brokerage/consulting firms, insurance agencies, TPAs and employers since 1990. Thousands of clients and millions of members trust New Benefits to deliver exceptional customer service and support, superior products, administration, print services, billing and compliance while promoting integrity and honesty in the marketing of non-insured products and services.  Our office is conveniently located in the North Dallas area and we are looking for YOU to be a part of our continued growth and success. Dazzling customer service is our promise!  We offer a fun, business casual environment with a strong company culture focused on employee engagement and recognition. We offer a fun, business casual environment with a strong company culture focused on employee engagement and recognition. As a valued member of our family, the IT Business Analyst is eligible for a comprehensive benefits plan including paid vacations and holidays, 401(k) with company match, health, voluntary dental, paid life insurance and a New Benefits discount card. Job Summary: The IT Business Analyst will provide the bridge between New Benefits IT capability and the business objectives. The IT BA is responsible for eliciting requirements, simplifying and prioritizing requirements for the development and delivery of the IT Department. The IT Business Analyst will then communicate these requirements to drive the design, review test cases, process change requests, manage project scope, customer acceptance, installation, and deployment. The IT Business Analyst is also responsible for developing agile user stories which will guide development. This begins with defining, analyzing, and documenting requirements, and then managing the requirements at the project level to ensure NB business needs are fulfilled. Responsibilities:Partner with the Development Team to:Understand the needs of key stakeholders through initiating and attending appropriate business meetingsStudy business functions, gather information, collect, and evaluate requirements to then prepare technical reports and presentations to summarize business objectives, business case analysis, IT capability, and financial considerationsFacilitate the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholders (primarily between the IT Department and NB business leaders)Identify current and future state business processesCreate, analyze, and validate detailed functional specificationsDefine elements of design, data migration rules, business rules, and other deliverablesCalculate/Forecast business case return on investment for development costs associated with achieving business objectives (cost/benefit analysis)Qualifications and Skills Required:Minimum of 3-5 years of experience collecting and documenting business requirements from clients3-5 Years of experience creating user stories and customer acceptance criteria to allow rapid developer understanding, effort sizing, and implementationMust be an excellent listener with strong verbal communication and technical writing skillsMust be familiar with Agile development practices to allow effective introduction of requirements into the processMust be skilled as a client advocate to product development and support team members including architects, designers, testers, customer acceptance leads, product release managers and support3-5 years of hosting agile product backlog creation, refinement, prioritization, and sprint planningExperienced with web based and browser interface software application developmentKnowledge of user interface design methods and experienced in creating mockups and wireframesMust be a self-starter, initiating the requirement gathering, organizing and delivery processMust be able to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours, and function in an environment with interruptionsStrong written and verbal communications skillsAbility to talk or hear, both in person and by telephoneGood visual acuityCapable of lifting up to 25 poundsPreferred:Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or technology related field preferred *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions Core Competencies (F.L.I.I.P.):Flexibility Maintains effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work responsibilities or environment and adjusts effectively to work within new structures, processes, requirements or cultures. Remains flexible in spite of adversity. Embraces change.Leadership Facilitates a positive and productive team oriented environment. Provides open communication/feedback within the team. Builds collaboration to maintain productive teams. Treats people with honesty and respect. Maintains positive relationships with employees at all levels. Uses appropriate interpersonal styles to establish effective relationships with clients, vendors and internal partners. Interacts with others in a way that promotes openness and trust and gives them confidence in ones intentions.Innovation Identifies and accomplishes challenging objectives or personal goals. Works effectively with others to achieve goals. Looks for and takes advantage of opportunities. Maintains a high level of interest, enthusiasm and personal performance. Takes steps to improve processes and find better solutions. Champions quality work and proactively takes steps to correct errors or improve overall products/solutions. Drives continuous improvement. Demonstrates a willingness to change approach based on feedback.Integrity Supports and upholds the organizations standards and values. Demonstrates honesty, reliability and professionalism. Maintains the highest ethical standards.Passion Provides excellent customer service to internal clients, partners, vendors and teams. Responds promptly, professionally, effectively, and efficiently. Recognizes sense of urgency in responding to needs. Follows up to ensure requests, needs, and commitments are met consistently.Reports to: Director of IT Classification: Exempt  Job Type: Full-time

Name: Business Value Analyst
Description: OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management. The opportunity: This is a position which is best described as a mix of sales, management consulting and finance within the umbrella of a global, premier software brand. Business Value Consulting team members will work on multi-million dollar deals and build expertise across industries and functions. The VA role is an opportunity for someone with consultative business analysis skills to have an impact on large enterprise software transactions. It represents a unique bridge from the world of business analysis to the critical function of Sales. You are great at:Driving the development and supporting the implementation of a comprehensive field sales value based selling program.Designing tools and deliverables to help penetrate enterprise customer accounts, including Business Capability and Retrospective Studies and Outside-In Analysis.Being the trusted adviser to OpenText customers and prospects including high level executives. This leader will present to help customers and prospects understand the value of a proposed World Class OpenText solution.Maintaining a strong understanding of the broad OpenText technology portfolio at a level sufficient to understand and communicate "the art of the possible" in terms of business process and Enterprise Information Management (EIM).Helping customers identify and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) that should be monitored to improve the value received from OpenText products and services.Developing high quality business transformation studies that document success, both quantitatively and qualitatively, that can be used to provoke sales opportunities with new prospects. The ideal candidate will have core knowledge to evaluate, drive, and present ROI for customers and clearly articulate how the OT solutions will drive down TCO for our solutions.Designing and delivering C-level engagements and strategy enablement workshops to create a common and compelling vision.Proactively maintain customer intimacy by working post sales with customers for best practices in the implementations of applications and value achieved, feeding the information back to the Business Value Consulting practice and organization.What it takes:MBA or equivalent work experience expected. Minimum of 10 years' experience in sales / business development or management consulting in the high tech space is preferred.Knowledge of enterprise applications and related processes including ERP, CRM, HCM, etc.Capable of establishing immutable credibility with customer executives and project teams.Experience with development of business cases that include benefits, ROI Analysis, Total Cost of Ownership and Competitive Analysis, Risk Management, Implementation road map and Business Transformation Strategies.Profound "customer curiosity" a natural interest in the customers' business and business environment and a willingness to research judiciously, efficiently and effectively on these topics, to assure client "literacy" and minimize their "overhead" in leveraging our services.Absolute comfort and ability to diplomatically coach, challenge, and extend customers' thinking to assure full capture of both direct and indirect business benefits of a proposed process and/or EIM improvements / possibilities.Full understanding of strategic consulting methods, engagement, and best practices to achieve consistent results.Executive engagement, facilitation, and public speaking techniques and experience.Significant sales achievements in connection with projects, products and/or servicesRecord of building strong customer relationships and customer contacts (executive access and effective offer positioning). At OpenText we understand and value diversity in our employees and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We hire the best talent regardless of race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, sex, age, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accommodationrequests@opentext.com. Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws including but not limited to: Family and Medical Leave Act (FLMA), Equal Employment Opportunity and Employee Polygraph Protection ActSDL2017

Name: Salesforce Admin/Business Analyst
Description: Req ID: 35565     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Salesforce Admin/Business Analyst to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).       Responsibilities:Responsible for the overall configuration, design, functionality and end-user support of the Salesforce.com platform with 2,000 users,Configure and maintain custom objects, record types, fields, page layouts, formulas, data validation rules, triggers, custom workflows, approval processes, installed packages, etc. within Salesforce.com,Maintain user roles and profiles, security settings, access settings, etc. (User Profiles, Role Hierarchy, Sharing Rules and Security),Implement change control and best practices with regards to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.,Complete regular internal system audits and prepare for seasonal Salesforce releases,Manage Salesforce.com data loads, feeds and other integrations,Coordinate the evaluation, scope and completion of new configuration and development requests,Work independently with members of the user community to gather requirements, define, document, and solution development requirements, then drive the configuration and development of the solution,Document, document, document,Work with Salesforce product manager to establish suitable processes to support administrative, development, and change management activities,Manage sandbox environmentsParticipate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with the business to ensure that solutions meet the defined product requirements by managing defectsAssist in training of new users, and grow the Salesforce.com skill set across the organization,Effectively act as the liaison between our users, vendors and the application development teams,Work independently with members of the user community to define, document, and solution development requirements   Skills Required: Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude  Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards  Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills  Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills  Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization  Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs  Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes    Experience Required: Minimum two years of experience as a Salesforce.com administrator  Saleforce.com Admin ADM201 certification  Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption  Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity  Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality  Strong data management abilities  A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion  A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements    Experience Preferred: Salesforce Platform App Builder Certification  Saleforce.com Advanced Admin (ADM211) certification  Salesforce Pardot  Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Developer certifications  Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment    This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Name: SOC Analyst-Security Analyst
Description: Ref No.: 18-05276 Location:  Dallas, Texas Position Type: Contract Start Date / End Date:  11/19/2018 to 05/26/2019  Intake notes: - Tech skills candidates should have in previous experience: SIEM: LogRhythm, McAfee ESM/Nitro. End Point: McAfee, Symantec, Trend. McAfee ePO, Service Now, CA Triole, AD, etc - This role is participating in a 24/7 shift rotation. The current shifts are 10 hours a day, 4 days a week. Sunday through Wednesday, and Wednesday through Saturday. There are 3 shifts: Morning, Mid-day, and Overnight. - interviews will be done both on the phone and in person and this can be a temp to perm position for the right candidate Client America, Inc. provides a complete portfolio of business technology services, computing platforms, and industry solutions. Client platform products are based on scalable, reliable and high-performance server, storage, point-of-sale, and mobile technologies. Client combines its renowned platform offerings with a full suite of onshore, near shore and offshore system integration, outsourcing, and datacenter services covering applications, operations, infrastructure, customer service, and multi-vendor lifecycle services. Client provides industry-specific solutions for retail, manufacturing, healthcare, government, education, financial services, and telecommunications sectors. For more information on Client America's business scope, visit http://solutions.us.Client.com/  We are looking for a Security Analyst for our E&CS (Enterprise & Cyber Security) Group in the Security Operations Center, SOC at our Dallas, TX location.  Appropriate candidates should possess at least 3-5 years' experience in a Security Operations Center as part of a Managed Security Services offering. We are looking for candidates who can provide a well-rounded knowledge and experience base in incident response and security event analytics. An overall flexibility and willingness to work under unpredictable time and project variables is essential.  The Security Operation Center Analyst will be responsible for the following:  •Detection, monitoring, analysis, resolution of security incidents; participate in providing containment recommendation  •Coordinate escalations to internal support teams to ensure timely delivery of incident resolutions •Perform network/system/application/log intrusion detection analysis and trending  •Perform tuning of the SIEM filters and correlations to continuously improve monitoring Participate in the security incident handling efforts in response to a detected incident, and coordinate with other stakeholders  •Ensure that Service Level Agreements are met  •Maintain standard operating procedures, processes and guidelines  •Automate security analysis, administration and remediation procedures, workflows and tasks •Maintain awareness of trends in security regulatory, technology, and operational requirements •Participate in client audits * Shift rotation will be required for this role.  Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:  •Provide detection and response to security events and incidents within the Client Network as well as various supported customer networks  •PCI and Web application vulnerability scanning  •Security log management and monitoring  •Intrusion detections and prevention systems operations  •Vulnerability detection, assessment, and mitigation  •Risk assessment and deployment of security patches.  •Antivirus management and operations.  •Develop and maintaining information security metrics.  •Administrative and service account creation.  •Provide assistance to core security and incident response teams  •Enterprise encryption standards development and support  •Development and distribution of various security advisories and awareness messages  Maintain growing knowledge of industry trends relating to security management and services.  Soft Skills/Abilities - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. - Ability to present and discuss technical information to users with varying technical expertise. - Proven ability to work under stress in emergencies. Flexibility to handle pressure from many directions simultaneously. - Must be detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy. - Excellent written and verbal communication skills. - Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain collaborative working relationships across multiple teams. - Strong customer focus and the ability to manage customer expectations. - Must have strong team-oriented interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively interface with a wide variety of people. - Demonstrated commitment to continuous process improvement. Professional Certification  - CISSP, CISA, or other security/audit / field related certifications a plus

Name: Business Planning Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe are hiring a Business Planning Analyst for a Contract position in Plano, TX  FOR IMMEDIATE DETAILS ABOUT THIS POSITION, contact ANY of us direct, referencing the job# below: Kindest Regards: JOANNE SMITH: (800) 732-4680 x720  KIANA AREVALO: (800) 732-4680 x703  SUMIT KUMAR: (800) 732-4680 x718  MICHELL CASEY: (800) 732-4680 x715  E M A I L: Recruiter.key@calance.com ==============================================================================* We will NOT accept 3rd Party/Corp to Corp (C2C) consultants ** Position: Business Planning Analyst JOB REF#: 682570 Duration: 12+ Months (On-going Contract)  Location: Plano, TX 75024 (on-site only)  Rate: Open/Market Rate, depends on experience level (W2 ONLY/Visa Transfers)  Calance is a 1st tier vendor and we have 24-48 hours to identify candidates for this position with a global company. The average consultants is on project 2-5 years, all work will be performed on-site and you MUST be available for a face to face interview. RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE: Support Business Planning Analyst to administer SI budget including: reporting (Hyperion), re-class and JV submissions, processing invoices  Support the design and establishment of SI Sharepoint site  Support the Project Coordination and Training manager in developing SOPs for 360 project management and coordinating training sessions  Support ad-hoc needs for Strategy Hub and other Social Innovation sub-functions as needed  REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE: (Resume must reflect this experience)  Proficiency in Hyperion and Sharepoint  Attention to detail (including numbers)  Proficiency in MS Office (Word/Excel), and MS Project  Strong written and verbal communication skills  Able to handle a high volume and diverse list of tasks  Attention to detail (including numbers)  Able to Interview in-person  Must have a stable work history, working in a similar role Other Requirements: Must reside locally (Dallas,TX area) and available to interview in-person  Must have a stable work history, working in a similar role  NO 3rd Party/C2C candidates will be accepted, W2 Only!!  Education: Bachelors Degree Preferred/ Nice-to-haves: Proficiency in MS Teams and MS Project CALANCE Benefits Offerings: Open enrollment of Medical/Dental/Vision benefits  401K Retirement program  Paid Bi-Weekly/Direct Deposit  Flex Spending Plan  Voluntary Life, AD&D, STD or LTD plansCompany DescriptionCalance is a recognized leader in providing top-tier Information Technology professionals across North America. With over 25 years of experience recruiting professionals ranging from Programmers to CIOs, Calance provide valuable staffing solutions for short and long term projects, as well as your permanent hiring needs. Our professionals are experts at helping organizations realize their information technology goals by selecting the best talent for each project or position.  Calance helps clients respond quickly to economic, strategic or technological changes by utilizing a flexible workforce. We offer highly-skilled professional IT consultants on a temporary or project basis. Consultants are employees of Calance while on assignment for the client, allowing for cost savings, risk management and operational benefits.  Calance's Contract-to-Hire option allows an IT organization to evaluate an individual before making a decision to bring them on as a full-time employee. Depending on the length of the temporary assignment, placement fees are waived or reduced.  Calance realizes that IT organizations often have needs for talented people to fill specific roles and that filling those needs can be challenging. Our highly experienced Account Managers and recruiting staff work closely with our clients to determine the desired skills, background and traits required for the position.  We apply our unique recruiting methodology to locate and recruit the most highly qualified candidates to match the requirements of your full-time employee position. Calance can assist in every step of the hiring process, from determining the exact job requirements to final negotiations, to help bring on-board the candidates you need.

Name: Kronos System Analyst
Description: Omni Hotels and Resorts creates genuine, authentic guest experiences at 60 distinctive luxury hotels and resorts in leading business gateways and leisure destinations across North America. Omni Hotels is known for its exemplary culture, authenticity to the markets in which we operate, innovation and exceptional service. Our commitment to career development has created tenure and loyalty that enables us to perpetuate our family atmosphere.  This position Is responsible for providing technical support and advice regarding the company’s current payroll systems and ensuring proper maintenance and availability of the systems. Configuration of Kronos to comply with relevant acts, regulations, policies and agreements relating to payroll administration, compliance issues, segregation of duties, current trends and developments in payroll.Analyze and evaluate work methods, design and implement ‘best practice’ payroll systems and procedures for the effective utilization of the software to perform duties.Handles Kronos upgrades and enhancements.Keep payroll staff informed of easier, quicker methods available for their use.Maintain user passwords and security for payroll systems.Develop and maintain interfaces, export and import files.Liaison between payroll and Human Resources, IT, Finance and Corporate Accounting regarding timekeeping system issues.Assist hotel with timekeeping uploads and verification.Design, modify and maintain reports.Research and provide recommended payroll system enhancements and implementation for efficiency gains.Coordinate and assist in all payroll system upgrades.Assist with paymaster training.Other duties as requested.Advanced skills in payroll computer systems, including payroll software and time and attendance systems.Knowledge of relevant acts, regulations, policies and agreements relating to payroll administration, compliance issues, segregation of duties, current trends and developments in payroll.Statistical and forecasting methods used in payroll analysis and management.Strong configuration and integration knowledge with Kronos Workforce Central Version 7 and up.Ability to analyze and evaluate work methods, design and implement ‘best practice’ payroll systems and procedures. Effective utilization of computer equipment and software to perform duties.Analysis of payroll data and practices, applying relevant laws, regulations and principles.Experience with payroll and time and attendance upgrades.Ability to train others in specialized payroll practices and procedures.Bachelor’s Degree preferred.Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.Good analytical abilities.Excellent communication skills.Ability to meet deadlines.Ability to work under pressure.Excellent organizational skills, ability to handle multiple priorities.Willingness to travel.Ability to maintain confidentiality.Omni Hotels & Resorts is an equal opportunity employer - vets/disability. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available using the following links: EEOC is the Law Poster and the following link is the OFCCP's Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination policy statementIf you are interested in applying for employment with Omni Hotels & Resorts and need special assistance to apply for a posted position, please send an email to applicationassistance@omnihotels.com.

Name: Business Analyst - Junior
Description: About the Role: We are currently seeking a resource that would be interested in playing a role of a Business Analyst This job will have the following responsibilities:Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst with track record of delivering business process requirements and use cases is required.Solid experience and understanding of Agile Scrum and Rational Unified Process Methodology in developing use cases, use case model, supplementary requirements, and business rules is essential.Solid understanding of relevant business issues.Qualifications & Requirements:Masters DegreeStrong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word and iGraphx or Visio Drawing tools along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required.Experience managing multiple large, complex and cross functional projects, with emphasis on systems, technologies, business process redesign, and knowledge of technical environments.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Trinity Industries is searching for a talented team player to fill the open position of Senior Business Analyst in our Dallas, Texas office.In this role, the selected individual will be responsible to act as liaison between the Trinity’s Business Units and the TrinityRail ‘s Business Systems team to collect requirements and provide advisory level services for newer enhancements/problems/incidents in order to optimize business processes and augment systems capabilities.What you'll do:Advise and assist in optimizing and streamlining business processesDesign and Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas believes in the diversity of our people, ideas and experiences, and we are committed to building an inclusive culture that represents the communities we serve.  ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY: As part of the nation's central bank, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is committed to strengthening the economy and our communities. At the Fed, you have the opportunity to become part of an important public service institution whose work touches lives across the globe. It's a big job and that's why we need talented, results-driven professionals who care about making a difference. POSITION SUMMARY: Currently the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is seeking self-motivated and customer focused Senior Business Analyst to serve as an integral member of a national team responsible for supporting the core functions of the Credit Risk Management business line.  RESPONSIBILITIES: The Senior Business Analyst will act as the liaison between the business users and the technical team with the following responsibilities:  Understand and analyze business requirements by working with business stakeholders Document business requirements including use cases, UI interfaces and business rules. Lead projects including planning, conducting stakeholder meetings, requirements sign offs, user testing and signoffs. Provide user support and resolve support requests including analysis, documentation and resolution of the requests. Develop in-depth understanding of Credit Risk Management business function. COMPETENCIES:Functional Knowledge - Requires comprehensive understanding of concepts and principles within own discipline and knowledge of others. Ensures Accountability - Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments. Communicates Effectively - Develops and delivers communications that covey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. Customer Focus - Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer-centric solutions. Specifically, experience in developing and maintaining internal and external customer relationships and offering consulting based on subject matter expertise. Prioritization and Planning - Applies organizational, time management and planning skills in order to manage assigned workload and complete multiple job assignments with multiple deadlines. Initiative - Self-directed and motivated with the ability to work independently with minimal direction. EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: 5+ years of practical business analysis or credit risk experience. Well versed with the entire process of business analysis including requirement gathering, analysis and documentation, use case preparation, developing test plan and test cases. Strong customer focus and business acumen. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Highly motivated self-starter with an eagerness to learn. Extremely organized with strong time-management skills. Capable of adapting to changing requirements and responsibilities. SQL experience strongly preferred. WORK HOURS AND CONDITIONS: 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. Flexibility/ additional hours may be required based on business needs. Required average travel of up to 10% may be necessary to complete job duties and responsibilities.  Notes: By federal law, this position requires that candidates fall within one of the following citizenship categories: (1) U.S. citizen, (2) U.S. national, (3) U.S. permanent residents who are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization, or (4) U.S. permanent residents who have applied for naturalization within six months of being eligible to do so.  Position may be filled at multiple levels depending upon candidate's experience  Employment is contingent upon the selected candidate passing a background check and financial credit check.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer

Name: CRM Business Analyst
Description: #LifeIsSweet The people. The passion. The success. You will frequently see Sugas huddled around a desk or whiteboard collaborating, cranking out ideas, or solving the latest industry problem. Are you ready to play a key role in influencing how companies create extraordinary relationships with their customers? We’d love to hear your ideas! We’re going places… join us for the ride, experience sweet success and show us your passion.Where do you fit? The Business Analyst is a CRM subject matter expert, with the ability to lead discussions and draw functional requirements out of business subject matter experts. As a member of SugarCRM's Professional Services organization, you will be responsible for identifying and organizing customer needs into requirements and working with the project team to successfully implement those requirements. Comfortable leading discussionsMust be goal-driven, a self-starter able to thrive in a fast-paced environmentMust have the ability to cut through the ambiguity and identify the core issuesStrong understanding of enterprise software and enterprise software implementation/projects. CRM or ERPExperience with Agile methodologyExperience implementing cloud/SaaS software solutionsMust develop a good understanding of SugarCRM product capabilities and best practices. Become Sugar certifiedExperience facilitating requirements sessions with business users, IT and senior managementStrong experience with business process definition and designExperience estimating work effortExperience creating detailed project documents – project plan, functional design, use cases, test plans, etc.Experience managing projects – timeline, resources and financialsExperience in end user trainingHistory of successful project completion (on time, on budget) for projects where you have worked on the requirementsGeneral office skills are required. Familiarity with project management and/or other tracking tools is requiredProject management cert. (e.g. PMP) desired but not essentialAbility to travel to customer locations and work from customer offices as requiredRespect and expect accountabilityLocation: Cupertino, CA, Raleigh, NC or Remote-U.S. We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Benefits and Perks: Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some great benefits and perks: Competitive salariesExcellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans like 401(k) matchGenerous paid time off policyWeekly catered lunch & learns, fully stocked kitchens, and nearby access to Cupertino’s newest restaurants and stores at Main Street CupertinoHealth/Wellness: Quarterly chair massages, Wellness Reimbursement, and Workforce Fitness ProgramOnsite Programs such as Dry Cleaning, Car Washes, Massage, Yoga, and moreCareer & Personal Development Program – multi-platformNew Hire Onboarding for all new employees worldwide – at Corporate Headquarters in Cupertino, CaliforniaRegular social events and birthday celebrations (yes, sweet treats are a big deal at SugarCRM)Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an impact nowWe are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your careerLearn more on LinkedIn and Twitter @LifeAtSugarNote to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: SugarCRM does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any SugarCRM employee. SugarCRM will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of SugarCRM and will be processed accordingly.

Name: Jr. Business Analyst
Description: Role: Junior Business AnalystJob Summary One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. The role works across functional boundaries to connect-the-dots between IT department products and services.
