Name: Business Analyst, Applications, Healthcare
Description: Matthew Noah is seeking to build relationships with Application Business Analysts in Dallas, TX for a new opportunity with our growing healthcare partner.  When we partner with talent, we learn not just your skills and background, but the many layers of your spirit your life aspirations, your career goals, and how you find a sense of purpose. After we map out how to make your ideal life your real life, we find the team that can take you there.  If the description below sounds like a great fit and if you're looking for fresh experience with your job search, then we encourage you to reach out to discuss what the right path for you is.  The Business Analyst - Applications will:  Interview and document business requirements from business users  Assess business processes and identify system deficiencies and opportunities for improvements  Develops process maps to document work and information flows  Design user interfaces and workflows that meet business requirements  Communicate with developers the requirements and act as the intermediary when necessary REQUIREMENTS 4-6 years of healthcare business experience  Must have experience working with developers on multiple technical projects  Ability to produce executive-level presentations and reports  Knowledge of PMBOK and/or BABOk is preferred  6+ years total business experience  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $95,000.00 /year  Experience: Application Analysis: 4 years (Required)Interfaces and Workflow Design: 4 years (Required)Business Analysis: 4 years (Required)Work and Information Flows Documentation: 4 years (Required)Requirements Management: 4 years (Required)

Name: Retail Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: PRG is working with a new client who is a major player in the retail industry. They are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team in Dallas immediately!!! This roles primary responsibility will be to provide data analytics and reporting to the various functions within Client site. This includes implementing solutions for optimizing and automating existing reporting as well as leveraging tools such as SQL and Tableau to create and monitor new key performance indicators and operational metrics. This is a great opportunity for someone who is interested in working alongside a fast-paced, data-driven team to help the organization achieve its strategic objectives. Candidates' must have: Bachelors Degree in MIS, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field  A minimum of 2 years and no more than 4 years of experience  Strong SSRS, SSIS, and SSAS skills

Name: Java Technical Business Systems Analyst
Description: Chase is the U.S. consumer and community banking (CCB) business of JPMorgan Chase & Co. We serve nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities and non-profits through more than 5,600 bank branches, 18,700 ATMs, credit cards, mortgage offices and online and mobile banking as well as through relationships with auto dealerships. Consumer Banking provides great products and an outstanding customer experience in 23 states, as well as online and over the phone.  The CCB Digital Business Services team, is chartered with managing and directing the business services supporting major externally facing application components (web and native mobile apps) focusing on the discipline of functional delivery in the area of customer login, product enrollment, and data sourcing across the JPMorgan Chase & Co. enterprise.  Technical Analyst Responsibility:  · Perform impact analysis on platform & project-specific technical topics  · Lead design discussions within the team and with other technology partners and project managers  · Work with product, business and application teams to write technical user stories for a SOA/services/messaging development team  · Research code to determine current system functionality  · Execute testing of REST and SOAP web services using tools like Soap UI/ Ready API to verify that the services meet the acceptance criteria defined in the user stories  · Check logs using Splunk to investigate any requirements or issues related to the project and/or addressed to the team  · Facilitate communication between the project stakeholders and technology teams  · Create knowledge artifacts and share/upload them in Confluence for the team’s referenceRequired Knowledge and Experience:· Bachelor’s Degree within a technical field  · 5 years of hands-on experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Systems Analyst, Technical Analyst or in a related discipline with an emphasis on delivering cutting-edge technology within finance  · Ability to read Java code and service definitions in order to understand existing system behavior  · Experience working with Spring, SOAP, REST, Micro services, XML and JSON message formats in a shared services/enterprise level organization  · Strong understanding of BDD/TDD and experience writing technical user stories in JIRA using industry standard notations like Gherkins  · Well versed with common Agile terms and methodology and using tools like JIRA and Confluence.  · Understanding of SQL, stored procedure and database scripting  · Understanding of software development processes and procedures  · Experience using the IDEs such as Eclipse, IDEA IntelliJ, GIT, Bitbucket  · Strong verbal and written communication skills  · Strong analytical and problem solving skills  · Ability to forge lasting relationships with other scrum team members  · Familiarity with service-oriented environments, and better development practices  Preferred Knowledge and Experience:  · Retail/Consumer banking and investment products  · Appreciation of responsive web design  · Fluent with modern web technologies and web application frameworks  EEO Statement  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary: The Senior IT Business Analyst position manages all aspects of intermediate to large size projects throughout the project lifecycle including project scope, schedule, resources, quality, costs and change control. Essential Job Functions:Assists and mentors more junior level IT Business AnalystsExpands or modifies current system to serve new purpose or improve work flowDefines business requirements using interviews, document analysis, surveys, business procedures descriptions, and workflow analysisAnalyzes and documents current and future optimized business process models that accurately reflect user workflowsAnalyzes business requirements to implement and improve computer systemsRequired Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:7+ years of experience in business or requirements analysisExtensive knowledge and understanding of Encompass (Loan Origination System) preferred and required dependent on roleDemonstrated experience implementing and maintaining systems and processes in large-scale, complex environmentsDemonstrated experience designing and implementing creative solutions to meet the needs of the businessDemonstrated experience thinking critically to identify strengths and weaknesses of alternate solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problemsDemonstrated experience researching information, problem solving, and making solid business decisionsDemonstrated experience reporting, analyzing, interpreting, and researching informationExtensive knowledge and understanding of the functional design and architecture of application systems across multiple technologies and platforms

Name: SAP QTC Business Analyst
Description: SAP QTC Business Analyst  Contract-to-Hire  Location: Irving, Texas  We have an immediate job opening for an SAP Quote to Cash (QTC) Business Analyst. This is an exciting opportunity to work on-site at our client's North American HQs in Irving, Texas. They are the leader in their industry and this will be a chance to become part of a huge initiative that is integral to their operations and success. This individual will support the SAP project across multiple business lines in North America working hand-in-hand with IT, SAP Project Team, Global Process Owners, and North American businesses conducting business process analysis and proposing process redesign. This role will work with the rest of the Quote to Cash work stream to both understand the existing as well as design and implement new business functionality, business requirements, and models into SAP processes from beginning to end within the Quote to Cash SD modules. This position will focus on technical and functional business units redesigning processes for driven business applications.  RESPONSIBILITIES  o Interacts with non-information technology related business areas to identify requirements, scope, support implementation of solutions.  o Provides end-to-end coverage for the process teams.  o Creates design of reports, forms, interfaces, and conversion.  o Facilitates system understanding and assist the training team in identifying requirements and validating final materials.  o Develops business scenarios and test scripts as well as lead efforts to conduct testing.  o Develops and maintains user documentation.  o Drives continuous improvements with use of technology solutions by demonstrating value add propositions.  o Tests, modifies and documents the system configuration.  o Provides post implementation support.  o Works in parallel with the training and communication team to ensure all aspects of change is handled.  REQUIREMENTS  o 4+ years of SAP business analysis experience specifically related to Quote to Cash (QTC)  o Proven experience working in an enterprise size IT environment.  o Must have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced deadline intensive environment.  o A broad understanding of business process, including front office and back office operations.  o Skilled with redesigning processes for technology driven business applications.  o Experience working in IT and cross-functional project teams.  o Knowledge of prevalent IT methodologies, project management methodologies, management practices, architectures, system development lifecycles and best practices.  o Must have strong technical writing skills & excellent communication and organization skills, verbally and in writing.  o Ability to transform and support advanced business functions and requirements into design.  o Strong business user who is experienced partnering with IT.  o Ability to flourish in an ambiguous working environment.  o Minimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree.  **To view all of our job openings, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings

Name: Senior Product Business Analyst - Remote
Description: Medecision is transforming healthcare one cool app at a time!  Are you the kind of person that is motivated by the challenge of a dynamic, changing market? Can you utilize and exploit progressive systems and processes to satisfy urgent business needs? Are you a good partner with your teammates; driven to execute team and individual commitments that align with business vision? Does the idea of a high visibility and high impact role in a medium-sized, growing company excite you? Are you interested in being part of a team that strives to achieve high business impact, execution excellence and has a lot of fun while we are doing it? Are you ready? We are! Join us in our journey toward liberating today’s fragmented healthcare systems to Connect Care Everywhere.  Medecision is looking for a Senior Product Business Analyst, a passionate power contributor who blends solid requirements definition and analysis skills to contribute to cutting-edge SaaS products.  You will work as a conduit between our product management, customers, and engineering teams to bridge our Product Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and our Agile SDLC methodologies. You will bring deep expertise in gathering business requirements, technical and functional specifications, and user stories that will help develop our product capabilities. You will consult with internal and external stakeholders to identify specific needs within across our application modules to ensure our capabilities solve customer problems. You will play a critical role in supporting the success of the overall product vision and strategy. THIS JOB MIGHT BE FOR YOU, IF…You, as the Senior Product Business Analyst, have deep knowledge and expertise in driving technical and functional requirements of product solutions offered to Payer and Provider markets (for example Commercial Plans; Medicare and Medicaid; MSSP; Duals; and CMS incentive plans). You will need to have a passion for user-centered design to enable our customers to achieve the outcomes they are seeking. In partnership with the Product Manager, you will need to look across the product portfolio and identify integration and user-centered designs that contribute to an exceptional experience for our customers. You will contribute to the overall product delivery, including the requirements on how the product integrates across and into our other solution offerings. You must enjoy spending time solving problems using the latest technical approaches and have a strong understanding of functional usability, technical design and software development to find innovative solutions that translate to a world-class commercial software product. Reports to: Vice President, Product Management Location(s): Philadelphia, PA; Dallas, TX; RemoteResponsibilitiesYOU’RE GOOD AT:Formulating and defining the product features to accomplish the release product scope and objectives, based on user needs and business processes with a comprehensive understanding of the current business model and operational needs as well as product vision and strategy.Eliciting the requirements needed to carry out business processes including interviews, intelligence analysis and survey assessments. During the elicitation process, the analyst is able to develop workflow and system diagrams to support the analysis and the business discussions. The analyst has the ability to identify business requirements and workflows that are common and exception handling across the market segments and personas.Translating business needs, processes and procedures into a workable system, and articulates on specific software requirements by communicating about these requirements with technology experts and business stakeholders. Representing the voice of the customer to the development teams.Working closely with development leads and other technology staff to deliver project results while implementing risk analysis and meeting required deliverables. Can conduct interface analysis to identify data translations, and operational supportability.Working closely with development and QA to troubleshoot and conduct problem solving sessions when issues are identified during the development life cycle. Can identify gaps and provide remediation to the product scope and vision.Pursuing opportunities to improve industry knowledge related to the priorities and needs of Medecision's clients as well as improve on personal professional management/ leadership development. Can participate on a process improvement work stream which provides innovated recommendations for process changes.QualificationsYOU HAVE:Bachelor’s Degree in Health Sciences, Computer Science or Business preferred, clinical degree is optional, but preferred.7+ years experience as an application Business Analyst in a healthcare organization or a HIT vendor.Demonstrated experience working in a product development lifecycle model (PDLM) and Agile environment.Ability to gain deep subject matter expertise in regard to functions/modules of a complex business-to-business (B2B) application framework/platform.Strong experience leading complex business requirements definition and analysis activitiesExpertise in analyzing requirements and communicate them to Product and/or Development as the Voice of the CustomerProven experience creating and maintaining product documentation / artifactsTechnical background, with experience in SaaS and HIT system design.Experience facilitating sessions with stakeholders and team to ensure business requirements are defined that ensure a successful product implementation to support the business and market requirements.Ability to work with development/QA and business users to coordinate and assist with the successful product user acceptance testing.Experience working with customers on evolving designs and serving as an advocate for the Voice of the Customer to inspire a Human-Centered Design approach.Experience working with various product roapmap and software development project management tracking tools is required, experience using Aha! or JIRA is highly preferred.The ability and desire to work in a fast paced, dynamic, and exciting environment.A high-energy, creatively-driven, hard-working and an inspiring innovative spirit.A passion for great products and a desire to delight customers.The ability to sift through details quickly and determine what’s important.A strong and focused desire to be a team player and collaborator.The ability to articulate customer needs and Medecision delivery capabilities to expedite time to value.Ability to travel up to 20% based on location.OUR CULTURE DRIVES US It’s not all about what we do. It’s as much about how we do it. Medecision team members show up. We consistently exemplify our 6 core values of success: Execution. Service – We deliver “standing ovation” service. Speed – We are Agile. Ownership— We all take ownership and responsibility for how we deliver our promises, how we spend money, who we hire, what we build and how we help one another grow.Passion. We show an infectious emotional commitment to our work because what we do is important to our customers, one another and ourselves.Partnership. We are all in this together, without boundaries. Our internal/external network contains the solutions we need: we’ll continuously seek them out, use them and improve them.Leadership. We are Medecision’s brand. We are experts in care management, care coordination and healthcare information and technology. We lead our clients to excellent results by providing our expertise on best practices, industry trends, solutions development and innovations. We are moving in sync with an evolving industry. There is no problem we cannot solve.Innovation. We are in a constant state of discovery, inventiveness, thinking outside the box, and leading others internally and externally to do the same.Candor. Medecision communicates in a sincere, direct and famil­iar way. We address conflict directly and escalate issues internally and externally to address conflict with speed and partnership. Join us in our quest to liberate healthcare!  This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by an employee within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities and qualifications may vary based on assignment. Medecision is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.

Name: Salesforce Admin/Business Analyst
Description: Req ID: 35565     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Salesforce Admin/Business Analyst to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).       Responsibilities:Responsible for the overall configuration, design, functionality and end-user support of the Salesforce.com platform with 2,000 users,Configure and maintain custom objects, record types, fields, page layouts, formulas, data validation rules, triggers, custom workflows, approval processes, installed packages, etc. within Salesforce.com,Maintain user roles and profiles, security settings, access settings, etc. (User Profiles, Role Hierarchy, Sharing Rules and Security),Implement change control and best practices with regards to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.,Complete regular internal system audits and prepare for seasonal Salesforce releases,Manage Salesforce.com data loads, feeds and other integrations,Coordinate the evaluation, scope and completion of new configuration and development requests,Work independently with members of the user community to gather requirements, define, document, and solution development requirements, then drive the configuration and development of the solution,Document, document, document,Work with Salesforce product manager to establish suitable processes to support administrative, development, and change management activities,Manage sandbox environmentsParticipate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with the business to ensure that solutions meet the defined product requirements by managing defectsAssist in training of new users, and grow the Salesforce.com skill set across the organization,Effectively act as the liaison between our users, vendors and the application development teams,Work independently with members of the user community to define, document, and solution development requirements   Skills Required: Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude  Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards  Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills  Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills  Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization  Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs  Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes    Experience Required: Minimum two years of experience as a Salesforce.com administrator  Saleforce.com Admin ADM201 certification  Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption  Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity  Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality  Strong data management abilities  A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion  A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements    Experience Preferred: Salesforce Platform App Builder Certification  Saleforce.com Advanced Admin (ADM211) certification  Salesforce Pardot  Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Developer certifications  Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment    This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: At Briggs Equipment, our employees and our culture are just as important to the  company as serving our customers. We believe our employees are the key to our  success. We pride ourselves in hiring the highest quality people, placing  emphasis on safety, ethics, integrity and respect.  We are an ESOP company. And we give thoughtful consideration to making  investments. We realize the decisions we make about investments and operating  practices ultimately affect the lives of our co-workers, families and business  partners. And like those who went before us, every one of us takes that  responsibility seriously.  Our Mission Statement  "Passionate people, powerful solutions, rapidly delivering the equipment and services to  move people and materials."  Our Vision  Achieving flawless execution of Safety First, Financial Performance, and Dealer  Excellence through the commitment of our employees.  Our Values IntegrityFamilyFunSuccess Simply stated, Briggs employees strive to do the right thing by exceeding the  expectations of each other, our customers and our community. POSITION PURPOSE: The Operations Analyst is responsible for inventory and asset management analysis for the company. Develops and monitors processes and reports to ensure the business is driving customer satisfaction, top line revenue, profitability and is aligned with the Company's business strategy. Name: Project Analyst
Description: BloomReach is a Silicon Valley firm that brings businesses the first open and intelligent Digital Experience Platform (DXP). We drive customer experience to accelerate the path to conversion, increase revenue, and generate customer loyalty. In 2016, BloomReach acquired the Amsterdam based content management software company Hippo.  With applications for content management, site search, page management, SEO and role-based analytics, BloomReach is a central location for all players who manage customer experience. Our Web Relevance Engine (WRE) algorithmically understands content and users, matching demand and intent data from across the web. BloomReach's portfolio of customers includes: Neiman Marcus, Staples, REI, Mailchimp and Air Miles. Created in 2009, BloomReach is headquartered in Mountain View, CA with offices worldwide and is backed by investment firms Bain Capital Ventures, Battery Ventures, NEA, Salesforce Ventures and Lightspeed Ventures.  BloomReach is seeking a Project Analyst. The primary responsibility is to assist Senior Project Managers, Technical Project Managers, other team members and customers in the implementation and execution of multiple BloomReach projects providing both administrative and logistic support of projects throughout the project lifecycle.  This role includes project scheduling, internal/external communication, risk analysis, reporting and change management. The Project Analyst will identify potential project issues, track and manage project tasks to resolution while assisting with the management and execution of all BloomReach professional services implementation projects. Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills are necessary to be successful in this position.  This role calls for someone who is professional with strong verbal and written communication skills. Other related activities include coordinating schedules with customers and vendors, tracking statements of work and PO's, supporting the successful onboarding of new clients, updating process documentation, identifying opportunities to excel within established processes and utilizing Workfront to create/assist with monthly revenue reporting for internal Business Managers. Responsibilities: Schedule customer kick-off calls, coordinate meetings with customers and provide email confirmation and updates to presentationsSchedule/conduct weekly status meetings with customers and provide weekly status reports to address and resolve outstanding issues with customers, track progress, budget and maintain ownership of issues through resolutionQualifications: Ability to travel up to 25% of the timeBachelor's Degree0-3 year(s) of professional experiencePreferred background in Customer Service, a positive can-do attitude and a high level of motivationTech savvy with a good understanding of computer systems, troubleshooting and networkingAbility to communicate clearly and concisely, both written and verbalStrong time management, task prioritization and problem-solving skillsAbility to multitask effectively with keen attention to detailAbility to work independently, taking ownership of assigned tasks through completionStrong Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Google Docs and Sheets skills requiredAbility to quickly learn, adapt/overcome in challenging customer situations and filter out project noise Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of BloomReach are considered property of BloomReach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Name: Business Analyst IV- Modeling/Data Science
Description: THE COMPANYFannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progressJOB INFORMATIONExamine, assess, and document business operations and procedures of operating for administrative unit. Relate these procedures to IT/IS systems and applications that are designed to enable the operating unit to accomplish its objectives. Assist operating unit staff by developing reports, downloads, and analyses from discipline-specific systems and applications. Provide input to IT/IS specialists in development projects to assist in developing specifications and functionalities in IT systems.KEY JOB FUNCTIONSAssess business operations and processes of assigned office or business unit to identify inefficiencies in procedures, information flows and handoffs, decisions, communications pathways and ways in which systems supporting these can be enhanced. Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that accomplish business operations of assigned work unit(s). Create, design, and format technical specifications including descriptive text, process flows, and other information needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and other units; serve on project team accomplishing these functions. Provide support to applications in production by tracking production problems and troubleshooting them to sustain application in production. Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s), or develop specifications for such queries or analyses to be performed by others. Serve as team, project, or technical lead in project involving definition of business processes or development of technical/business specifications for new or modified business management or operational software.EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMBA, MS, or Doctorate a plusMINIMUM EXPERIENCE6 years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS4 years of hands-on experience with technical tools and coding.3 year’s hands-on experience with data mining, visualization, and complex analysis.3 years’ experience with business systems analysis.Demonstrated technical skills in coding, analysis through hands-on work experience and education.Strong Data Mining knowledge with use of SAS, SQL.Strong data visualization ability with tools like Tableau.Data-driven, results-oriented with the ability to quickly analyze data and make decisions that drive program performance. Business-minded focus with the ability to connect dots that help produce creative solutions for our customers.Understand systems, data flows, and architecture to assist with the creation and/or standardization of technology solutions.Strong written communication skills with the ability to create documentation for business requirements and/or functional/technical specifications.Ability to lead a team and mentor othersStrong interpersonal and presentation skills to synthesize and communicate information to senior management. Servicing, Mortgage Default, REO industry experience preferable.Statistical Analysis experience a plus.R and/or Python knowledge a plus.EMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: DescriptionBusiness Intelligence Analyst - (This position can sit in either Plano, TX or Sherbrooke, Quebec) LIFE AT BRP At BRP, we have a visceral connection to our consumers, one created from a shared passion for the Ultimate Ride. Our teams have a unique ability to develop market-shaping products and services that move people physically and emotionally. Distributed throughout more than 100 countries, BRP is a global leader in the world of powersports vehicles and propulsion systems built on over 75 years of ingenuity and intensive consumer focus. Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft and Manitou boats, Evinrude and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts, motorcycles and recreational aircraft. We support our lines of product with a dedicated parts, accessories and  clothing business to fully enhance your riding experience.  Our 10 000 employees make up a big family of diverse cultures who all share a common value: innovation. Our people are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve at the heart of an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.  www.brp.com Follow us on:LinkedIn @BRPTwitter@BRPnewsYouTube @CommunicationsBRPWHY JOIN THE TEAM?You want to be a part of a fast paced and challenging environment where the feeling of accomplishment will drive you.You want to work with a multidisciplinary and collaborative team of dedicated and passionate people.You want to join a team that will offer an outstanding work environment and gives you the opportunity to positively impact the dealer network by giving play to your drive for innovation and self-initiative every day.YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Create scalable PowerBI dashboards for end customers  Support, Execute and Deliver the roadmap of dealer facing reports in line with the Salesforce2020 business plan  Contribute to the planning of the next fiscals reporting roadmap to actively support BRP’s Dealer Value Proposition (DVP)  Be a key player in projects aiming to increase BRP’s dealer network profitability and efficiency  Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data using advanced analytics and statistical techniques to guide business strategies YOUR SKILLSHighly proficient in using PowerBI to create reports and dashboardsStrong background with BI/analytics tools like Business Objects and TableauAbility to create complex SQL queries, Stored Procedures and User Defined FunctionsStrong data related analytical, critical thinking, flexibility and problem-solving skillsThe ability to prioritize, organize, learn quickly, work independently and in a teamThe ability to deliver high quality solutions on time in a fast-paced environment.Advanced-level skills in MS SuiteLeadership is a mustYOUR QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, business, engineering or equivalent experience;At least 5 years of relevant work experienceMandatory bilingualism, written and spoken (French/English)Strong writing skills, creativity and attention to detailKnowledge of powersports an assetAN EXCEPTIONAL AREA - EASTERN TOWNSHIP The Eastern Townships are located in the southern part of the province and share a 300km+ long border with the United States. The region’s breathtaking landscape features 15 mountains, 19 lakes, 7 rivers, 33 beaches and 3 national parks. 80% of the territory is forested, making its more than 200 km of hiking trails possible. In the fall, the landscape becomes a festival of colours, delighting young and old alike. Nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts are sure to find what they’re looking for among the many seasonal and yearround activities available, which include hiking, cycling, camping, skiing and golfing, not to mention hunting and fishing. Food lovers can treat their taste buds to the refined flavours of the region’s vineyards, microbreweries and local products. There are also plenty of options for those who want to relax, with over 15 spas and relaxation centres, all of which are surrounded by idyllic vistas. The Eastern Townships offer unmatched quality of life.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM HR is undergoing a huge transformation and we are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our Technology Transformation Team.  The team is driving innovation by bringing in best in class software systems as well as overseeing the build of innovative Watson powered AI solutions. The technology we bring are focused on enabling the talent, executive, and learning teams. Our goal is to have the highest performing workforce with the best skills aligned to the right roles at the right time.  You enjoy solving the toughest challenges and roadblocks and can also take responsibility independently. You work well under pressure and are able to keep deadlines in a changing working environment.  We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to work with the business to help understand, and translate business needs into high level and granular technical requirements. The selected candidate will help facilitate build buy evaluations in partnership with the project management and product management team.  Work Location  Littleton OR Cambridge OR Raleigh  Required Technical and Professional Expertise 3+ years of experience creating and gathering requirements for enterprise level projects1+ year of experience supporting a software engineering team. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Work closely with Product Manager, project manager, development organization and third party vendors.Create Business Definition or Business Requirements Document and Use CasesUtilize design thinking skills to help the business arrive at their desired requirements.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsSuccessfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneouslyStrong analytical skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Sales Operations Business Analyst
Description: Organizations across the globe rely on OneSource Virtual for Workday services, support, optimization, and consulting. We create solutions built on the Workday application that empower customers to become strategic HR organizations, then scales with them as they grow. To date, OneSource Virtual offers HR outsourcing, IT outsourcing, application optimization, and consulting services to 500+ customers that represent more than 35 percent of Workday’s customer base.  Position Summary/Objective  The Sales Operations Business Analyst will help the Sales and Sales Operations teams become more efficient and effective by leveraging Salesforce.com and improving current processes. In addition this position is responsible for supporting members of the sales team, leading efforts in process documentation updates, managing and driving team projects as well as finding ways to better leverage existing technology.  Essential Functions/Duties/Responsibilities Maintain and update important documentation that Sales utilizes to properly close businessManage and drive Sales Operations projects ensuring team members are successful and meeting timeline objectivesIdentify, document and recommend solutions for process issues as well as recommend best practicesAssist in creating and updating training material for Sales and Sales Operations teamsProactively research current processes and document shortcomings or gaps in processPresent future state process recommendations to sales operations leadership for approvalManage and help resolve Salesforce related requests from business users via a ticketing systemBuild and maintain Salesforce reports and dashboard analyticsParticipate in data analysis/validation and User Acceptance Testing for Sales OperationsAssist with Deal Desk, contractual document reviews, and financial auditsWork in excel to provide reports and executive level insightsOther relative duties as assigned as needed1 or 2 conferences a year that may require travel Competencies Effective time management and organizational skills with the ability to work with tight deadlinesProactive and able to work in a fast paced environmentNavigational, searching, and basic experience/exposure in Salesforce.com in order to handle day-to-day job functions Supervisory Responsibility  None  Qualifications and Experience BS Degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, or other related fields3 – 6 years of experience as a Salesforce Business AnalystMinimum 3 years’ experience with successfully managing projects, conducting business analysis and process improvementsExperience improving the quality of process outputs of a team resulting in: i.e. reduced process cycle time, reduced cost, increase customer satisfaction, and increased profitsHands on experience with Salesforce – reporting, dashboards, knowledge of sales cycleFluency in Microsoft Applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and AccessDemonstrated experience with CRM applications and technologySalesforce experience is required / Workday experience is a + You are encouraged to learn and share ideas when you join the OneSource Virtual team. We reward innovative thinking, fresh perspectives, creative collaboration, and hard work. As an organization experiencing routine strategic growth, we are always on the lookout for intelligent, talented, and forward-thinking professionals to join our team. OSV employees enjoy a values-based culture, upward mobility, and professional development with opportunities of all kinds.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Description: Supply Chain Business Operations Metrics and Data Analytics team is seeking a Data Analytics Specialist to serve as one of the team members responsible for SAS Supply Chain operational metrics, data, and reporting. You will be responsible for quick-turn query designs using SAP, SAP Business Explorer Query Designer, and other applications for data extractions, analytics, and identification of solutions to various business problems with respect to SAS Supply Chain Operations with a focus on procurement. You will also be responsible for creating technical specifications and collaborating with SAS and/or Corporate Information Technology teams to design, test, and implement SAP improvements and Supply Chain value stream performance metrics/dashboards. You will be responsible for knowing procurement processes/transactions and collaborating with SAS procurement organizations to understand their business needs. You will be responsible for various project management activities and training activities. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: * Act as an analytical liaison between database tools and the end-user (procurement and MPMs) requirements, working cross-functionally to identify and analyze data, and troubleshoot issues * Extract data across multiple source systems to consolidate information into a single source for consumption and/or distribution * Provide Customer Service (i.e., respond to requests for information and/or process related questions) * Provide additional assistance with ad hoc requests for data, metrics, and analytics * Interface with members of the SC Operations team and SAS Procurement to identify and implement process improvement opportunities * Prepare reports, metrics, analytics, and presentations * Support in presentation creation for executive level briefings * Coordinate process and system updates, user acceptance testing, and communications * Document internal processes and work instructions * Effectively communicate system and process changes to SAS Procurement, MPMs, and other stakeholders while successfully influencing positive change * Participate in the formulation of key metrics and forecasts * Train SAS Supply Chain users, SAS Procurement, and MPMs with respect to SAP transactions, Business Warehouse, and Supply Chain value stream metrics/dashboards Requirements Qualifications: * 6+ years of experience in supply chain data analytics using SAP Business Explorer Query Designer, and SAP ad hoc reporting * Experience with Supply Chain/procurement business processes and Supply Chain/Procurement SAP transactions * Experience with Data Analysis and Data Mining * Experience with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables and graphing expertise), SAP, SAP Business Explorer Query Designer, SAP ad hoc reporting, Access, Microsoft server maintenance and HTML programming * Experience with creating technical specifications, test plans, and implementation plans for SAP improvements and Supply Chain value stream performance metrics/dashboards. * Experience with other Microsoft Office products including: Word, PowerPoint, Visio and Project * Experience developing procedures for consistent work performance * Experience developing and delivering presentations (verbal and/or written) to key stakeholders * Manage and prioritize multiple tasks and projects at the same time * Experience meeting deadlines and working in an environment with changing priorities * Experience facilitating meetings * Experience with Project Leadership, Management or Project Management * This position requires U. S. Citizenship  Additional Job Details: Desired Qualifications: * Strong analytical skills * Ability to learn/use internal tools (i.e. SAP AO, SAP Lumira Discovery) * Professional and positive attitude; willingness to learn and be innovative * Self-starter with initiative and independent judgment for assisting team members * Ability to stay organized and manage multiple high priorities; strong attention to detail * Good interpersonal skills * Strong Business Acumen / Business Intelligence * Strong teamwork and collaboration skills * Lean or R6Sigma Specialist/Expert * Experience with the following SAP Lumira Discovery Sharepoint SAP Analysis for Office (AO) SQL programming Required Education * Bachelors Degree (BA or BS), prefer computer science, information technology, management information systems, or related field Expertise: SAP Business Explorer Query Designer, SAP ad hoc reporting Data Analytics SAP Supply Chain transactions (with a focus in procurement) Supply Chain and Procurement business processes SAP Lumira Discovery SAP Analysis for Office (AO) SharePoint Kinaxis RapidResponse Access HTML programming Microsoft server maintenance Must be eligible to access US only data  Notes to Vendor: Expertise: SAP Business Explorer Query Designer, SAP ad hoc reporting Data Analytics SAP Supply Chain transactions (with a focus in procurement) Supply Chain and Procurement business processes SAP Lumira Discovery SAP Analysis for Office (AO) SharePoint Kinaxis RapidResponse Access HTML programming Microsoft server maintenance Must be eligible to access US only data Additional Job Requirements: US Citizen Required?: Yes If Yes, International Travel?: ST Hourly Bill Rate: $40.00  OT Hourly Bill Rate: $60.00  DT Hourly Bill Rate: N/A  Security Clearance Required: Unclassified  If "Other" was selected under Security Clearance Required, please Specify:  Any Special Authorization Needed?: N/A If Yes, Specify: Is The Contractor Authorized To Start UnCleared Or With An Interim?: N/ASDL2017

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Omni Hotels and Resorts creates genuine, authentic guest experiences at 60 distinctive luxury hotels and resorts in leading business gateways and leisure destinations across North America. Omni Hotels is known for its exemplary culture, authenticity to the markets in which we operate, innovation and exceptional service. Our commitment to career development has created tenure and loyalty that enables us to perpetuate our family atmosphere.  • Support Directors, VPs and CFO with preparation and analysis of financial statements. Perform ad-hoc financial analysis and modeling on property-level and company-level performance.Aid in the budgeting and forecasting processes regarding preparation, comparison analysis and accuracy reportingComplete ad hoc reporting needs as requested by senior management and support other departments as necessaryMaintain integrity of standard financial reports and build new reports as neededFully understand and utilize the various reporting capabilities of Omni’s reporting and analysis tools.Maintain and distribute short and long-term company projectionsDevelop trend analysis to aid senior management in identifying opportunities in the operation.Prepare presentations for executive team that portray actionable conclusions.Identify and address procedural problems and deficiencies impacting the consistency and timeliness of financial information.Provide field support with regard to financial systems and reportsAssist in the research and implementation of future forecasting and reporting systems.  • Bachelor’s Degree in business, accounting, finance or hospitality required, with 2+ years relevant work experience in a similar industry or roleMBA, Master’s Degree in related field or relevant professional qualifications a plusPrior experience in hospitality or consulting preferredExperience generating reporting to support finance and business stakeholdersHigh level of computer, analytical and technical skills, with the ability to communicate complex financial information across varying levels of understandingAbility to work independently with minimum supervision and as part of a teamAbility to meet tight deadlinesAbility to recognize problems, collect data, draw valid conclusions and define/suggest resolutionsProficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)Prior experience using accounting and analytical softwareExcellent organizational skills, ability to handle multiple prioritiesAbility to maintain confidentiality

Name: Watson Health- Business Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition OverviewThis position is an individual contributor role within the Provider Consulting Team. Name: Business Systems Analyst Lead
Description: Company OverviewLennox International(LII) is a leading global provider of innovative climate control solutions for heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVACR) markets. Beginning over a century ago, Lennox International has built a strong heritage of Innovation and Responsibility. Our position as an innovation leader continually inspires us to promote more efficient energy use and a healthier environment through our product operations. Our engaged and diverse workforce is committed to providing climate control solutions that provide the most value and comfort for our customers. We are proud to have instilled a shared sense of responsibility and commitment among our approximately 10,000 employees located throughout North America, South America, Europe, Asia, and Australia.  Job DescriptionUnder general direction, has duties of instructing, directing, and checking the work of other business systems analysts. Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering system capacity and limitations, operation time, and form of desired results. Analyzes business and user needs and follows through the full development life cycle. Responsible for feasibility studies, project charters and/or statements of work, implementation, communication, testing, change management, and training strategies. May modify, maintain, and update application configuration. Responsible for solving highly technical and complex problems on multiple projects, and providing consultative support to internal staff. Serves as the authority on subject matter associated with content, processes, and procedures associated with specific business applications. Educates others in the workflow, business processes, and reporting metrics enabled by assigned applications. Monitors other business analysts in software development methods, processes and implementation of those methods. Provides mentoring and direction to team members and is a key contributor. May manage projects with large budgets or of extended duration. Responsible for managing project plan, scope, risk, and resources. May act as team leader for large project teams. Participates in IT financial management activities including annual budgeting cycle, project estimating, capital approval process, project budget oversight, and resource time tracking. May be responsible for multi-year planning to determine broad direction, prioritize projects and evaluate ROI within a functional sub-area.  QualificationsRequires a bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Requires at least 8 years related experience. Exceptional abilities and responsibilities exceed those typically achieved by a career level Business Systems Analyst. Not only possesses full technical knowledge of most phases of systems analysis, but also considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. Must be able to communicate effectively with both end users and IT staff. Possesses excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to provide direction to career level team members.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description: Working primarily within the Oracle R12 EBS platform, the business systems analyst serves as a senior, internal consultant and advisor between the client and technology group for Order to Cash areas. Plans, conducts and directs the analysis of complex, company-wide, business problems relating to systems. Provides strategic and technical guidance to identify, evaluate and develop systems or automated processes. Applies knowledge of industry trends and technology to drive organizational change. Transforms strategic company architecture and design principles into specific systems requirement and specifications. Resolves issues and provides solutions that meet business requirement and are cost effective. Prepares specifications for system changes. Recommends and initiates systems testing. Re-engineers technical processes and systems for greater efficiencies with positive impact to business operations. Essential duties and responsibilities:Works as primary Oracle R12 support analyst for Order to cash modules including Order Management, Configurator, Advanced Pricing, Shipping, Inventory, GOP, Oracle XML Gateway and integrations across EBS modules and third-party systems.Should be proficient in Business Analysis, Business Knowledge, Testing, Architecture Knowledge and Solution Design. Serve as a liaison between technology and business end-users.Works with O2C business stakeholders and other cross-functional business partners to prioritize process transformation initiatives and support architectural assessments/project scoping exercise.Identify, assess and document business requirements, recommending business priorities and advising the business on options, risks, and costs versus benefits of various solutions.Triage incidents/problems with Order Management, Configurator, Pricing, Inventory, GOP, Shipping systems as they arise, and either manage or directly perform enhancements/fixes to provide resolution satisfactory to key business partners.Provide direction and leadership in promoting and implementing best practice solutions for both business process and technology.Create & identify ways to improve order process, global pricing, shipping strategies and third-party integrations.Manage execution of complete Order to cash modules in line with global business process and their changes.QualificationsServe as technology and process expert in Oracle ERP Distribution modules such as Oracle Order Management, Configurator, Advanced Pricing, Shipping, Inventory and integrations across EBS and third-party modules.Expert with Order to Cash processes such as Standard Sales Order, assemble to order, pick to Order, back to Back Order, Drop Ship Order, Bill Only and Ship Only Orders.Thorough knowledge in understanding the credit check process, Scheduling, Processing Constraints, Defaulting Rules, MOAC, Pricing Attributes mapping, Dynamic Formula, Modifiers, Qualifiers, Standard, Intercompany and customer specific price listsExcellent knowledge and experience in Oracle Order Management Integration with third party Order Entry applications.Through understanding of integration of Oracle Shipping with third party systems using Oracle XML Gateway and Oracle transport agent.Thorough knowledge on how the Order management and Procurement modules are integrated with other modules in Oracle EBS R12 (e.g. Order Management and WIP and Purchasing and Order Management).Expertise in custom pricing and designing pricing solutions based on QP: custom attributes.Solid understanding of Order Management and AR modules and their integration with various oracle CRM modules.Ability to identify the gaps in standard Oracle and come out with simple and effective solutions with minimal customizations.Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as internal personal skills, familiarity with business practices and cultures across multiple international regions.Excellent critical thinking skills to help address and resolve business issues.Team player, flexible and ability to resolve conflicts and working with global teams.Experience in working with both Waterfall as well as Agile project methodologies.ABOUT DJO GLOBAL DJO Global is a leading global developer, manufacturer and distributor of high-quality medical devices that provide solutions for musculoskeletal health, vascular health and pain management. Our products address the continuum of patient care from injury prevention to rehabilitation after surgery, injury or from degenerative disease, enabling people to regain or maintain their natural motion. Our products are used by orthopedic specialists, spine surgeons, primary care physicians, pain management specialists, physical therapists, podiatrists, chiropractors, athletic trainers and other healthcare professionals. In addition, many of our medical devices and related accessories are used by athletes and patients for injury prevention and at-home physical therapy treatment. Product lines include rigid and soft orthopedic bracing, hot and cold therapy, bone growth stimulators, vascular therapy systems and compression garments, therapeutic shoes and inserts, electrical stimulators used for pain management and physical therapy products. Our surgical division offers a comprehensive suite of reconstructive joint products for the hip, knee and shoulder. Our products are marketed under a portfolio of brands including Aircast®, Chattanooga, CMF, Compex®, DonJoy®, ProCare®, Exos, Dr. Comfort®, DonJoy Performance® and DJO® Surgical.  For additional information on the Company, please visit www.DJOglobal.com.  DJO is a portfolio company of the Blackstone Group  EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.SDL2017

Name: Business Value Analyst
Description: OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management. The opportunity: This is a position which is best described as a mix of sales, management consulting and finance within the umbrella of a global, premier software brand. Business Value Consulting team members will work on multi-million dollar deals and build expertise across industries and functions. The VA role is an opportunity for someone with consultative business analysis skills to have an impact on large enterprise software transactions. It represents a unique bridge from the world of business analysis to the critical function of Sales. You are great at:Driving the development and supporting the implementation of a comprehensive field sales value based selling program.Designing tools and deliverables to help penetrate enterprise customer accounts, including Business Capability and Retrospective Studies and Outside-In Analysis.Being the trusted adviser to OpenText customers and prospects including high level executives. This leader will present to help customers and prospects understand the value of a proposed World Class OpenText solution.Maintaining a strong understanding of the broad OpenText technology portfolio at a level sufficient to understand and communicate "the art of the possible" in terms of business process and Enterprise Information Management (EIM).Helping customers identify and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) that should be monitored to improve the value received from OpenText products and services.Developing high quality business transformation studies that document success, both quantitatively and qualitatively, that can be used to provoke sales opportunities with new prospects. The ideal candidate will have core knowledge to evaluate, drive, and present ROI for customers and clearly articulate how the OT solutions will drive down TCO for our solutions.Designing and delivering C-level engagements and strategy enablement workshops to create a common and compelling vision.Proactively maintain customer intimacy by working post sales with customers for best practices in the implementations of applications and value achieved, feeding the information back to the Business Value Consulting practice and organization.What it takes:MBA or equivalent work experience expected. Minimum of 10 years' experience in sales / business development or management consulting in the high tech space is preferred.Knowledge of enterprise applications and related processes including ERP, CRM, HCM, etc.Capable of establishing immutable credibility with customer executives and project teams.Experience with development of business cases that include benefits, ROI Analysis, Total Cost of Ownership and Competitive Analysis, Risk Management, Implementation road map and Business Transformation Strategies.Profound "customer curiosity" a natural interest in the customers' business and business environment and a willingness to research judiciously, efficiently and effectively on these topics, to assure client "literacy" and minimize their "overhead" in leveraging our services.Absolute comfort and ability to diplomatically coach, challenge, and extend customers' thinking to assure full capture of both direct and indirect business benefits of a proposed process and/or EIM improvements / possibilities.Full understanding of strategic consulting methods, engagement, and best practices to achieve consistent results.Executive engagement, facilitation, and public speaking techniques and experience.Significant sales achievements in connection with projects, products and/or servicesRecord of building strong customer relationships and customer contacts (executive access and effective offer positioning). At OpenText we understand and value diversity in our employees and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We hire the best talent regardless of race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, sex, age, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accommodationrequests@opentext.com. Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws including but not limited to: Family and Medical Leave Act (FLMA), Equal Employment Opportunity and Employee Polygraph Protection ActSDL2017

Strong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word and iGraphx or Visio Drawing tools along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required.Experience managing multiple large, complex and cross functional projects, with emphasis on systems, technologies, business process redesign, and knowledge of technical environments.

The average consultants is on project 2-5 years, all work will be performed on-site and you MUST be available for a face to face interview. RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE: Support Business Planning Analyst to administer SI budget including: reporting (Hyperion), re-class and JV submissions, processing invoices  Support the design and establishment of SI Sharepoint site  Support the Project Coordination and Training manager in developing SOPs for 360 project management and coordinating training sessions  Support ad-hoc needs for Strategy Hub and other Social Innovation sub-functions as needed  REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE: (Resume must reflect this experience)  Proficiency in Hyperion and Sharepoint  Attention to detail (including numbers)  Proficiency in MS Office (Word/Excel), and MS Project  Strong written and verbal communication skills  Able to handle a high volume and diverse list of tasks  Attention to detail (including numbers)  Able to Interview in-person  Must have a stable work history, working in a similar role Other Requirements: Must reside locally (Dallas,TX area) and available to interview in-person  Must have a stable work history, working in a similar role  NO 3rd Party/C2C candidates will be accepted, W2 Only!!  Education: Bachelors Degree Preferred/ Nice-to-haves: Proficiency in MS Teams and MS Project CALANCE Benefits Offerings: Open enrollment of Medical/Dental/Vision benefits  401K Retirement program  Paid Bi-Weekly/Direct Deposit  Flex Spending Plan  Voluntary Life, AD&D, STD or LTD plansCompany DescriptionCalance is a recognized leader in providing top-tier Information Technology professionals across North America. With over 25 years of experience recruiting professionals ranging from Programmers to CIOs, Calance provide valuable staffing solutions for short and long term projects, as well as your permanent hiring needs. Our professionals are experts at helping organizations realize their information technology goals by selecting the best talent for each project or position.  Calance helps clients respond quickly to economic, strategic or technological changes by utilizing a flexible workforce. We offer highly-skilled professional IT consultants on a temporary or project basis. Consultants are employees of Calance while on assignment for the client, allowing for cost savings, risk management and operational benefits.  Calance's Contract-to-Hire option allows an IT organization to evaluate an individual before making a decision to bring them on as a full-time employee. Depending on the length of the temporary assignment, placement fees are waived or reduced.  Calance realizes that IT organizations often have needs for talented people to fill specific roles and that filling those needs can be challenging. Our highly experienced Account Managers and recruiting staff work closely with our clients to determine the desired skills, background and traits required for the position.  We apply our unique recruiting methodology to locate and recruit the most highly qualified candidates to match the requirements of your full-time employee position. Calance can assist in every step of the hiring process, from determining the exact job requirements to final negotiations, to help bring on-board the candidates you need.

Name: IT Business Lead Analyst
Description: About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’sMission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels.
