Name: Business Analyst, Corporate Development
Description: In an effort to  provide a more healthy, safe and satisfying environment to our employees,  individuals to whom job offers are extended may undergo nicotine testing as a  part of the pre-employment process.The Corporate Development team has an immediate need for a Business Analyst to support the team in the Dallas corporate office of Tenet Healthcare. The Business Analyst will support the team in processing and analyzing potential strategic opportunities including mergers, acquisitions, divestitures and real estate transactions. This role requires high attention to detail, ability to turn out a high volume of work in a highly visible business unit and an extremely fast paced operation.Key responsibilities include:Development of strategic analysis and related management presentations for review by senior executives and the board of directors (preparing complex business presentations in PowerPoint)Tracking and support of transactions and assigned projects and coordination with various internal departments (Excel)Development of models, including financial statement analysis and utilization of common business valuation methodologies to illustrate projected financial results (Excel)Organization and performance of due diligence on live transactions (on an as needed basis)Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in finance, accounting, or economics or equivalent/relevant experience1 to 3 years' experience in investment banking, management consulting, and/or M&A/corporate finance, preferably in healthcare industry. This is not a senior associate role.Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-based environment with minimal supervisionRequires flexibility and the ability to pivot / quickly respond to rapidly changing business needsExceptional problem solving, organization and communication skills to manage and track overlapping tasks and assignments, with frequent priority changesExpert level of proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint Job:  Corporate Primary Location:  Dallas, Texas Facility:  Tenet Headquarters Job Type:  Full-time Shift Type:  DaysEmployment practices will not be influenced or affected by an applicants or employees race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status or any other legally protected status. Tenet will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities unless doing so would result in an undue hardship.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description: Working primarily within the Oracle R12 EBS platform, the business systems analyst serves as a senior, internal consultant and advisor between the client and technology group for Order to Cash areas. Plans, conducts and directs the analysis of complex, company-wide, business problems relating to systems. Provides strategic and technical guidance to identify, evaluate and develop systems or automated processes. Applies knowledge of industry trends and technology to drive organizational change. Transforms strategic company architecture and design principles into specific systems requirement and specifications. Resolves issues and provides solutions that meet business requirement and are cost effective. Prepares specifications for system changes. Recommends and initiates systems testing. Re-engineers technical processes and systems for greater efficiencies with positive impact to business operations. Essential duties and responsibilities:Works as primary Oracle R12 support analyst for Order to cash modules including Order Management, Configurator, Advanced Pricing, Shipping, Inventory, GOP, Oracle XML Gateway and integrations across EBS modules and third-party systems.Should be proficient in Business Analysis, Business Knowledge, Testing, Architecture Knowledge and Solution Design. Serve as a liaison between technology and business end-users.Works with O2C business stakeholders and other cross-functional business partners to prioritize process transformation initiatives and support architectural assessments/project scoping exercise.Identify, assess and document business requirements, recommending business priorities and advising the business on options, risks, and costs versus benefits of various solutions.Triage incidents/problems with Order Management, Configurator, Pricing, Inventory, GOP, Shipping systems as they arise, and either manage or directly perform enhancements/fixes to provide resolution satisfactory to key business partners.Provide direction and leadership in promoting and implementing best practice solutions for both business process and technology.Create & identify ways to improve order process, global pricing, shipping strategies and third-party integrations.Manage execution of complete Order to cash modules in line with global business process and their changes.QualificationsServe as technology and process expert in Oracle ERP Distribution modules such as Oracle Order Management, Configurator, Advanced Pricing, Shipping, Inventory and integrations across EBS and third-party modules.Expert with Order to Cash processes such as Standard Sales Order, assemble to order, pick to Order, back to Back Order, Drop Ship Order, Bill Only and Ship Only Orders.Thorough knowledge in understanding the credit check process, Scheduling, Processing Constraints, Defaulting Rules, MOAC, Pricing Attributes mapping, Dynamic Formula, Modifiers, Qualifiers, Standard, Intercompany and customer specific price listsExcellent knowledge and experience in Oracle Order Management Integration with third party Order Entry applications.Through understanding of integration of Oracle Shipping with third party systems using Oracle XML Gateway and Oracle transport agent.Thorough knowledge on how the Order management and Procurement modules are integrated with other modules in Oracle EBS R12 (e.g. Order Management and WIP and Purchasing and Order Management).Expertise in custom pricing and designing pricing solutions based on QP: custom attributes.Solid understanding of Order Management and AR modules and their integration with various oracle CRM modules.Ability to identify the gaps in standard Oracle and come out with simple and effective solutions with minimal customizations.Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as internal personal skills, familiarity with business practices and cultures across multiple international regions.Excellent critical thinking skills to help address and resolve business issues.Team player, flexible and ability to resolve conflicts and working with global teams.Experience in working with both Waterfall as well as Agile project methodologies.ABOUT DJO GLOBAL DJO Global is a leading global developer, manufacturer and distributor of high-quality medical devices that provide solutions for musculoskeletal health, vascular health and pain management. Our products address the continuum of patient care from injury prevention to rehabilitation after surgery, injury or from degenerative disease, enabling people to regain or maintain their natural motion. Our products are used by orthopedic specialists, spine surgeons, primary care physicians, pain management specialists, physical therapists, podiatrists, chiropractors, athletic trainers and other healthcare professionals. In addition, many of our medical devices and related accessories are used by athletes and patients for injury prevention and at-home physical therapy treatment. Product lines include rigid and soft orthopedic bracing, hot and cold therapy, bone growth stimulators, vascular therapy systems and compression garments, therapeutic shoes and inserts, electrical stimulators used for pain management and physical therapy products. Our surgical division offers a comprehensive suite of reconstructive joint products for the hip, knee and shoulder. Our products are marketed under a portfolio of brands including Aircast®, Chattanooga, CMF, Compex®, DonJoy®, ProCare®, Exos, Dr. Comfort®, DonJoy Performance® and DJO® Surgical.  For additional information on the Company, please visit www.DJOglobal.com.  DJO is a portfolio company of the Blackstone Group  EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.SDL2017

Name: Business Information Analyst
Description: Company: G6 HospitalityBusiness Information Analyst G6 Hospitality ______________________________________________ About the role  Come join a company that has been growing rapidly and outperforming the market segment over the last 5 years. G6 Hospitality, which represents the Motel 6 and Studio 6 brand has initiated a system-wide renovation effort, invested in technology and has expanded globally.  The Business Information Analyst is a multifunctional role, responsible for collaborating on the development and implementation of databases that provide the Contact Center with accurate and complete statistical data. Additional responsibilities include compiling and analyzing data that allows key leaders the opportunity to make informed business decisions. This individual is in charge, in collaboration with IT leaders, for the administration of systems used by the Contact Center. This also includes configuring and managing data interfaces and applications to ensure continued work flow and data reliability. The Business Information Analyst is also responsible for proactively monitoring potential system issues, identifying process improvement opportunities, and provides management with suggested corrections and or enhancements.  What you will be doing  The Business Information Analyst is a multifunctional role, responsible for collaborating on the development and implementation of databases that provide the Contact Center with accurate and complete statistical data. Additional responsibilities include compiling and analyzing data that allows key leaders the opportunity to make informed business decisions. This individual is in charge, in collaboration with IT leaders, for the administration of systems used by the Contact Center. This also includes configuring and managing data interfaces and applications to ensure continued work flow and data reliability. The Business Information Analyst is also responsible for proactively monitoring potential system issues, identifying process improvement opportunities, and provides management with suggested corrections and or enhancements. Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Business Value Analyst
Description: OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management. The opportunity: This is a position which is best described as a mix of sales, management consulting and finance within the umbrella of a global, premier software brand. Business Value Consulting team members will work on multi-million dollar deals and build expertise across industries and functions. The VA role is an opportunity for someone with consultative business analysis skills to have an impact on large enterprise software transactions. It represents a unique bridge from the world of business analysis to the critical function of Sales. You are great at:Driving the development and supporting the implementation of a comprehensive field sales value based selling program.Designing tools and deliverables to help penetrate enterprise customer accounts, including Business Capability and Retrospective Studies and Outside-In Analysis.Being the trusted adviser to OpenText customers and prospects including high level executives. This leader will present to help customers and prospects understand the value of a proposed World Class OpenText solution.Maintaining a strong understanding of the broad OpenText technology portfolio at a level sufficient to understand and communicate "the art of the possible" in terms of business process and Enterprise Information Management (EIM).Helping customers identify and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) that should be monitored to improve the value received from OpenText products and services.Developing high quality business transformation studies that document success, both quantitatively and qualitatively, that can be used to provoke sales opportunities with new prospects. The ideal candidate will have core knowledge to evaluate, drive, and present ROI for customers and clearly articulate how the OT solutions will drive down TCO for our solutions.Designing and delivering C-level engagements and strategy enablement workshops to create a common and compelling vision.Proactively maintain customer intimacy by working post sales with customers for best practices in the implementations of applications and value achieved, feeding the information back to the Business Value Consulting practice and organization.What it takes:MBA or equivalent work experience expected. Minimum of 10 years' experience in sales / business development or management consulting in the high tech space is preferred.Knowledge of enterprise applications and related processes including ERP, CRM, HCM, etc.Capable of establishing immutable credibility with customer executives and project teams.Experience with development of business cases that include benefits, ROI Analysis, Total Cost of Ownership and Competitive Analysis, Risk Management, Implementation road map and Business Transformation Strategies.Profound "customer curiosity" a natural interest in the customers' business and business environment and a willingness to research judiciously, efficiently and effectively on these topics, to assure client "literacy" and minimize their "overhead" in leveraging our services.Absolute comfort and ability to diplomatically coach, challenge, and extend customers' thinking to assure full capture of both direct and indirect business benefits of a proposed process and/or EIM improvements / possibilities.Full understanding of strategic consulting methods, engagement, and best practices to achieve consistent results.Executive engagement, facilitation, and public speaking techniques and experience.Significant sales achievements in connection with projects, products and/or servicesRecord of building strong customer relationships and customer contacts (executive access and effective offer positioning). Name: Sr. Business Analyst - COAF
Description: Plano 6 (31066), United States of America, Plano, Texas  At Capital One, were building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.  Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.  Sr. Business Analyst - COAF  As a Senior Business Analyst at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You will team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. And you will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.  Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  - Analysis: Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and solve for them using analysis to make strategic or tactical recommendations  - Product: Perform modeling/analytics to assist new product and pricing strategies for various lending products  - Marketing: Support direct-to-consumer marketing efforts for select products, and strategic intent for products distributed through the retail channel. Help build targeted insights to inform the design and development of new customer experiences, as well as breakthrough technology and concepts designed to deliver on new go to market strategies  - Credit Risk: Support step-change improvements in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis  - Execution: Involve problem frame-works, develop hypotheses, test and analysis, solution development, scope operational feasibility, lead implementation efforts and develop a monitoring plan  - Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including: IT, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability Basic Qualifications:- Bachelors Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering) 1 year of experience in analysisPreferred Qualifications:- Masters Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering CFA, SQL, SAS, FRM certifications1 year of experience in Statistical model building, market research, SQL querying  - 2 years of experience in business analysis in a corporate setting1 year of experience in consulting Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Description: Join Netcracker Technology, a wholly owned subsidiary of NEC Corporation, to work for a forward-looking software company, offering mission-critical solutions to service providers around the globe. Our comprehensive portfolio of software solutions and professional services enables large-scale digital transformations, unlocking the opportunities of the cloud, virtualization and the changing mobile ecosystem. With an unbroken service delivery track record of more than 20 years, our unique combination of technology, people and expertise helps companies transform their networks and enable better experiences for their customers.Position Summary (Roles & Responsibilities):Provide post-production support services for the customers, including the following activities:Analyze, identify, prioritize and assist in resolution of issues in production environmentsAnalyze, categorize and assist in development by application enhancement requestsProvide business users with application supportConfiguration management and change managementFinalize the implementation process; identify the outstanding tasks and problems remaining after the implementation.Work with professional services to ensure seamless transition and knowledge transfer to customer support.Establish good working relationship with the customers while providing onsite technical support for production environment.Troubleshoot, analyze and resolve various software problems in customer solution.Implement and deploy change requests and enhancements to further improve the existing solution.Perform product demonstrations as necessary to introduce customer to solution.Work with professional services, product management, quality assurance and development teams to develop and improve product offering and eliminate software problems.Required Experience & Skills: Experience: At least one year of recent development or support experience in enterprise-wide information systems or experience in software technical support or equivalent.  Skills: Experience as a developer, implementation or technical support engineer;Experience in Java, J2EE and SQL technologies;Experience in software technical support or equivalent will be considered an asset;Experience with Oracle Server (SQL, PL-SQL);UNIX experience as tech support engineer (checking health of processes, updating configs, checking logs, configuring cron jobs, etc.)Knowledge of implementation methodologies and development techniques;Strong communication skills and fluent in English language (written & spoken);Experience in telecommunications industry (preferred)Education:Bachelor degree in Information Systems or a related field.

Name: Business Systems Analyst

Support the product owner(s) in defining the overall user experience and engage appropriate technical team(s), UIX design team and business group(s) to elicit, interpret, analyze and validate requirements for new functionality being requested by business groups and generate the system requirements in user story format for technical team(s).?  ? Work in collaboration with Product Owners with creation of stories, feature decomposition, documentation and managing dependencies, and story templates for repeatable features.?  ? Work with Product Owner to drive team to 3 sprints of groomed stories.?  ? Support the Product Owner on the health of the backlog, execute continuous requirements elicitation, story level grooming activities and ensure stories meet the definition of ?ready?.?  ? Transform business requirements into technical, or system requirements to be documented as supporting artifacts in stories to be built and delivered by the team.?  ? Resolve requirement related impediments affecting the team?s progress.?  ? Facilitate pre-grooming and grooming sessions, as required, to ensure scope and the definition of successful completion for the project is understood by the team.?  ? Assist Product Owner in prioritization of user stories?  ? Responsible to have an in depth business and technical knowledge of the applications you support. Consistently improve on business and technical knowledge.?  ? Active participation in Progressive Elaboration sessions, and any other requirements and/or project planning sessions.?  ? Active participant in the Business Systems Analyst Community of Practice to contribute to and maintain standards, best practices, skills, and any other discipline specific to the Business Systems Analyst role.?  ? Own the updating of stories and communication of the changes to the requirements and functionality appropriately across the team.?  ? Adhere to all standards, policies and governance practices.?  ? Adhere to all administrative responsibilities.?  ? Support QA Test Engineers with Test Case creation and guidance. Support QA to clarify requirements.?  ? Support Team day to day throughout a sprint to quickly answer questions resolve requirements concerns.?  ? Support QA to clarify requirements

Name: Business/Data Analyst Intern-Coop - Boston
Description: Job Description IBM CIO (Chief Information Office) Organization is looking for innovative talent for our Boston area locations who bring fresh new ideas to create a productive environment for all IBMers across the globe through our internship program offering. Our mission is to provide the best work experience in a digital workplace to all IBM employees and consequently positively impact on the way IBM deliver what our clients need.  Are you interested in working in an innovative and collaborative environment for the summer? If so, this is your chance to work in the first IBM area to become agile and to create meaningful solutions that impact our technology and business transformation for a new business era - all in just one summer!Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience with User Experience (UX) designMinimum of 1-year experience using problem solving skills such as: Analyze causes using existing techniques or tools, prepare and recommend solution alternativesAbility to absorb professional knowledge quickly and develop skillsAbility to draw upon professional concepts to collaborate with others to carry out assigned dutiesAbility to challenge the validity of given procedures and processes with the intent to enhance and improveEnrolled in a Bachelor of Science in Business Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or a similar degree programAbility to work in the United States without the need for current or future IBM sponsorship Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Experience using Agile and Design Thinking methodologiesExperience working with leaders of designExperience writing user stories and requirements documents using analytical skills EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Reliability Analyst
Description: We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.  Perform continuing analysis of the effectiveness of the maintenance and inspection program in order to satisfy the requirements of an FAA-Approved Reliability Program.  Collect, integrate, analyze, and present maintenance data in order to provide insightful and actionable information to Tech Ops Leadership to make better and more informed business decisions. WORK ACTIVITIES/CONTEXT:Maintain compliance with Southwest Airlines MPM and FAA requirements for the D074 Reliability Program on an ongoing basis.Perform data collection, validation, and classification on data elements required by the Reliability Program and exercise judgement within defined procedures to determine appropriate action.Perform root cause analysis on data of moderate scope to measure aircraft/fleet performance for safety, reliability, and economic impact, and identify deficiencies in the Maintenance Program.Work with individuals and groups across Tech Ops to identify and address adverse trends, evaluate the effectiveness of corrective measures, and provide detailed briefings up to Tech Ops Leadership.Evaluate and apply performance standards and statistical analysis methods.Maintain awareness of and compliance with Reliability training requirements as defined in the MPM.Compile, build, and publish monthly Reliability reports.Provide Reliability data, statistics, and analysis to internal and external Customers at an exceptional level of customer service. Must be able to meet any physical ability requirements listed on this description.  May perform other job duties as directed by Employee’s Leaders. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required.Must be at least 18 years of age.Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986.EDUCATION:Bachelor's degree (B.S. / B.A.) in Aviation, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent relevant work experience required.WORK EXPERIENCE:Two + years prior analysis experience in Aviation, Engineering, or Reliability related field required.Prior root cause analysis experience preferred.LICENSING/CERTIFICATION:FAA Airframe & Powerplant license and/or pilot experience preferred.Continuous Improvement Certification in Six Sigma/Lean or related field preferred.SKILLS/ABILITIES/KNOWLEDGE/WORK STYLE: Must be able to comply with Company attendance standards as described in established guidelines. Prefer familiarity with AC 120-17A Maintenance Control by Reliability Methods, MSG-3 based Aircraft Maintenance Programs, and FAA Inspector's Handbook.Must be able to organize and balance multiple concurrent initiatives/assignments while maintaining a high degree of accuracy, attention to detail, and timely delivery.Must be able to perform more complex tasks with occasional guidance from direct Leaders.Must be comfortable delivering formal written and verbal communication to various levels of the organization up to Tech Ops Leadership.Must be able to read and understand aircraft and component diagrams, manuals, and other technical or regulatory documents.Must be able to visualize, articulate, and condense complex issues into concise, easily understood updates and/or presentations.Must be able to deliver high quality results as an individual contributor, including when under tight time constraints and/or while dealing with competing priorities.Must be proficient in communication, visualization, and report-writing applications like Tableau, Word, PowerPoint, etc.Must be proficient in data querying and processing applications like Alteryx, Access, Excel, PL/SQL Developer, etc.Prefer proficiency in project management and process flow applications like Quick Base, Project, and MRO software, etc.OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:Ability to travel to industry conferences 1-2 times per year including overnights preferred.Must be able to work a flexible schedule as needed to support the operational needs of the Department. Must maintain a well-groomed appearance per Company appearance standards as described in established guidelines. Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Marketing Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWas your Statistics class one of your favorite classes in college? Does creating data maps excite you? Would you describe yourself as socially savvy with current trends and consumer behaviors? Do you love analyzing data to highlight marketing trends? If youre looking for an exciting career opportunity in digital advertising and marketing, working with a fast-growing company that runs on-going digital and social campaigns for some of todays top brands (with clientele ranging from ESPN and Disney to Simplehuman and Celebrity Charity Campaigns) then Monkedia is the place for you.  We are looking for a Marketing Business Intelligence Analyst. As a business, we manage multiple clients' digital advertising accounts on a daily basis and we'd love for someone to help us figure out ways to streamline our day to day. If using Visual Basic to highlight gaps and areas of opportunity in regards to performance of campaigns, targeting, and ad creative strikes your fancy, we want to talk! Our biggest goal is to produce the greatest ROI from each campaign... can you help us enhance that? The answer is yes if you are a polished, results oriented, analytical thinker with strong project management skills. If you can bring solution-based thinking, analytical rigor and an extraordinary level of drive to this position, even better. Responsibilities:Dive into account analytics, using Facebook and proprietary systems, to understand trends across advanced metrics for campaign, ad set, and ad performanceSee through the data and analyze it precisely to find appropriate conclusions. Must be vigilant and like challenging problemsApply statistical methods creatively to measure effects of budget adjustments, audience resonance, and content performanceExecuting tests, collecting and analyzing data, Identifying trends and patterns in the advertising data, and strategically implement optimization methods to maximize ROIMinimum Qualifications2-4 years of experience in a marketing, digital marketing or business intelligence roleStrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with vigilance, accuracy and attention to detailThe ability to perform daily account management and optimization of various advertising accountsExperience analyzing and generating reporting for major metrics, goal tracking, revenue tracking, and moreStrong math and analysis skills, as well as strong written and oral communication skills.A logical but creative mindset, being able to take a companys objectives and identify campaign strategy through research and analysis (i.e.: recommending appropriate keywords, targeting, interests, and more)Bachelors degreeMust be legally authorized to work in the United States Preferred Qualifications Strong understanding of statistical methods and analysis such as probability distributions, regression analysis, correlation, causation, variance, etcA degree in mathematics, information systems, statistics, economics, computer science, and/or behavioral economics is a plusUnderstanding Facebook Advertising and/or Google AdWords would be a plus. Why Monkedia?  At Monkedia we believe people are the greatest part of our business, thats why were invested in finding driven, passionate, and charismatic individuals to become a part of our team. Perks:Our Las Colinas Office is easily accessible from several major highwaysMany restaurants and retail within 5 mins of officeStay home when you need it - Unlimited sick daysVoted 2018 Best and Brightest to work for!Fully-stocked vending machine with prices at low vendor costMonthly company and team events/outings like on-site laser tag tournaments, christmas light shows, company casino night, and more!Free parking1 hour lunch breaksSmart casual dress code - jeans and flannels welcomeBenefits:Competitive salaryMedical, Dental, Vision, Life, & Disability insurance plansPaid vacation days9 paid holidays This position is based in our Las Colinas office. This is your chance to build your career with our collaborative and engaging team as part of a fast-growing, creative company leading initiatives in social media advertising. We need brains, ambition, and passion to continue helping connect all kinds of products and services with customers all over the globe.  At Monkedia, we care less about your badges of honor and more about who you are and what youve accomplished. We are a positive opportunity employer and give opportunities less on the school you graduated from and more on what youve done as a well-rounded human-being. When applying be sure to send us YOU, not just your accolades. And, if youre paying attention, be sure to include your favorite company or celebrity you follow on social media in your cover letter!

Name: Billing Operations Support Analyst
Description: The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for developing dashboards, ad-hoc reports, and visual analytics to provide insights into the data to satisfy business needs.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Responsible for design, development, and maintenance of reports and analyses.Partner with business teams to translate requests into reports, data insights, and actionable metrics.Supports the definition and documentation of internal and external user interfaces and supports system and data requirement clarification and definition.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and validate data integrity.Addresses other ongoing data requests and administrative needs as necessary.Displays proficiency with technology, including office applications, sales force automation, database systems, relational database architecture, executing data imports, running exports, merging records, and running reports.Deliver informative, well-organized presentations.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or another related field5+ years of analytic experienceExperience in creating presentations and working with all levels of managementExperience in data structures, data representation, data cleaning techniques, and data governanceProficient in working with Microsoft Office, specifically MS Excel.Experience with programs such as MS CRM, Power Pivot, Power Query, and BI tools (Tableau or MS Power BI).Must be able to handle a wide work variety and work in a fast-paced environment.High attention to detail and ability to validate data from multiple sources.Flexibility to adapt to changes in project dynamics.Must be a detail-oriented, organized, self-starter, and can prioritize workload.Industry knowledge and Billing and Financial process experience a plus.To apply for this position, please send resumes to HR@progenity.com

Name: Financial Business Analyst
Description: *Financial Business Analyst***Share this** Find similar career opportunities *Financial Business Analyst***Category:** Business Analysis (functional and technical)*City:** Dallas, Texas, United States*Position ID:** J1118-0446*Employment Type:** Full Time*Meet our professionals***CGI: An employer of choice***Position Description:** The Finance Business Analyst will be the client-facing lead supporting the roll out of our new Oil & Gas ERP solution, X2R FAS (Financial Accounting System), to our legacy clients. This product is being rolled out to 20+ users of our legacy solutions, and provides the ability for our clients to manage all aspects of their oil and gas assets through an integrated, modern SaaS product suite. It will involve interfacing with senior clients, our oil & gas SME?s and other CGI members *Your future duties and responsibilities:** Proven track record of success in completing IT implementation projects.  Work with the client during implementation to identify any requirements gaps in X2R and communicate those to the X2R program manager.  Work with the client during implementation to configure X2R per client requirements.  Support the conversion of legacy clients accounting information to X2R  Coordinate and support user acceptance testing of X2R with the client.  Train the client on X2R  Work with the project manager to ensure on time implementation of the solution.  Analyze potential risks and determine countermeasures.  Ensure smooth hand-off from project team to stake holders and end users.  Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.  Strong verbal and written communication skills. *Required qualifications to be successful in this role:** 5 years of Business Analyst experience  5 years of Financial / Accounting ERP systems experience  ? Oil & Gas experience.  ? Accounting background.  ? Experience working as a business analyst.  ? Ability to communicate effectively with clients.  ? Strong personal interaction, confidence, and verbal communication skills.  ? Must be able to work collaboratively with teammates, both senior and junior.  ? Experience in working as business analyst. Desired Skills: ? Ability to understand business functionality to the level required to understand the project and key elements to success.  ? Comfortable working closely and communicating collaboratively with clients.  ? Strong, confident personal presence, to represent CGI on a daily basis to our client.  ? Experience with JIRA.  Experience with SQL  ? Experience with report writing or BI tools  Bachelor?s degree in applicable field LI-TM1*Skills:** + Accounting  + Business Analysis *What you can expect from us:***Build your career with us.** It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change?supporting our clients? digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com .  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics. Name: Business Analyst Sr. - IR Health CDS and RQR
Description: SecurityThis position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code 51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record informationSalarySalary NegotiableExperience and EducationBachelor's degree in business administration, computer science, or other related field and five (5) years business systems and/or project experience with exposure to systems or project development and testing, installation, and training.Job DutiesManages projects and serves as primary customer contact.Defines and maintains project plan and schedules.Monitors compliance with definitions of project scope, timelines, and deliverables.Provides regular project status reports to customer and internal management.Assists business analysts of lower grade to coordinate projects.Collects, interprets, and documents specifications required to develop new and revise existing software applications.Develops and implements operational plans for new and existing business computer applications.Participates in development of project proposals for customers.Coordinates testing of new applications and changes to existing applications to ensure integrity and quality of data while providing and/or assisting in training of system users. Name: Senior Analyst - External Reporting
Description: My client is a leading Financial Services Firm. They are seeking an External Reporting Analyst to join their growing team in the Dallas, Texas area.  Client Details  My client is a leading Financial Services Firm. They are seeking an External Reporting Analyst, who has their CPA completed, to join their growing team in the Dallas, Texas area.  Description  Assists with the preparation of disclosures and supporting documentation for Form 10-K/10-Q  Assists in the administration of 10-K/10-Q, including filing with the SEC  Prepares the 10-K/10-Q eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL)  Preparation of financial reporting/metrics tables for the Company's quarterly earnings release.  Reviews supporting documents used in the quarterly earnings call for accuracy  Tracks common stock outstanding and treasury stock in an Excel worksheet  Calculates basic and diluted weighted average shares outstanding monthly  Prepares the monthly cash flow statement  Profile  Bachelor's degree in Accounting  Strong understanding of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)  3-5 years of accounting or financial reporting related work experience  CPA required  Series 27 (FINOP) license required or the ability to pass the exam within one year of employment  Solid financial reporting skills  Analytical skills  Understanding of SEC reporting requirements  Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word  Detail oriented and excellent organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects concurrently  Strong communication skills and able to work with different levels of management  Job Offer  Competitive base salary plus bonus  Organic growth/promotes from within  Challenging work environment of like-minded individuals  Great work/life balance

Name: SAP Business Analyst (Finance)
Description: SAP Business Analyst (Finance)  McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy.  Every single McKesson employee contributes to our missionby joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our companyand of healthcare. At McKesson, you'll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that's vital to us all.  We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career.  Wherever you contribute here at McKesson, you will have the ability to make a real impact in the lives of others.  Position Description  Act as a core member of the integrated SAP application development SCRUM Finance team responsible for leading enhancements projects in a highly complex and integrated IT landscape in FI-GL, AR, AP, Banking, Asset Accounting, Inter-Company Reporting, Financial Analytics Reporting, Financial Consolidation with Hyperion, Special Purpose Ledger, Profit Center Accounting, Cost Center Accounting, Product Costing, Project Systems, COPA, BPC Functional  Relies on experiences in Healthcare Industry and extensive SAP implementation experience to identify new applications opportunities, gather requirements, generate conceptual design, configure/prototype solution alternatives, author functional specifications, and work closely with the IT team and key business users to implement these solutions  Lead discussions with key business users in order to understand needs, clarify and define problems, recommend and build solutions and lead the implementation  Accountable to ensure that assigned projects and tasks are completed on time, on budget and are of high quality and comply with McKesson IT standards  Work directly with customers to take functional requirements & translate them in to functional specifications within multiple process areas  Lead IT solution and collaborate with IT team members, change management, project managers and key business users (preferably in Healthcare Industry)  Collaborate across SAP teams (MM/SD/BW) as well as with 3rd party applications/vendors on various business to business integrations utilizing Hyperion and Siebel CRM and SAP BPC/BW  Collaborate with migration team to ensure successful production deployment of code and configuration and early life support and provides technical assistance to operations and support staff during the early life support periods  Identify opportunities for improving business processes to align with SAP and Industry best practices  Participate in Regular Scrum Team Activities to support IT Agile methodology (daily Scrum Team Meetings; Design and Estimating; PI Planning Sessions; User Story Review and Demo's; PI Retrospective Meetings)  Minimum Requirements  8+ years experience in designing, building, and implementing business solutions using information technology. Proven, significant experience in business analysis, requirements definition and deployment of business requirements to information systems.  Critical Skills  5+ years in business analysis, requirements definition and building SAP systems solution  Minimum 5 years of SAP FICO Finance experience  Involved in at least 2 full life cycle SAP implementations including requirements gathering, configure/prototype solution alternatives, implementing solutions as well as post go-live support  Proficient in Agile software development methodology  Demonstrated experience supporting, developing or enhancing SAP FI Module with cross functional experience in SD (sales & distribution) /MM (materials management = P2P) /BW (business warehouse) environment (can have BPC - business planning and consolidation)  Excellent verbal and written communication skillsAdditional Knowledge & Skills  Detailed knowledge of building system solutions in SAP  Demonstrated process & configuration skills in multiple SAP functional areas  Good understanding of SAP architecture, SAP solutions & modules  Expertise in SAP transactional navigation in one or more functional areas (e.g., OTC, PTP, FI)  Proficiency in navigating SAP troubleshooting/monitoring tools (e.g., ST22, SM13, SM59) to assist in the resolution of complex business functional issues  Proficiency in technical integration with non-SAP systems (e.g., IDOCs, ALE)  Previous implementation experience on S/4 HANA Finance/ simple FinanceEducation  4-year degree in computer science or related field or equivalent experience  Physical Requirements  General Office Demands  Benefits & Company Statement  McKesson believes superior performance - individual and team - that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it's flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population.  We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting.  But we can't do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our missionwhatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our companyand of healthcare. At McKesson, you'll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that's vital to us all.  McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer - minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.  Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.  Agency Statement  No agencies please.  United States-Texas-Irving  Technology  McKesson Corporate  Full-time  Regular  Day Job  Standard  Nov 29, 2018

Name: Sr. Business Analyst - COAF
Description: Plano 6 (31066), United States of America, Plano, Texas  At Capital One, were building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.  Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.  Sr. Business Analyst - COAF  As a Senior Business Analyst at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You will team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. And you will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.  Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  - Analysis: Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and solve for them using analysis to make strategic or tactical recommendations  - Product: Perform modeling/analytics to assist new product and pricing strategies for various lending products  - Marketing: Support direct-to-consumer marketing efforts for select products, and strategic intent for products distributed through the retail channel. Help build targeted insights to inform the design and development of new customer experiences, as well as breakthrough technology and concepts designed to deliver on new go to market strategies  - Credit Risk: Support step-change improvements in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis  - Execution: Involve problem frame-works, develop hypotheses, test and analysis, solution development, scope operational feasibility, lead implementation efforts and develop a monitoring plan  - Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including: IT, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability Basic Qualifications:- Bachelors Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering) 1 year of experience in analysisPreferred Qualifications:- Masters Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering CFA, SQL, SAS, FRM certifications1 year of experience in Statistical model building, market research, SQL querying  - 2 years of experience in business analysis in a corporate setting1 year of experience in consulting Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Name: Business Data Analyst I - Clearview Analyst I
Description: Business Data Analyst I - Clearview Analyst I  Apply now "  Date: Nov 27, 2018  Location:Richardson, TX, US  Company: Dover Corporation  Job Requisition ID: 24904  Department: Manuf. & Operations (DEPT_MFGOP)  Dover Fueling Solutions (DFS), comprised of the most trusted names in the fuel industry, are global leaders in driving innovation for over 100 years. DFS, the industry's 1st end-to-end fueling solution, provides advanced fuel-dispensing equipment, including systems and payment, automatic tank gauging and wet stock-management solutions. The DFS business is comprised of industry leading brands including Tokheim, Wayne Fueling Systems, Fairbanks, ProGauge, ClearView and OPW Fuel Management Systems. We lead every market we serve with focused expertise, progressive thinking and customer-inspired innovation in order to push the boundaries of performance for our customers and shareholders. To learn more about DFS, visit www.doverfuelingsolutions.com. DFS is part of the Fluids segment of Dover Corporation (NYSE: DOV). Position Summary: The ClearView fuel management system gives access to real-time information, produces detailed system-wide reports, alerts for fuel loss, reconciles deliveries, and more. ClearView captures real-time data from a site's Automatic Tank Gauge and Point of Sale system to deliver continuous fuel management. The Dover Fueling Solutions ClearView Business Data Analyst I, will analyze system data to determine the nature of issues shown by the ClearView system and determine what follow-up steps are necessary. Responsible for in-depth analysis regarding customer support. Key Responsibilities:Provide support and advanced research assistance to internal and external customers. Assist with questions and issues with understanding data files from various tank gauges or POS systems.High level analysis of complex alerts from the ClearView system. This includes the ability to understand and decode fuel level variances, Point of Sale transactions, and fuel deliveries. All with a high degree of accuracy and detail.Interface with customers. When a customer has an issue or unsolved problem or request, the analyst will need to assist the customer via phone or email, or simply to provide more data. Capability to convert graphical data into tabular data for internal and external customers.Create reports using historical data to identify trends and key findings for multiple features of the wetstock management system.Identify cross-reference differences within internal system and customer fuel accounting files that may include PDI, Pinnacle, and others.Monitor customer alerts during off company hours at an independent level.Efficient in all facets of the analysis system which includes generating and applying tank charts, unrecorded removal alerts, unrecorded gain alerts, short delivery alerts, and delivery gain alerts to provide back-up support as necessary.Identify delivery split loads and cross-drops as bill of loadings are matched to system generated deliveries derived from real time ATG data.Develop documents to various processes to focus on improvements and training within the analyst team. This may include flow-charts or complete training documentation for specific topics.Communicate and collaborate with engineering team to enhance overall improvement of the system.Candidate Experience and Qualification:Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing to customers, management and other employees.Excellent Customer Service skills.Knowledge of Microsoft Office at an intermediate/high level.Bachelor's Degree preferred within a related field such as Mathematical Statistics, Data Sciences, Information Technology Business Intelligence.Familiarity with data presentation tools such as SAS, Oracle, Tableau, advanced data features of MS ExcelMust be able to comprehend, analyze and present data effectively.Ability to resolve customer requests with limited to no assistance.High level problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Maintaining a professional and positive attitude.Responsiveness to internal customers with appropriate sense of urgency when required.Must be willing to work weekends and holidays.Fuel Industry experience and/or knowledge preferred. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law. Name: Sr Financial Analyst
Description: OverviewWorldVentures, a dynamic, global, fast growing member based travel company, is currently sourcing for a Senior Financial Analyst to be based in our Plano, Texas headquarters. WorldVentures is a fast paced environment with a core of innovation and fun. If you are prepared to grow your career, wear multiple hats, and be part of a fast paced team with a focus on exceptional service, this may be the role for you.The Sr. Financial Analyst, reporting to the Sr. Director of Analytics, under general direction with minimal oversight will work on, but are not limited to, annual budgeting process, executive level reporting, data analysis, financial modeling, and evolving into a subject matter expert. A successful candidate will be a highly self-motivated, detailed oriented individual who is a naturally curious problem solver, capable of working either independently or as part of a group, in a professional environment. This candidate will have a strong passion to identify and solve real business problems using data, analytical skills and should have excellent presentation skills to explain complicated analyses in a clear and concise manner. Additionally, he or she should be a pro-active problem solver who can think out-of-the-box to provide the best solution to problems. The successful candidate will work closely with executives and the business units.  ResponsibilitiesAnalyze financial results by identifying drivers and variances from prior year, budget and forecast, and explain variances.Create monthly, quarterly and annual financial presentations to review performance results to management by assembling and summarizing data, identifying trends, and effectively communicating analyses and variance(s) with a level of detail appropriate to the audience. Build and maintain of Budgeting, Financial Forecasting, Financial Reporting, Operating Plan, and other projects.Work with leadership and the analytics team to develop and monitor key performance indicators, analyze, highlighting trends and variances.Develop and maintain financial models for new business opportunities, promotions and other special projectsConduct in-depth research of historical financial data; analyze and report company’s current financial statusWorks with accounting team, analytics team, other internal departments to provide documents as neededAd-Hoc Reporting and Analysis QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Science, or any related field from an accredited institution.Master’s degree in Business Administration is an added advantage.3 - 5 years of relevant experience in the Finance department, including budgeting/forecasting, financial modeling, financial systems, internal financial reporting, and business operations supportThe ability to think analytically, solve problems to complex business processes, and document results.Advanced knowledge and experience using Microsoft Office, specifically MS Excel, MS Access and PowerPoint.Experience working in SQL is a plus.Solid mathematical aptitude and effective project management skills.WorldVentures is a privately held company based in Plano, Texas with active representatives and members in over 28 countries. WorldVentures proudly offers competitive salaries and benefits including but not limited to Medical, Dental, Vision, Life / AD&D, FSA, 401K and a robust vacation and holiday package. In addition, all full time employees automatically receive a WorldVentures membership at no cost to allow employees access to our exclusive DreamTrips group travel experiences.

Name: Analyst (Junior)
Description: Quadratic, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Richards Group, provides advanced analytics, digital analytics, data solutions, and relationship marketing services to more than 100 class-leading clients across a wide range of verticals.Were searching for a new statistical analyst who shares our passion for data, analysis, modeling, learning, and continuous improvement. Like all team members, this person must be incredibly curious, empathetic, sincere, and hardworking. Quadratic requires a healthy balance between thinking and doing, between detail orientation and out-of-the-box thinking. Our clients needs are constantly evolving, and our charter is to help them move forward.  We hold dear the notion that if you are not failing, youre not trying hard enough.  The analyst will use their experiences, knowledge, and passion for learning to solve diverse business problems for clients, helping them make better decisions. The position requires experience working with a range of mathematics techniques, from linear algebra to statistical modeling to machine learning. You can expect to work with enterprise, digital, marketing, and research data in a collaborative environment. Based on which approach has the most merit, Bayesian inference, belief networks, structural equation modeling, hidden Markov modeling, random forests, latent class, DoE, factor analysis, principal component analysis, k-means clustering, CART, and CHAID might all be in a days work.  The ideal candidate will have fluency in statistics software coding (R, SAS, Stata, Python, etc.) and maybe even a little Java or C++ in their toolkit.  Responsibilities Use data analytics software (SQL, SAS, R, etc.) to clean and organize large data sets to be used in analysesDesign, diagnose, and deploy statistical models using a statistical software package such as R, SAS, or StataDevelop test plans in conjunction with media teams to support campaign objectivesPerform ad hoc quantitative analyses to answer unique and challenging business questionsAdapt and learn to help answer the question at hand in the best way possibleEffectively present project deliverables to internal stakeholders and clients with varying levels of technical expertise Requirements Degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, economics, engineering, or physics, or relevant work experienceTwo or more years of professional experience preferredThree or more years of building and implementing statistical and/or machine learning models (OLS, logistic regression, time series, HLM, neural networks, CHAID, etc.)Advanced level of experience in at least one data statistical software package and data manipulation platform (R, SAS, Stata, SQL, Python, etc.)Knowledge of common marketing analytics techniques such as media mix models, multivariate testing, A/B testing, segmentation, and attribution algorithms is desiredHighly organized, with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environmentAbility to work independently and within a team structure to discuss methodology, results, and recommendationsAbility to present findings and recommendations in a clear and compelling wayA healthy passion for finding meaning in our lives

Name: Business Analyst - Flight Planning
Description: Business Analyst Flight PlanningPosition Type: Full Time Department: Ground Summary NAVBLUE, an Airbus Company, is a leading global provider of flight operations solutions which directly support millions of flights each year and help NAVBLUEs airline customers maximize efficiency, reduce costs, ensure compliance with complex national and international safety regulations, and effectively deliver their services.  NAVBLUEs software solutions form integral components of our airline customers operations centres, and we are currently seeking a Business Analyst,who is customer-facing, responsible for eliciting, documenting, communicating and managing business and technical requirements to ensure that the software product delivered by NAVBLUE effectively meets stakeholders needs. This individual is responsible for understanding and assessing a customers business operations, identifying issues and opportunities, recommending appropriate solutions, ensuring proper translation of business requirements into a set of structured business processes, knowledge, technology and organization specifications that satisfies NAVBLUEs customers strategic and operational objectives. The Business Analyst may also perform user acceptance testing.  The incumbent requires extensive knowledge of customers business operations and a thorough understanding of NAVBLUEs solutions, system development and implementation process.  The incumbent requires extensive knowledge of software applications used to facilitate the collaborative development, recording and distribution of requirements to stakeholders. They should be skilled users of the tools used in the organization and must understand the applicability, strengths and weaknesses of each. Responsibilities:Interview internal and/or external customers to elicit, understand and document business requirementsEnsure that functional specifications are consistent with technology road-mapContribute to project definitions, initial cost assessment of projects, and integration of various project suppliers and vendors.Prepare stakeholders for requirements elicitation processConduct requirements elicitation processes; understanding stakeholder needs and identify potential solutions to meet stakeholder needsConfirm requirements-gathering results with stakeholders, ensuring common understanding of outcomes and that information has been recorded properlyProvide information in a format that is useful to stakeholdersAnalyze and maintain relationships between requirements, designs, solution components to identify impact analysis, coverage of requirements and allocation of tasksEnsure that requirements and designs are accurate and current throughout requirements life cyclePrioritize requirements by assessing value, urgency and risks associated with each requirementEvaluate, document, manage and communicate new and changing stakeholder requirementsEnsure requirements and designs are sufficiently detailed to be usable by appropriate stakeholdersEnsure requirements and designs deliver required business value and supports organizations goals and objectivesIdentify, explore and describes options for solutions to meet business needsAssess business value associated with potential solutions and compare options to identify and recommend the solution option that best provides overall value.Academic/Educational Requirements:Bachelors Degree in computer science, information systems, or a related disciplineRequired Skills/Experience:At least 5 years of experience in Commercial Flight Operations as a pilot, Aircraft Dispatcher (certified) or Operations Controller is highly desired.Prior experience with NAVBLUE products and services an asset.Experience in commercial aviation flight operations/dispatchHigh level of communication skills and effective interpersonal skills essential when interacting with customers and other NAVBLUE employees. The individual must maintain a professional and personal conduct at all times. At times this requires strong interpersonal skills to resolve critical and contentious issues.Must possess strong presentation skills and be able to communicate professionally in written responses to emails, RFPs, and when submitting reports.Highly analytical, capable of creative thinking, decision-making and conceptual thinking. Able to develop solutions through creative and adaptive approaches.Strong organization and time management skills, capable of handling multiple projects with competing timelines and prioritiesBusiness acumen capable of understanding business needs and integrating knowledge and experience from past situationsProficient in MS Office suite, especially word processing, spreadsheets, presentation software and collaboration & knowledge management tools. Advanced user capability is required.Ability to integrate requirements of different types of airlines and regulatory requirements.Must be able to establish and maintain strong relationships.Must work effectively with others in a team environment as well as work independently with little supervision, depending on the task at hand.Self-managing; capable of proactively working with management to understand priorities and drive tasks to completion with minimal support or input from management.How to Apply: If you are interested in joining the NAVBLUE team and feel that your experience matches the above criteria, please send us your application via indeed.  We thank all applicants for applying. Only selected applicants will be contacted.  NAVBLUE, an Airbus company, welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations will be available on request for candidates throughout the entire recruitment and selection process. About Us: NAVBLUE is the new generation of digital, user-friendly Flight Operations and Air Traffic Management solutions. Powered by Airbus pioneer spirit and infused with Navtechs agility, it combines the best of both worlds.  A leading global provider of flight operations solutions serving more than 400 airlines and aviation service companies across all platforms, NAVBLUE has a proven track record in product innovation. With access to Airbus resources and data, NAVBLUE provides its customers with the best solutions based on the best data, fully supporting them in their digital transformation.  NAVBLUE is a fully owned subsidiary of Services by Airbus and is based in Hersham (UK), Cardiff (UK), Toulouse (France) and Waterloo, ON (Canada), with offices around the world.  Job Type: Full-time

Name: Analyst
Description: Robert Half Finance is working with a fast-growing company to full-time an outstanding Financial Analyst. In addition to measuring, analyzing, and forecasting performance in conjunction with operating plans, you will conduct financial modeling on a variety of financial products in this Financial Analyst role. Additional duties include advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management. You will focus on areas like forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management as a business partner on tis dynamic team. In this Financial Analyst position, you will be responsible for supporting world class strategic and financial planning methods, building long-range operating plans to support business imperatives and developing rolling forecast processes to ensure resources every quarter are consumed at maximum effectiveness. Additional aspects of this position include operationalizing and cultivating a more data-driven planning process and improved monthly and quarterly reporting. For more information contact Amanda.Leone@roberthalf.com or 214.855.5070. https://www.linkedin.com/in/amanda-leone-71078365/ Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities ? Analytical support of all financing-related activities, including Excel modeling, report generation, and coordinating with the Operations and Accounting teams to review, analyze, confirm, and report corporate financial results and operating performance metrics. ? Annual budgeting and forecasting processes. Support the creation and refinement of various quantitative and predictive analyses developed in the course of FPQA?s budgeting and forecasting activities.  Robert Half Finance & Accounting, the world's leader in specialized financial staffing, provides exciting full-time opportunities in the areas of accounting, bookkeeping, finance, audit, taxation and more. We pioneered the professional staffing industry, and we've been successfully matching professionals with employers since 1948. Our proven proprietary processes, along with our relationships in 325 locations worldwide, allow us to provide you unparalleled access to exciting career opportunities.
