Name: Business Analyst (Dallas/Houston, TX)
Description: Praescient Analytics focuses on combining advanced analytics technologies and methodologies together in order to empower national intelligence and state/local law enforcement communities and their missions. We are implementing an innovative Records Management System (RMS), built by our amazing partner Mark43, as a tool upon which our first responders rely. Our users are diverse, and we are therefore committed to embracing diversity of thought and experience within our team. We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our teams in Texas (Houston/Dallas)in direct support of numerous Police Departments. You have to be passionate about implementing the next generation of law enforcement technologies as you will work directly with the client to assist with the roll-out of this system, and help drive passionate user adoption throughout the force. This role requires a sharp attention to detail, strong organizational skills, an interest in working directly with customers, and a knack at supporting law enforcement users with revolutionary software. Members of our current team have backgrounds in consulting technical project management, and experience with large SaaS deployment projects.  You will be involved in the full spectrum of implementation of the Mark43 platform at our client sites. You will play a key role assisting your team in researching clients’ current technologies, processes, and policies in order to recommend implementation strategies to support the enterprise adoption of the product to clients. In this role you can expect to be deeply involved with understanding and supporting the ultimate users of the product and it’s your job to get to know each user – from analyst to detective – to ensure that they transition their workflows to this new RMS in a way that is effective, elegant, and creates champions of the users. You are our advocates onsite, every day, helping the Police Departments across their diverse and vital mission sets. What you can expect to work onWorking with a team to support this important enterprise software deployment; be able to comfortably shift from speaking to a group of people to a single person on a complex caseAssist with the development, planning, and implementation of product training for users (on scale of 10s to 100s) – conduct this training and tailor it to each user’s unique abilities and missionSpend time on site with our clients, interacting with stakeholders and guiding them through the different stages of implementationTrack project schedule with stakeholders, help identify schedule risks, and support creation of mitigation strategiesBuild and manage relationships with power-users and influencers within client siteSolicit and organize user feedbackWorking towards a worthwhile mission with a team of friendly and intelligent coworkersWhat we expect from youBA/BS from an accredited college or universityAn interest in GovTech and the public safety spaceExperience in a customer-facing role, preferably in a project management, business analyst, training, client support, and/or feedback collection roleWillingness to empathize with users who may be unlike yourselfPassion for supporting law enforcement, first responders, and other government agenciesStrong organizational skills and ability to multitaskProficiency in Microsoft Office & Google SuiteExcellent written and oral communication skillsAbility to work independently and towards a deadline with minimal oversightComing to work with an open mind and leaving your ego at the doorOwnership over your own work and a commitment to every part of a task, from big picture to small detailsAn attitude that is self-motivated, humble, detail oriented, and committed to qualityAbility and passion about how technology can help enable our clients to conduct their missions more effectively, and capacity to quickly learn technology to be seen as a subject matter expert onsiteWhat you This includes a commitment to provide a work environment that is free from all forms of illegal harassment including sexual harassment.

Name: Sr Business Consultant
Description: Sr Business Consultant  30-Nov-2018 Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY  Plan Sponsor Insights (PSI) is searching for an experienced customer-facing analyst that uses data from various sources to understand a customers health plan performance, how programs and strategies have influenced that performance, and ultimately provide solutions and strategies to the customer in a consultative manner. Fundamental Components: strategies related to the overall plan results for a customer. Results may include things such as medical cost, pharmacy cost, clinical programs, population health and disability. This role will require creating reports or presentations as necessary and the analyst will need to be able to articulate results to a wide range of audiences including customers and consultants and must be able to present complex information in a compelling format and manner. The individual in this position may conduct weekly and monthly analytic reviews with a cross functional team and must be able to meet multiple deadlines in a fast paced environment.  The ideal candidate will have a thorough understanding of the healthcare industry including benefit plans, medical management programs, population health and incentive strategies. The candidate must have strong technical and communication skills and be able to work in a face-paced environment and handle multiple priorities. They must maintain up-to-date knowledge of external/industry trends. BACKGROUND/EXPERIENCE desired:Business/Industry Knowledge: Minimum of 7-10 years of industry experience interpreting/analyzing all aspects of a customers experience (financial results, medical management results, population health, effectiveness of incentive/wellness strategies, etc.). Experience must include using data across the spectrum of a customers products/results to tell the story, connect the dots between various strategies and results and ultimately identify, value and communicate areas of opportunity. Must have strong knowledge of claim coding (CPT/DRG, etc.), provider networks, benefit designs, healthcare products/funding, medical management programs and financial acumen.Strong communication skills. Able to articulate (verbally and written) complex business results, issues and strategies in a clear, concise and confident manner to all levels and positions of an organization (internal and external).Relationship management: Demonstrated relationship management skills at the senior level; capacity to quickly build and maintain credible relationships at varying levels of the organization simultaneously.Strategic Thinking: Must have demonstrated ability to think strategically in an independent manner and out of the box versus accepting the status quo.Technical Skills: Strong technical skills in all Microsoft Office Applications is required with advanced proficiency in Access and Excel preferred. Experience with reporting/analytic applications is preferred with knowledge of SAS programming a plus.EDUCATION The highest level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. FUNCTIONAL EXPERIENCES Functional - Information Management/Medical economics/7-10 Years  Functional - Finance/Financial analysis/7-10 Years  Functional - Finance/Financial reporting and analysis/7-10 Years TECHNOLOGY EXPERIENCES Technical - Database/Microsoft Access/7-10 Years/Power User  Technical - Desktop Tools/Microsoft PowerPoint/7-10 Years/Power User  Technical - Reporting Tools/SAS/4-6 Years/End User REQUIRED SKILLS General Business/Communicating for Impact/MASTERY  General Business/Consulting for Solutions/ADVANCED ADDITIONAL JOB INFORMATION Aetna is about more than just doing a job. This is our opportunity to re-shape healthcare for America and across the globe. We are developing solutions to improve the quality and affordability of healthcare. What we do will benefit generations to come.  We care about each other, our customers and our communities. We are inspired to make a difference, and we are committed to integrity and excellence.  Together we will empower people to live healthier lives.  Aetna is an equal opportunity & affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of personal characteristics or status. We take affirmative action to recruit, select and develop women, people of color, veterans and individuals with disabilities.  We are a company built on excellence. We have a culture that values growth, achievement and diversity and a workplace where your voice can be heard.  Benefit eligibility may vary by position. Click here to review the benefits associated with this position.  Aetna takes our candidates's data privacy seriously. At no time will any Aetna recruiter or employee request any financial or personal information (Social Security Number, Credit card information for direct deposit, etc.) from you via e-mail. Any requests for information will be discussed prior and will be conducted through a secure website provided by the recruiter. Should you be asked for such information, please notify us immediately.Req#54535BRJob Group Management Full or Part Time Full Time Supervisory No Percent of Travel Required10 - 25%Posting Job Title Sr Consultant - Client facing analytics Potential Telework Position Yes Additional Locations TX-Dallas Primary Location TX-Dallas EEO Statement Aetna is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer Resource Group2

Name: Business Data Analyst - II
Description: Job DescriptionDescription:Responsibilities: Excellent leadership and communication skills, to influence and lead teams and to evangelize data science across the organization  Proven leadership experience in the domain of Data Science and Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence  Having a wide-latitude in determining objectives and approaches to solution development on mission critical assignments  Going beyond established analytical thinking and problem-solving by applying creativity to unconventional concepts and out-of-the-box solutions  Be part of a dynamic and cohesive team of highly trained and successful researchers  Independence in the shaping and development of projects  Ability to quickly understand patterns within large quantity of data and to reference key characteristics using visualization techniques and tools like Tableau  Demonstrating strong programming skills in large-scale data analysis using Java, R, Python or related software  Leveraging strong math skills and statistical knowledge to advanced data mining and data analysis activities related to next generation Cloud technologies  As an insight incubator, works autonomously or leads teams to generate or shape new and highly critical business propositions that exploit and monetize big data research  Provides consultative guidance across Intuit's businesses on how best to utilize data for business decision-making, and to build the organization mind-set and capabilities needed to fully exploit this data as an asset  Works with business planners to propose innovative products and services that fully utilize the power of big data, or that indicate the need for new data platforms and associated product/service functionality  Sets self-initiated research objectives and exercises a wide latitude of discretionary judgment in exploring advances in artificial intelligence and applying innovative machine learning techniques to Intuit's data capturing and mining business strategy  Collaborates with infrastructure teams Qualifications MS in Engineering Mathematics, Statistics, Theoretical/Computational Physics, or related field  Solid knowledge of statistical techniques is required  3 years as either a lead in a data science role or in a management position in data science  Strong communication skills and proven experience as an influencer at executive level  Hands-on programming experience with one or more of the following: Java, Python, R, or related languages  5+ years experience manipulating large datasets and using databases (e.g. SAS, R, SQL, S-Plus, etc.)  1-3+ years experience with a general-purpose programming language (e.g. C, Java, Python, etc.)  Familiarity with basic principles of distributed computing and/or distributed databases (Hadoop, NoSQL, etc.)  Demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts-all the way down to the theoremsand to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues Strongly Preferred: PhD in Engineering Mathematics, Statistics, Theoretical/Computational Physics, or related field  Proven experience with Machine Learning techniques, especially on large scale datasets  Proven experience with Hadoop and related programming environments (Hive,Pig,etc)  Demonstrable skills in creative-problem-solving of complex and advanced technical subject matter  Strong interpersonal and communication skills in order to effectively contribute to technical teams and make presentations to a variety of technical and business personnel

Name: Statistics Analyst I
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas believes in the diversity of our people, ideas and experiences, and we are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve. ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY As part of the nation's central bank, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is committed to strengthening the economy and our communities. At the Fed, you have the opportunity to become part of an important public service institution whose work touches lives across the globe. It's a big job and that's why we need talented, results-driven professionals who care about making a difference. JOB DESCRIPTION The Bank's Statistics Department currently has an opening for a Statistics Analyst I. The Statistics Analyst will be responsible for accurate and timely analysis and delivery of financial and structure data for a panel of less complex financial institutions using established procedures and working under direct supervision. The analyst ensures accuracy and integrity of reported data and information in accordance with established guidelines, policies, and procedures. The Statistics Analyst will also use business software and analytical systems, review data reports, charts, and graphs that are used in the analysis of report data for less complex analysis.  The analyst will also work with a team lead and/or more senior analysts to resolve quality assurance related problems, respond to questions on reporting requirements, and clearly communicate conclusions, analytical findings, and value-added information to peers, management, Board of Governors staff, and other stakeholders. This analyst will also need to consistently contribute with value-added analyses in a clear and well thought-out manner. The level of work is considered introductory and under direct supervision. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Effective application with guidance of basic quality assurance, extended analysis, and associated contextual information for monetary/economic policy and structure/regulatory reports data ensuring timely delivery of fit for use data to the Board of Governors, FRB New York and other data owners. With team lead guidance, learn the process of reviewing and commenting on proposed changes to reports technical memoranda in a timely manner. Based on their review, analyst is expected to raise issues they have identified which could have general operating or quality assurance implications for Reserve Banks or financial institutions. Learn to consistently leverage basic business software and analysis skills to support data analytics and related processes used in analysis, quality assurance, and testing. As they progress, analyst will have responsibility to incorporate automation tools into daily analysis including the interpretation of reports, data grids, graphs, and charts related to the basic data review processes. Active learning and participation in local and system testing initiatives that reflect an understanding of the underlying data collection and workflows. In support of quality assurance, effectively translate report changes to targeted systems to execute assigned testing scenarios and project plans. Active participation in team and department level projects that provide collective benefits.KEY COMPETENCIES Functional Knowledge: Requires conceptual knowledge of theories, practices and procedures within a discipline Business Expertise: Applies general knowledge of business developed through education or past experience Leadership: No supervisory responsibilities; accountable for developing technical contribution Problem Solving: Uses existing procedures to solve standard problems; analyzes information and standard practices to make judgments Impact: Has limited impact on own work team; works within standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines Interpersonal Skills: Exchanges straightforward information, asks questions and checks for understandingEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE BS/BA degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or other similar program, or equivalent work experience in a related field such as banking, accounting, audit, etc. Proficient in the use of; SAS, SQL, R, or other related software a plus Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate clearly, correctly, and concisely; adjusts communication style to fit a variety of people and situations; tailors the tone and content of communications to fit the audience Professional skills; analytical project skills; knowledge of bank operations including data analysis and general regulatory knowledge preferred Basic accounting principles and financial industry knowledge; ability to read and understand financial statements; data analysis skills; familiarity with related ratio analysis preferred Equivalent education and / or experience may be substitutedWork Hours and conditions: Monday - Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; flexibility / additional hours may be required based on business needs; some travel may be required, up to 5% Notes: By federal law, this position requires that candidates fall within one of the following citizenship categories: (1) U.S. citizen, (2) U.S. national, (3) U.S. permanent residents who are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization, or (4) U.S. permanent residents who have applied for naturalization within six months of being eligible to do so.  This position may be filled at various levels based on knowledge, skills abilities and education.  Assessments may be required as part of the interview process.  The candidate selected for this position may be included in the Bank's Leadership Development Program (LDP) if eligibility requirements are met. The LDP is two-years in length and provides accelerated learning and development for early career professionals. To be eligible for the LDP, selected candidates must have at least a 3.5 GPA, up to two years of professional work experience and have approval of their management. To learn more about the LDP, please visit KNECT. https://www.dallasfed.org/careers/ldp.aspx  We are Proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Business Analyst - Accenture Technology
Description: Job descriptionReady to fast-track your Salesforce career?Join the largest team of Salesforce certified professionals in the industry and champion innovation, leverage deep and cutting-edge Salesforce expertise and pioneer solutions to help transform the world’s leading organizations and governments.Ready to solve complex problems? Advance your skills? Deliver next-generation Salesforce solutions?Now is the perfect time for you to join the Accenture Salesforce team, where you’ll:Expand your experience with over 200 intelligent tools across all 12 Salesforce-recognized industries.Lead in the development and implementation of new Salesforce-based solutions.Benefit from our long-standing partnership with Salesforce to access the coolest Salesforce technologies, like Lightning, Einstein and Bolt, so you can put them to meaningful applications at scale.Join more than 11,800 skilled Salesforce professionals, collaborating across multiple areas to drive enterprise-wide transformational projects on a global scale.Build new skills and strengthen your expertise with unparalleled training and support—whether you're taking the more than 4,200 unique Salesforce certifications or working towards your Certified Technical Architect (CTA) certification.Join Accenture and be empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community.Job DescriptionThe Accenture Technology - Salesforce team is seeking a Marketing Cloud Business & Systems Integration Consultant to design, implement and deploy Salesforce.com Marketing Cloud solutions to a wide variety of clients at the enterprise level. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in marketing and Salesforce.com application. Additionally, the candidate should have the ability to uncover business requirements, develop a technical strategy and be able to create and effectively demonstrate solutions that address customer requirements. Business and Systems Integration professionals analyze, design and/or develop best practice business changes through technology solutions.We can hire for this role anywhere in the US, as long as you are located near an Accenture office, and willing and able to travel domestically approximately 80% of the time to meet client needs.Typical day snapshot - Marketing Cloud Integration ConsultantNew challenges and opportunities arise every day, and Consultant’s roles will vary based on the projects where they are engaged. The work is truly exciting and interesting and will require our Consultants to:Meet with clients to analyze their work practices and understand the nature of their businesses to properly define needs and customize marketing solutions using the Force.com platform.Lead the development of a strategic vision for project (product development, enhancements, etc) and embrace the criticality of gaining its adoption.Make recommendations based on this analysis – estimate work effort, lead project scoping (as the sole or primary Cloud First representative), determine required resources, set a realistic schedule, and build proper communication and governance plans (Project Management 101, if you will).Maintain effective client relations and rapport - delivering timely and relevant information with the utmost concern for stakeholder and project impact.+ Basic qualificationsBasic QualificationsA minimum of 6 months experience with Salesforce Market Cloud (formerly ExactTarget)A minimum of 6 months customer relationship management experience (service, marketing and/or sales).Preferred SkillsMinimum of 2 years of campaign management experience using cloud technology (e.g., Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot) or on-premise technology (e.g., IBM, Teradata, Adobe).Previous technology consulting work experience.Minimum of 2 years designing marketing solutions (e.g., capability assessment, requirements gathering, experience design, process reengineering).Minimum of 2 years of Salesforce.com implementation experience.Salesforce.com certifications (Admin, Sales and Service Cloud Consultant) helpful.Bachelor's Degree preferred.Professional Skill RequirementsProven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environmentProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentDesire to work in an information systems environmentExcellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skillsExcellent leadership and management skillsApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: projekt202 is the leader in experience-driven software strategy, design and development. We have spent over 15 years refining our unique methodology that combines deep user insight with collaborative design and development. As a result, our team creates better, more meaningful user experiences and innovative software for the worlds greatest brands, including Capital One, Mercedes-Benz Financial Services, Dell, The Container Store, Neiman Marcus, and many more. Our work is recognized by top industry analysts, including the experts at Gartner, who stated, The perspective and processes projekt202 is focusing on and perfecting will, over time, become standard operating procedure for any application development project.Our team is passionate about user-centric design and development. We enjoy working together to share our expertise and solve our clients business challenges. At projekt202, we also have fun and enjoy hanging out with each other in a culture that supports and celebrates our diverse talents, backgrounds and skills.We are seeking a Financial Analyst to provide proactive support and analysis to help us manage our financials.Must be a self-starter with ability to influence decisions through financial analysis and work across teams and units to deliver.Responsibilities:Monthly Actual vs Forecast analysis for Revenue and Expenses, Staff and ProfitabilityFacilitate and support yearly Annual Operations Plan (AOP) Running inter-systems financials reconciliationsSupport billing projects and revenue managementLead improvements in our Financial systems and processesOther ad-hock analytical workRequirements:B.S. in finance, accounting, business or equivalent.Technology industry experience preferred.Minimum of 2 years (more preferred) FP&A or financial analysis experience.Strong Excel experience required (pivots, look-ups, macros, etc.) to develop sophisticated business models.Ability to work in an extremely fast-paced environment with rapidly changing business priorities.Strong quantitative and analytical skills combined with business and financial acumen.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Comfortable working as part of a small team.For more information please visit www.projekt202.com to hear from our leadership team on why you should join us on this amazing journey!Direct applicants only, no agency submittals please.At this time, projekt202 does not provide sponsorship.

Name: BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Job Title:Business/Operational AnalystDepartment:FinanceCompany:Dimension DevelopmentReports To:Assistant CFOSupervises: N/AJob Description Date:January 1, 2016Job Purpose: Thoroughly analyzes financial and operational key performance metrics and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders.Job Responsibilities: 1.Use proprietary software (Dimension Development Hotel Accounting Program) as well as external sources to identify, generate, gather, verify, review, research, analyze, comprehend, interpret, and report on key performance indicators and financial information.2.Analyze variances and data trends and prepare reports, charts and other outputs as required. To convert information into insightful findings and actionable recommendations to optimize existing and future operations across the company.3.Provide high-quality recurring and ad-hoc performance reports to assist senior management with operational decisions, as required.4.Assist the Assistant CFO with the development and maintenance of various analytical models.5.Prepare a monthly reporting package that includes financial, operational, competitive, and customer satisfaction metrics. To analyze key business trends.6.Work closely with all regional and property leaders to identify areas of improvement. To support and contribute expertise to projects relating to the achievement of property financial, guest service, and operational goals.7.Assist hotel leadership with the actual implementation of new processes.8.Assist with the preparation of annual budgets. To consolidate budget data from business unit leaders, evaluate data received and follow up directly with budget holders as appropriate. Ensure that all budgets are accurate, comprehensive and completed on time.9.Serve as a super user of business intelligence tools (such as Broadvine and MicroStrategy) in the creation of dashboards and reports.10.Research and evaluate different analysis tools, business intelligence tools, and modeling techniques to identify possible opportunities for process improvement.11.Other duties as assigned.Job Skills:1.Track record of problem solving complex issues and continuous process improvement skills.2.Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required, and will be tested, including pivot tables and advanced formulas. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.3.To maintain a thorough understanding of financial and operational metrics across the industry.4.Ability to work proactively, independently and as a strategic partner in a cross-functional team environment. To establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow team members, management, external contacts, guests, and the public. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict/resolution.5.Demonstrated strong analytical skills. To define and analyze problems and identify root causes. To set challenging and productive goals; prioritizing tasks, accepting responsibility, and overcoming obstacles.6.To work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities within a broad team of cross-regional and cross-functional members. To perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with frequent interruptions and distractions. To adapt to frequent changes in the workload and be able to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established timeframes.7.To thrive in an environment that is both strategic and creative, and which requires rapid learning, multitasking and prioritizing under tight deadlines 8.To remain highly-driven and self-motivated. To remain positive, productive, and professional in high stress situations.9.To maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail at all times. To be well-organized and detail-oriented in order to manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and expectations simultaneously.10.To sustain a high level of confidentiality.11.To demonstrate partnering, influencing, and communication skills at all levels of the organization. 12.To maintain excellent written and verbal communication and comprehension skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex analytical topics to a wide audience who may or may not be familiar with analytics or the subject matter.Job Qualifications: Describe the minimum qualifications needed to complete the job responsibilities.EducationBachelor's Degree in a business or hospitality field, or equivalent work experience. Advanced degrees or certifications are preferred.ExperienceOne year experience in the job offered or two year's experience in a business intelligence or similar analytical capacity or related role. Hospitality/Entertainment Industry experience is preferred.

Relevant major’s preferred (Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Information Technology.)

The analyst will also work with a team lead and/or more senior analysts to resolve quality assurance related problems, respond to questions on reporting requirements, and clearly communicate conclusions, analytical findings, and value-added information to peers, management, Board of Governors staff, and other stakeholders. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Effective application with guidance of basic quality assurance, extended analysis, and associated contextual information for monetary/economic policy and structure/regulatory reports data ensuring timely delivery of fit for use data to the Board of Governors, FRB New York and other data owners. With team lead guidance, learn the process of reviewing and commenting on proposed changes to reports technical memoranda in a timely manner. Based on their review, analyst is expected to raise issues they have identified which could have general operating or quality assurance implications for Reserve Banks or financial institutions. Learn to consistently leverage basic business software and analysis skills to support data analytics and related processes used in analysis, quality assurance, and testing. As they progress, analyst will have responsibility to incorporate automation tools into daily analysis including the interpretation of reports, data grids, graphs, and charts related to the basic data review processes. Active learning and participation in local and system testing initiatives that reflect an understanding of the underlying data collection and workflows. In support of quality assurance, effectively translate report changes to targeted systems to execute assigned testing scenarios and project plans. Active participation in team and department level projects that provide collective benefits.KEY COMPETENCIES Functional Knowledge: Requires conceptual knowledge of theories, practices and procedures within a discipline Business Expertise: Applies general knowledge of business developed through education or past experience Leadership: No supervisory responsibilities; accountable for developing technical contribution Problem Solving: Uses existing procedures to solve standard problems; analyzes information and standard practices to make judgments Impact: Has limited impact on own work team; works within standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines Interpersonal Skills: Exchanges straightforward information, asks questions and checks for understandingEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE BS/BA degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or other similar program, or equivalent work experience in a related field such as banking, accounting, audit, etc. Proficient in the use of; SAS, SQL, R, or other related software a plus Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate clearly, correctly, and concisely; adjusts communication style to fit a variety of people and situations; tailors the tone and content of communications to fit the audience Professional skills; analytical project skills; knowledge of bank operations including data analysis and general regulatory knowledge preferred Basic accounting principles and financial industry knowledge; ability to read and understand financial statements; data analysis skills; familiarity with related ratio analysis preferred Equivalent education and / or experience may be substitutedWork Hours and conditions: Monday - Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; flexibility / additional hours may be required based on business needs; some travel may be required, up to 5% Notes: By federal law, this position requires that candidates fall within one of the following citizenship categories: (1) U.S. citizen, (2) U.S. national, (3) U.S. permanent residents who are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization, or (4) U.S. permanent residents who have applied for naturalization within six months of being eligible to do so.  This position may be filled at various levels based on knowledge, skills abilities and education.  Assessments may be required as part of the interview process.  The candidate selected for this position may be included in the Bank's Leadership Development Program (LDP) if eligibility requirements are met. The LDP is two-years in length and provides accelerated learning and development for early career professionals. To be eligible for the LDP, selected candidates must have at least a 3.5 GPA, up to two years of professional work experience and have approval of their management. To learn more about the LDP, please visit KNECT. https://www.dallasfed.org/careers/ldp.aspx  We are Proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: U.S. Anesthesia Partners (USAP) is the largest single-specialty anesthesia practice in the country with over 4,000 clinical providers and associates. By joining our team you will participate in a highly collaborative and dynamic environment. As an organization we are mission focused on delivering the highest quality in patient care and you will be directly supporting our talented clinical team. We extend this same commitment to quality to our associates and supply tools and resources that will ensure we win in the healthcare marketplace and support of USAP.  We are proud of our inclusive people culture that supports our associates to perform at their best. USAP is an equal opportunity employer. Candidates with physician services or related health care experience is a plus. We offer a competitive benefits package.  The HRIS Analyst is an intermediate position within the HRIS structure. The primary focus of this position is the support and maintenance of the Human Resource Information System (HRIS) in addition to other systems supported by the HRIS function. The HRIS Analyst is responsible for the daily support and maintenance of Human Resources Information Systems, the implementation of new systems, the improvement of HR-related processes and the development of Human Resources related reports. The HRIS Analyst assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities relating to payroll, time off, employee records, benefits, and more. The HRIS Analyst also supports HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned. Duties involve independent judgment and discretion on issues that may be sensitive or confidential in nature. Name: Financial Analyst II
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas believes in the diversity of our people, ideas and experiences, and we are committed to building an inclusive culture that represents the communities we serve.ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY:As part of the nation’s central bank, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is committed to strengthening the economy and our communities. At the Fed, you have the opportunity to become part of an important public service institution whose work touches lives across the globe. It’s a big job and that’s why we need talented, results-driven professionals who care about making a difference.POSITION SUMMARY:Currently we have an opening in our Financial Management department for a Financial Analyst II located in Dallas, TX. The Financial Analyst is responsible for analyzing financial status by collecting, monitoring and studying data to assist management in planning, reporting and forecasting financial information.RESPONSIBILITIES:Applies more advanced financial analysis and/or cost accounting principles, practices, and techniques to record, compile, distribute, and analyze cost data; prepare operating budgets; and perform financial analysis to support strategic decision making and/or reduce costsProvides consultation and training to departments on budget and cost accounting related mattersAssists in preparation of more advanced analysis and variance reports, tables, charts, and graphs; gathers data, identifies variables, prepares/tests mathematical models, and determines / prioritizes viable solutions.Solves a range of straightforward problems. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction.Provides analytical support for moderately complex projects, developing budget/cost accounting/financial analysis methods and procedures.Utilize computer systems to perform assigned tasks including designing and troubleshooting standard and advanced reports Assists other cost/budget analysts and coordinates more advanced cost/budget matters with other departmentsAnalyzes budget and cost accounting performance, and prepares reports and recommendations to managementGenerates forecasts and analyzes trends in budget, cost accounting and other areas of business Researches trends and performance to assist the organization`s financial planningCreates financial models of "what if" scenarios for future business planning decisions in areas such as capital, facilities projects, software development, etc.COMPETENCIES:Functional Knowledge: Requires expanded conceptual knowledge in own discipline and broadens capabilities.Expertise: Understands key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work.Leadership: No supervisory responsibilities but provides informal guidance to new team members.Problem Solving: Solves problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using technical experience and judgment and precedents.Impact: Impacts quality of own work and the work of others on the team; works within guidelines and policies.Interpersonal Skills: Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting (with emphasis on cost), Operations Research/Analysis, Business Administration or other related field2-5 years professional experience in a financial planning, cost accounting, or operations research environmentSkilled in organization, meeting deadlines, accuracy, team player, customer focus, influencing others, independence, initiative, perseverance, presentation, decision making.Proficient utilizing Outlook, Excel (pivot tables), Lawson, and AribaKnowledge and experience in own discipline; Name: Sr. Business Analyst -SAP Order to Cash
Description: Title: Sr. Business Analyst - Invoicing System Implementation Terms: 6+ Month Contract (Extensions are likely this could be multi-year contract role) Location: Dallas, TX Summary: Seeking a Senior IT Business Analyst to work on an implementation of a new Invoicing platform (SAP Order to Cash O2C). Large enterprise project that involves interfacing with cross-functional teams across the organization. Candidates need 8+ years of experience as a BA and have experience on Invoicing system projects, with a preference for SAP. Position Overview: The Senior IT BA is an experienced member of the Application Development Group who demonstrates depth and breadth of business analysis process, techniques and methodologies. Contributes to application design by defining needs and recommending solutions that will maximize the value delivered by the system to stakeholders. Determines how the project they are assigned to impacts other projects or business areas. Ensures that their project meets the strategic goals/initiatives of the organization. Influence, persuade, and lead other team members and stakeholders to achieve project goals and objectives. Responsibilities: Leads and facilitates interviews and cross-functional working sessions with Product Owner and other business stakeholders to elicit and clearly define requirements. Develop partnerships with stakeholders. Be an advocate and trusted advisor for stakeholder groups. Embrace responsibility for understanding, prioritizing, & defining continuous improvement requests Convert business requirements into functional and software/technical requirements Capture non-functional and other system requirements Develop detailed knowledge/expertise in applications assigned. Will analyze system integration impacts and define integration requirements Collaborate with developers to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs Review detailed requirements with project manager/technical lead to ensure adherence to scope and level of effort estimations Estimate requirements gathering level of effort, develop business analysis work plans, and ensure BA deliverables quality and timeliness Coordinate with Quality Assurance (QA) and the development team to ensure requirements are understood Participate and/or coordinate required testing/validation of system fixes, which may include creating the actual test cases or reviewing test cases created by QA Support User Acceptance Testing Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner; escalate and retain ownership of all open/unresolved issues Provide leadership and mentoring to junior team members Required Skills/Experience: 10+ years of relevant Business Analysis experience Experience on Invoicing system projects; SAP Order to Cash preferred Extensive experience working with multiple business stakeholders and ability to understand how business process drives technology needs Experience with large, complex projects Ability to elicit comprehensive business, functional and technical requirements Extensive experience creating user stories in addition to workflows, dataflows, and process flows Experience creating system flows and system integration diagrams Experience creating data dictionaries Recent experience working within an Agile methodology required Experience facilitating and leading discovery workshops for large projects Experience with VSTS (A plus) or requirements management tool Preferred Skills/Experience: Experience with SAP Invoicing software implementations - provided by Dicebusiness analyst, SAP, Order to Cash, O2C, OTC, requirements gathering, user stories, agile, process flows, dataflows, sdlc, data flow

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: We want to hear from you, if you're a Financial Analyst with effective communication skills. If you enjoy working as part of a team, this position is right for you. If you're looking for Financial Analyst work, this thriving company is seeking skilled candidates through Robert Half Finance. This role's primary duties will consist of implementing financial modeling on various financial products as well as measure, analyze, and forecast performance in conjunction with operating plans. Other important responsibilities will consist of advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management. If the idea of interacting with team members as a crucial business partner in areas such as forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management excites you, contact Robert Half Finance today. Located in the Dallas, Texas, this Financial Analyst role is a full-time employment opportunity.  For more information contact Amanda.Leone@roberthalf.com or 214.855.5070.  https://www.linkedin.com/in/amanda-leone-71078365/  Your responsibilities  ? Analyze performance to date and assess potential risks and opportunities  ? Work alongside cross-functional partners in Accounting and Operations to ensure plans are properly executed  ? Drive monthly reporting to business partners on financial results and actions required  ? Work alongside senior executives on strategic deep dives to create financial models and insights on topics such as: Retention forecasts, event tracking and execution, Campaign Planning Tracking, return on investment of strategic investments, and strategic resource allocation, and prioritization  ? Possess the know-how and be able to explain internal and external drivers impacting performance and trending  ? Track of monthly and quarterly performance by comparing actuals versus expectations to ensure business partners handle their resources r  ? Flexible individuals comfortable with large amounts of information, and adept at managing expectations  ? Deliver valuable foresight and decision support by enabling effective Business Intelligence (BI)  ? Edit and manage forecasting reports  ? Drive P and L forecasting and Area/Segment level Bookings on a weekly, quarterly and annual basis  ? Work closely with Accounting on the monthly and quarterly financial close processes

Name: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Business Analyst - Accenture Technology
Description: Job descriptionReady to fast-track your Salesforce career?Join the largest team of Salesforce certified professionals in the industry and champion innovation, leverage deep and cutting-edge Salesforce expertise and pioneer solutions to help transform the world’s leading organizations and governments.Ready to solve complex problems? Advance your skills? Deliver next-generation Salesforce solutions?Now is the perfect time for you to join the Accenture Salesforce team, where you’ll:Expand your experience with over 200 intelligent tools across all 12 Salesforce-recognized industries.Lead in the development and implementation of new Salesforce-based solutions.Benefit from our long-standing partnership with Salesforce to access the coolest Salesforce technologies, like Lightning, Einstein and Bolt, so you can put them to meaningful applications at scale.Join more than 11,800 skilled Salesforce professionals, collaborating across multiple areas to drive enterprise-wide transformational projects on a global scale.Build new skills and strengthen your expertise with unparalleled training and support—whether you're taking the more than 4,200 unique Salesforce certifications or working towards your Certified Technical Architect (CTA) certification.Join Accenture and be empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community.Job DescriptionThe Accenture Technology - Salesforce team is seeking a Marketing Cloud Business & Systems Integration Consultant to design, implement and deploy Salesforce.com Marketing Cloud solutions to a wide variety of clients at the enterprise level. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in marketing and Salesforce.com application. Additionally, the candidate should have the ability to uncover business requirements, develop a technical strategy and be able to create and effectively demonstrate solutions that address customer requirements. Business and Systems Integration professionals analyze, design and/or develop best practice business changes through technology solutions.We can hire for this role anywhere in the US, as long as you are located near an Accenture office, and willing and able to travel domestically approximately 80% of the time to meet client needs.Typical day snapshot - Marketing Cloud Integration ConsultantNew challenges and opportunities arise every day, and Consultant’s roles will vary based on the projects where they are engaged. The work is truly exciting and interesting and will require our Consultants to:Meet with clients to analyze their work practices and understand the nature of their businesses to properly define needs and customize marketing solutions using the Force.com platform.Lead the development of a strategic vision for project (product development, enhancements, etc) and embrace the criticality of gaining its adoption.Make recommendations based on this analysis – estimate work effort, lead project scoping (as the sole or primary Cloud First representative), determine required resources, set a realistic schedule, and build proper communication and governance plans (Project Management 101, if you will).Maintain effective client relations and rapport - delivering timely and relevant information with the utmost concern for stakeholder and project impact.+ Basic qualificationsBasic QualificationsA minimum of 6 months experience with Salesforce Market Cloud (formerly ExactTarget)A minimum of 6 months customer relationship management experience (service, marketing and/or sales).Preferred SkillsMinimum of 2 years of campaign management experience using cloud technology (e.g., Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot) or on-premise technology (e.g., IBM, Teradata, Adobe).Previous technology consulting work experience.Minimum of 2 years designing marketing solutions (e.g., capability assessment, requirements gathering, experience design, process reengineering).Minimum of 2 years of Salesforce.com implementation experience.Salesforce.com certifications (Admin, Sales and Service Cloud Consultant) helpful.Bachelor's Degree preferred.Professional Skill RequirementsProven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environmentProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentDesire to work in an information systems environmentExcellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skillsExcellent leadership and management skillsApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. Name: Senior Business Analyst- Resiliency
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co, youre not just working at a global financial institution. Youre an integral part of one of the worlds largest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of over 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from traditional enterprise technology to microservices to big data and mobile solutions. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to leverage and create state-of-the-art technology solutions. Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, youll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. Youll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where youand the products you deliverwill thriveYou will be joining an elite team that is responsible for designing, building and managing two entire datacenter footprints specifically for the purpose of enabling the entire firm to implement and test state-of-the-art infrastructure and application resiliency capabilities. To support this program, we are building out two full datacenter footprints and then layering on top an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) platform, a Cloud Foundry based Platform as a Service (PaaS) solution and eventually a Kubernetes based Container as a Service platform. We are also designing and implementing a process and automation strategy for onboarding, testing and decommissioning entire application infrastructures.The GTI Technology Strategy and Architecture Solutions team is seeking a Business Analyst Lead/Scrum Master to join our team. You will be responsible for defining processes, creating business requirements for functionality releases, grooming stories in the backlog, managing Scrum ceremonies, and designing efficient metrics and reporting. The Business Analyst will work closely with our resiliency leads, Line of Business Solutions Architects, and all GTI Towers to define process, tooling, roadmaps and reporting.Soft skills/attributes required for this role:Takes accountability for a major initiative and can run it using program management techniquesCredible and mature personality, with some presenceConcise communicator - able to translate detail into a concise story, getting immediately to the punch lineSelf-starter, motivated - wants to get in, roll sleeves up and make a differenceEffective influencing skills, with diverse groupsWants to be a change agent, make improvements - Thrives on changePays close attention to detailHas excellent analytical and decision making skillsHard Skills / Requirements:Degree in a technical discipline or similar experienceExcellent Metrics and Reporting SkillsExperience with Agile methodologies including use of Jira and ConfluenceBroad base technical knowledge coveringProven experience managing and working with culturally diverse and geographically distributed teamsExperience working through an application lifecycle from start to finish including Agile development methodologiesExperience troubleshooting a project gone wrong and working to fix it, adjusting to major scope/design changeExperience working within large global organization and building and maintaining a global network financial industry experience desiredDemonstrated ability establishing credibility with business executives, along with presenting to and influencing senior managementEffective Project and Program Management skillsKey Differentiators for Ideal candidate:Multi-Year Experience as a Business AnalystProven record in successful process and tools implementationStrong experience in process management and change

It means we seek out the best of the best, and then we challenge them to make us better.  If you are looking to be a "behind the scenes" technologist, this isn't the place for you. Name: FP&A Analyst
Description: The Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Analyst will be an integral part of the finance and accounting team and report to the VP Finance, Chief Accounting Officer. The FP&A Analyst will assist with the preparation of internal/external financial reports, Board of Directors materials, monthly financial analysis materials, and provide ad hoc analysis for the organization. The analyst will have the opportunity to regularly interface with the executive management team, including the CFO. Job Duties & Responsibilities: Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, cost of revenue, expenses and capital expenditures  Monitor performance indicators, highlight trends, analyze causes of variances, and make recommendations for improvement  Drive the continued development of Budgeting, Financial Forecasting, Operating Plan and Modeling tools  Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts  Ad-Hoc Reporting and Analysis  Quarterly and Monthly Financial reports  Evaluate, implement and work with a Business Intelligence Tool and Dashboard reports  Develop financial models and analyses to support strategic initiatives  Analyze complex financial information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for decision making purposes  Supporting Senior Management Team and Departments heads with in-depth analysis  Prepare presentations to Board of Directors and Senior Management Team Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Solid understanding of accounting and finance principles  Superior analytical skills  Strong written and oral communication skills  Strong business partnering and interpersonal skills  Organized, flexible and easily adaptable to changing conditions  Ability to work well in high pressure situations in order to meet deadlines  High degree of proficiency with Excel, MS Access and PowerPoint  Ability to multi-task and manage numerous simultaneous priorities  High energy, high ownership of work product and dedication and commitment to driving results Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance; MBA/MS preferred  3 5 years work experience, with 2+ years in corporate accounting or finance role  Public accounting experience a plus  Demonstrated success in financial modeling and analysis  Experience with financial planning and analysis functions, including annual budget, capital budgeting, long-term strategic planning

Name: Sr. Business Analyst with Project Management Experience
Description: InfoTech Resources is seeking a Sr. Business Analyst with Project Manager experience for a 6-month contract position with our client in Dallas. The BA/PM will be responsible for defining business systems’ scope, requirements, and related documentation as part of large-scale efforts to develop or modify complex information systems. Applicants with expertise in design and implementation of system enhancements will be particularly suitable. Acts as a SME and supports train-the-trainer and other learning activities with internal business groups• Develops thorough knowledge of customer segments and needs as well as understanding of product features and functionality• Supports applications in production and ongoing upgrades and improvements.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSKnowledge, Skills, and Abilities:• 8+ years of relevant information technology and business analysis experience• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required, including an understanding of how to interpret customer requests and translate them into application and operational requirements• Strong technical skills with the ability to learn new applications quickly• Familiarity with .NET applications, enterprise application integration, n-tier architecture• Experience in managing simultaneous complex tasks from inception to successful completion• Experience in real estate Industry a plusEducational Level /Certifications• Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field• Six Sigma certification is a plus - provided by DiceBusiness analysis, Project management, PMP, CBAP, requirements gathering, prototyping, wireframes, Agile Scrum

Name: Commercial/Corporate Credit Analyst
Description: Tasks: Analysis will identify the key strengths and weaknesses of that debtor. May also include an evaluation of the borrower’s industry and the borrower’s position within their respective industry.Effectively partners with credit platform to improve efficiencies of operation, minimize risk, and expand sales opportunities.Evaluates financial statements and concludes independent written credit evaluations.Analysis will comprise of a wide-ranging evaluation of the business and will be used by supervision in approving credit requests. Analysis should sufficiently summarize the important aspects of the business including a detailed financial analysis, management competencies, collateral evaluation, and guarantor support.Offers commendations for monitoring relative to risk and policy, including revision to existing covenants.Offers endorsements regarding credit risk rating of commercial accounts and assesses collateral quality and values.Provides recommendations to loan officers regarding credit structure and policy compliance.Works closely with Commercial and/or Corporate Lenders/Relationship mnagers and may accompany them on client visits.Completes the annual servicing of existing relationships as allocated.Communicates completion dates with sales and credit partners, and works to meet agreed upon deadlines. Corporate Credit Analyst opportunity:  Safeguards that loans are underwritten to comply with policy and are also suitably moderated. Incumbent applies knowledge of commercial lending principles to all duties performed. Works under limited supervision and in compliance with established policies, procedures and banking regulations.  Is responsible for providing an independent and fully inclusive written evaluation of selected commercial loans. Collaborates carefully with commercial loan officers and other employees to recognize and manage risk on commercial loans up to the bank’s legal lending limit. The analysis will achieve in supporting the approval or denial of a loan request and endorsements on structure and risk rating.     Requirements: Position Requirements: Eight or more years banking experience with emphasis on financial analysis and/or commercial lendingFamiliarity with fundamental principles of SAS, SQL or other query and analytics software is strongly preferred.Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business or Finance and/or equivalent experienceAdvanced written and analytical skills to include a capacity to analyze balance sheet structure, and income and cash flow trends on credits up to the legal lending limit of the bank. Experience documenting actions for execution of structured queries and reporting code.Extensive exposure to commercial credit and lending concepts, practices and regulations.PC proficiency with Word and Excel, including the use of system and user generated formulas, macros, charts, and tables.Experienced with financial statement spreading, including proficiency in preparing pro-forma statements within Moody’s or other software package. Ability to research industry sources needed for credit evaluations.Practice developing and executing queries and/or reporting for large data setsStrong organization skills with the ability to self-manage time and priorities to meet deadlines.

Name: Graduates - Future Leaders Program Analyst
Description: Graduates - Future Leaders Program Analyst Dallas - LBJ Freeway Intake Year: 2019 Sectors: Research and Analysis, Product Management About IHS Markit Named 'Most Influential Tech Analyst Firm in 2018', IHS Markit are at the forefront of the digital and technological revolution. At IHS Markit, we deliver impactful, real-world analytics and intelligence for industries and markets all around the world in everything from finance to aerospace. The products, services and information we provide will uncover more intelligent solutions to today's most critical business challenges. IHS Markit is a global leader in information, analytics and solutions for the major industries and markets that drive economies worldwide. We partner with clients in business, finance and government to help them see the big picture with unrivalled insights that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. The role Understanding the latest trends and leveraging sharp analytical skills and specialized industry expertise, our analysts deliver the data rich insights that guide our clients in long term decision making. If you are passionate about building the story behind the data, and becoming an industry or product specialist, then the Analyst stream is for you. Opportunities within this stream include: * Research and Analysis * Product Management On our Future Leaders Program, you will join a team of industry experts who will work with you to accelerate your development. We take a holistic approach to your learning, and with world-leading development opportunities at its core, we'll help you focus on building the skills you'll need to achieve your goals. What we're looking for We seek candidates with diverse backgrounds and ideas with a desire to learn and thrive. The programme will provide you with a variety of experiences to help you identify your strengths develop highly transferable skills and align you to a successful career path for a bright future at IHS Markit. To be an ideal fit for the role, you'll have: * Be legally eligible to work for the duration of the program in the country for which you apply * A Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree (or equivalent) completed no later than September 2019 * This program is aimed at graduates with 0-12 months relevant experience * Demonstrated passion or interest in one or more of our key industries * Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills * Excellent communication skills * An ability to learn and adapt quickly in a rapidly changing environment * The ability to build strong working relationships in a collaborative setting For our Analyst applicants, we recommend the following: * With depth of knowledge key to providing industry leading advice, it can be advantageous to have a study background in a field relevant to your team/role How to apply * Submit your online application, which should include your CV, along with a short cover letter/motivational statement (we suggest around 300 words). * We want to hear more about you; why you're interested in joining IHS Markit, and why you're interested in being considered for the role/s you have applied for. * We are active in a wide number of industries if you're not yet sure which industry would best suit you, that's no problem, we're happy to help guide you. If you do have a specific preference, please ensure you include this information so that you are considered for the most relevant roles. Our assessment process The assessment process that follows is designed to ensure you can learn more about us, showcase your skills and find a role that is right for you. Stage 1: Submit CV & Covering Letter Stage 2: HireVue video interviews Stage 3: Final stage assessment day You may be considered for multiple suitable roles throughout this process. If these roles fall within the same stream, you will be assessed during the same process. If the roles fall across multiple streams, you may be asked to complete different assessments aligned to those roles. We recruit on a rolling basis and most of our assessment days are due to take place in early 2019. We recommend early application. Our commitment to diversity Our business and our customers are diverse, and we believe that embracing a diverse and inclusive environment is key to defining who we are. Our people are what makes us unique and you will get the opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from across the world who continuously find the best possible solutions, adding value and driving change for our customers. It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below). EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.SDL2017

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Business Process Analyst When was the last time you had the opportunity to inspire the creativity locked up within your co-workers? Do you have a vision to see how different technologies can be used to improve the experience of those working around you? Are you fascinated with business process and passionate about technology?  Polk Mechanical Company is expanding their IT department to include a data-driven, business-minded analyst to assist in the standardization and optimization of our core business processes. We are looking for a highly-technical software analyst to work with the end users to understand their current processes and make suggestions on how different features, functions and workflows can improve their workday. Organization Structure and Interfaces: Reports to: IT Director  Primary Interfaces: Polk employees at all levels from staffers through the Executive Team Environment: Multi-location: jobsite and office based business model  Pace: constant changing targets and quick turnaround is essential due to shifting priorities, changing client needs and project specifications  Demographic diversity: workforce enjoys a wide range of diversification associated with ethnicity, culture, position qualifications, socio-economic background, geographical differences, white & blue collar, etc. Success Factors:Key functional experience needs to include the basics of: MS-SQL Server and Data Analysis, Business and Technical requirement analysis, Project management skills, Overseeing software implementation and testing, Business process modeling and mapping, Data modelingAbility to communicate with users and create solutions: Collaborate with teams to develop, standardize, and maintain new or improved processes based on findings and analysis.Holistic view and understanding of operations: Understanding the relationships of each portion of our business, and creating solutions based on multi source analysis, business process modeling and mapping.Ability to set and maintain realistic schedules and deadlines: Multitasking and working on multiple projects at once, while communicating approach and schedule to leadership. If you re up to the challenge of organizing a great group of can-do personalities and showing them how standardization will improve their overall quality of work, send us a copy of your resume along with a writeup of your most creative business process improvement. In a tech-starved industry, you need to be creative in how you apply technology to processes, clear and concise in your presentation, and ready to face objection.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: **Company Overview:**Flowserve is the recognized world leader in supplying pumps, valves, seals, automation, and services to the power, oil, gas, chemical, and other industries. With more than 18,000 employees in more than 55 countries, we combine our global reach with a local presence.**Position Requirements:****Position Requirements:**+ Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics & Finance, Information Technology or related discipline.+ Knowledge of SQL databases and statistical software packages is desirable+ Minimum 5 years preferably in a reporting, process improvement or analytical role+ CIP Black Belt Certification preferred**Competencies/Skills:**+ Excellent interpersonal, written/verbal communication, and leadership skills with the ability to quickly build credibility, influence and make recommendations to all levels+ Strong analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail+ Organizational skills - ability to multi-task, prioritize, and execute on assigned deliverables+ Facilitation skills - emphasis on coordinating customer relationships with internal functions/groups; ability to solve issues by coordination across cross-functional areas+ Strong cross-functional team player+ Ability to change direction quickly based on analytic needs+ Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas in a plain language+ A strong desire to data mine and search for patterns that could create new insights+ Enjoy discovering and solving problems+ Strong organizational skills - ability to effectively manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously+ A high level of proficiency with Microsoft Office+ Knowledge of BPC and Lotus Notes databases is a plus+ Experience with real-time analytics and business intelligent platforms such as Tableau is a plus+ Ability to travel on occasion**Preferences:**+ Support and continuously evolve established reporting and analytics for FPD Supply Chain processes as well as the Monthly Operations Review process.+ Support the business with clear and insightful analysis applying advanced modeling techniques leveraging the data at hand+ Continuously enhance and implement business tools, reporting and analytics so management team can drive improved forecasting accuracy+ Conduct data mining / analytics to provide insights across products, markets and geographies for the purposes of growing the front end of the business.+ Develop other demand information and analytics for Executive Management+ Conduct various data auditing, aggregation, validation and reconciliation within the data made available+ Support the annual business planning and fiscal budgeting related to department**Position Description:**The Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for supporting and managing data analytics needs including, but not limited to the sales and operating demand forecast process, market level pricing, and product performance as required by Flowserve Pumps Division (FPD) Supply Chain Operations. He / She will work collaboratively with the Supply Chain teams in over 25 facilities Globally to align these analytics with business strategies and objectives. Superior communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to work cross-functionally with other areas of the organization, strong analytical skills, a professional demeanor and the ability to participate in and lead teams are the keys to this position. Strong organizational skills are required to be able to effectively manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously. The incumbent must be able to work in a highly visible, dynamic and fast paced environment. They must also have a curiosity, desire and strong enjoyment of diving into available data for the purpose of developing new insights to grow the front end of our business. This position reports directly to the Director Supply Chain for Pumps Division.**Job Posting/Business Card Title:**Sr. Business Analyst**Percentage of Approximate Travel Required:**10%**Primary Posting Location:**IRVING, Texas US**Job Posting Category:**Supply Chain**Employment Type:**Full time**Relocation Eligible:**No**Country:**United States**Auto req ID:**43544BR**Preferences:**NA**43544BR**

Name: SAP Business Analyst (Finance)
Description: McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy.  Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—by joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Name: Loan Analyst
Description: If you are looking for a balanced lifestyle in an intellectually stimulating field with different career options for professionals in the financial sector apply now!SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Must have financial services industry experience with accounting skillsBachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or Business with financial services driven coursesMS ExcelAnalytical Skills, Multi-Tasking, PrioritizingWHAT WE OFFER:Medical BenefitsFlexible working hours, no weekend workCOMPANY DESCRIPTION: an American worldwide banking and financial services holding company headquartered in New York City. GROWTH OPPORTUNITY:Career advancementIncreased duties and responsibilitiesKeeping up with technology, systems, processesJOB DESCRIPTION: Duration: 3+ Months  Pay rate: $19.00 per hour  Education: Bachelor's degree  Location: Dallas, TX  The Corporate Trust Administrator role is critical in providing top quality service to clients and for complete administration of assigned corporate trust and/or agency accounts.
