Furthermore, the Corporate Trust Administrator is tasked with ensuring compliance and customer satisfaction to the highest standards of the bank. The Trust Administrator (TA) reports directly to the Relationship Manager. The position requires a responsible individual to perform ongoing administrative activities for Corporate Trust Services. Under the guidance of the Relationship Manager and Team Leader, the TA will be responsible for much of the day to day administration of the portfolio, involving funds transfer, trade clearance, compliance monitoring and client service and communication. Escalation is also required when a matter is discovered to be incorrect.  Previous experience in Financial Services preferred. BA/BS degree in finance or related field preferred. Experience in MS Office applications, such as Word, Excel, etc. Detail-oriented with ability to prioritize and organize workflow. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to acquire a working knowledge of the portfolio of accounts by working closely with the Relationship Manager. Name: Sr. Business Process Analyst
Description: Overview Trend Micro: Securing Your Journey to the Cloud Trend Micro, the world’s largest independent security software company, strives to make the world a safer place by protecting digital information. Our solutions for consumers, businesses and governments provide layered security to protect information on mobile devices, endpoints, gateways, servers and the cloud. Trend Micro enables the smart protection of information, with innovative technology that is simple to deploy and manage, and security that fits an evolving ecosystem. Our solutions are supported by over 5000 employees in over 50 countries and powered by the world’s most advanced cloud-based global threat intelligence, the Trend Micro™ Smart Protection Network™.  This position will be the point of contact and business partner for day to day management of CRM and PRM System (currently Saleforce.com). The Business Process Analyst will also be responsible for ongoing stakeholder management with issues, enhancements, general application direction, and guidance. Business Process Analyst will work closely with the business stakeholders and provide project management, business process analysis expertise and deliver world class support to the business.  Duties & Responsibilities The Business Process Analyst will work with business and functional teams to gather requirements, design quality solutions, and create business specificationsThe Business Process Analyst will lead the functional responsibilities & process design, implementation and administrative operational support, depending on the stage of system lifecycle.The role works closely with the Subject Matter Experts, the customer base and internal and external IT technical teams and service providers implementing application requirements and supporting business applications deployment and systems operational needs.This position will develop and conduct testing for applications, document business processes, developing test scripts and user guide, conduct training of end users and resolve problems with CRM and PRM applications.This position will Lead, manage and communicate project expectations and solutions to team members and business usersWork with the cross functional teams in helping them create quality design documents and in developing quality Products within the scheduled timelineCollaborate with business users to identify opportunities to further utilize Salesforce.com to achieve business goals, new functionality, reports & dashboardsManage solution scope, changes to requirements, and requirements conflictsIdentify stakeholders of the work effort, how they are impacted, and what their needs and roles are to effectively engage in the effortTranslate design specifications by co-working with both internal and external teams of developers and other functional analysts while ensuring all nuances of the requirements are understood and executed per requirements.Manage all aspects of assigned projects from initiating to closure following Trend Micro’s defined process and quality standard.Support users with day to day issues and be a front line support partner for issue resolution. Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related field. MBA/MS preferred.com certificate is a big plus.Experience gathering and documenting system requirements and documenting system functional design for business applications package solutions and related implementation issues from a functional perspective.Experience with enterprise wide system implementation, integration, interfaces and data conversion.Demonstrated experience in business analysis on large complex projects.Demonstrated experience working with diverse set of users (Sales, Marketing, Technical Support)Strong business knowledge in Account Management/Cleanse, Opportunity/Lead management, Quote, Case Management, Partner Portal management, and BI functionalities5+ years of combined working experience in business process analysis, system analysis or project management roles5+ years of CRM experienceStrong problem solving skills, should be able to research and understand an undocumented set up and application testing of developed functionalityUse T-SQL to query data in RMDB.Previous exposure with Marketing tools (Marketo) and technologies highly desiredDemonstrated problem solving and analytical skillsAbility to work in a fast paced environment, multi-task multiple critical priorities simultaneously, and have excellent organization skillsExcellent facilitation, influencing and negotiation skills.Must be flexible to working with global teams and stakeholders across time zones during issue resolution and project execution. Trend Micro provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Trend Micro does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

Name: Fixed Asset Financial Analyst
Description: Fixed Asset Financial Analyst IIDallas TXWhat does it mean to be a BrinkerHead? We play like a team, take pride in our culture and seek every opportunity to make people feel special. Life is short. Work happy. At Brinker, we connect, serve and give to create the best life for our Team Members, Guests and community. Through our cultural beliefs, Brinker empowers its Team Members to positively impact our 4 Key Results: Engaging Team Members, Bringing Back Guests, Growing Sales and Increasing Profits. Brinker International is an equal opportunity employer; we foster an inclusion environment that promotes respect, diversity of thought and success for all. Job SummaryThis position requires formal technical training in Fixed Asset and Accounting processes as well as experience at developing and producing ad hoc reporting and analysis as needed. Individuals in this position are called upon to provide key financial and business analysis/support to management on capital expenditure and depreciation trends as well as Brinker's capital and depreciation plans. This position requires interaction with a broad range of internal team members through the Brinker organization.Your Key Job FunctionsPrepare routine financial forecasts for Fixed Assets (including capital expenditures, depreciation) and complete related analysis, variance reports, and scenarios or sensitivities.Prepare the accounting close journal entries for certain fixed asset items.Review monthly Fixed Asset reconciliations to the Accounting general ledger and monitoring key accounts for completeness and accuracy.Oversee the execution of all aspects of accounting for capital projects, including additions and retirements, related to both new restaurant construction as well as capital expenditures for existing restaurants, IT, and corporate office.Partner and maintain collaborative relationships with teams such as Planning and Analysis, Operations, Finance, Accounting and other business partners to ensure fixed asset accounting and budgets / forecasts are complete and accurate, and partners are provided communication / information as needed.Assist in the coordination of the annual planning process for Fixed Assets (including capital expenditures and depreciation)Continuously monitor changes within the industry and business to ensure proper treatment of fixed assets.Identify and collaborate to implement process improvements to make the monthly and quarterly cycles more efficient.Proactively search out opportunities to improve business results through analysis and report recommendations to customers in an organized and easily understood format.Work ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related field3 years related work experience. Fixed asset experience preferredStrong analytical and critical thinking skills with attention to detail.Team-oriented with good verbal and written communication skills and an ability to build relationships effectively.Proven ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast paced environment. Motivated self-starter and able to work independently. Ability to manage time effectively and prioritize projects based on cost/benefit.Ability to maintain confidentiality on proprietary business information.Superior working knowledge of Excel, and database products (Hyperion, Essbase).Why Brinker We offer a competitive benefits package including medical/dental/vision, life insurance, paid vacation/holidays, and 401(k) with company match and generous dining discounts. Every team member working at the Restaurant Support Center (aka Brinker headquarters) is eligible for annual bonus potential. Our campus includes an onsite gym plus opportunities to increase your wellbeing with onsite Yoga and boot camp programs. Work/Life/Fun balance in a casual and collaborative work environment! Team members enjoy company-wide events and celebrations. Regular volunteer opportunities with our community give back programsCheck our Careers page for more exciting opportunities!  Brinker Careers Join our talent communities! Brinker LinkedIn #LifeisShortWorkHappy #brinkerjobs #brinkerhead

Name: Digital Analyst (Senior)
Description: Quadratic, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Richards Group, provides advanced analytics, digital analytics, data solutions, and relationship marketing services to more than 100 clients across a wide range of verticals.We’re searching for a new team member who shares our passion for transforming data into meaningful insights and opportunities for our clients. Like all team members, this person must be extremely detail-oriented with a curious nature. The digital analyst is expected to be a thought leader who will generate innovative ideas for how we integrate data, technology, and analytics to help clients make smarter, more informed decisions.We are a flat organization, so the digital analyst role comes with the opportunity for considerable growth in skill set and responsibility through technology and media training, direct client relationships, team mentoring, and supervision of junior team members.ResponsibilitiesDevelop testing, measurement, tracking, data visualization, and technology integration strategies to support clients’ business objectivesCreate comprehensive reporting, insights, and recommendations across websites, digital advertising, social media, email marketing, etc.Work closely with key cross-functional teams (media, digital strategy, advanced analytics, brand management, etc.) to interpret campaign resultsConsult with internal and external clientsAssist with implementation and management of site analytics (Adobe Analytics, Google 360, etc.) and tag management platforms (Dynamic Tag Management, Tealium, etc.)Assess new technologies and develop POVs as necessaryDevelop, implement, and manage A/B and multivariate testsMaintain working knowledge of industry best practicesManage project timelines and budgetsRequirementsPossess at least a bachelor’s degree plus four years of digital or web analytics experienceExperience in development of tagging recommendations and implementation documentsExperience with tag management systems such as Tealium, Google Tag Manager, or Adobe Dynamic Tag ManagementExperience with report and insight developmentStrong math/statistic skillsStrong communication skills for both technical and nontechnical audiencesAdvanced Excel skillsExperience in any of the following is a significant plus: Tableau, DMP (BlueKai, Adobe Audience Manager, etc.), Adobe Data Workbench, attribution, DCO tool

Name: IT Business Sr. Analyst
Description: Job Background/Context: This position provides information and insights to the CTI Strategic Support team. The individual in this role will be exposed to CTI’s regional and sector functions, CTI CAO/Business Operations teams, as well as Finance and HR in support of the ongoing maturation and evolution of CTI to an agile yet consistently governed organization.  This position requires strong analytical and detailed thinking, highly collaborative and open mindset, and ability to work in “ambiguity” and through iterations. Familiarity with governance models, driving technology and business process analysis/reengineering efforts is critical. Additional knowledge of SDLC and Agile concepts is beneficial. Key Responsibilities:Provides in-depth analysis and critical thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and make recommendations that influence decisions of key business partners.Utilizes multiple data sources to validate analytics and assumptions, driving conception and publication of data-driven findings, recommended actions and outputs which feed larger CTI Strategic Support activities.Utilizes assorted tools/technology (MS PowerPoint, Access, Excel) and tools to automate data gathering and analysis. Rapidly acquires knowledge of target domains (business/function as well as technology), and leverages prior experience, Citi knowledge and subject matter expertise to drive development of key insights and actions.Works independently, in small teams, or directly with Head of CTI Strategic Support to distill volume of data and analysis into actionable insights and executive-level summaries. Contributes to development of improvement/change strategies.Assists Strategic Support team to perform strategic evaluations, identify potential gaps and implement corrective actions. Possesses a good understanding of client core business functions.  About Citi  Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all. Skills:Demonstrated thought leadership in financial analysis, organizational strategy, process re-engineering (six sigma, Agile, Lean, etc.) and other transformation capabilitiesStrong ability to navigate and drive progress in challenging situations.Analytical, driven self-starter with a passion for decomposing complex problems and deliverables, obtaining and analyzing data, deriving actionable insights, and developing succinct, well-crafted summaries and recommendations suitable for publication directly to senior CTI leadership.Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet assigned deadlines.Organized, accurate and detail oriented.Motivated and a quick learner.Advanced skill and proficiency with MS PowerPoint, Excel (data acquisition, analysis, pivot tables), Access & other analysis tools.Strong Presentation skills in PowerPoint.Ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams effectively under pressure in a rapidly changing environment.Proven ability to be comfortable and adaptive with ambiguity. Ability to exchange complex information within team and with others. Knowledge/Experience:Business process, workflow, financial, business analysis and project delivery.Knowledge in one or more areas of Core Infrastructure / Data Centre Technologies.Broad-based knowledge of other functional and technical areas.Ability to exercise judgment and evaluate options under circumstances not covered by procedures or precedents.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Business Unit: Information Technology Department: AD Job Family: Information Technology Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst Corporate Title: Senior Associate FLSA Code: Exempt Business Unit Description: The Information Technology group delivers secure, reliable technology solutions that enable DTCC to be the trusted infrastructure of the global capital markets. The team delivers high-quality information through activities that include development of essential, building infrastructure capabilities to meet client needs and implementing data standards and governance.  Application development delivers solutions that respond to the business needs of the global capital markets with quality, efficiency, and excellence, using innovative technologies and providing secure information management. Position Summary: Requirements elaboration; business process management (modeling / automation); User Interface design; data models; coordinates activities of team members; management of multiple projects.  The DTCC AD Senior BSA models business processes, derives requirements and produces detailed business rule definitions to create system functional component descriptions. The Senior BSA will participate in projects from the Business Requirements review phase, working with Functional Architects and product management, to analyze the requirements in detail. This involves reviewing business requirements and documenting functional specifications details for the application development team. This position provides guidance to team members by elaborating the necessary details for projects. The Senior BSA analyzes business processes in great detail, participating in application design, supporting development teams and testing. The Senior BSA must possess good communications skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to translate business processes into functional specifications. This position requires working closely with the technical and governance functions, reviewing and interpreting technical designs and specifications, assisting with estimating costs and producing schedules. supports user acceptance and industry testingProcess automationRecommends controls by identifying gaps and designing solutions to automate manual processesPerforms the Project Management role as defined in AD’s SDLC for team-driven initiativesAwareness of Security and Privacy RisksMitigates risk by following established procedures, spotting key errors and demonstrating strong ethical behavior.Leadership Competencies for this level include:Accountability: Demonstrates reliability by taking necessary actions to continuously meet required deadlines and goals.Global Collaboration: Applies global perspective when working within a team by being aware of own style and ensuring all relevant parties are involved in key team tasks and decisions.Communication: Articulates information clearly and presents information effectively and confidently when working with others.Influencing: Convinces others by making a strong case, bringing others along to their viewpoint; Name: Business/Data Analyst
Description: Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive. As an experienced Information Architect professional, your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and technologists toward creating next-level solutions that improve the way our business is run. Your deep knowledge of design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming will help your team raise their game, meeting your standards, as well as satisfying both business and functional requirements. Your expertise in various technology domains will be counted on to set strategic direction and solve complex and mission critical problems, internally and externally. Your quest to embracing leading-edge technologies and methodologies inspires your team to follow suit. And best of all, you’ll be able to harness massive amounts of brainpower through our global network of technologists from around the world.Responsibilities of the RoleSubject matter expertise in technology infrastructure (Compute, Storage, backup, network, cloud) and asset lifecycle managementUnderstand and deliver data modeling requirements – physical and logical data modelingDrive data quality enhancements at scale to solve business problems in a prioritized mannerBuild and support data flow integration between different products increasing the capabilities of our product and expanding its use across the firmAbility to understand and deliver client requirements end to end for reference data and data lake aligned use casesEnsure proper risk management process is adhered too, to mitigate risk exposure for the firmClient centric focus – ensure a positive user experience by our consumersTechnology Infrastructure ExpertiseAbility to understand in depth how technology products are delivered (e.g. virtual server infrastructure technology, block storage, industry leading cloud providers) Ability to understand what data needs to be collected and how it can be collected to meet the firm’s requirementsUnderstand of disaster recovery (DR) requirements, how a technology organization would plan and assess readiness for DR scenarios – including technology products used to achieve DR readinessStrong Data Architecture experienceAdvanced understanding of reference data, data lake, and other information system solutionsExperience integrated multiple systems together to create an intelligent and resilient information system solutionAbility to use industry standard tools to create logical and physical data models for technology infrastructure and reference dataInformation System DesignExperience delivering or supporting information systems using extract, translate, load (ETL) and publishing methodsUnderstanding the right technical solution to represent the data appropriately to meet the client requirementExperience with performance tuning of information systems (e.g. streamlining ETLs to run faster)Data Quality ExperienceUnderstanding the core concepts of data quality–how to measure improveAbility to analyze data for data quality gapsUnderstanding what data quality issues pose the greatest risks to the firm’s operations and raising those to governance effectively Soft Skills/attributes required for this RoleExperience at a large multinational companyCollaborative personality – ability to deliver in coordination with many different teamsStrong communication skills – ability to provide clarity and focus to projects while working with both engineering groups as well as senior managementStrong presentation skills – ability to create professional presentations and present clear stories to large audiencesSelf-motivated – desire to take on increasing responsibility over timeAutonomous – ability to understand their role in depth and make decisions independently When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Statistics Analyst I
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas believes in the diversity of our people, ideas and experiences, and we are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve. ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY As part of the nation's central bank, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is committed to strengthening the economy and our communities. At the Fed, you have the opportunity to become part of an important public service institution whose work touches lives across the globe. It's a big job and that's why we need talented, results-driven professionals who care about making a difference. JOB DESCRIPTION The Bank's Statistics Department currently has an opening for a Statistics Analyst I. The Statistics Analyst will be responsible for accurate and timely analysis and delivery of financial and structure data for a panel of less complex financial institutions using established procedures and working under direct supervision. The analyst ensures accuracy and integrity of reported data and information in accordance with established guidelines, policies, and procedures. The Statistics Analyst will also use business software and analytical systems, review data reports, charts, and graphs that are used in the analysis of report data for less complex analysis.  The analyst will also work with a team lead and/or more senior analysts to resolve quality assurance related problems, respond to questions on reporting requirements, and clearly communicate conclusions, analytical findings, and value-added information to peers, management, Board of Governors staff, and other stakeholders. This analyst will also need to consistently contribute with value-added analyses in a clear and well thought-out manner. The level of work is considered introductory and under direct supervision. KEY RESPONSIBILITIESEffective application with guidance of basic quality assurance, extended analysis, and associated contextual information for monetary/economic policy and structure/regulatory reports data ensuring timely delivery of fit for use data to the Board of Governors, FRB New York and other data owners.With team lead guidance, learn the process of reviewing and commenting on proposed changes to reports technical memoranda in a timely manner. Based on their review, analyst is expected to raise issues they have identified which could have general operating or quality assurance implications for Reserve Banks or financial institutions.Learn to consistently leverage basic business software and analysis skills to support data analytics and related processes used in analysis, quality assurance, and testing. As they progress, analyst will have responsibility to incorporate automation tools into daily analysis including the interpretation of reports, data grids, graphs, and charts related to the basic data review processes.Active learning and participation in local and system testing initiatives that reflect an understanding of the underlying data collection and workflows. In support of quality assurance, effectively translate report changes to targeted systems to execute assigned testing scenarios and project plans.Active participation in team and department level projects that provide collective benefits.KEY COMPETENCIESFunctional Knowledge: Requires conceptual knowledge of theories, practices and procedures within a disciplineBusiness Expertise: Applies general knowledge of business developed through education or past experienceLeadership: No supervisory responsibilities; accountable for developing technical contributionProblem Solving: Uses existing procedures to solve standard problems; analyzes information and standard practices to make judgmentsImpact: Has limited impact on own work team; works within standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlinesInterpersonal Skills: Exchanges straightforward information, asks questions and checks for understandingEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEBS/BA degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or other similar program, or equivalent work experience in a related field such as banking, accounting, audit, etc.Proficient in the use of; SAS, SQL, R, or other related software a plusStrong written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate clearly, correctly, and concisely; adjusts communication style to fit a variety of people and situations; tailors the tone and content of communications to fit the audienceProfessional skills; analytical project skills; knowledge of bank operations including data analysis and general regulatory knowledge preferredBasic accounting principles and financial industry knowledge; ability to read and understand financial statements; data analysis skills; familiarity with related ratio analysis preferredEquivalent education and / or experience may be substitutedWork Hours and conditions: Monday Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; flexibility / additional hours may be required based on business needs; some travel may be required, up to 5% Notes: By federal law, this position requires that candidates fall within one of the following citizenship categories: (1) U.S. citizen, (2) U.S. national, (3) U.S. permanent residents who are not yet eligible to apply for naturalization, or (4) U.S. permanent residents who have applied for naturalization within six months of being eligible to do so.  This position may be filled at various levels based on knowledge, skills abilities and education.  Assessments may be required as part of the interview process.  The candidate selected for this position may be included in the Bank's Leadership Development Program (LDP) if eligibility requirements are met. The LDP is two-years in length and provides accelerated learning and development for early career professionals. To be eligible for the LDP, selected candidates must have at least a 3.5 GPA, up to two years of professional work experience and have approval of their management. To learn more about the LDP, please visit KNECT. https://www.dallasfed.org/careers/ldp.aspx  We are Proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer  .SDL2017

Name: PERFORMANCE ANALYST
Description: We’re here to ensure the advertising industry and the people in it are healthy and engaging positively and effectively with those around them. We’re here, ultimately, to improve the lives of people working in the media industry. And we take our responsibility seriously. ABOUT THE ROLE The Campaign Performance Analyst will be responsible for working with internal teams on specific accounts to align campaign objectives and KPIs, develop performance measurement plans, and recommendations for campaign optimization. This position is responsible for developing and delivering insightful and actionable reports that tell a performance story. It will have a strong focus on insights vs. observations with responsibility for driving performance outcomes and optimized media investment priorities. The priority for this position is working across the internal team to deliver optimal performance to drive client growth, retention and high levels of client satisfaction. ABOUT THE TEAM The Performance Analytics team has a passion for analytics and a common vision for improvement and growth. As trusted advisors to both our internal teams and clients, our time is split between diving deep into rows of data, showing off our reporting dashboards, and educating our clients on KPIs, tools and evolving methodologies. Among our supportive team network you can often find us showing off the creative reporting templates and custom dashboards that make us proud. CORE RESPONSIBILITIESAlign campaign objectives and KPIs and develop performance measurement plans and recommendations for campaign optimization.Develop and deliver insightful and actionable reports that tell the performance story of the campaign.Partner with Client and Media Services, Search, and Social team members to develop forward-looking campaigns based on historical performance insights.Present reports, optimization recommendations, and insights to both client and internal audiencesUnderstand Centro solutions related to analytics and reporting such as ad verification, attribution, brand studies, viewability, etc.Mentor Associate level performance analysts.QUALIFICATIONS2+ years digital media experience, especially in client facing buying or media measurement departmentsBachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing, Business, Statistics or Economics preferredStrong independent thinking and problem solving abilitiesExcellent organization and communication skillsHighly motivated with a strong record of project or process managementStrong qualitative skills with ability to demonstrate quality data organization and analysis techniquesUnderstanding of media buying and ad serving landscapeStrong knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelAbility to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, under tight deadlinesExceptional customer service and communication skillsAdaptable and flexibleA fun, positive attitude that embodies the Centro’s cultureCentro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: At Exeter Finance, we are committed to helping customers find the right financing for their next vehicle purchase. By building strong relationships with our customers and network of dealer partners we are able to give options that make sense, getting customers behind the wheel of their car.  Every team member is integral to our success. Whether you’re at a servicing center helping customers with their loans, in the field building relationships with dealers, or supporting the company from its corporate offices, you'll enjoy a nurturing, invigorating and positive work environment.  Our vision is to be a premier finance company and lender of choice known for its People, Performance and Service.  Assists in the development, modification and maintenance of analysis related to loan origination, performance and forecasting.  Manages individual projects as assigned to ensure adherence to schedule, as well as quality and accuracy of delivered results.  Performs ad hoc projects related to the entire function of credit risk, and summarize results using verbal, written, and formal presentation techniques.  Analyzes business intelligence data. Assesses data extraction, report generation and bugs appearing in operations involving the data warehouse or applicable reporting applications. Synthesizes current business intelligence or trend data to support recommendations for action. Documents specifications for business intelligence or information technology (IT) reports, dashboards, or other outputs.  Collects business intelligence data from various resources. Generates standard or custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, clients, and other stakeholders. Maintains and updates business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, systems, or methods.  Validates system applications. Programs the user interface and application side of business intelligence solutions.  Creates reports in SSRS.  Other duties as assigned.  Exeter Finance LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Analyst Manager-HCM
Description: Exempt  Earliest Start Date 09/01/2018 Monthly Salary  Salary commensurate with experience  Hours per Week 00 Flexible from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Hiring Department  Office of Shared Information Services  Please Note  Please note that our online application allows you to upload only a single document when applying for a position. Please review required documents section in the job posting and combine your resume and other required documents (such as cover letter or references) into a PDF or Word document. Upload this combined document when the system requests you to upload a resume. To be considered for this position, you must also complete the additional application at: http://bit.ly/2OhjfCQ  Required Application Materials A resume is required in order to apply.A letter of interest is required in order to apply.A list of 3 professional references is required in order to apply. In order to be considered, applicants must have uploaded all required materials in a combined document and must have completed all sections in their on-line application.  Please Note: To be considered for this position, you must also complete the additional application at: http://bit.ly/2OhjfCQ  Purpose of Position  Business Analyst Manager defines and performs the most complex process and systems analysis, design, and implementation. This individual also leads process and systems implementation and reengineering efforts to ensure highest quality of processes, information, organizational change, and services to internal and external customers. In addition, our Business Analyst Manager provides user support through problem resolution, system modification, maintenance, training, and procedure development. Also, this individual identifies, implements, and maintains system controls to ensure system and servicing data integrity, and serves as division liaison for inter-departmental process and systems development. Providing these services in an effective and efficient manner will ensure maximum access to and implementation of technology services and resources within the University of Texas System and the Office of Shared Information Services.  Essential Functions Manage/Support PeopleSoft environments including configuration, upgrades, patches and implementation of new functionality.Analyze and model the business domain to create a complete picture of work-flows and technical requirements fulfilled by existing and proposed software. Define the business problem and primary objectives of new projects. Identify and validate the key business requirements.Evaluate potential software solutions, including delivered components with PeopleSoft applications, and the system architecture to ensure that they meet business requirements. Create functional requirements in use cases. Coordinate requirements walk-through and sign-offs, verifying with user representatives/stakeholders that use cases and process models accurately portray specific business needs.Contribute to project plans and develop plans when applicable; including resource allocationPerform impact analysis on all PeopleSoft and PeopleTools updates, rollout of new functionality and provide proposals for applying them effectively.Provide service and support determined by the current Service Level Agreements, including on-call support. Direct Shared Information Services business analyst staff to ensure technology is accessible, functional and equipped with current hardware and software.Monitor and maintain technology to ensure maximum access and usability across UT System locations.Supervise and manage teams to ensure task completion.Provide daily team leadership for team contributors including:facilitating regular team meetings; helping teams prioritize and execute work; making work assignments as needed; promoting team member development and expansion.Prepare, review and report team activities including: team operating highlights and performance; service level agreement analysis; other team reporting as needed; service improvement recommendations. Complete team reviews, both annual and otherwise.Responsible for timesheet management and approval for their team.Provide leadership through training, development, mentoring, and performance management initiatives. Provide team leadership including: guiding contributors on processes, procedures and task execution; providing feedback to management to improve team performance; includes conducting periodic and mandatory performance reviews.Provide team escalation management including: resolving/escalating major team issues, problems and requests; option generation and negotiation; conflict management and resolution; overall risk management Manages and approves all leave requests for business analyst team.Other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree with coursework in computing or information systems or any equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Minimum eight years of progressively responsible experience in computer systems management, software development life cycle methodologies and analysis 5+ years supervisory experience with a combination of: 4+ years of developing business requirements; and 2+ years of testing experience (including script development and planning). Self-starter, with high energy and outstanding analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent organization, management, presentation, and communication (verbal and written) skills.  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or related field. 10+ years of experience in systems analysis, design, and software programming. Preferred experience in a higher education environment. 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst supporting PeopleSoft applications within a particular suite,. maintaining, configuring, and testing systems with a combination of: 4 + years extensive experience in systems analysis, design, and testing; 4+ years of PeopleSoft Human Capital Management System Application experience (version 8.8 or greater); 2 years of SQL plus or general reporting. Solid working knowledge in three or more modules within the Human Resources suite of PeopleSoft 9.1 or 9.2 and the understanding of integration with Finance, Campus Solutions. Strong understanding (all phases) of the application development lifecycle; software development life cycle methodologies and project management disciplines. Strong understanding of production support procedures, ITIL methodologies and project management concepts. Possess strong adaptability to team leadership style of management. Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills; Ability to work well with people in all levels of the organization and handle fast paced, dynamic, sometimes volatile environment. Provide and promote excellent customer service. Strong MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, Project Visio); videoconferencing; Service Now or equivalent service(Incident and Problem Management, Change) management system. Additional certifications in supported technologies. Ability to travel as needed.  Working Conditions May work around standard office conditions.Some travel may be required.Uses standard office equipment.Requires occasional evening or weekend hours.Additional Information The retirement plan for this position is Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS), subject to the position being at least 20 hours per week and at least 135 days in length.  Complete all sections on the application, including highest level of education, college degrees (if applicable), references and all questions on the application questionnaire. If you are applying for the first time make sure to complete all biographical information including address, email and phone. You may update this at any time by selecting to edit your profile in the application.  Security sensitive; conviction verification conducted on applicant selected.  EO/AA Statement  The University of Texas System Administration is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or sexual orientation. Reasonable disability accommodation may be requested by contacting the Office of Human Resources.SDL2017

Name: Revenue Analyst
Description: OTA Insight is a Revenue Management Intelligence Provider for the hospitality business (our clients are individual hotels and major chains like Hilton, Accor, ). OTA Insight is an online dashboard solution (SaaS) providing rate intelligence for the hotels to increase their revenue by optimising their pricing. We combine cutting edge technology and data analytics to provide smarter business intelligence to maximise occupancy and revenue.Today OTA Insight is present in more than 140 countries around the world and has more than 30 000 partners.We are expanding internationally and are looking for a full-time Revenue Analyst (London) to join our Revenue Analytics & Strategic Alliances team. As a Revenue Analyst you are responsible for the Revenue Insight from integration to post live support. You will be responsible for the integration with different RMSs (Revenue Management Systems) like IDeaS, Duetto, LodglQ and PMS (Property Management Systems) like OPERA, Protel, and benchmarking providers like STR, Fairmas, Benchmarking Alliance, MKG.ResponsibilitiesAssist our clients with the implementation of OTAs Revenue Insight tool. You guide the hotel revenue management team how to use our tool so they can formulate transient and group inventory restrictions and pricing strategies towards the goal of increasing market share and maximizing revenues for the hotel. Support in analysing results of strategies and tactics deployed on a monthly basis. Provide all communication necessary to hotels strategy team.Provide in-depth analysis of the rooms business to focus on maximizing revenue while assisting in generating sales and marketing plans to achieve the maximum from the hotel partners.Analyze recent trends for all revenue streams and provide detailed analysis to assist the Director of Revenue/Revenue Manager in the revenue forecasting process for the hotel. Develop analysis for the business/leisure travel sales team that allows them to better evaluate new and existing accounts. Review all outliers that fall out of established booking patterns and provide feedback to the Revenue Management, Sales & Marketing teams. Proactively monitors and strives to maintain high levels of quality, accuracy and process consistency across the organization.Identifies areas for improvement; prioritizes, designs and facilitates successful implementation and adoption of new processes. Collaborates closely with the product manager and engineering team in order to give them market feedback so they can improve our product.Supports sales strategy and enablement initiatives around sales process and methodology focused on improving productivity, visibility, and accountability against goals.Collaborates with Business Operations, Information Technology and other business stakeholders to drive high levels of data integrity and operational reliability of our standardized business analytics, tools and processes.SkillsBachelors Degree in Business, Communication, Finance, Economics or other relevant field.2/3 years experience within the Hospitality Industry as (assistant) Revenue Manager/Yield Manager/Reservations Manager.Experience creating and interpreting sales metrics and reports.Skilled in successfully implementing new technologies.Outstanding listening, analytical, organizational and time management skills. Ability to dig into data, surface actionable insights and demonstrates sound decision-making skills. A problem-solver at heart. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Demonstrates a high level of diplomacy.Strong work ethic, hands-on, detail oriented with a customer service mentality.Team player, ability to work cross-functionally, self-driven, motivated, and able to work under pressure.Able to drive a project from conception to completion, not just execute on an existing plan.Results-oriented and demonstrated record of developing initiatives that impact productivity.At OTA Insight you join our high performance #bestteamever where you can be part of growing and developing a market leading technology platform. We are a rapidly growing company and are looking for passionate and talented team players. With extensive training and development programs the opportunities to succeed here are endless, as we continue our journey to innovate and disrupt with our cutting-edge technology.

Name: Reliability Analyst
Description: We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.  Perform continuing analysis of the effectiveness of the maintenance and inspection program in order to satisfy the requirements of an FAA-Approved Reliability Program.  Collect, integrate, analyze, and present maintenance data in order to provide insightful and actionable information to Tech Ops Leadership to make better and more informed business decisions. WORK ACTIVITIES/CONTEXT:Maintain compliance with Southwest Airlines MPM and FAA requirements for the D074 Reliability Program on an ongoing basis.Perform data collection, validation, and classification on data elements required by the Reliability Program and exercise judgement within defined procedures to determine appropriate action.Perform root cause analysis on data of moderate scope to measure aircraft/fleet performance for safety, reliability, and economic impact, and identify deficiencies in the Maintenance Program.Work with individuals and groups across Tech Ops to identify and address adverse trends, evaluate the effectiveness of corrective measures, and provide detailed briefings up to Tech Ops Leadership.Evaluate and apply performance standards and statistical analysis methods.Maintain awareness of and compliance with Reliability training requirements as defined in the MPM.Compile, build, and publish monthly Reliability reports.Provide Reliability data, statistics, and analysis to internal and external Customers at an exceptional level of customer service. Must be able to meet any physical ability requirements listed on this description.  May perform other job duties as directed by Employee’s Leaders. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required.Must be at least 18 years of age.Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986.EDUCATION:Bachelor's degree (B.S. / B.A.) in Aviation, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent relevant work experience required.WORK EXPERIENCE:Two + years prior analysis experience in Aviation, Engineering, or Reliability related field required.Prior root cause analysis experience preferred.LICENSING/CERTIFICATION:FAA Airframe & Powerplant license and/or pilot experience preferred.Continuous Improvement Certification in Six Sigma/Lean or related field preferred.SKILLS/ABILITIES/KNOWLEDGE/WORK STYLE: Must be able to comply with Company attendance standards as described in established guidelines. Prefer familiarity with AC 120-17A Maintenance Control by Reliability Methods, MSG-3 based Aircraft Maintenance Programs, and FAA Inspector's Handbook.Must be able to organize and balance multiple concurrent initiatives/assignments while maintaining a high degree of accuracy, attention to detail, and timely delivery.Must be able to perform more complex tasks with occasional guidance from direct Leaders.Must be comfortable delivering formal written and verbal communication to various levels of the organization up to Tech Ops Leadership.Must be able to read and understand aircraft and component diagrams, manuals, and other technical or regulatory documents.Must be able to visualize, articulate, and condense complex issues into concise, easily understood updates and/or presentations.Must be able to deliver high quality results as an individual contributor, including when under tight time constraints and/or while dealing with competing priorities.Must be proficient in communication, visualization, and report-writing applications like Tableau, Word, PowerPoint, etc.Must be proficient in data querying and processing applications like Alteryx, Access, Excel, PL/SQL Developer, etc.Prefer proficiency in project management and process flow applications like Quick Base, Project, and MRO software, etc.OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:Ability to travel to industry conferences 1-2 times per year including overnights preferred.Must be able to work a flexible schedule as needed to support the operational needs of the Department. Must maintain a well-groomed appearance per Company appearance standards as described in established guidelines. Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Specialist, Business Analyst
Description: If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online. Job DescriptionOverview:The Business Intelligence and Analytics team provides transactional and financial insights to management by analyzing trends in sales, gains, losses, margin and other key performance metrics to drive strategic and operational performance optimization. The team is also responsible for providing analytics support and reporting services for driving ongoing performance improvements for other business units.Within TXU Energy, the Specialist job function has lead and subject matter expert responsibility for analyzing and developing improvements to business processes, identifying and facilitating the creation of appropriate reporting and definition around each function, managing and integrating processes relating to operations, and delivering an improved customer experience.Responsibilities:Deliver key insights by uncovering root causes for trends in sales, gains, losses and swaps by transaction type, channel, campaign, product and over time. Ability to derive insights from complex data for presentation and decision making.Partner with our Marketing, Credit and Information Technology team to develop / deliver structured and ad-hoc reporting that supports analytical groups across the company utilizing tools such as SAS and SQL for data extraction and Tableau, Excel and others for visualization. Partner with our modeling team to create models which help improve customer retention, acquisition and improve customer value.Provide deep-dive analytical support for various sales channels, including campaign performance measurement. Focus on acquisition and retention performance optimization by analyzing current processes. Analyze financial impact of trends and opportunities leveraging business metrics of success such as NPV, PV/I etc. to develop financially justifiable recommendations.Partner with Pricing and Performance Management teams to build and further improve relevant business cases. Perform sensitivity analyses for key assumptions and market scenarios, as necessary.Partner with business functions across the company and with acquisition, retention and service channels, including reactive and targeted call centers, Door to door, DM, Online and others to provide relevant, insightful, timely and accurate views of performance and incentive reportingRequirements:Bachelors with 5+ years or Masters plus 2+ years of relevant industry experienceExcellent business, financial and analytical acumenPrior experience in extracting and analyzing large volume of data using SAS / SQL or other large data analysis tools. Very strong Microsoft Excel & Power-point skillsExperience in a customer-focused and/or relationship building roleProject Management / Planning & Leadership SkillsStrong problem solving and analytical skills•Prior experience in creating visual dashboards using tools like Tableau is highly preferredExcellent inter-personal, communication skill and Presentation skillsPrior experience in big data technologies like Hadoop/HANA, Voice Analytics desirablePrior experience in Web technologies desirablePrior experience with data modeling desirable Very high level of initiative in terms of learning the business and designing valuable analysesOn-time production of analyses and results of the highest integrity and qualityAbility to adapt and work in complex and ever changing environmentDevelopment of clear, concise, and effective executive level reporting and presentationsJob FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyTXU Retail Services CompanyLocationsIrving, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to: Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication. If this describes you, then you will have a good career here!If you currently work for Vistra Energy, TXU or Luminant please apply via the internal career site.

Name: Senior Business Operations Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY Working under general direction, provides complex operations and administrative support for a business unit or large department. Coordinates and oversees budgeting, process improvement, controls for specialized software and other functions enabling the department to meet objectives in an effective and efficient manner. Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations and communicates with other departments as necessary.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Analyzes monthly department budget reports to maintain expense controls. Prepares commentary and explanation of variances for management review. Recommends revised controls and implements improvements as approved by management.Monitors invoicing for expenses to ensure compliance with established policy, service contracts and other operating constraints. Works with appropriate departments to define and implement accounting standards for complex transactions or special projects.Acts as system administrator for specialized software utilized by the business group to support its operations. Maintains systems by researching and resolving problems, maintaining system integrity and security. Coordinates software/release upgrades with IT. Prepares and provides training and reference material to assist users.Troubleshoots and resolves complex inquiries and requests from internal and external clients.Reviews and monitors department processes and procedures to identify opportunities to improve service delivery to internal and external customers. May network with external contacts to research and recommend best practices.Coordinates budget preparation. Researches and collects input from multiple internal and external resources.Compiles a variety of operating, financial and statistical information as needed to respond to management requests. Coordinates work with other departments and adds commentary to complete analysis reports and proposals.Leads and facilitates communication of best practices, policies, procedures and initiatives to support operations. Establishes processes to share knowledge and implement process improvements. Facilitates process improvement by engaging appropriate resources in issue identification and resolution.Develops project plans and costs, including personnel and fiscal requirements to achieve defined objectives. May provide periodic updates relative to project resource and fiscal plans.Performs other duties as assigned.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May lead project teams and/or plan, and supervise assignments of lower level employees.QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE Bachelor's Degree (BA/BS) or equivalent from four year college or university plus a minimum of five years related work experience to include budgeting, finance and or business analytics; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Work experience related to specific department or business unit function preferred.Tableau experience is strongly desired.CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES NoneCOMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires advanced knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and commissions. Conducts advanced financial analysis.REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills.OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. Spreadsheet skill set to include advanced functions such as graphics, pivot tables, macros and database management required.Tableau experience desired.SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.

Name: IT Business Sr. Analyst
Description: Job Background/Context: This position provides information and insights to the CTI Strategic Support team. The individual in this role will be exposed to CTI’s regional and sector functions, CTI CAO/Business Operations teams, as well as Finance and HR in support of the ongoing maturation and evolution of CTI to an agile yet consistently governed organization. This position requires strong analytical and detailed thinking, highly collaborative and open mindset, and ability to work in “ambiguity” and through iterations. Familiarity with governance models, driving technology and business process analysis/reengineering efforts is critical. Additional knowledge of SDLC and Agile concepts is beneficial. Key Responsibilities: • Provides in-depth analysis and critical thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and make recommendations that influence decisions of key business partners. • Utilizes multiple data sources to validate analytics and assumptions, driving conception and publication of data-driven findings, recommended actions and outputs which feed larger CTI Strategic Support activities. • Utilizes assorted tools/technology (MS PowerPoint, Access, Excel) and tools to automate data gathering and analysis. Rapidly acquires knowledge of target domains (business/function as well as technology), and leverages prior experience, Citi knowledge and subject matter expertise to drive development of key insights and actions. • Works independently, in small teams, or directly with Head of CTI Strategic Support to distill volume of data and analysis into actionable insights and executive-level summaries. Contributes to development of improvement/change strategies. • Assists Strategic Support team to perform strategic evaluations, identify potential gaps and implement corrective actions. Possesses a good understanding of client core business functions. About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.  Skills: 1. Demonstrated thought leadership in financial analysis, organizational strategy, process re-engineering (six sigma, Agile, Lean, etc.) and other transformation capabilities 2. Strong ability to navigate and drive progress in challenging situations. 3. Analytical, driven self-starter with a passion for decomposing complex problems and deliverables, obtaining and analyzing data, deriving actionable insights, and developing succinct, well-crafted summaries and recommendations suitable for publication directly to senior CTI leadership. 4. Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet assigned deadlines. 5. Organized, accurate and detail oriented. 6. Motivated and a quick learner. 7. Advanced skill and proficiency with MS PowerPoint, Excel (data acquisition, analysis, pivot tables), Access & other analysis tools. 8. Strong Presentation skills in PowerPoint. 9. Ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams effectively under pressure in a rapidly changing environment. 10. Proven ability to be comfortable and adaptive with ambiguity. Ability to exchange complex information within team and with others. Knowledge/Experience: • Business process, workflow, financial, business analysis and project delivery. • Knowledge in one or more areas of Core Infrastructure / Data Centre Technologies. • Broad-based knowledge of other functional and technical areas. • Ability to exercise judgment and evaluate options under circumstances not covered by procedures or precedents.

Name: Business Analyst Ii

Name: Specialist, Business Analyst
Description: If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online. Job DescriptionOverview: The Business Intelligence and Analytics team provides transactional and financial insights to management by analyzing trends in sales, gains, losses, margin and other key performance metrics to drive strategic and operational performance optimization. The team is also responsible for providing analytics support and reporting services for driving ongoing performance improvements for other business units.  Within TXU Energy, the Specialist job function has lead and subject matter expert responsibility for analyzing and developing improvements to business processes, identifying and facilitating the creation of appropriate reporting and definition around each function, managing and integrating processes relating to operations, and delivering an improved customer experience. Responsibilities:Deliver key insights by uncovering root causes for trends in sales, gains, losses and swaps by transaction type, channel, campaign, product and over time. Ability to derive insights from complex data for presentation and decision making.Partner with our Marketing, Credit and Information Technology team to develop / deliver structured and ad-hoc reporting that supports analytical groups across the company utilizing tools such as SAS and SQL for data extraction and Tableau, Excel and others for visualization.Partner with our modeling team to create models which help improve customer retention, acquisition and improve customer value.Provide deep-dive analytical support for various sales channels, including campaign performance measurement. Focus on acquisition and retention performance optimization by analyzing current processes.Analyze financial impact of trends and opportunities leveraging business metrics of success such as NPV, PV/I etc. to develop financially justifiable recommendations.Partner with Pricing and Performance Management teams to build and further improve relevant business cases. Perform sensitivity analyses for key assumptions and market scenarios, as necessary.Partner with business functions across the company and with acquisition, retention and service channels, including reactive and targeted call centers, Door to door, DM, Online and others to provide relevant, insightful, timely and accurate views of performance and incentive reportingRequirements:Bachelors with 5+ years or Masters plus 2+ years of relevant industry experienceExcellent business, financial and analytical acumenPrior experience in extracting and analyzing large volume of data using SAS / SQL or other large data analysis tools.Very strong Microsoft Excel & Power-point skillsExperience in a customer-focused and/or relationship building roleProject Management / Planning & Leadership SkillsStrong problem solving and analytical skills•Prior experience in creating visual dashboards using tools like Tableau is highly preferredExcellent inter-personal, communication skill and Presentation skillsPrior experience in big data technologies like Hadoop/HANA, Voice Analytics desirablePrior experience in Web technologies desirablePrior experience with data modeling desirableVery high level of initiative in terms of learning the business and designing valuable analysesOn-time production of analyses and results of the highest integrity and qualityAbility to adapt and work in complex and ever changing environmentDevelopment of clear, concise, and effective executive level reporting and presentationsJob FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyTXU Retail Services CompanyLocationsIrving, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to: Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication. Ability to communicate with people at all levels;Be comfortable in fast paced environment and management of multiple initiatives simultaneously;Strong analytical skills and demonstrated understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into requirements;Excellent in writing effective client documentation including functional specifications, process flow maps, and use cases;Expert in all tools including MS Word, Powerpoint, Excel, and Visio;Past experience in Confluence helpful but not required;Ability to work independently as well as within a goal oriented project team.

Name: Business Analyst 3 Core
Description: Business Analyst 3 Core I. DESCRIPTION OF SERVICESThe Department of Information Resources (DIR) requires the services of one or more Business Analysts, hereafter referred to as Worker(s), who meets the general qualifications of ITSAC Business Analyst 3 Category, Core Technology Type and the specifications outlined in this document for the Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts (CPA).   All work products resulting from the project shall be considered “works made for hire” and are the property of the CPA. CPA may include pre-selection requirements that potential Vendors (and their Workers) submit to and satisfy criminal background checks as authorized by the Texas law. CPA will pay no fees for interviews or discussions, which occur during the process of selecting a Worker(s).  Worker will performs highly advanced analysis and programing tasks such as:• Work with programmers and business analysts to develop Business Application Overview for the Business Information Model (BIM) sections of the Integrated Tax System (ITS).• Develop detailed documentation for each section of the Business Information Model (BIM) sections of the Integrated Tax System (ITS).• Work with other IT sections to collect and customize application-specific instructional material for the development of new hires• Assist with the development of application-specific training materials for the development of new hires A senior level Business Analyst must have a strong background in the Texas Comptroller’s Integrated Tax System with experience with Natural Programming, TSO, DB2 and SQL in a zOS environment, Endevor, PAC, and Infopac. Must be able to quickly develop expertise in complex systems, be quality conscious and be dedicated to delivering quality products on time and on budget. Worker must cross-train and transfer knowledge to and from current CPA staff. Onsite Requirement: Worker will be required to work onsite with the team. Working remotely will be limited and must be pre-approved by the Project Manager/Direct Supervisor WORKER SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS  • Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills • Must be able to work independently• Must be able to work in a diverse team environment• Must possess problem-solving skills and ability to multi-task• Must be able to retain knowledge of environment and systems once given instruction• Knowledge of project management and software development methodologies• Must be able to work around projects and deadlines with readiness to put in extra efforts when necessary• Perform related work as assignedMinimum Requirements: Years Skills/Experience 8 Extensive experience with gathering, creating, and maintaining documentation of business requirements and information system processes 8 Detailed knowledge of all processes of the Texas Comptroller’s Integrated Tax System from Tax Payer Setup through Return Processing, Collections, Allocations and Reporting 3 Experience with software development processes  3 Experience working with application programmers 3 Familiar with mainframe application programming tools such as Natural, JCL, TSO, QMF, SQL, and DB2. 3 Experience in unit and system integration testing of developed application 3 Experience developing training material for programmers and business users. 3 Extensive experience with highly complex security application requirementsPreferences: Years Skills/Experience 8 Proficient with the Microsoft Office products, including Microsoft Project, Word, Visio, Excel and PowerPoint 3 Assist with the development of Training Materials III. TERM OF SERVICEWork Order Term: 3 – 3.5 Months February 15, 2016 thru May 15, 2016. 519 hours per worker.  Estimated hours for FY16: 1300. This assignment may be extended based on project need and funding. IV. WORK HOURS AND LOCATIONA. Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the CPA. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00AM to 5:00PM, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed. *Candidate may have to work evenings or weekends in order to meet business needs and or deadlines.B. The primary work location(s) will be at 111 E. 17th Street, Austin, Texas 78774. Any and all travel, per diem, parking, and/or living expenses shall be at the Worker’s and/or Vendor’s expense.C. CPA will provide pre-approved, written authorization for travel for any services to be performed away from the primary work location(s). Pre-approved travel expenses are limited to the rates and comply with the rules prescribed by the State of Texas for travel by its classified employees, including any requirement for original receipts. D. The Worker(s) may be required to work outside the normal business hours on weekends, evenings and holidays, as requested. Payment for work over 40 hours will be at the hourly rate quoted and must be coordinated and pre-approved through CPA.  ESPONSE DEADLINE for consideration and should be received by February 2, 2016 @ 5:00 PM (CT).
