Name: Graduates - Future Leaders Program – Analyst
Description: Intake Year: 2019 Sectors: Research and Analysis, Product Management About IHS Markit Named ‘Most Influential Tech Analyst Firm in 2018’, IHS Markit are at the forefront of the digital and technological revolution. At IHS Markit, we deliver impactful, real-world analytics and intelligence for industries and markets all around the world – in everything from finance to aerospace. The products, services and information we provide will uncover more intelligent solutions to today’s most critical business challenges. IHS Markit is a global leader in information, analytics and solutions for the major industries and markets that drive economies worldwide. We partner with clients in business, finance and government to help them see the big picture with unrivalled insights that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. The role Understanding the latest trends and leveraging sharp analytical skills and specialized industry expertise, our analysts deliver the data rich insights that guide our clients in long term decision making. If you are passionate about building the story behind the data, and becoming an industry or product specialist, then the Analyst stream is for you. Opportunities within this stream include: Research and AnalysisProduct Management On our Future Leaders Program, you will join a team of industry experts who will work with you to accelerate your development. We take a holistic approach to your learning, and with world-leading development opportunities at its core, we’ll help you focus on building the skills you’ll need to achieve your goals. What we're looking for We seek candidates with diverse backgrounds and ideas with a desire to learn and thrive. The programme will provide you with a variety of experiences to help you identify your strengths develop highly transferable skills and align you to a successful career path for a bright future at IHS Markit. To be an ideal fit for the role, you'll have: Be legally eligible to work for the duration of the program in the country for which you applyA Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree (or equivalent) completed no later than September 2019This program is aimed at graduates with 0-12 months relevant experienceDemonstrated passion or interest in one or more of our key industriesStrong critical thinking and problem-solving skillsExcellent communication skillsAn ability to learn and adapt quickly in a rapidly changing environmentThe ability to build strong working relationships in a collaborative settingFor our Analyst applicants, we recommend the following:With depth of knowledge key to providing industry leading advice, it can be advantageous to have a study background in a field relevant to your team/roleHow to applySubmit your online application, which should include your CV, along with a short cover letter/motivational statement (we suggest around 300 words). We want to hear more about you; why you’re interested in joining IHS Markit, and why you’re interested in being considered for the role/s you have applied for.We are active in a wide number of industries – if you’re not yet sure which industry would best suit you, that’s no problem, we’re happy to help guide you. If you do have a specific preference, please ensure you include this information so that you are considered for the most relevant roles.Our assessment process The assessment process that follows is designed to ensure you can learn more about us, showcase your skills and find a role that is right for you. Stage 1: Submit CV & Covering Letter Stage 2: HireVue video interviews Stage 3: Final stage assessment day  You may be considered for multiple suitable roles throughout this process. If these roles fall within the same stream, you will be assessed during the same process. If the roles fall across multiple streams, you may be asked to complete different assessments aligned to those roles.  We recruit on a rolling basis and most of our assessment days are due to take place in early 2019. We recommend early application. Our commitment to diversity Our business and our customers are diverse, and we believe that embracing a diverse and inclusive environment is key to defining who we are. Our people are what makes us unique and you will get the opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from across the world who continuously find the best possible solutions, adding value and driving change for our customers.  It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Right to Work  Pay Transparency Policy  E-VerifyCurrent ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Name: Email Marketing Analyst
Description: COMPANY OVERVIEWFor over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 40 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com, LastCall.com, and CUSP.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates works towards the goal of enabling our customer to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.Email Marketing Analyst  Neiman MarcusOverviewThe Email Marketing Analyst is responsible for supporting the Email Marketing Team in analyzing and compiling email channel results to support benchmarking and program optimization. This person will contribute to quarterly calendar planning by aggregating prior year’s performance for editorial and promotional campaigns and identifying opportunities for growth. This person will also provide post-launch analysis and partner with the Email team to deliver actionable insights to cross functional partners such as Merchant, Creative, and Site teams.This role will partner closely with the Customer Insights & Analytics team in developing dashboards and enhancing our tagging processes so that reporting coincides with align with changes to our business. This role will also support the team in tracking and executing our robust A/B testing agenda that aligns with our organizational strategic objectives.This role is very detail-oriented and requires adaptability in covering a variety of duties and tasks on a daily basis.DutiesCreate and distribute KPI reports relating to email campaigns and assigned projects, driving to insights and recommendations.Proactively learn about customer behavior and engage in understanding other reporting and customer analytics that might influence email channel improvementsSupport Customer Analytics and Email Managers in development and execution of test plans and prepare results summariesSupport maintenance and improvements to customer contact mapSupport ad hoc email reporting requestsCommunicate effectively with Marketing, Creative, Merchandising, Advertising, Customer Insights & Analytics, and Email Service Provider on performanceJob Requirements:1-2 years’ experience in online marketing, email experience preferredStrong analytical abilityStrong communication and organizational skills; extremely detail-orientedHighly proficient in MS Excel, and familiarity with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, and TableauSelf-starter, able to work with minimal supervisionBachelor’s degree in Marketing or a related fieldOccasional ability to work outside normal business hours

Name: Client Benefit Analyst -Dallas, Texas
Description: Company :United Concordia Companies IncJob Description : JOB SUMMARYThis job provides account support activities associated with the administration of all experience rated and community rated dental groups. The incumbent is responsible for providing or coordinating prompt support to UCCI Sales and Service personnel, group administrators, brokers, and Agent Plan personnel to ensure the resolution of issues related to benefit interpretations, customer service inquiries, claims adjudication, benefits issues, membership and billing activity, etc. This job is ultimately responsible for ongoing account retention, satisfaction, and administration, complementing the efforts of Sales and Service Executives. This activity is intensified and focused for new accounts. This additionally includes identifying and resolving problems related to benefit interpretations, rating concerns and any subsequent adjudication requirements. To this end, the incumbent cultivates and maintains efficient working relationships with key internal areas, such as Customer Service Operations (Claims, Dental Benefits, Customer Service, Membership & Billing), Provider Data Management, Underwriting, and Professional Relations. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIESProvide account support activities associated with the administration of all experience rated and community rated dental groups. The Client Benefit Analyst is responsible for providing or coordinating prompt support to UCCI Sales and Service Personnel, group administrators, brokers, and Agent Plan personnel to ensure the resolution of issues related to benefit interpretations, customer service inquiries, claims adjudication, benefits issues, membership and billing activity, etc.Collect and analyze customer specific information including gathering data from multiple sources related to Benefit/Claim Utilization, Enrollment, Networks (utilization, disruption, geo-access) and making recommendations based on the results of their data analysis. This includes benefits design analysis based on benefit utilization while factoring in financial analysis to determine cost impact.Representing UCD at Client meetings, including but not limited to, Open Enrollment meetings and Health and Wellness fairs. The Client Benefit Analyst is expected to sell at member level for both renewal and new business clients at open enrollment in addition to acting as an oral health wellness consultant at renewal and new business client wellness events. Other duties as assigned.EDUCATIONRequiredAssociate's Degree in Business Administration/ManagementPreferredBachelor's Degree in Business Administration/ManagementEXPERIENCERequired3 - 5 years Sales Support experience1 - 3 years Dental Insurance Industry experiencePreferred1 - 3 years of Dental Sales experienceLICENSES OR CERTIFICATIONSRequiredProducer's License - Accident & Health, or within 45 days of hire.SKILLSAnalytical SkillsCommunication SkillsTravel Required0% - 25%Disclaimer: The job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and essential duties and responsibilities of work performed by employees within this job title. It may not contain a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees to do this job.Compliance Requirement: This position adheres to the ethical and legal standards and behavioral expectations as set forth in the code of business conduct and company policies.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Highmark Health and its affiliates prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation/gender identity or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Highmark Health and its affiliates take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation/gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Name: Performance Analyst - FUTURE OPPORTUNITY
Description: We’re here to ensure the advertising industry and the people in it are healthy and engaging positively and effectively with those around them. We’re here, ultimately, to improve the lives of people working in the media industry. And we take our responsibility seriously.  PERFORMANCE ANALYST ABOUT THE ROLE The Campaign Performance Analyst will be responsible for working with internal teams on specific accounts to align campaign objectives and KPIs, develop performance measurement plans, and recommendations for campaign optimization. This position is responsible for developing and delivering insightful and actionable reports that tell a performance story. It will have a strong focus on insights vs. observations with responsibility for driving performance outcomes and optimized media investment priorities. The priority for this position is working across the internal team to deliver optimal performance to drive client growth, retention and high levels of client satisfaction. ABOUT THE TEAM The Performance Analytics team has a passion for analytics and a common vision for improvement and growth. As trusted advisors to both our internal teams and clients, our time is split between diving deep into rows of data, showing off our reporting dashboards, and educating our clients on KPIs, tools and evolving methodologies. Among our supportive team network you can often find us showing off the creative reporting templates and custom dashboards that make us proud. CORE RESPONSIBILITIESAlign campaign objectives and KPIs and develop performance measurement plans and recommendations for campaign optimization.Develop and deliver insightful and actionable reports that tell the performance story of the campaign.Partner with Client and Media Services, Search, and Social team members to develop forward-looking campaigns based on historical performance insights.Present reports, optimization recommendations, and insights to both client and internal audiencesUnderstand Centro solutions related to analytics and reporting such as ad verification, attribution, brand studies, viewability, etc.Mentor Associate level performance analysts.QUALIFICATIONS2+ years digital media experience, especially in client facing buying or media measurement departmentsBachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing, Business, Statistics or Economics preferredStrong independent thinking and problem solving abilitiesExcellent organization and communication skillsHighly motivated with a strong record of project or process managementStrong qualitative skills with ability to demonstrate quality data organization and analysis techniquesUnderstanding of media buying and ad serving landscapeStrong knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelAbility to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, under tight deadlinesExceptional customer service and communication skillsAdaptable and flexibleA fun, positive attitude that embodies the Centro’s culture Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law. Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law.

Optimization, and Relationship Marketing)  + SME on ALL Marketing Technology systems (e.g. Adobe Digital Asset Management (DAM), BrandPoint, Spredfast (Social Media), Print Vendor Enhancements are met and delivered  + May include some supervisory responsibilities  + May direct work to vendors and consultants *Bachelor Degree, at least 5 years of BSA experience, and a good Name: Technical Business Analyst, Summer 2019 Internship
Description: Job Description About Jack Henry & Associates, Inc.  Jack Henry & Associates, Inc.® is a leading provider of technology solutions and payment processing services primarily for the financial services industry. Its solutions serve more than 9,000 customers nationwide and are marketed and supported through three primary brands. We may have 38 office locations, approximately 6,400 Associates, and generate $1.5 billion in revenue, but we are One Team. Join in the fun – apply to be a part of our Corporate Intern Team and impact tomorrow’s technology products.  About The Program  This is a 10-week program that begins June 3, 2019. This is a paid opportunity where a college student learns through application. JHA interns are fully immersed in the day to day activities of the business unit they are working in. Throughout the duration of the program, students will build upon their current skillsets and work in a collaborative environment while learning from subject matter experts across the organization. JHA Corporate Interns will participate in projects and company objectives that will result in creative solutions that inspire innovation both at JHA and across the FinTech industry.  The program kicks off with an orientation that will allow students to learn more about JHA’s award-winning company culture and three brands – Jack Henry Banking, Symitar, and ProfitStars. The internship will end with a trip to the corporate headquarters and a student led presentation. This presentation is an opportunity for all interns to showcase their internship experience with other JHA Associate’s.  Internship Description  JHA’s Enterprise Payment Solutions, a strategic component of JHA Payment Solutions, is seeking a business-minded, detail-oriented college student to join their Corporate Internship Program for Summer 2019. The EPS department provides the comprehensive SmartPay platform that provides an integrated suite of payment solutions that supports the entire payment life cycle by seamlessly accepting, processing, and settling virtually every payment type generated in every payment channel.  The chosen candidate will interact with technical teams to convey business requirements, work with industry research groups to prepare for product trends and learn how to create business requirements and system documentation, as well as contribute to end-user and project management documentation.  Main objectives provided to the intern will include:  Financial under-writing through application support  Engagement with the new Riskforce platform – development and design.  Preferred Qualifications Include:  Strong analytical, problem-solving, and resolution skills  Strong communication skills  Strong writing skills  Basic understanding of the Fintech industry  Basic IT skills  Passion for math and statistics  Minimum Qualifications Students Must: Attend an accredited college or university.  Pursue a bachelor’s degree or higher in: Finance, Accounting, Business Management, Insurance, Risk Management & Insurance, or Financial Services Management  Have a cumulative 3.0 GPA.  Remain in good academic standing throughout internship.  Meet JHA employment requirements.  Be able to work up to 40 hours per week throughout the summer internship.  Be able to travel 25% of the time.  Be a junior or senior student (sophomore year completed) at the beginning of internship.  Meet legal requirements to work in the U.S. for an indefinite period of time. Equal Employment OpportunityApplicants for U.S. based positions with Jack Henry & Associates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.Jack Henry & Associates, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and maintains a Drug-Free Workplace.Females, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Name: Financial/ Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Global Financial Firm located in Irving, TX has an immediate contract opportunity for an experienced Analyst  The Cyber Security & Network Services (CS&NS) organization is responsible for the management of critical security & network infrastructure, services, and monitoring across the enterprise on a global level.  The CS&NS Business Operations & Shared Services organization aims at allowing CS&N to maintain its focus on strategic initiatives and key programs related to improving the experience of customers and employees, increased productivity, and strengthened controls.  Program/Project Management The Cyber Security & Network Services Business Management Analyst reports directly to the CS&NS Global Business Manager, and is responsible for supporting the centralized management of Investments, Financials and Commercial Transactions. Key Responsibilities: " Oversee, centralize and manage Commercial Transactions for Cyber Security & Network investments; responsible for obtaining business and financial approval for all transactions  " Assess global financial impact for Network and Security purchases  " Accountability for tracking end-to-end procurement process from initial engagement to procurement system processing for purchase orders, etc.  " Invoice management to ensure timely and accurate payments; ensure accruals and taxes are appropriately handled  " MIS Reporting for Senior Management, status updates on investments, financial recognition, commercials, etc.  " Liaise with regional finance teams to ensure proper financial tracking and reporting based off regional/country regulatory or internal requirements  " Provide inputs to investment plan and outlook process  " Create financial presentations for senior management around the current and upcoming years' strategies  " Create and support Initiative Expenditure Proposals (IEPs) for capital purchases greater than $100M outlining the business and financial impact, project milestones, risks and savings.  " Build and maintain relationships with internal and external customers, and business partners  " Develop an inventory system to reconcile purchases with actual devices live on Client's internal network to align actual financial impact with purchases and budgets " Qualifications: " Min. 3-5 years of experience in financial analysis, understanding of Capital Expenditure, depreciation of assets  " Strong analytical and mathematical skills  " Experience with excel formulas and formatting  " Knowledge of basic financial accounting principles  " Experience with MIS reporting, creating management reporting and metrics  " Knowledge and experience in tracking investment expenditures

Name: Sr. Financial Business Analyst
Description: Established, Entrepreneurial, Empowered…Explore the Opportunities!NCH Corporation – Sr. Financial Business AnalystNCH is currently looking for a Sr. Financial Business Analyst to support NCH China. The individual will assist Finance in FP&A (Financial, Planning & Analysis) for the China division. We offer opportunities for career advancement, and a culture that recognizes results, while embracing the importance of work/life balance. Join our team as a Sr. Financial Business Analyst, where our future begins with you!Responsibilities:Lead the annual planning process for the China division, including income statement, balance sheet and cash flows. Analyze historical performance and industrial trends to set up financial targets for the regions, and assist regions in formulating business plans.Manage monthly forecast, consolidate and present forecast to China management to facilitate executive-level business decisions.Develop and maintain financial models/tools for planning/forecast and analysis, and roll out the models/tools.Coordinate monthly financial reviews to analyze financial results, review variances vs. plan and prior year, and develop action plans to meet financial targets.Assist management in preparing presentations to the Executive Committee for quarterly meetings, the annual plan meeting, and other executive events.Perform in-depth analysis to identify issues and opportunities; recommend strategies and solutions to increase revenue, reduce cost, and improve profitability.Update and maintain a Balanced Scorecard reporting system, deliver monthly balanced scorecards for business performance tracking and benchmarking.Create queries with Business Objects, Oracle Discoverer and other business database querying tools, analyze and provide input for performance evaluation and business decisions.Use NPV, IRR, ROI and other financial techniques to analyze business initiatives, including but not limited to capital investment, variable contribution, pricing, and product launches.Requirements:Undergraduate degree in Finance or Business disciplines, preferably accounting.5+ years of experience in financial and business analysis, with proven ability to dissect business issues, present data in a simple and compelling way, and present to higher level managementBilingual fluency in Mandarin Chinese (preferred) and EnglishInternational business experience preferred. Experience with China highly desiredDemonstrated advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Power Point, Visual Basic, Access and Business Object preferredAdvanced knowledge of business concepts and tools (NPV, ROI, Break-even, cost-benchmarking, pricing, sensitivity analysis, etc.)Advanced understanding of common financial reports and financial metrics (Income statement, Cash Flow Statement, Balance Sheet)Experience with Oracle or similar ERP software preferredHighly motivated, self-directed, flexible team player with demonstrated ability to thrive in a business-critical high stress environmentAbility to work collaboratively with management level and executive personnelSelf motivated, organized and goal oriented with a keen attention to detailSolid communication skills; ability to develop a method for presenting information in a simple yet impactful wayMust be willing to relocate to Dalian ChinaEqual Opportunity EmployerWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  With minimal supervision and working at the highest technical level of most phases of business analysis, this position collaborates with others to develop new products and enhance existing products. This includes project definition and solution design for requested product and operational enhancements for existing products and internal systems.  REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTING  This position typically performs work at a WageWorks location with significant technical resources and reports to a Director or VP level with enterprise-wide product development responsibility.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES  NOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent’s performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent’s immediate supervisor or manager.  1. Work closely with internal teams (service teams, technical staff, sales, marketing, and operations) and external teams (clients, partners and service vendors) to enhance current products and develop new ones.  2. Provide input into and oversight of project definition and solution design for requested new products, product features, and operational enhancements for internal systems.  3. Act as the liaison between the business units and the technology organization, to manage business priorities, communicate changes in scope or schedule, and call out risks.  2. Perform impact assessment and define the scope of requested product changes, enhancements, new products and new systems.  3. Adhere to and assist product management and other project requestors in adhering to the appropriate software product development process.  4. Define the scope of projects including all internal and external user touch points and processes.  5. Create detailed functional requirement specifications based on defined business requirements.  6. Identify tasks and work with the development team to estimate development costs for proposed projects.  7. Drive and project manage product development projects from inception to customer delivery.  MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS  1. May provide assistance with product development efforts to test products and ensure that systems provide the result or perform as intended.  2. May develop training materials and provide product training to staff and users of product enhancements for which functional requirements have been created.  3. Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.  ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS  WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the eight Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance.  Clients and Participants Come First: Exceeding client and participant expectations is our highest priority  Integrity: We are open, honest, ethical and conscientious  Passion: A will to win and a relentless drive for excellence  Accountability: Deliver on commitments and take ownership for solving problems and creating solutions  Leadership and Influence: Our actions inspire vision and clarity of purpose  Continuous Improvement and Innovation: We embrace change and drive new ideas into business solutions  Dignity and Respect: We value the diversity of our people, encourage their development and reward their performance  Creating Value for Shareholders: Deliver consistent growth and premium returns  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY  NOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.  No formal supervisory authority entailed. This position will act as a resource to less-experienced Business Analysts and may provide matrixed leadership for assigned projects.  ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES  EDUCATION:  Knowledge of software development and/or business management as normally obtained through completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science/engineering, Business, or a related degree. Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) certification is desirable.  WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE:  The knowledge, skill and ability to create detailed functional requirements for software development projects as described as normally obtained through a minimum of 10 or more years progressively responsible business analysis experience.  SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:  Requires the highest level of understanding of the business, technology strategy and platforms, and functional transactions to perform business analysis as described.  Consumer marketing or product management experience in the consumer or financial services industry including:  • Familiarity with Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA) and Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) programs.  • Direct contact with both employers and employees in an HR or employee benefits-related capacity.  • Project management experience.  • Familiarity with financial services, general accounting principles, bank account reconciliation practices, and operational processes.  A high level of employee benefits knowledge and significant experience as a service or account manager for a group health plan provider, broker agency or benefits consultant, including a keen understanding of benefits administration from an employer’s perspective (the employer/vendor relationship as well as the employer/employee relationship, is strongly preferred.  Must have a high level of interpersonal and communication skills and an exceptional ability to work well with others to effectively interact with internal and external customers and department staff, as described above. The ability to build relationships, influence key decision-makers, and collaborate on a cross-functional team comprised of diverse personalities, skill sets, and levels of experience is required.  The ability to work in a fast-paced, high energy environment that requires flexibility and the capacity to quickly learn and assimilate information/new skills is essential. Must possess the ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Outstanding organizational skills, follow-up skills, focus and attention to detail.  Incumbents must have the ability to use initiative and work independently as well as collaboratively with a team.  EQUIPMENT:  A high level of proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, Excel, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required. Knowledge and familiarity with standard project management tools is required.  TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONS  Travel may be required as necessary to meet with internal and external clients.  WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDS  Work is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDS  Work requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with constant interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 20 lbs. Incumbent may experience elevated levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.

Here at PrimeLending, our culture is built around one simple belief – investing in our talented, dedicated employees.  PrimeLending is currently seeking a Business Analysis Manager that will be responsible for providing hands-on management and leadership on organizational initiatives to a team of Business Analysts, while occasionally participating as a seasoned Business Analyst for their own set of projects. This position will ensure that correct business functionality, requirements, and industry standards are addressed to provide the most efficient solutions. Name: Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst with on-line and mobile experience in an agile environment to contribute toward the success of our digital technology initiatives with the overall goal of allowing our Servicing customers to self-serve using a variety of channels. Specific responsibilities include: * Support in the development and delivery of the CBSS servicing digital roadmap with a focus on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. * Analysis, design, and testing in support of business and technology improvements from planning through implementation in an agile environment to support the following capabilities: customer communications, payments, statements & documents, default, and portal solutions. * Develops and maintains detailed knowledge of business's current technology and USB on-line capabilities and roadmap along with supporting and leading future technology capabilities. * Develops an on-going support model to ensure on-going availability and support for the digital solution(s) * Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. * Works with technology and application development teams to design or select solutions that appropriately meet the business needs for large and complex projects. * Reviews and coordinates execution of automated test plans while looking for opportunities to improve testing process. Position is responsible for supporting the implementation of the digital strategy to support CBSS Servicing. The digital strategic roadmap for CBSS Servicing focuses on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. Overall capabilities covered include: customer communications, account management, payments, default, and Responsive Web solutions. Technical scope spans technology platforms ranging from Mainframe systems, Mobile Technologies, On-line, imaging, middleware, and ETL toolsets. Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship. Basic Qualifications * Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience * At least 6 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications. Preferred Skills/Experience Extensive experience in: * On-line and mobile implementations * Information management * Agile software development * IT project management * System analysis * System testing with experience in test automation * IT standards, procedures, policy * Business assessment * Mortgage and Consumer Servicing experience a plus Subject matter expert in: * Requirements analysis with knowledge of test driven requirements * Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with various levels of management and within technology and business * Excellent facilitation skills with business users, business leaders, technology peers and outsourced resources * Self-motivated and takes ownership and accountability for results * Excellent analytical, interpersonal, organizational, and problem-solving skills preferred * Must be an independent, self-starting team player and have the ability to perform in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment * Provide leadership and mentoring to less experienced analysts and collaborate with internal and external teams * Ability to work in a matrix environment across multiple projects and technologies * Knowledge of Six Sigma and Lean concepts a plus * Knowledge of the TFS system and agile backlog and tracking a plusSDL2017

Name: Acquisition Marketing Analyst
Description: Hotels.comAcquisition Marketing Analyst Are you passionate about data and analytics? Would you like to play a key role in a team that is solving the toughest problems in online marketing, in partnership with some of the brightest and most advanced marketers in the world? And all of that whilst working in the dynamic, competitive, customer-focused and data-rich world of online travel?  Hotels.com are looking for an astute, consultative, passionate, individual with a strong analytical background to fill the Acquisition Marketing Analyst role. The role, and team, will have analytical ownership of high-visibility initiatives across Search Engine Marketing and Online Advertising, furthering our understanding and driving strategic decisions within a core part of our business.  As part of the Acquisition Marketing Analytics team, you will be working closely with the other 7 highly skilled analysts within the team, as well as colleagues across all Hotels.com functions such as Marketing, Finance, Data Science and Online Product. You will also collaborate with experts at our key marketing partners such as Google and Facebook.  This job is for you if youre looking for a role where you can apply your analytical talents and extraordinary problem-solving skills to become an expert in online marketing analytics, within a dynamic, fast-paced and fun business. What Youll Do:Applying advanced analytical techniques to identify optimization levers and influence marketing strategyCollaborating with our Marketing Data Science team to find opportunities and embed machine learning techniques within our marketing activitiesCrafting and evaluating tests to optimize incremental customer acquisitionUnderstanding and actively communicating factors affecting trading performance to stakeholders including Hotels.com leadership teamPartnering with our Digital Analytics and Data Engineering teams to ensure robust and accurate data capture and continuous improvement of data available for both analytics and the wider businessCollaborating with other team members, marketing partners and analysts across EG sister brands to share knowledge and best practicesWho You Are:Experience of using R (or similar tools) to structure, transform and visualize big dataStrong SQL skills a requirement hands on use of big data in large projects using Hadoop, Presto or Spark a bonusExperience within a large ecommerce environment and understanding of online marketing beneficial1+ years experience in an advanced analytics roleBachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Data Science or similarA relevant Masters degree a plusWhy Join Us: Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where extraordinary people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.  Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We passionately strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.  If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.  Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.  *LI-BSTEWARD  LPS-ARM-NAExpedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

Name: Agile Analyst
Description: We currently have an Agile Analystcareer opportunity at our Dallas, TX location.  Essilor is an international company and the leading provider of eyeglass lenses in the world. Our mission is improving lives by improving sight, and we work every day to bring good vision to the 4.5 billion people around the globe in need of visual correction. Our products such as Varilux®, Crizal® and Transitions® are available in more than 130 countries and are worn by one billion people daily. Essilor of America and its subsidiary, Essilor Laboratories of America, Inc., employ more than 7,000 in the U.S. and own the largest and most comprehensive optical laboratory network in the U.S.Position SummaryDigital is at the heart of consumer awareness and interaction (search, select, buy) in our category and plays a key role in delivering on our Mission and growth objectives. Towards this end, we seek to establish a leadership position in providing consumers with information and tools to enhance their vision.The Agile Analyst combines the product owner and business analyst personas into a single role that helps shape the work of software development teams. The Agile Analyst focuses on ensuring that true business value is delivered by distilling the needs of our customer representatives and the team into clear language. He/she is naturally curious, a deep listener, and is able to unify the divergent opinions of stakeholders. The Agile Analyst is able to take high level requirements and break them down into specific, implementable requirements for the development team.Key Areas of ResponsibilitiesScope of the role:The role involves analyzing stakeholders’ needs, building these needs into workable user stories and managing various backlogs for Essilor’s Digital Acceleration team.Specific Responsibilities of the Role Include:− Capture the intent of stake holders into clear, concise user stories and acceptance criteria.− Construct simple wireframes, flow documents, and low fidelity mockups.− Decompose high level stories into specific, implementable requirements that are clear, concise, and ready for the development team to implement.− Lead sprint planning, story grooming, and demo sessions.− Analyze a broadly-defined area and, using functional decomposition, define user stories and create a well-organized, value-driven framework to provide the required business value in initiatives.− Educate the larger DITAC team in agile workflows and processes.− Recommend changes or improvements with a focus on business value and needs of DITAC.Candidate ProfileKnowledge / ExperienceDivisional or BU Experience - Experience in a Global business UnitExperience / Track Record - Understands the multiple dimensions of the business needs, from the potential impact of processes on key metrics to the impacts of the new/changed business processes.− Has experience using a variety of modeling tools and agile techniques to help customer representatives discover the range of user stories which will ultimately make up the system.− Understands the various ways the broad community of users will need to interact with the system.− Listens to and can positively reconcile the divergent needs of disparate stakeholders to identify designs that will work.Industries Experience - Business, IT, SoftwareGeographical Experience - Global experience highly preferredQualificationsEducation / Qualification / Certification - Degree in Business, Communications, Statistics, IT or related field preferred.Language - Excellent proficiency in English. Proficiency in other languages is a plus.Psychometrics - Broad range of investigative and interpersonal skills5-7 Years of experience− Ability to think critically and skeptically− Ability to reach consensus among different parties− Willing to stretch and learn new skills− Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)− Able to work with different groups to get work done− Works well in a team− Positive can do attitude and a passion for software.− Good understanding of IT software (not coding specifically)− Able to create compelling user stories Back  Share

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply! About Genesis10: Genesis10 is a leading U.S. business and technology consulting firm with hundreds of clients needing proven talent and solutions to power their strategic initiatives. If you are a high performing business or IT professional with solid, referenced experience, we want to meet you. Genesis10 recruiters and delivery professionals are highly accomplished career advocates, who get to know you beyond your resume to position you with the opportunities that fit your skills, experience and aspirations. We have benefit options to fit your needs and a support staff that works with you from placement throughout your engagement - project after project. Name: Strategic Business Analyst II
Description: DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY:  Under the direction of the Center of Excellence System Director, the Strategic Business Analysts have the responsibility of assisting in the development and recommendation of IT strategies related to IT systems and solutions used within CHRISTUS Health. This position will assist in understanding the current environment and continually scan the horizon to bring solutions for gaps in current technologies. The Strategic Business Analysts serves as a business relationship link between business units and the leadership level. Must be able to synthesize and translate research and trends into strong actionable insights in order to address business challenges relative to meet the ever-changing healthcare landscape. Name: IBM Security - X-Force - Strategic Cyber Threat Analyst - IRIS
Description: Job DescriptionIBM X-Force Incident Response & Intelligence Services (IRIS) is looking for a Cyber Threat Analyst to join their X-Force IRIS Threat Analysis group (TAG). The candidate will provide industry-leading threat intelligence services across several security domains in an exciting and growing security delivery organization within IBM.The primary responsibility of this team is to triage open source intelligence (OSINT). TAG then creates intelligence collections on the X-Force Exchange (XFE), and publishes a daily newsletter out to IBM and to IBMs Security customers. This newsletter, known as the X-Force Threat Assessment Service (XFTAS), is the main communication channel with clients and is used to deliver cyber security news, information on emerging threats, and many other security-oriented intelligence items.Cyber Threat Analysts will also work with teams across and external to IBM Security to support the intelligence needs of the organization, foster collaboration and promote IBMs thought leadership in the cyber security space. Analysts will be involved in the development of content for external publication, including, but not limited to: XFTAS and X-Force Exchange Collections.Cyber Threat Analysts will occasionally travel for training, conferences or client engagements.Cyber Threat Analyst Skills:Takes a proactive approach to learning about the latest threats, threat actors, tactics, techniques and procedures and malware.Demonstrates and provides subject matter expertise of the threat landscape including, but not limited to cyber-attack vectors, threat actors, security trends, and security policies and recommendations in both the government and commercial space.Delivers high quality written technical assessments of threats through the X-Force Exchange (XFE) platform. Develops and publishes the X-Force Threat Analysis Service daily threat assessment.Performs multiple assigned technical tasks including research, analysis, solution design, development, product installation, system integration, and possibly root cause analysis of the advisory system when required.Has IT Security Industry experience, work regularly with client teams to develop requirements, plan, design, and generate a solution that meet the client security needs. This often includes using tools and methods to analyze, design and implement client solutions. Has enhanced professional, operational, and inter-personal skills to function effectively in collaborative high stakes and high stress situations with clients.Provides analytical ability and creativity necessary in developing and implementing solution deliverables for medium size projects or components of a larger project. Provides business or technical advice to managers, as well as give consulting, project management or technical direction to team members and/or client personnel. May lead a team on small projects or a segment of larger projects.Assists in the balancing of project management or technical work assignments with team members skills to mitigate risk on the project/engagement/proposals.Possesses strong verbal communication skills to deliver strategic, tactical and operational intelligence to audiences with varying degrees of technical knowledge.Has experience conducting and correlating threat research using OSINT, incident response engagement data, and proprietary tools, performing threat modeling, and producing intelligence threat assessments.Reviews technical literature prepared by other staff members for content, coverage, and clarity.Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned.Required Technical and Professional Expertise2 years experience in Cyber Security.1 years experience exploitation techniques and malware analysis.2 years experience in applying knowledge of information security best practices, threat intelligence research and compromising techniques.1 year technical writing experience.1 year experience with shell scripting (bash) .Knowledge of Windows Internals.Excellent communication skills.Preferred Tech and Prof Experience5 years experience in Cyber Security.3 years experience exploitation techniques and malware analysis.3 years experience in applying knowledge of information security best practices, threat intelligence research and compromising techniques.2 years technical writing experience.MIS/CIS/CS and/or other technology field of study.EO StatementIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Quality Assurance/Compliance Testing Analyst
Description: With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.We’re currently looking for a Quality Assurance/Compliance Testing Analyst to join our team in Irving, TX.This role will be responsible for working closely with the operations and compliance teams to gain complete understanding of current procedures in order to investigate data, identify system and procedural gaps, identify improvements, and report findings to management and specified stakeholders of the business. The Analyst will also be responsible for administering the department software and reconciling any issues with the appropriate stakeholders for Vendor Management or Quality Assurance (Compliance Testing). This role demonstrate strong judgment and critical-thinking skills, related to developing and executing compliance testing and interpreting findings, and excellent interpersonal skills; preferred experience interviewing and interacting with operations subject-matter experts.Job functions Include but are not limited to:Gain understanding of project requirements using various sources such as reports, interviews, documented analysis, requirement workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, task and workflow analysis.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, and perform root cause analysis for identified issues, many of which are complex operation and compliance issues.Collaborate to identify weaknesses in existing procedures, and communicate necessary corrections, including making process or system improvement recommendations.Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and produce accurate and reliable information for decision making on corrective actions.Perform remediation activities, including management escalation and historical reporting.Provide ongoing guidance, support and feedback to business partners to promote a progressive and sustainable compliance culture across the organization, and escalate concerns to the Manager for possible corrective action.Minimum Qualifications:Job Knowledge and Skills: Knowledgeable of compliance laws, rules, regulations, as well as company policies and procedures. Strong foundation in operational processes. Works with a sense of urgency to achieve department goals, while maintaining quality of work; ability to prioritize multiple work assignments with ongoing deadlines. Possess good judgment, business acumen; attention to detail; critical thinking skills. Strong Analytical and problem solving skills. Strong and effective communication (written and verbal) and teaming/interpersonal skills; strong leadership capabilities, and ability to initiate and maintain cross-team relationships. Self-starter; requires minimal supervision.Experience: Minimum 3 years’ experience required in a lending/finance industry operational environment or business analyst experience. Compliance, audit, and/or root cause analysis experience a plus.Education: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited University required.Computer Skills: Advanced knowledge of Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint)Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Drive your career forward and join the company leading the technology and business evolution of the automotive industry by applying today.All of us at Nissan – regardless of functional area or expertise – share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance vehicles. It is Nissan’s policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, military status, disability, or any other status protected by law. Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire. **Visa sponsorship for this position is not available at this time.**Irving Texas United States of America

Name: Business Analyst - Crew Planning & Operations
Description: Business Analyst Crew Planning & OperationsPosition Type: Full Time Department: Ground Summary NAVBLUE, an Airbus Company, is a leading global provider of flight operations solutions which directly support millions of flights each year and help NAVBLUEs airline customers maximize efficiency, reduce costs, ensure compliance with complex national and international safety regulations, and effectively deliver their services.  NAVBLUEs software solutions form integral components of our airline customers operations centres, and we are currently seeking a Business Analyst,who is customer-facing, responsible for eliciting, documenting, communicating and managing business and technical requirements to ensure that the software product delivered by NAVBLUE effectively meets stakeholders needs. This individual is responsible for understanding and assessing a customers business operations, identifying issues and opportunities, recommending appropriate solutions, ensuring proper translation of business requirements into a set of structured business processes, knowledge, technology and organization specifications that satisfies NAVBLUEs customers strategic and operational objectives. The Business Analyst may also perform user acceptance testing.  The incumbent requires extensive knowledge of customers business operations and a thorough understanding of NAVBLUEs solutions, system development and implementation process.  The incumbent requires extensive knowledge of software applications used to facilitate the collaborative development, recording and distribution of requirements to stakeholders. They should be skilled users of the tools used in the organization and must understand the applicability, strengths and weaknesses of each. Responsibilities:Interview internal and/or external customers to elicit, understand and document business requirementsEnsure that functional specifications are consistent with technology road mapContribute to project definitions, initial cost assessment of projects, and integration of various project suppliers and vendors.Prepare stakeholders for requirements elicitation processConduct requirements elicitation processes; understanding stakeholder needs and identify potential solutions to meet stakeholder needsConfirm requirements-gathering results with stakeholders, ensuring common understanding of outcomes and that information has been recorded properlyProvide information in a format that is useful to stakeholdersAnalyze and maintain relationships between requirements, designs, solution components to identify impact analysis, coverage of requirements and allocation of tasksEnsure that requirements and designs are accurate and current throughout requirements life cyclePrioritize requirements by assessing value, urgency and risks associated with each requirementEvaluate, document, manage and communicate new and changing stakeholder requirementsEnsure requirements and designs are sufficiently detailed to be usable by appropriate stakeholdersEnsure requirements and designs deliver required business value and supports organizations goals and objectivesIdentify, explore and describes options for solutions to meet business needsAssess business value associated with potential solutions and compare options to identify and recommend the solution option that best provides overall value.Academic/Educational Requirements:Bachelors Degree in computer science, information systems, or a related disciplineRequired Skills/Experience:At least 5 years of experience in Commercial Flight Operations with Crew Planning products such as a Crew Planner, Crew Scheduler, or Crew Operations.Prior experience with NAVBLUE products and services an asset.Experience with Crew Planning and Crew Scheduling ProductsHigh level of communication skills and effective interpersonal skills essential when interacting with customers and other NAVBLUE employees. The individual must maintain a professional and personal conduct at all times. At times this requires strong interpersonal skills to resolve critical and contentious issues.Must possess strong presentation skills and be able to communicate professionally in written responses to emails, RFPs, and when submitting reports.Highly analytical, capable of creative thinking, decision-making and conceptual thinking. Able to develop solutions through creative and adaptive approaches.Strong organization and time management skills, capable of handling multiple projects with competing timelines and prioritiesBusiness acumen capable of understanding business needs and integrating knowledge and experience from past situationsProficient in MS Office suite, especially word processing, spreadsheets, presentation software and collaboration & knowledge management tools. Advanced user capability is required.Ability to integrate requirements of different types of airlines and regulatory requirements.Must be able to establish and maintain strong relationships.Must work effectively with others in a team environment as well as work independently with little supervision, depending on the task at hand.Self-managing; capable of proactively working with management to understand priorities and drive tasks to completion with minimal support or input from management.Must be able to travel both domestically & internationallyHow to Apply: If you are interested in joining the NAVBLUE team and feel that your experience matches the above criteria, please send us your application via indeed.  We thank all applicants for applying. Only selected applicants will be contacted.  NAVBLUE, an Airbus company, welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations will be available on request for candidates throughout the entire recruitment and selection process. About Us: NAVBLUE is the new generation of digital, user-friendly Flight Operations and Air Traffic Management solutions. Powered by Airbus pioneer spirit and infused with Navtechs agility, it combines the best of both worlds.  A leading global provider of flight operations solutions serving more than 400 airlines and aviation service companies across all platforms, NAVBLUE has a proven track record in product innovation. With access to Airbus resources and data, NAVBLUE provides its customers with the best solutions based on the best data, fully supporting them in their digital transformation.  NAVBLUE is a fully owned subsidiary of Services by Airbus and is based in Hersham (UK), Cardiff (UK), Toulouse (France) and Waterloo, ON (Canada), with offices around the world.  Job Type: Full-time

Name: VIE - BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST (W/M) - GERMANY
Description: VIE - BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST (W/M) - GERMANY Apply  Job title  VIE - BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST (W/M) - GERMANY Contract Type  VIE (European candidates)  Publication date  2018-11-08 Country  Company presentationThe world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health, Air Liquide is present in 80 countries with approximately 65,000 employees and serves more than 3.5 million customers and patients. Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902.  Air Liquide’s ambition is to lead its industry, deliver long term performance and contribute to sustainability.  Air Liquide places diversity at the heart of its activities and is committed to promoting professional equality and employment for people with disability.Entity and activity descriptionAir Liquide is the world leader in gases for industry, health and environment, and is present in over 80 countries with 65,000 employees.  The subsidiary “AL DEUTSCHLAND”, with its sister German companies, is the second largest multi business line entity in Europe.  The business line Large Industries (LI) is in charge of Air Liquide’s main production sites and delivers large quantities of industrial gases to our most important customers (Steel, Oil & Gas and Chemical industries) via pipeline or onsite production. LI Operations Controlling supports LI’s management, the commercial and operational teams in leveraging existing contracts, realizing efficiencies and fuelling our ambitious growth strategy. The team is a key spill between the management teams of the Cluster Central Western Europe (Germany, Austria and Switzerland) and the operational and business teams in the field.  Smart Innovative Operation (SIO) is a key element of the Air Liquide Large Industries (LI) strategic plan, supporting to move towards a Customer Centric organization. The program leverages developments in the field of digitization and big data analyses and was defined with the aim to make a step change in Real-Time Decision-Making, and to improve customer satisfaction through improved Safety, Reliability and Efficiency performance. Within this programme new tools need to be implemented to further improve the follow-up of our real time performance and levering business opportunities.  As part of the LI Operations Controlling team you will be working on developing new Business Intelligence (BI) solutions for both management and the LI commercial team touching the core of our business model.Missions and Responsibilities● Build further models for the Large Industries business line to follow the real time performance of its contracts.  ● Provide the necessary data and tools for the commercial team, in order to adjust its proposals to its customers on a real time basis.  ● Analyse Energy Contribution (EC) in sales and costs by developing a BI solution through reports.  ● Support in ad-hoc analysis for customer offtake, efficiency projects and customer/site profitability.Competencies and Profile● Masters degree in business or engineering.  ● Strong analytical skills.  ● IT affinity (Interest in Excel, SAP, Data-bases). Prior knowledge is a plus but not compulsory.  ● Very good communication skills, motivated and proactive team player.  ● Willingness to gain understanding of LI core business model.  ● Interested to learn German (language skill not a must).Additional informationExpected starting date: 01/02/2018 The mission will be based in Düsseldorf, Belgium for a 12 month-initial period with a possible extension to 12 additional months accordingly to the VIE regulations. Learn more about the VIE program and eligibility conditions below: https://www.civiweb.com/EN/le-volontariat-international/VI_CONDITIONS.aspx

Name: Implementation Analyst
Description: Enforce Consulting is a fast growing consultancy focused on bringing cloud computing applications to mid-market and enterprise companies. With offices in San Francisco, Dallas, and Sydney, Enforce Consulting has strategic partnerships with cloud application leaders in human capital management, marketing, and banking operations. Our rapid growth provides experienced consultants an opportunity to fully develop their consulting career, while creating deep expertise in market leading cloud computing applications.Market-leader is seeking entry-level Implementation Analyst consulting position to participate in all stages of the implementation life-cycle (discovery, configuration, testing, deployment, post go-live support), under the direction of the Project Manager. Implementation Analyst project responsibilities include all aspects of data analytics, including retrieval, analysis, configuration, testing, and conclusion reporting. Must be vigilant in your analysis to come to correct conclusions Superior math skillsHigh level of integrity and discretion in working with highly confidential client and customer dataExperience in business process mapping Knowledge & SkillsDemonstrated proficiency in relational databases including SQL & XML Proficient in Microsoft Office products Ability to engage with multiple projects & clients at the same time and manage priorities Desire and ability to thrive as a detail-oriented team player who can work with minimal supervisionUnderstanding software development life-cycle Superior collaboration skills Strong organizational, multi-tasking and time management skills Strong written and oral communication skills including the ability to present findings, or translate data conclusions into an understandable document. Ability to clearly, easily communicate complex ideasAbility to successfully operate in a fast-paced deadline driven environmentAbility and willingness to travel to client sites as needed on a limited basis

Name: SAP FI Analyst

Strong technical aptitude in order to analyze, troubleshoot, comprehend and support complex processes based on standard and customized SAP configurations. Good understanding of ABAP programming language. Strong problem-solving skills as well as incident and change management knowledge.
