Name: Business Data Analyst - II
Description: The Business Applications and Data Support Analyst within Information Technology supports change and problem management, application and configuration management and production support of our suite of business applications and customer web sites ensuring that the systems and data are accurate and available in a 24x7-operating environment. This job requires gaining a strong working knowledge of business applications as well as a strong understanding of how business users could utilize or adapt the software to support their areas of responsibility. This is a hands on position requiring both leadership and technical problem solving skills. 5 to 7 years of experience.  Candidate will work with a multidisciplinary team to design, develop & create analytical solutions through applications of Data Mining, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. The ideal candidate will increase the maturity of the portfolio application team/s analytical capabilities by progressing from traditional Predictive Modeling to true machine intelligence, and take advantage of emerging technologies around Data Science and AI. Apply Data analysis skills for threat intelligence and Web anomaly detection Candidate will be expected to be hands on as well as guide and mentor new modelers in the team. JOB TITLE: Data Analyst and AI specialist. JOB DUTIES: Understand business needs and apply Data Science/AI/Machine Learning technology to solve real-world business problems Ability to build and optimize models using machine learning techniques including feature selection & engineering, boosting, deep learning and ensembles Address pain points of the business and provide additional insights across domains like Regression, Classification, Machine Vision, Threat modelling, Deep Learning, and/or statistical modeling.  Candidate will be working with various team members of application development teams Analyze source data, working with structured and unstructured data Manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources to highlight patterns, anomalies, relationships, and trends Extend company’s data with third party sources of information when needed May manage one or more advanced research projects simultaneously Understands business needs and applies AI/Machine Learning technology to solve real-world problems Present analysis and recommendations to target audience MUST HAVE SKILLS: Leading the Business: Problem Solving & Decision Making. Risk Taking, Innovation. Results Orientation. Business Perspective. Understanding & Navigating the Organization (Includes Collaboration). Leading Others: Forging Synergy. Communicating Effectively. Leveraging Differences. Excellent presentation skills with powerpoint. DESIRED SKILLS: Relevant work experience in research and/or advanced analytic work (e.g. predictive modeling) in the telecom industry preferred. EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS: Masters STEM degree with 4 years experience or Bachelor's STEM degree with 6 yrs required. Moderate working knowledge of modeling/research/analytics or actuarial required. Relevant statistical analysis work experience required. REQUIRED SHIFT: This position is standard 9-5.Required Skills Required Experience Job Location  Irving, US-TX

Name: Business Analyst - AVP
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18071577 DescriptionAbout  CitiCiti,  the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and  does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides  consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of  financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit,  corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services,  and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding  assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on  behalf of our clients.  Citis  Mission  and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi  Leadership Standardsexplain  how we do it. Our missionis to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by  responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic  progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by  constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive  impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of  skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work  every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our  strategic priorities.  Diversity is a  key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from  every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our  workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a  priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where  individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for  others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.  Job Overview:The Core Infrastructure Shared Services (CISS) Business Analyst and TPM Support role provides support, guidance and oversight for strategic programs and projects within the organization, including focused management, third party management and reporting for any efforts that are behind schedule or not meeting requirements.In this role, you will focus on producing the Monthly Operations Review (MOR) for the organization, reporting on projects, financials, workforce, and goals. Partnering with representatives from each core function in CISS, Finance, Controllers Office, and Workforce Management, the Analyst will deep dive areas of focus, collecting and analyzing data sources, to gain understanding and knowledge critical to successful reporting and presentations.The TPM Support or BAO Support role is part of Citis Third Party Management (TPM) program. The BAO Support role is designed to help BAOs manage their relationships with third parties and mitigate risk for Citis businesses. The person in this role will collaborate across the business office and operations teams to help Core Infrastructure Shared Services (CISS) BAOs ensure that our third parties deliver products/services in a safe and sound manner that is in compliance with Citis policies and standards as well as applicable laws and regulations.In addition to these reporting responsibilities, the resource will also produce other daily, weekly, monthly or quarterly reports, as well as additional ad hoc reports as needed. The Analyst will contribute to or develop business operations models, Senior Leader updates, and other presentations as needed by management or other Business Office personnel.Key Responsibilities:Provide support to all functions of CISS, administrative and TPM support as well as operational analysis of current projects and initiativesCISS Monthly Operations Review (MOR) communications and creation of executive level presentation decksData analytics for the organization, including but not limited to, reporting on financials, workforce management, service quality, Risks & Controls, and project goalsWorking in conjunction with functional heads to summarize and capture the performance of operations pertaining to CISS focuses and objectivesBuilding samples of charts, figures, graphical representations, etc. to include in analytical tools, executive reports, and technologies dashboardsWriting, drafting, and editing of documents and publications produced by the business office for internal and external useManaging ad hoc requests for investigative work and unique reports to support a CISS sponsored objectiveProduce agendas for weekly/monthly meetings that are attended by functional teams as well as senior level managersExecute BAO activities (as defined in the BAO Handbook) throughout the phases of the Relationship Lifecycle: Planning, Due Diligence/ Third-Party Selection, Contracting, Ongoing Monitoring, and Relationship TerminationComplete initial Risk Assessment for third party and reevaluate as required; identify any significant changes in relationship to trigger update of Risk AssessmentVerify and complete all on-going monitoring tasks to insure third partys compliance to required policies and controlsMonitor third party performance and SLAs; either directly or through coordination with other Citi stakeholdersReview, assess and act on results of Risk Management Assessments/AnalysisLead remediation of any issues or gaps identified from ongoing monitoringDraft and present high-level metrics to applicable senior management and stakeholdersAdditional administrative tasks and team organization/planningQualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent work experienceExcellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to articulate complex and sensitive issues to senior management in a confident mannerAnalytical capabilities with large data setsExperience with reporting toolsExperience in Supply Chain Management, risk management and/or regulatory compliance in one or more of the following risk disciplines: technology risk, business continuity, operational risk, supplier risk, or audit and controls.Understanding of supplier or third-party risk impact in a financial services company preferredExposure to regional / sector risk management teams and an understanding of the sensitivity of the dynamic relationships cross-sectors and regionsAbility to organize and prioritize multiple deliverables while working independently and effectively in a large, global corporate environmentStrong MS PowerPoint and Excel skills

Name: Agile Analyst
Description: We currently have an Agile Analystcareer opportunity at our Dallas, TX location.  Essilor is an international company and the leading provider of eyeglass lenses in the world. Our mission is improving lives by improving sight, and we work every day to bring good vision to the 4.5 billion people around the globe in need of visual correction. Our products such as Varilux®, Crizal® and Transitions® are available in more than 130 countries and are worn by one billion people daily. Essilor of America and its subsidiary, Essilor Laboratories of America, Inc., employ more than 7,000 in the U.S. and own the largest and most comprehensive optical laboratory network in the U.S.Position SummaryDigital is at the heart of consumer awareness and interaction (search, select, buy) in our category and plays a key role in delivering on our Mission and growth objectives. Towards this end, we seek to establish a leadership position in providing consumers with information and tools to enhance their vision.The Agile Analyst combines the product owner and business analyst personas into a single role that helps shape the work of software development teams. The Agile Analyst focuses on ensuring that true business value is delivered by distilling the needs of our customer representatives and the team into clear language. He/she is naturally curious, a deep listener, and is able to unify the divergent opinions of stakeholders. The Agile Analyst is able to take high level requirements and break them down into specific, implementable requirements for the development team.Key Areas of ResponsibilitiesScope of the role:The role involves analyzing stakeholders’ needs, building these needs into workable user stories and managing various backlogs for Essilor’s Digital Acceleration team.Specific Responsibilities of the Role Include:− Capture the intent of stake holders into clear, concise user stories and acceptance criteria.− Construct simple wireframes, flow documents, and low fidelity mockups.− Decompose high level stories into specific, implementable requirements that are clear, concise, and ready for the development team to implement.− Lead sprint planning, story grooming, and demo sessions.− Analyze a broadly-defined area and, using functional decomposition, define user stories and create a well-organized, value-driven framework to provide the required business value in initiatives.− Educate the larger DITAC team in agile workflows and processes.− Recommend changes or improvements with a focus on business value and needs of DITAC.Candidate ProfileKnowledge / ExperienceDivisional or BU Experience - Experience in a Global business UnitExperience / Track Record - Understands the multiple dimensions of the business needs, from the potential impact of processes on key metrics to the impacts of the new/changed business processes.− Has experience using a variety of modeling tools and agile techniques to help customer representatives discover the range of user stories which will ultimately make up the system.− Understands the various ways the broad community of users will need to interact with the system.− Listens to and can positively reconcile the divergent needs of disparate stakeholders to identify designs that will work.Industries Experience - Business, IT, SoftwareGeographical Experience - Global experience highly preferredQualificationsEducation / Qualification / Certification - Degree in Business, Communications, Statistics, IT or related field preferred.Language - Excellent proficiency in English. Proficiency in other languages is a plus.Psychometrics - Broad range of investigative and interpersonal skills5-7 Years of experience− Ability to think critically and skeptically− Ability to reach consensus among different parties− Willing to stretch and learn new skills− Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)− Able to work with different groups to get work done− Works well in a team− Positive can do attitude and a passion for software.− Good understanding of IT software (not coding specifically)− Able to create compelling user stories Back  Share

Name: IBM Security - X-Force - Strategic Cyber Threat Analyst - IRIS
Description: Job DescriptionIBM X-Force Incident Response & Intelligence Services (IRIS) is looking for a Cyber Threat Analyst to join their X-Force IRIS Threat Analysis group (TAG). The candidate will provide industry-leading threat intelligence services across several security domains in an exciting and growing security delivery organization within IBM.The primary responsibility of this team is to triage open source intelligence (OSINT). TAG then creates intelligence collections on the X-Force Exchange (XFE), and publishes a daily newsletter out to IBM and to IBMs Security customers. This newsletter, known as the X-Force Threat Assessment Service (XFTAS), is the main communication channel with clients and is used to deliver cyber security news, information on emerging threats, and many other security-oriented intelligence items.Cyber Threat Analysts will also work with teams across and external to IBM Security to support the intelligence needs of the organization, foster collaboration and promote IBMs thought leadership in the cyber security space. Analysts will be involved in the development of content for external publication, including, but not limited to: XFTAS and X-Force Exchange Collections.Cyber Threat Analysts will occasionally travel for training, conferences or client engagements.Cyber Threat Analyst Skills:Takes a proactive approach to learning about the latest threats, threat actors, tactics, techniques and procedures and malware.Demonstrates and provides subject matter expertise of the threat landscape including, but not limited to cyber-attack vectors, threat actors, security trends, and security policies and recommendations in both the government and commercial space.Delivers high quality written technical assessments of threats through the X-Force Exchange (XFE) platform. Develops and publishes the X-Force Threat Analysis Service daily threat assessment.Performs multiple assigned technical tasks including research, analysis, solution design, development, product installation, system integration, and possibly root cause analysis of the advisory system when required.Has IT Security Industry experience, work regularly with client teams to develop requirements, plan, design, and generate a solution that meet the client security needs. This often includes using tools and methods to analyze, design and implement client solutions. Has enhanced professional, operational, and inter-personal skills to function effectively in collaborative high stakes and high stress situations with clients.Provides analytical ability and creativity necessary in developing and implementing solution deliverables for medium size projects or components of a larger project. Provides business or technical advice to managers, as well as give consulting, project management or technical direction to team members and/or client personnel. May lead a team on small projects or a segment of larger projects.Assists in the balancing of project management or technical work assignments with team members skills to mitigate risk on the project/engagement/proposals.Possesses strong verbal communication skills to deliver strategic, tactical and operational intelligence to audiences with varying degrees of technical knowledge.Has experience conducting and correlating threat research using OSINT, incident response engagement data, and proprietary tools, performing threat modeling, and producing intelligence threat assessments.Reviews technical literature prepared by other staff members for content, coverage, and clarity.Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned.Required Technical and Professional Expertise2 years experience in Cyber Security.1 years experience exploitation techniques and malware analysis.2 years experience in applying knowledge of information security best practices, threat intelligence research and compromising techniques.1 year technical writing experience.1 year experience with shell scripting (bash) .Knowledge of Windows Internals.Excellent communication skills.Preferred Tech and Prof Experience5 years experience in Cyber Security.3 years experience exploitation techniques and malware analysis.3 years experience in applying knowledge of information security best practices, threat intelligence research and compromising techniques.2 years technical writing experience.MIS/CIS/CS and/or other technology field of study.EO StatementIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Regulatory Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The Regulatory Analyst is primarily responsible for providing regulatory support to assist the Texas and Louisiana Operation Teams in complying with federal, state and local regulations ahead of a fast-paced, 5-7 rig program. Duties and job responsibilities:Manage all regulatory and permitting activities associated with drilling, completions, and operations of wells for assigned areas of Texas and Louisiana.Prepare and submit drilling permits, completion reports, waiver requests, inactive well compliance, work permits, and other required work reports to regulatory agencies.Compile various required regulatory submittals to include filings related to bonding, water usage and disposal, commingling, annual submittals, and notice of violations.Interact with professionals in land, drilling, completions and field operations to secure the necessary data and exhibits to perform core job functions.Work closely with management, operations and other professionals to clearly define regulatory issues and develop solutions.Monitor status of regulatory submittals and follow up with regulatory agencies to ensure timely submittals and approvals.Evaluate regulatory compliance issues in new and existing operating areas as well as assist in the development of compliance systems/documents to ensure ongoing compliance.Maintain understanding of most current regulations and tracking proposed regulations and identifying potential impacts to our business.Establish and maintain both internal and external working relationships.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.Minimum of 3 years of oil and gas related experience, sub-surface oil and gas regulatory compliance and demonstrated knowledge of the industry.Minimum of 2 years regulatory and compliance experience.Strong computer skills using Microsoft Office applications and Wellview applications.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic, multi-task, customer service environment.Good organization and time management skills.Strong ethics, service attitude, team player. Aethon is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to the principles of being an equal opportunity employer and to providing our employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: PDS Tech has an immediate job opening for a **Business Systems Analyst** in **Plano, TX** to work with the business infrastructure team in the automotive industry. This job will require participating in business projects to help in an implementation project. This job will require identifying the project scope and establishing project timelines and meeting deadlines. You need to have prior experience performing requirements gathering on previous jobs along with reviewing test cases and test results. This is a contract job with the possibility of extensions.  + Act as liaison and primary contact to Business Units, Integration/Infrastructure, Architecture and PMO, providing an advocate for technology initiatives  + Participate in multiple technology and/ or business projects and play a key role as subject matter expert for successful implementation  + Assist managers in change management efforts related to organization, and short- and long-term strategic plans and goals  + Support ALL Marketing business groups (e.g. Brand and Design, Dealer Incentives, Marketing Optimization, and Relationship Marketing)  + SME on ALL Marketing Technology systems (e.g. Adobe Digital Asset Management (DAM), BrandPoint, Spredfast (Social Media), Print Vendor (DST/Broadridge-Billing Statements, RR Donnelley, and AutoPoint), emerging technology, Adobe Campaign, Acxiom EMD, Insight, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Enterprise Lead Management System, Adobe Analytics, and Adobe Target  + **Day to day activities will include:**  + Assist in identifying project scope, high level business requirements, and work estimates based on business request  + Lead requirements gathering sessions with requesters and/or Product Owner, business stakeholders, and technical resources  + Review test cases/test results and test plan to ensure that requirements have been fully met by the project delivery team  + Identify potential new and improved technical directions, develop strategic options/ approaches to recommend to management  + Act as critical advisor to the team, providing deep functional expertise in the work plan, standards, process and procedures, and change management efforts  + Conduct all phases of complex analysis to prioritize making recommendations toward solutions, and manage resources to achieve unit, division and corporate goals.  + Work closely with the PgMO, BSA CoE and QA CoE to ensure standards of Projects and System Enhancements are met and delivered  + May include some supervisory responsibilities  + May direct work to vendors and consultants *Bachelor Degree, at least 5 years of BSA experience, and a good attitude to learn.** For immediate consideration, please apply directly to the application link or send your resume to Michael at msanchez@pdstech.com.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

Name: Performance Analyst - FUTURE OPPORTUNITY
Description: We’re here to ensure the advertising industry and the people in it are healthy and engaging positively and effectively with those around them. We’re here, ultimately, to improve the lives of people working in the media industry. And we take our responsibility seriously.  PERFORMANCE ANALYST ABOUT THE ROLE The Campaign Performance Analyst will be responsible for working with internal teams on specific accounts to align campaign objectives and KPIs, develop performance measurement plans, and recommendations for campaign optimization. This position is responsible for developing and delivering insightful and actionable reports that tell a performance story. It will have a strong focus on insights vs. observations with responsibility for driving performance outcomes and optimized media investment priorities. The priority for this position is working across the internal team to deliver optimal performance to drive client growth, retention and high levels of client satisfaction. ABOUT THE TEAM The Performance Analytics team has a passion for analytics and a common vision for improvement and growth. As trusted advisors to both our internal teams and clients, our time is split between diving deep into rows of data, showing off our reporting dashboards, and educating our clients on KPIs, tools and evolving methodologies. Among our supportive team network you can often find us showing off the creative reporting templates and custom dashboards that make us proud. CORE RESPONSIBILITIESAlign campaign objectives and KPIs and develop performance measurement plans and recommendations for campaign optimization.Develop and deliver insightful and actionable reports that tell the performance story of the campaign.Partner with Client and Media Services, Search, and Social team members to develop forward-looking campaigns based on historical performance insights.Present reports, optimization recommendations, and insights to both client and internal audiencesUnderstand Centro solutions related to analytics and reporting such as ad verification, attribution, brand studies, viewability, etc.Mentor Associate level performance analysts.QUALIFICATIONS2+ years digital media experience, especially in client facing buying or media measurement departmentsBachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing, Business, Statistics or Economics preferredStrong independent thinking and problem solving abilitiesExcellent organization and communication skillsHighly motivated with a strong record of project or process managementStrong qualitative skills with ability to demonstrate quality data organization and analysis techniquesUnderstanding of media buying and ad serving landscapeStrong knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelAbility to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, under tight deadlinesExceptional customer service and communication skillsAdaptable and flexibleA fun, positive attitude that embodies the Centro’s culture Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law. Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job Title: Data Analyst / Tableau DeveloperLocation: Atlanta, GADuration: 3 monthsPosition Type: Contract (W2)Interview: Phone and In-PersonEducation: BachelorsWork Type: On-SiteExp Required: 5+ Yrs.No: of Positions: 1Responsibilities:•Conduct business meetings with customers to determine project requirements and milestones.•Work with business to prioritize business and information needs•Analyze data to develop insights and conclusions and share these findings with business partners.•Provide functional and technical guidance to business teams when needed.•Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages: Tableau, OBIEE, SAP BO.•Strong knowledge of SQL and RDBMS platforms - Oracle, Teradata•Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy•Provide expertise in design, development and implementation of reporting and analytics systems.•Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques•Work with technical resources to design and model the data warehouse systems.•More of a consulting role in nature•Experience working with business partners and gathering requirementsPlease share your updated resume

Name: Technical Business Systems Analyst
Description: Chase is the U.S. consumer and community banking (CCB) business of JPMorgan Chase & Co. We serve nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities and non-profits through more than 5,600 bank branches, 18,700 ATMs, credit cards, mortgage offices and online and mobile banking as well as through relationships with auto dealerships. Consumer Banking provides great products and an outstanding customer experience in 23 states, as well as online and over the phone.  The CCB Digital Business Services team, is chartered with managing and directing the business services supporting major externally facing application components (web and native mobile apps) focusing on the discipline of functional delivery in the area of customer login, product enrollment, and data sourcing across the JPMorgan Chase & Co. enterprise.  Technical Analyst Responsibility:  · Perform impact analysis on platform & project-specific technical topics  · Lead design discussions within the team and with other technology partners and project managers  · Work with product, business and application teams to write technical user stories for a SOA/services/messaging development team  · Research code to determine current system functionality  · Execute testing of REST and SOAP web services using tools like Soap UI/ Ready API to verify that the services meet the acceptance criteria defined in the user stories  · Check logs using Splunk to investigate any requirements or issues related to the project and/or addressed to the team  · Facilitate communication between the project stakeholders and technology teams  · Create knowledge artifacts and share/upload them in Confluence for the teams referenceRequired Knowledge and Experience:· Bachelors Degree within a technical field  · 5+ years of hands-on experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Systems Analyst, Technical Analyst or in a related discipline with an emphasis on delivering cutting-edge technology within finance  · Ability to read Java code and service definitions in order to understand existing system behavior  · Experience working with Spring, SOAP, REST, Micro services, XML and JSON message formats in a shared services/enterprise level organization  · Strong understanding of BDD/TDD and experience writing technical user stories in JIRA using industry standard notations like Gherkins  · Well versed with common Agile terms and methodology and using tools like JIRA and Confluence.  · Understanding of SQL, stored procedure and database scripting  · Understanding of software development processes and procedures  · Experience using the IDEs such as Eclipse, IDEA IntelliJ, GIT, Bitbucket  · Strong verbal and written communication skills  · Strong analytical and problem solving skills  · Ability to forge lasting relationships with other scrum team members  · Familiarity with service-oriented environments, and better development practices  Preferred Knowledge and Experience:  · Retail/Consumer banking and investment products  · Appreciation of responsive web design  · Fluent with modern web technologies and web application frameworks  EEO Statement  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Name: Sr. Financial Business Analyst
Description: Established, Entrepreneurial, Empowered…Explore the Opportunities!NCH Corporation – Sr. Financial Business AnalystNCH is currently looking for a Sr. Financial Business Analyst to support NCH China. The individual will assist Finance in FP&A (Financial, Planning & Analysis) for the China division. We offer opportunities for career advancement, and a culture that recognizes results, while embracing the importance of work/life balance. Join our team as a Sr. Financial Business Analyst, where our future begins with you!Responsibilities:Lead the annual planning process for the China division, including income statement, balance sheet and cash flows. Analyze historical performance and industrial trends to set up financial targets for the regions, and assist regions in formulating business plans.Manage monthly forecast, consolidate and present forecast to China management to facilitate executive-level business decisions.Develop and maintain financial models/tools for planning/forecast and analysis, and roll out the models/tools.Coordinate monthly financial reviews to analyze financial results, review variances vs. plan and prior year, and develop action plans to meet financial targets.Assist management in preparing presentations to the Executive Committee for quarterly meetings, the annual plan meeting, and other executive events.Perform in-depth analysis to identify issues and opportunities; recommend strategies and solutions to increase revenue, reduce cost, and improve profitability.Update and maintain a Balanced Scorecard reporting system, deliver monthly balanced scorecards for business performance tracking and benchmarking.Create queries with Business Objects, Oracle Discoverer and other business database querying tools, analyze and provide input for performance evaluation and business decisions.Use NPV, IRR, ROI and other financial techniques to analyze business initiatives, including but not limited to capital investment, variable contribution, pricing, and product launches.Requirements:Undergraduate degree in Finance or Business disciplines, preferably accounting.5+ years of experience in financial and business analysis, with proven ability to dissect business issues, present data in a simple and compelling way, and present to higher level managementBilingual fluency in Mandarin Chinese (preferred) and EnglishInternational business experience preferred. Experience with China highly desiredDemonstrated advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Power Point, Visual Basic, Access and Business Object preferredAdvanced knowledge of business concepts and tools (NPV, ROI, Break-even, cost-benchmarking, pricing, sensitivity analysis, etc.)Advanced understanding of common financial reports and financial metrics (Income statement, Cash Flow Statement, Balance Sheet)Experience with Oracle or similar ERP software preferredHighly motivated, self-directed, flexible team player with demonstrated ability to thrive in a business-critical high stress environmentAbility to work collaboratively with management level and executive personnelSelf motivated, organized and goal oriented with a keen attention to detailSolid communication skills; ability to develop a method for presenting information in a simple yet impactful wayMust be willing to relocate to Dalian ChinaEqual Opportunity EmployerWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  With minimal supervision and working at the highest technical level of most phases of business analysis, this position collaborates with others to develop new products and enhance existing products. This includes project definition and solution design for requested product and operational enhancements for existing products and internal systems.  REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTING  This position typically performs work at a WageWorks location with significant technical resources and reports to a Director or VP level with enterprise-wide product development responsibility.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES  NOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent’s performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent’s immediate supervisor or manager.  1. Work closely with internal teams (service teams, technical staff, sales, marketing, and operations) and external teams (clients, partners and service vendors) to enhance current products and develop new ones.  2. Provide input into and oversight of project definition and solution design for requested new products, product features, and operational enhancements for internal systems.  3. Act as the liaison between the business units and the technology organization, to manage business priorities, communicate changes in scope or schedule, and call out risks.  2. Perform impact assessment and define the scope of requested product changes, enhancements, new products and new systems.  3. Adhere to and assist product management and other project requestors in adhering to the appropriate software product development process.  4. Define the scope of projects including all internal and external user touch points and processes.  5. Create detailed functional requirement specifications based on defined business requirements.  6. Identify tasks and work with the development team to estimate development costs for proposed projects.  7. Drive and project manage product development projects from inception to customer delivery.  MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS  1. May provide assistance with product development efforts to test products and ensure that systems provide the result or perform as intended.  2. May develop training materials and provide product training to staff and users of product enhancements for which functional requirements have been created.  3. Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.  ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS  WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the eight Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance.  Clients and Participants Come First: Exceeding client and participant expectations is our highest priority  Integrity: We are open, honest, ethical and conscientious  Passion: A will to win and a relentless drive for excellence  Accountability: Deliver on commitments and take ownership for solving problems and creating solutions  Leadership and Influence: Our actions inspire vision and clarity of purpose  Continuous Improvement and Innovation: We embrace change and drive new ideas into business solutions  Dignity and Respect: We value the diversity of our people, encourage their development and reward their performance  Creating Value for Shareholders: Deliver consistent growth and premium returns  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY  NOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.  No formal supervisory authority entailed. This position will act as a resource to less-experienced Business Analysts and may provide matrixed leadership for assigned projects.  ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES  EDUCATION:  Knowledge of software development and/or business management as normally obtained through completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science/engineering, Business, or a related degree. Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) certification is desirable.  WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE:  The knowledge, skill and ability to create detailed functional requirements for software development projects as described as normally obtained through a minimum of 10 or more years progressively responsible business analysis experience.  SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:  Requires the highest level of understanding of the business, technology strategy and platforms, and functional transactions to perform business analysis as described.  Consumer marketing or product management experience in the consumer or financial services industry including:  • Familiarity with Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA) and Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) programs.  • Direct contact with both employers and employees in an HR or employee benefits-related capacity.  • Project management experience.  • Familiarity with financial services, general accounting principles, bank account reconciliation practices, and operational processes.  A high level of employee benefits knowledge and significant experience as a service or account manager for a group health plan provider, broker agency or benefits consultant, including a keen understanding of benefits administration from an employer’s perspective (the employer/vendor relationship as well as the employer/employee relationship, is strongly preferred.  Must have a high level of interpersonal and communication skills and an exceptional ability to work well with others to effectively interact with internal and external customers and department staff, as described above. The ability to build relationships, influence key decision-makers, and collaborate on a cross-functional team comprised of diverse personalities, skill sets, and levels of experience is required.  The ability to work in a fast-paced, high energy environment that requires flexibility and the capacity to quickly learn and assimilate information/new skills is essential. Must possess the ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Outstanding organizational skills, follow-up skills, focus and attention to detail.  Incumbents must have the ability to use initiative and work independently as well as collaboratively with a team.  EQUIPMENT:  A high level of proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, Excel, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required. Knowledge and familiarity with standard project management tools is required.  TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONS  Travel may be required as necessary to meet with internal and external clients.  WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDS  Work is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDS  Work requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with constant interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 20 lbs. Incumbent may experience elevated levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.

Name: Business / Systems Analyst - IV
Description: The position also requires collaboration across larger organization to deliver intelligence using digital sales KPIs, clickstream, omni channel, social media, site traffic, customer feedback, site performance logs, benchmark studies and various other data sets. This position is critical to driving data driven insights that will assist improvement of online channel by driving online channel mix form 15% to 30% in 2017 and driving additional gross adds and upgrades.  The ideal candidate should have exposure on correlating the customer experience with digital sales performance to bring out insights on improvement areas. The candidate should have knowledge on competitive analysis and be extremely familiar with digital platforms such as Adobe analytics. In this role, the candiate will develop a team that will be implementing descriptive, predictive and prescriptive capabilities to improve digital sales  Required Qualifications  BS/MS in Engineering, Math, Statistics, Information Systems, or equivalent practical experience.Advanced degree preferred.  4+ years of relevant experience in data analysis, data engineering and business intelligence  3+ years experience in data analysistechniques such as Logistical/Linear regression, Neural networks, Market basket analysis, Clustering, Segmentation, Time Series Clustering, K means Clustering etc.  3+ years hands on experience in analytics and reporting using advanced SQL, data warehousing, ETL.  3+ years experience in statistical modeling using clustering, classification, text mining algorithms (Naive Bayes, Association analysis, Regression, Decision Trees, etc.).  2+ years experience in Big data, HBase, Hive, Solr, Aster, Lambda architecture, streaming data processing, data modeling.  2+ years of experience with customer journey analytics (nPath analysis, Text/NLP processing, Transaction, search & entity extraction etc.)  Exposure/Experience with open source tools and technologies such as microservices, Play, Akka, Redis, Cassandra, Elastic search  Work under minimal supervision in a large cross functional team environment and demonstrate self-direction and motivation.  Demonstrated leadership and self-direction.  Execution focused and results oriented  Demonstrated willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques

Name: Junior Finance Analyst - Entry Level
Description: Position: Junior Finance Analyst  Location: Dallas, TX  Overview: $38-43k Avenica is currently recruiting for a Junior Finance Analyst position. This is a great entry level position with opportunities for professional growth and development. Financial associates perform a variety of accounting and financial duties. The candidate will assist managers with creation of financial proposals and reports. Responsibilities: · Represents the company to customers in a courteous and professional manner.  · Provides prompt, efficient and accurate service in processing requests and transactions.  · Opens a variety of business and consumer accounts after determining customers' needs.  · Explains various account and ownership options, providing the counseling necessary to meet clients' needs.  · Proactively follows-up with existing clients.  · Completes a variety of reports related to banking and investment transactions.  · Knowledgeable with regards to lending, investments, mortgages, and all other services offered by the company.  · Serves as liaison between the customer and all the services offered by the company. Qualifications/characteristics of a successful candidate: · Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university – finance interest or related coursework is preferred  · 0-3 years of professional experience  · Customer-service oriented – excellent interpersonal skills  · Strong analytical/problem solving skills  · Demonstrated ability to motivate and influence others  · Team player  · Financial/business acumen Avenica actively recruits college graduates seeking entry level positions using a proven, personalized process to connect grads with great jobs, not with an app or an algorithm. Whether you are fresh out of college and looking for your first real job, or a few years out and looking to redirect your entry level career, we can help you. Our model focuses on finding the right candidate for each position. To learn more, visit our website at www.Avenica.com. Avenica considers the entire candidate – not just specific college degree or work experience – while trying to find a perfect career match. If we believe we can be a valuable resource to you in your job search, we will help you identify your transferable skills, discuss potential career options, and coach you on your resume and interview skills. All of our services are free of charge to job seekers.  Avenica is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages applicants of all ages, experiences, and backgrounds to apply for open positions. Avenica does not discriminate on the basis an applicant’s age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, or status with regard to public assistance.

Name: (Mortgage) Mgr, Business Analysis

Here at PrimeLending, our culture is built around one simple belief – investing in our talented, dedicated employees.  PrimeLending is currently seeking a Business Analysis Manager that will be responsible for providing hands-on management and leadership on organizational initiatives to a team of Business Analysts, while occasionally participating as a seasoned Business Analyst for their own set of projects. This position will ensure that correct business functionality, requirements, and industry standards are addressed to provide the most efficient solutions. We are looking for a Manager that possesses excellent leadership and coaching abilities, along with deep knowledge of process and who can translate business needs into technology requirements. We’re also seeking someone that will lead our team to successfully deliver high quality deliverables, helping them grow, while developing your own leadership skills.Essential FunctionsReview and provide guidance on the development of business, functional and system requirements; to ensure adherence to best practices and consistency, including requirements solicitation and expectations, and on meeting quality and deadline needs. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: FleetPride is the largest after-market distributor of heavy-duty truck and trailer parts in the U.S. with some of the best and brightest people in the business! Partner with the best in the heavy-duty industry and apply today!  Plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operational systems in support of core business processes. Gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. Responsible for generating and compiling reports based on their findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. This position will be primary support for Salesforce.com (SFDC) implementation, administration, enhancement, and integration with other systems.  Essential Tasks Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals.Lead efforts to elicit, review and secure sign-off of business requirements, functional requirements, (SFDC application) functional use cases, functional integration use cases, data migration requirements and reporting requirements through engagement with the business stakeholders and subject matter experts (SMEs).Design, develop, and maintain complex workflows rules, validation rules and custom workflows in salesforce.com.Evaluate new tools and Salesforce updates as they become available and implement where appropriate. Strong technical and functional proficiency in Salesforce.com, performing tasks such as: security settings, workflow rules, custom object creation, reports, and dashboardsCoordinate with technical team members (onsite and potentially offshore) to hand-off requirements in all of the aforementioned areas and to convey a complete understanding of the business’ needs for the same.Suggest design options and provide feedback on feasibility of solution designs proposed by technical team members. Ensure the proposed design meets all of the requirements and identify where gaps may exist and proactively work to close these.Identify and document relevant functional test cases and related testing scripts as a part of the quality assurance process. If necessary, participate in the execution testing and quality assurance related activities.Drive, support and if necessary formally lead a User Acceptance Testing (UAT) effort that culminates in an explicit business approval to use the application in a production environment.As necessary, employing communication skills such as persuasion and negotiation with key business stakeholders and SMEs to obtain this approval.Play a key role in the support enhancements, upgrades and new system deployments for SFDC and potentially EDI, B2B portals, eCommerce and other customer impacting applications.Develop and deliver relevant training directly to the end users of the system, or in a train the trainer format. Coordinate and perform other post-implementation support.Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.When necessary, lead design sessions in prototyping new systems for the purpose of enhancing business processes, operations, and information process flow.Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in the assigned business processes. Perform in the role of Project Manager on technology enabled business projects.Work with FP&A to perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.Create systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system programmers. Conduct research on software and hardware products to justify recommendations and to support business needs. Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members Skills Troubleshooting:Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it. Equipment Selection:Determining the kinds of tools and equipment needed to do a job. Technology Design: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs. Learning Strategies: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things. Judgment & Decision making: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one. Communicating:Conveying information to others in an effective manner. Active Learning: Understanding the implication of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making. Time Management: Managing one's own time and the time of others. Mathematics: Ability to use mathematics to solve problems. Critical Thinking: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Coordination: Adjusting actions in relation to others’ actions. Service orientation: Actively looking for ways to help people.  Attributes Oral Expression: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand. Oral Comprehension: The ability to understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Written Comprehension: The ability to understand information and ideas presented in writing. Written Expression: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.  Originality: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem. Complex Problem Solving: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. Problem Sensitivity: The ability to determine when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It involves recognizing there is a problem and resolving it. Deductive Reasoning: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. Inductive Reasoning: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).  Physical Demands  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Reaching above shoulder heights, below the waist or lifting as required to file documents and store materials.  Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard or mouse, and to handle other computer components.  Occasional lifting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.  Sitting for extended periods of time.  Environmental / Atmospheric Conditions  The primary environment is characterized by ambient room temperatures, lighting and traditional office equipment found in a typical office environment.  Qualifications Education A Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science, or Management Information Systems.Consideration will be given to an equivalent combination of related education and required work experience. Professional Experience/CompetenciesMinimum of 8+ years of related work experience.5 to 7 years of experience implementing Salesforce.com technology based applications preferably in industrial distribution industry.Proven experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions that support business processes and transactions.Demonstrated project management principles and skills.Knowledge and experience with both waterfall and agile project methodologiesExcellent understanding of a Sales and Distribution oriented organization’s goals and objectives.Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required.Highly self motivated and directed.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Exceptional analytical skills and attention to detailsAbility to create meeting presentations that are clear and easy to comprehendAble to document meeting minutes accurately and effectively in an efficient manner to allow meeting members to review in a reasonable timeframe once a meeting has occurred.Able to work independently with minimal supervision This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. He or she will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor.  FleetPride is the leader in the industry comprised of retail, service, distribution and wholesale divisions.

Name: Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst with on-line and mobile experience in an agile environment to contribute toward the success of our digital technology initiatives with the overall goal of allowing our Servicing customers to self-serve using a variety of channels. Specific responsibilities include: * Support in the development and delivery of the CBSS servicing digital roadmap with a focus on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. * Analysis, design, and testing in support of business and technology improvements from planning through implementation in an agile environment to support the following capabilities: customer communications, payments, statements & documents, default, and portal solutions. * Develops and maintains detailed knowledge of business's current technology and USB on-line capabilities and roadmap along with supporting and leading future technology capabilities. * Develops an on-going support model to ensure on-going availability and support for the digital solution(s) * Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. * Works with technology and application development teams to design or select solutions that appropriately meet the business needs for large and complex projects. * Reviews and coordinates execution of automated test plans while looking for opportunities to improve testing process. Position is responsible for supporting the implementation of the digital strategy to support CBSS Servicing. The digital strategic roadmap for CBSS Servicing focuses on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. Overall capabilities covered include: customer communications, account management, payments, default, and Responsive Web solutions. Technical scope spans technology platforms ranging from Mainframe systems, Mobile Technologies, On-line, imaging, middleware, and ETL toolsets. Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship. Basic Qualifications * Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience * At least 6 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications. Preferred Skills/Experience Extensive experience in: * On-line and mobile implementations * Information management * Agile software development * IT project management * System analysis * System testing with experience in test automation * IT standards, procedures, policy * Business assessment * Mortgage and Consumer Servicing experience a plus Subject matter expert in: * Requirements analysis with knowledge of test driven requirements * Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with various levels of management and within technology and business * Excellent facilitation skills with business users, business leaders, technology peers and outsourced resources * Self-motivated and takes ownership and accountability for results * Excellent analytical, interpersonal, organizational, and problem-solving skills preferred * Must be an independent, self-starting team player and have the ability to perform in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment * Provide leadership and mentoring to less experienced analysts and collaborate with internal and external teams * Ability to work in a matrix environment across multiple projects and technologies * Knowledge of Six Sigma and Lean concepts a plus * Knowledge of the TFS system and agile backlog and tracking a plusSDL2017

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Oracle R12 Financials
Description: Job Description:JOB DESCRIPTIONServes as an internal consultant and advisor between the client and technology group.Plans, conducts, and directs the analysis of complex, company-wide, business problems relating to systems.Provides strategic and technical guidance to identify, evaluate and develop systems or automated processes.Applies knowledge of industry trends and technology to drive organizational change.Transforms strategic company architecture and design principles into specific systems requirement and specifications.Resolves issues and provides solutions that meet business requirement and are cost effective.Prepares specifications for system changes.Recommends and initiates systems testing.Re-engineers technical processes and systems for greater efficiencies with significant impact to business operations.Responsible for daily Oracle R12 support for R12 financials and Source to Pay.Responsible for understanding affects of requested financial changesQUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Minimum 5 years of relevant experienceBA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experienceMust have experience with the following Oracle R12 modules/areas: R12 Financials, General Ledger, Accounts Receivables, Accounts Payables, Fixed Assets, Cash Management, EB Tax, SLA, Vertex, Source to Pay, Order Management, Cost Accounting and Fixed Assets.Strongly prefer experience with Oracle SQL,PL/SQL, TOAD, Insight, OBIee 11g,Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to gather business requirements and create/ update MD50 documentsExperience with SDLC processAbility to conduct meetings with cross functional team membersAbility to manage month end close process and work directly with Global Accounting/Finance teamABOUT DJO GLOBAL DJO Global is a leading global developer, manufacturer and distributor of high-quality medical devices that provide solutions for musculoskeletal health, vascular health and pain management. Our products address the continuum of patient care from injury prevention to rehabilitation after surgery, injury or from degenerative disease, enabling people to regain or maintain their natural motion. Our products are used by orthopedic specialists, spine surgeons, primary care physicians, pain management specialists, physical therapists, podiatrists, chiropractors, athletic trainers and other healthcare professionals. In addition, many of our medical devices and related accessories are used by athletes and patients for injury prevention and at-home physical therapy treatment. Product lines include rigid and soft orthopedic bracing, hot and cold therapy, bone growth stimulators, vascular therapy systems and compression garments, therapeutic shoes and inserts, electrical stimulators used for pain management and physical therapy products. Our surgical division offers a comprehensive suite of reconstructive joint products for the hip, knee and shoulder. Our products are marketed under a portfolio of brands including Aircast®, Chattanooga, CMF, Compex®, DonJoy®, ProCare®, Exos, Dr. Comfort®, DonJoy Performance® and DJO® Surgical.  For additional information on the Company, please visit www.DJOglobal.com.  DJO is a portfolio company of the Blackstone Group  EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.SDL2017

This position will assist in understanding the current environment and continually scan the horizon to bring solutions for gaps in current technologies. In addition, the Strategic Business Analysts will collaborate closely with Business Relationship Management to understand how solutions will affect the consumer of technologies/solutions. Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: Hilltop Holdings is building a premier financial services company, dedicated to Integrity, Collaboration, Adaptability, Respect, and Excellence. Our principles are the momentum that drives our actions, guides our decisions, and enables us to earn the confidence of the customers and communities we serve. If you want to be a part of a team on the rise, Hilltop Holdings may be your next move forward.  The primary focus of this position is the design, support and maintenance of the Company’s Human Resource Information System (HRIS) in addition to other systems supported by the HRIS team. This individual serves as a technical point-of-contact for assigned functional areas and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes and upgrades, complex report writing and analysis of data flows for process improvement opportunities. Analytics and Metrics - Produce ad hoc and scheduled reports. Develop reports, perform analysis on HR data, identify trends, and develop scorecards.Work with the HR and technical teams to implement new and/or upgrade system functionality, including ESS and MSS capabilities, talent management, LMS, compensation management and organizational Chart. This will include analysis, design, development, testing and post go live trouble shooting and support.Provide first level support to the Human Resources team with troubleshooting and issue resolution.Testing application functionality prior to the release of upgrades and customizations.Maintain procedures and business process documentation.Ensure data integrity through quality assurance and proactively validating data.Assist in other areas of human resources as needed.A minimum of 3-5 years of experience working with human resources systems is required.Strong understanding of human resources processes, practices and metrics, and experience with managing system configurations to align with HR policies.Experience working with payroll, benefits and other sensitive data.An understanding of database reporting would be an asset.A high degree of accuracy and attention to detail is required.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner are required.Must possess strong problem solving, organizational skills, time management and the ability to multitask.Proficient knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office. Expert level Excel required.

Name: Senior Credit Analyst
Description: Title: Sr. Credit Analyst  Job Grade: Exempt/Salary Department: Credit Department Company Overview: Veritex Holdings Inc. is a publicly traded bank holding company headquartered in Dallas, Texas. Through our wholly-owned subsidiary, Veritex Community Bank, a state chartered bank, we provide relationship-driven commercial banking products and services tailored to meet the needs of small to medium-sized businesses and professionals. Since our inception, we have targeted customers and acquisitions primarily in the Dallas Metropolitan area. We have expanded to 22 locations including a mortgage office. We are a fast growing and dynamic organization. The quality of our employees and their dedication to service is what separates us from other banks of any size. We strive to attract and retain exceptional employees who share our commitment to superior customer service, continued growth and organizational success. In 2017, we were recognized as one of the Top 100 Places to Work in Dallas by The Dallas Morning News as well as one of the Best Banks to Work for in the US by The American Banker! Job Summary Underwriting commercial and real estate credit requests of different degrees of complexity, limited management supervision where applicable. The scope of the underwriting/analysis will include, but will not be limited to, spreading financial statements of borrowing entities and related sponsors/guarantors, analyzing cash flow capacity, assessing the adequacy and efficacy of credit structure, and engaging in any other meaningful type of analysis (i.e. strategic, accounting, financial, prospective, compliance) relevant to the assessment of repayment capacity as well as identification and mitigation of credit risk. Responsibilities of the job will also include special projects related to credit administration and market analysis, supporting multiple functions in the appraisal ordering and review process, as well as the mentoring of less experienced analysts Detailed Description:Middle market bank and C&I underwriting experience a plusSpread financial statements on a spreadsheet program, calculate repayment ability, and prepare written comments to facilitate sound credit decisions regarding loan requests.Analyze collateral adequacy with respect to credit structure and type of loan.Analyze market and submarket conditions with respect to the project being underwritten.Spread and analysis of company and guarantor/principal financial statements.Assist with ordering real estate appraisals and coordinating appraisal workflow.Assist with internal reviews of real estate appraisals and ordering external appraisal reviewsAttend work on a regular basis, on time, and withstand varying degrees of stress.Attention to regulatory requirements and compliance training applicable to position (Bank Secrecy Act, Customer Information Privacy ETC)Integrity, discretion, and respect for confidential information are absolutely essential.Education and Experience • Education and Experience: Bachelors degree in Finance or Accounting, or related field required. Must have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours in Accounting. Three to five years of experience in commercial credit underwriting/analysis including analytical exposure to commercial and industrial credits as well as commercial real estate relationships a plus.High proficiency in business software including word processing and spreadsheet programs.Must be able to multi task Skills and AbilitiesExcellent organizational skills needed to handle multiple tasks and priorities.Excellent written and verbal communications skills.Must be customer service and detail oriented.Analytical ability required in order to gather and interpret data in situations where the problems are complex.Excellent interpersonal skills Physical Demands The employee will occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. The employee will regularly sit; talk; hear; and use hands to finger, handle or feel. The employee will occasionally stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; climb and balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Special vision requirements include close, distant, and peripheral vision; depth perception; and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The work environment and physical demands are those of a standard retail branch setting. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. Disclaimer The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job. Incumbent must attend work on a regular basis, on time, and withstand varying degrees of stress. This position description describes the minimum selection requirements to qualify for the position. Promotion and other employment decisions are based on employer needs, being in good standing, fully competent performance, and other non-discriminatory subjects.  As of the date shown below, the contents of this job description are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skill required of personnel so classified. Further, essential job functions are subject to change based upon business needs.  Veritex Community Bank is an equal opportunity employer. Veritex Community Bank Corporate Human Resources [Dallas, Texas] Revised: 9/07/2012

Name: Sr. Web Analyst Full-Time | RM Dayton Analytics, Ltd. Co.

Name: Business System Analyst - 03
Description: Current Openings  Business System Analyst - 03  Vastika Inc seeking a business analyst to work with our partner business, development and quality assurance teams to deliver on a variety of IT development efforts. This entails working with teams across several geographic sites. Business Analyst responsibilities will include triage of production incidents, defining proper incident resolution in conjunction with business partners, assisting Quality Assurance with technical analysis of issues encountered, and occasional support coverage for off hour’s production installations. In addition, responsibilities would include some general Project Manager including project estimation, establishing milestones/schedules, maintaining & reporting project status, and work intake management. Name: Business Vault, Designer and BI
Description: Description: At Client, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company's growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for Client and for the people who work here. Qualification - 7+ years system integration and data management within a software development/engineering environment preferred - 5+ years data modeling and data warehouse experience - 1 year of Agile development - 1 year experience with the development and management of QlikView - 3+ years in data integration across disparate application environments (Microsoft, Unix, AS400, cloud, Oracle, composite services) Key Day to Day Responsibilities - Lead work sessions with users to define their reports and BI requirements - Work with the Application Development team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models. - Create logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy. - Optimize and update logical and physical data models to support new and existing projects. - Maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata. - Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models. - Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environments. - Validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness. - Analyze reporting requirements and propose appropriate solutions. - Develop data models according to company standards. - Guide System Analysts, Engineers, Programmers and others on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces. - Examine new application design and recommend corrections if required. - Lead the rollout of Reporting and Business Intelligence tools. Additionally - Experience and Qualifications - Ability to execute high quality, consistent, on-time results, with a keen attention to detail - Self-starter, able to work independently, able to succeed in a fast-paced, high intensity start-up environment - Effective oral and written communications skills. Ability to elicit and communicate technical and non-technical information in a clear and concise manner - Strong problem solving and analytical skills with experience analyzing data necessary to resolve issues uncovered and related to source data - Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills with ability to manage multiple simultaneous customer projects - Ability to evaluate and interpret end user information requirements, and to develop and implement appropriate technical solutions
