Name: Data/Business Analyst
Description: Tenaska Power Services has an opening for a Data/Business Analyst. The position will report to the Settlements Manager and is expected to collaborate with, and in some cases support, a number of key staff including Energy Managers, Energy Originators, and Accounting staff. This position will have an active role in updating, as well as creating, logic to validate energy settlement charge types across multiple energy markets. Essential Job FunctionsValidates energy settlement charges for multiple customers and across multiple energy marketsResponsible for settlement charge type modeling development and maintenance in TPS’s proprietary software system, creating data points and coding equationsResponsible for creation and maintenance of settlement procedures documentationResponsible for settlement report and dashboard design and development in TPS's proprietary software system and vended visualization software The ideal candidate for this position will have a working knowledge of centrally cleared energy markets and a willingness to learn TPS’s proprietary software system and business processes. He/she must be capable of developing/testing logic using C# light language.Required Skills Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline; Electrical and Computer Engineering preferred (Five years of related experience for a related power industry company may be substituted for a degree)Previous experience validating and analyzing energy settlement charge types, is a plusObject Oriented Programming knowledge, C# programming, or VBA script is a plusStrong analytical skillsDemonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneouslyGood oral and written communication skillsTenaska is an equal opportunity employer.Required Experience  Job Location  Arlington, US-TX

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob DetailsJob TitleSr. Business AnalystJob ID20170636LocationPlano - Corporate HeadquartersFull/Part TimeFull-TimeFavorite JobRegular/TemporaryRegularNORTH TEXAS TOLLWAY AUTHORITYThe North Texas Tollway Authority was created in 1997 to help advance local highway projects that lacked government funding. In addition to building and maintaining the finest roads in North Texas, we serve an estimated 7.5 million customers and process toll payments for all area toll roads and the airport toll gates. NTTAs nearly 800 employees work together to connect North Texans through safer, quicker and higher-quality roads.Brief Description:Under general direction of the PMO Manager, the Sr. Business Systems Analyst functions as a liaison between the Business Leadership Team, and other key stakeholders. Sr. Business Systems Analyst, working in conjunction with the IT Project Manager will plan, direct, and coordinate activities of designated projects, to ensure that the goals and objectives of the projects are accomplished, within the prescribed time frame, funding parameters and according to standard operating policy and procedure (SOPs). The Sr. Business Systems Analyst is the direct interface between the business, development staff, support staff, and project management, and is responsible for business process definition. Working as change agents, the Sr. Business Analyst will drive key activities like; requirements gathering, documenting existing and future-state business process flows, defining solution options, and supporting the development of related project planning documentation. During the development phase of a project, the Sr. Business Systems Analyst will ensure that the clients project support and service needs are executed in the development of the software, as well as accurately outlining system specifications. The Sr. Business Systems Analyst ensures that IT specific issues are addressed thoroughly, as well as communicated to the client and project team members as they arise. The Sr. Business Systems Analyst will also evaluate business processes and controls to ensure they adhere to industry best practices. The Sr. Business Systems Analyst will develop training programs and assist the business in the development of appropriate documentation for users. In a lead role, will be an advocate for adhering to the IT Project Management Life Cycle.Position Responsibilities:Capable of performing all of the duties of a Business AnalystDevelops project planning Documentation, process flows, project scheduling, and identification of risks, contingency plans and allotment of resources for each phase of the project, and arranges for recruitment or assignment of project personnel.Consults with management to review project proposals, to determine time frame, funding limitations, procedures for accomplishing the project, staffing requirements, and allotment of available resources to various phases of the project.Responsible for handling / overseeing more than one project at a time depending on scope of work of each project.Coordinates with other departments and prepares scope of work (needs analysis) based on solution needed by customer.Formulates and defines technical scope and objectives of project for project personnel.Identifies and schedules project deliverables, milestones, and required tasks.Coordinates recruitment or assignment of project personnel.Assigns duties, responsibilities, and scope of authority to project personnel.Directs and coordinates activities of project personnel to ensure project progresses on schedule and within prescribed budget.Function as a change agent, to advance the use of technology solutions throughout the NTTA business organizations, utilizing formal project management techniques, as identified in the Project Management Body-of-knowledge (PMBOK).Establishes standards and procedures for project reporting and documentation.Reviews status reports prepared by project personnel and modify schedules and plans as required.Prepares project status reports and keeps management, clients, and others informed of project status and related issues.Confers with project personnel to provide technical advice and resolve problems.Provide function specific user training across all disciplines within the IT environment.Communicates directly with all levels of management, as required. Ability to cope with job related stress including but not limited to deadlines, customer, supervisory and staff interactions, multi-tasking and high work volumes is required.Position Qualifications:Formal Education: Work requires knowledge of a specific vocational, administrative, or technical nature which may be obtained with two-year associates degree, diploma, or equivalent from a college, technical, business, vocational, or correspondence school. Appropriate certification may be awarded upon satisfactory completion of advanced study or training.Experience: Over five years and up to seven years.Supervision: Work requires functioning as a lead worker performing essentially the same work as those directed, and includes overseeing work quality, training, instructing, and scheduling work.Human Collaboration Skills . Contacts may require the consideration or different points of view to reach agreement. Elements of persuasion may be necessary to gain cooperation and acceptance of ideas.Freedom to Act:  Receives Limited Direction: The employee normally performs the duty assignment according to his or her own judgment, requesting supervisory assistance only when necessary. The assignment may be reviewed upon completion. Performance is reviewed periodically.Technical Skills:  Skilled: Work requires a comprehensive practical knowledge or a technical field with use of analytical judgment and decision-making abilities appropriate to the work environment of the organization.Budget Responsibility:  Does research for budget documents; and compiles data for computer entry; enters or oversees data entry. Has responsibility for monitoring budget expenditures (typically non-discretionary expenditures) for a work unit of less than a department size, i.e. program, projects, or small organizational units.Reading: Advanced - Ability to read literature, books, reviews, specifications, or technical journals, abstracts, financial reports, and/or legal documents. Ordinarily, such education is obtained in or at the college level or above. Math: Advanced Ability to apply fundamental concepts of theories, work with advanced mathematical operations methods, and functions or real and complex variables. Ordinarily, such education is obtained in or at the college level or above.Writing: Advanced Ability to write editorials, journals, speeches, manuals, or critiques. Ordinarily, such education is obtained in or at the college level or above. Certification & Other Requirements: PBA or PMP preferredHow To ApplyClick Apply. Register or log-in to your account. Complete the application in its entirety, including any questions, and click Submit.If you have questions about the application process, please access our Frequently Asked Questions At any time during the application process, you can click on the Job Title to which you are applying to return to this page to access the FAQs.Refer your Family and Friends to apply at https://careers.ntta.orgNTTA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability or veteran status.Company DescriptionThe NTTA is an organization sanctioned by the State of Texas to develop and maintain high-quality roadways in North Texas. NTTA tollways are designed to relieve traffic congestion and get North Texans around the region quickly, easily and safely.Our deeper purpose is to enhance the quality of life for area residents. With board members from all around North Texas, including Collin, Denton, Dallas, Tarrant and other surrounding counties, the NTTA represents North Texas as a whole in our mission to provide a safe and reliable toll road system, increase value and mobility options for our customers, operate the Authority in a businesslike manner, protect our bondholders, and partner to meet our region's growing need for transportation infrastructure.

Name: IT Support Analyst
Description: IT Support Analyst Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to be a leader within a highly successful global payroll services business? Are you an experienced IT Support Analyst? Are you looking to take your career to the next level by driving success through our values of Respect, Integrity, Teamwork, Accountability, Diversity and Community? Do you have a strong work ethic, global mindset and the desire to help build a great culture?  iiPay is a high growth, innovative company, based in US and UK, focused on delivering an outstanding customer experience and service levels. Our payroll managed service is underpinned by our market leading global payroll management system delivering a unique client experience and value-added services.  iiPay has a unique opportunity for a experienced and motivated IT Support Analyst to be based in Dallas, who wants to be part of this rapidly expanding business, taking on the responsibility of delivering ad supporting IT services across the business to help drive to our goal of Paying the Planet.Role overviewiiPay are rapidly expanding and as such require additional resource to fulfil IT support requirements  Working as part of a helpdesk you will resolve both 1st / 2nd line IT issues along with taking the lead in delivering a variety of international IT projects from concept through to completion.Key Objectives of the role·  Deliver 1st / 2nd line IT Support services across the business  ·  To problem solve, provide solutions and play an interactive role within a team environment.  ·  Provide support to existing IT operations  ·  Undertake IT projects from concept through to completion as per the companys roadmapExperience, Skills and KnowledgeExperience of working as helpdesk support ·  Experience of software installation & troubleshooting in a networked environment including Microsoft Windows & Office, Centralised Antivirus/Encryption & VPN  ·  Experience of installing and configuring network connected devices including desktops, laptops, printers & scanners  ·  Understanding of Active Directory, DHCP, DNS & networking (TCP/IP)  ·  Knowledge of data cabling, including patching, CAT5/6 wiring Understanding of Cloud based applications (Microsoft, Okta, Box)Knowledge of centralised/unattended deployment for OS and applicationsKnowledge of Linux & PowerShell scriptingConfiguration and security of mobile devices and smartphonesKnowledge of telephone systemsWhat we are looking for in youThe successful candidate will be required to deliver IT Support across the business. You will have superb communication and interpersonal skills coupled with a professional telephone manner. You must be able to work well within a team and manage your own time effectively. You will be able to pick up and learn new technologies quickly.  You will be the first point of contact for all IT queries across a wide range of IT disciplines. The role will involve resolving IT issues, configuring software and hardware and supporting the IT infrastructure across our different locations. You will also be able to deliver a variety of IT projects across the business.  We are looking for someone with MCP, MCSA or equivalent qualifications or relevant experience working in a similar role.  This role is office based in Dallas and cannot be a remote position. There may be a small amount of travel required. What can we offer you? As well as offering you the opportunity to be innovative and ambitious, iiPay believe in offering a competitive salary, generous benefit package and a great culture and employee engagement initiatives, not to mention our other benefits below! 3 Weeks vacationAdditional 10 to 12 Holidays and Floating daysPaid Sick and FML daysMedical, Dental and Vision plansLife/ AD&DVoluntary Life/AD&DVoluntary Long-Term DisabilityVoluntary Worksite Benefits401(k)Daily free snacks and beveragesMonthly free breakfastsFree ParkingFree gym within the office buildingContinuous development and financial assistance for education and professional membershipsGreat company events! Please note that we do not use agencies in our recruitment and cannot accept unsolicited resumes from agencies.

Name: Desktop Support Analyst
Description: Position Purpose:This position is responsible to ensure proper computer operation so that end users can accomplish business tasks. This includes receiving, prioritizing, documenting, and actively resolving end-user help requests and escalating incidents when considered appropriate and necessary to maintain SLA expectations. Problem resolution may involve the use of diagnostic and help request tracking tools, as well as requiring that the individual give in-person, hands-on help at the desktop level.Duties and Responsibilities:• Provide first contact support of incoming requests to the service desk via telephone, web portal, email and chat to ensure courteous, timely and effective resolution of end-user issuesBuild rapport and elicit problem details from service desk customersPrioritize incidents and service requests according to defined processes to meet defined SLAsEscalate incidents with accurate documentation to suitable technician, when requiredRecord, track and document the service desk incident-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made and actions taken, through to final resolutionUse remote tools and diagnostic utilities to aid in troubleshootingResearch solutions through internal and external knowledge base as neededIdentify and learn appropriate software and hardware used and supported by the organizationPerform hands-on fixes at the desktop level when remote tools are not appropriate, including hardware repairs, delivery of peripherals or other fixes as determinedInstall antivirus software and ensure virus definitions are up to datePerform preventative maintenance, including checking and cleaning of workstations, printers and peripheralsTest fixes to ensure an incident has been adequately resolvedDevelop help sheets and FAQ lists for end usersContribute to technician knowledge base as neededReinforce SLAs to manage end-user expectationsProvide suggestions for continual improvementEducation:High school diploma. Associates degree preferred.

Name: User Researcher, Business Technology
Description: Are you comfortable with ambiguity yet oddly organized and talented at going from chaos to clarity? Are you fascinated by human behavior and curious about how organizational culture, context and technology connect? Then we’d love to hear from you!The Business Technology Innovation team at Salesforce is looking for a design researcher who has an endless curiosity about why people do what they do, a passion for inventive problem solving, and is excited about working with our internal business executives and leaders to convey what is really meaningful to their internal and external customers. Our design researchers scope, plan, execute and analyze all aspects of research programs across all of our business organizations within Salesforce—bringing unique perspectives to solving our biggest and most important business challenges that impact our end-customer experience.About Business Technology InnovationBusiness Technology Innovation is an internal-facing, entrepreneurial innovation team within Salesforce. We help our own internal businesses, like Marketing and Sales, recognize and interpret forces of change in their business landscape and partner with them to plot a course towards a more robust, digital future, through human-centered design. And we help build and deliver that future by using our own world-class technology to set our business on a path of growth and change.Our engagements combine elements of strategic advisory, visioning, user research, ideation, storytelling, value propositions, workshop facilitation, rapid prototyping, end-user concept testing, and product design.ResponsibilitiesGather, prioritize and shape key questions from designers, business strategists, solution engineers, business analysts and our business partners into research objectivesPlan and conduct practical and impactful research that varies in approach, scope and timeframeAnalyze and synthesize research findings into a reframed business challenge and insightsCreatively convey those insights to the appropriate people in the most engaging mannerFacilitate multi-disciplinary teams through various exercisesConfidently communicate a provocative point of view, both written and verbal, to C-suite executivesBasic Qualifications3-5 years of relevant work experience conducting research as part of an internal or agency team and/or academic studies in a relevant field (e.g., anthropology, business, cultural studies, design, psychology)Strong foundation in qualitative methods and contextual inquirySound ability to scope, plan, execute and analyze qualitative researchWillingness to experiment with research methodsExceptional storytelling skills, including the ability to communicate clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of an organizationInterest in working across a wide range of industriesEnthusiasm for working in a collaborative environment with a culture of critiqueAbility and willingness to travel 25% of the time (both national and international)Preferred QualificationsExperience conducting qualitative research in a B2B settingExperience with enterprise software solutionsExperience working in digital and emerging technologiesExperience with video editing and storytellingPosting StatementSalesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

And we’ll need a great team behind us. (That’s where you come in.) We want to show the world that transparency, candor and collaboration aren’t just good values. They’re good business. Working here isn’t for people who want to punch a clock. It’s for people who want to punch a hole in the status quo. Come join us. And make a difference instead of just a living. Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant’s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant’s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  This role can be based in any of the following locations: Lewisville, TX; Gardena, CA  The Senior Business Analyst leads the requirements gathering process and works as a liaison in order to understand the business issues and challenges of our customers. Than working with the teams to solution ideas that enable customers to achieve their goals. The Senior Business Analyst works closely with product owners, designers, web developers, engineers, scrum masters and quality assurance teams to understand, analyze, and document requirements and deliver functional specifications for project delivery. Name: Financial Analyst II
Description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas believes in the diversity of our people, ideas and experiences, and we are committed to building an inclusive culture that represents the communities we serve. ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY: As part of the nation's central bank, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas is committed to strengthening the economy and our communities. At the Fed, you have the opportunity to become part of an important public service institution whose work touches lives across the globe. It's a big job and that's why we need talented, results-driven professionals who care about making a difference. POSITION SUMMARY: Currently we have an opening in our Financial Management department for a Financial Analyst II located in Dallas, TX. The Financial Analyst is responsible for analyzing financial status by collecting, monitoring and studying data to assist management in planning, reporting and forecasting financial information. RESPONSIBILITIES: Applies more advanced financial analysis and/or cost accounting principles, practices, and techniques to record, compile, distribute, and analyze cost data; prepare operating budgets; and perform financial analysis to support strategic decision making and/or reduce costs Provides consultation and training to departments on budget and cost accounting related matters Assists in preparation of more advanced analysis and variance reports, tables, charts, and graphs; gathers data, identifies variables, prepares/tests mathematical models, and determines / prioritizes viable solutions. Solves a range of straightforward problems. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction. Provides analytical support for moderately complex projects, developing budget/cost accounting/financial analysis methods and procedures. Utilize computer systems to perform assigned tasks including designing and troubleshooting standard and advanced reports Assists other cost/budget analysts and coordinates more advanced cost/budget matters with other departments Analyzes budget and cost accounting performance, and prepares reports and recommendations to management Generates forecasts and analyzes trends in budget, cost accounting and other areas of business Researches trends and performance to assist the organization`s financial planning Creates financial models of "what if" scenarios for future business planning decisions in areas such as capital, facilities projects, software development, etc.COMPETENCIES: Functional Knowledge: Requires expanded conceptual knowledge in own discipline and broadens capabilities. Expertise: Understands key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. Leadership : No supervisory responsibilities but provides informal guidance to new team members. Problem Solving: Solves problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using technical experience and judgment and precedents. Impact: Impacts quality of own work and the work of others on the team; works within guidelines and policies. Interpersonal Skills: Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting (with emphasis on cost), Operations Research/Analysis, Business Administration or other related field 2-5 years professional experience in a financial planning, cost accounting, or operations research environment Skilled in organization, meeting deadlines, accuracy, team player, customer focus, influencing others, independence, initiative, perseverance, presentation, decision making. Proficient utilizing Outlook, Excel (pivot tables), Lawson, and Ariba Knowledge and experience in own discipline; still acquiring higher-level knowledge and skills; ability to learn about the organization, processes and customers. Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills, be comfortable working in a team environment as well as able to work well independently Equivalent education and/or experience may be substituted for any of the aboveWork Hours and Conditions: Monday - Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; flexibility / additional hours may be required based on business needs; some travel may be required, up to 5%Notes: Employment is contingent upon the selected candidate passing a financial credit check Assessments may be required as part of the interview process Based on related education and experience of the selected candidate, this position may be filled at various levels. We are Proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Position Title Senior IT Business Analyst  16-Oct-2018 Department Information Technology Primary Location Irving-TX Job PostingThe Company and the Role: Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.  Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, a global leader in aggregates, cement, concrete, and other downstream activities. The Group employs over 60,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in 60 countries.  Lehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified and proven IT Senior Business Analyst (Sr. BA). As part of the Project Management Office, the Sr. BA develops expertise in several business areas and is primarily responsible for translating business requirements into functional specifications and ensuring projects deliver on the objectives and benefits.  This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas.  This position is perfect for a proven Business Analyst who would like to align themselves with a progressive and growing company to enhance their skills and career. While working in a fast paced, performance culture, you will begin your career with a proven leader in the cement and construction materials supply.  Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled What you’ll get to do:Involved in requirements gathering and analysis to identify problems and suggest solutions using a systematic, multi-step approach.Work cross-functionally to solve problems and recommend changes to technology solutions and/or business processes.Collaborate within the project team and other external departments to lead the assessment and selection of technology solutions and vendors, including the documentation and management of proposal requests.Understand project objectives and benefits, documents the business case and project charter, including scope, resources and initial budget. Share technical and administrative knowledge to others.Drive project success via formal requirements definition, solution design facilitation, and work with business and technical teams to build detailed test scripts.Leverage several project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, and Hybrid) to ensure predictable project success.Lead small projects and/or system enhancements.Provide support to junior staff.Perform other job-related duties as assigned.Who we are looking for:Minimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree.Minimum 6-8 years of experience in an information technology environment.Minimum 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst.An energetic passion for continuous improvement.Strong analytical abilityExperience working in IT and cross-functional project teams.Knowledge of prevalent IT and project management methodologies, system development lifecycles and best practices.Prefer Business Analyst or Project Management certification.Prefer industry knowledge of construction materials business processes.Excellent communication and organization skills, verbally and written. Our corporate office supports the Lehigh Hanson plants in North America and offers a competitive benefits package that includes a 401(k) savings plan with company match, tuition reimbursement, and employee purchase program. Amenities include an on-site deli, free covered parking, and free fitness center.  No search firms please. Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: Hilltop Holdings is building a premier financial services company, dedicated to Integrity, Collaboration, Adaptability, Respect, and Excellence. Our principles are the momentum that drives our actions, guides our decisions, and enables us to earn the confidence of the customers and communities we serve. If you want to be a part of a team on the rise, Hilltop Holdings may be your next move forward.  The primary focus of this position is the design, support and maintenance of the Company’s Human Resource Information System (HRIS) in addition to other systems supported by the HRIS team. This individual serves as a technical point-of-contact for assigned functional areas and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes and upgrades, complex report writing and analysis of data flows for process improvement opportunities. Analytics and Metrics - Produce ad hoc and scheduled reports. Develop reports, perform analysis on HR data, identify trends, and develop scorecards.Work with the HR and technical teams to implement new and/or upgrade system functionality, including ESS and MSS capabilities, talent management, LMS, compensation management and organizational Chart. This will include analysis, design, development, testing and post go live trouble shooting and support.Provide first level support to the Human Resources team with troubleshooting and issue resolution.Testing application functionality prior to the release of upgrades and customizations.Maintain procedures and business process documentation.Ensure data integrity through quality assurance and proactively validating data.Assist in other areas of human resources as needed.A minimum of 3-5 years of experience working with human resources systems is required.Strong understanding of human resources processes, practices and metrics, and experience with managing system configurations to align with HR policies.Experience working with payroll, benefits and other sensitive data.An understanding of database reporting would be an asset.A high degree of accuracy and attention to detail is required.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner are required.Must possess strong problem solving, organizational skills, time management and the ability to multitask.Proficient knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office. Expert level Excel required.

Name: Competitive Intelligence Analyst
Description: ExamSoft Worldwide is seeking a talented and self-motivated Competitive Intelligence Analyst to deliver actionable insights about customer and market trends driving opportunities or threats that could impact the business. The Competitive Intelligence Analyst will report to the Director, Digital Marketing.  This role will conduct research using a variety of formal methods including surveys, interviews, and data analysis with a large focus on delivering competitive insights, identifying market trends, and implementing best practices. Responsibilities:Collect data on consumers, competitors and market place and consolidate information into actionable items, reports and presentationsUnderstand business objectives to design and conduct surveys to discover prospective customers' preferences and needsCompile and analyze statistical data using modern and traditional methods to collect itPerform valid and reliable market research SWOT analysisInterpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations on pricing models and target marketsProvide competitive analysis on various companies' market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operationEvaluate program methodology and key data to ensure that data on the research is accurate and remains currentRemain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practicesDevise focus group discussions, mail responses, surveys, etc. to obtain market insights and make recommendations based on the dataProvide organization with vital information to help make decisions on the promotion, distribution, and design of products or servicesManage any necessary vendors to control costs and acquire appropriate supporting materialQualifications:Bachelor's degree required; emphasis in Business, Marketing, or related quantitative fieldMinimum two (2) years relevant experience in market research and/or analyticsExperienced with survey software tools such as Qualtrics, Survey Monkey preferredExperienced with data visualization platforms such as SiSense or equivalent preferredDemonstrated expertise in market and customer research methodologies and proven knowledge of tools and techniques to capture, analyze, and disseminate actionable insights, requiredAbility to analyze data to draw both qualitative and quantitative conclusions, requiredStrong multi-tasking ability; including managing multiple projects at the same time and manage outsourcing projects with external agencies and vendors, requiredDemonstrated communication (written, verbal, presentation) skills with the ability to interact with all levels of stakeholders, requiredStatistical and/or mathematical ability; able to synthesize data from a wide variety of sources, skilled in analysis and reporting, requiredStrong time management skillsStrong self-starter and management track recordWhy ExamSoft? ExamSoft is a market-leading assessment-management solution that supports the entire testing process, including exam creation, administration, delivery, scoring, and analysis. The software delivers powerful, actionable data to assess learning outcomes. ExamSoft is a growing company that hires smart and talented people who are excited about personal growth, the positive impact they have on education, and enjoy working in a challenging and fun work environment.  ExamSoft offers market competitive pay & annual bonuses along with 100% paid employee benefits & subsidized dependent benefits. Because teamwork is essential to the company and culture, there are monthly in-office and quarterly off-site events, including volunteer and community involvement events!  Love to snack? So does ExamSoft! There is a variety of snacks provided in the office from fruit and nuts to cookies and chips, and both of our offices include an onsite gym.  Most of all, ExamSoft offers a dynamic, fun, and fast-paced work environment, filled with awesome coworkers!

strategic thinking, business acumen, and accountabilityAbility to establish strategic technical direction, translate concepts into actionable, implementation plans and identify technologies that Education: Bachelors Degree Preferred/ Nice-to-haves: Marketing systems experience (Adobe Digital Asset Management (DAM), BrandPoint, Spredfast (Social Media), Print Vendor etc.) CALANCE Offerings: H1 Transfers/Green Card processing offered  Open enrollment of Medical/Dental/Vision benefits  401K Retirement program  Paid Bi-Weekly/Direct Deposit  Flex Spending Plan  Voluntary Life, AD&D, STD or LTD plansCompany DescriptionCalance is a recognized leader in providing top-tier Information Technology professionals across North America. We offer highly-skilled professional IT consultants on a temporary or project basis. Consultants are employees of Calance while on assignment for the client, allowing for cost savings, risk management and operational benefits.  Calance's Contract-to-Hire option allows an IT organization to evaluate an individual before making a decision to bring them on as a full-time employee. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Corner Bakery Cafe:This Senior Financial Analyst position will play a key role in the financial planning and analysis function, responsible for providing analytical support across all areas of the brand. This role will partner with senior management to monitor key performance indicators, analyze financial results and identify areas of opportunities to strengthen the business. The position will require a high level of independent problem-solving, decision-making, prioritization, sense of urgency and adaptability to support the initiatives and priorities of the brand. ResponsibilitiesProvide analytical support for ad hoc reporting regarding performance against brand objectives.Present monthly financial summaries of key performance indicators and pertinent financial highlights to benchmark progress against strategic business plans.Analyze company trends using key operational metrics, while providing insight into future risks and opportunities.Analyze business initiatives (e.g. Marketing, Product Tests) and recommend appropriate actions.Identify opportunities with analytical support to positively impact company profitability.Partner with other departments to analyze business needs.Participate in the annual budgeting process and periodic forecasts as required.QualificationsA bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.3-7 years relevant work experience (restaurant or retail industry experience a plus).Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work well independently.Excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills.Ability to work with all levels within the organization in a professional and competent manner.Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines.Ability to model business requirements and prepare sensitivity analysis.Advanced knowledge of Excel and other MS Office applications.EOE / E-Verify EmployerLocation: 12700 Park Central Dr. #1300, Dallas, Texas 75251

Name: Enterprise Information Analyst - Dallas/Richardson
Description: OverviewTexas Capital Bank is looking for a hands-on Enterprise Information Analyst who has experience in information management, data warehousing, big data, and analytics technologies to provide us with tactical direction in the areas of business intelligence and analytics. This role reports into Enterprise Data Management and develops analytical solutions to support the new Enterprise Data Strategy. The Enterprise Information Analyst will develop detailed knowledge of underlying data and systems at Texas Capital Bank and become a subject matter expert on content, current and future uses of data, and the quality and interrelationship between core elements of a new data repository. The Enterprise Information Analyst will partner with the Enterprise Data Analysts to drive the Enterprise Data Strategy, assess and implement business consumption tools, facilitate user adoption of business intelligent assets, and develop OLAP and semantic data layers for business consumption. ResponsibilitiesPerforms role in areas of advanced data techniques, data integration, data visualization, data discovery, statistical methods, analytic design and self-service Business IntelligenceDevelops and maintains self-service Business Intelligence data environments using Microsoft SQL Server architecture required for structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. Proven track record to drive rapid prototyping and design for end-to-end analytical environmentsDevelops enterprise data from new and existing data sources, publicly available data and business-to-business partnerships for advanced data analytics and self-service Business IntelligenceEstablishes standards and guidelines for the design and development, tuning, deployment and maintenance of advanced data analytics and modelsWork with lines of business to define data requirements and deliverables, and translates data requirements into production specificationsUnderstand and articulates line of business data requirements and works alongside the IT Delivery team to define the corresponding solution design QualificationsBachelor’s degree and 5+ years of SQL + MSBI, with emphasis in SQL Server Analysis Services (Cubes)Prior experience building and supporting enterprise-wide programs for self-service BIUnderstanding of data management principles and industry best practices, inherent risks, and controlsAbility to understand data requirements across lines of business and organize as common data requirements to support company specific strategic objectivesStrong problem solving and analytical skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills to interact with business owners across the organization and influence outcomesBanking experience in an analytical, finance or IT role preferred Experience with data analytics development within the Azure cloud platform preferred

Name: Global Netting Analyst
Description: Who we areCollaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for diverse, talented team members who want to grow and start their impossible with us. Who we’re looking forToyota’s Accounts Receivable Department is looking for a highly-motivated and qualified Global Netting Analyst.The primary responsibility of this role is to manage TEMA Global Netting and receivable systems to ensure the timely and accurate collection of funds and settlement of intercompany balances. Reporting to the Manager of Accounts Receivable, the person in this role will support the Accounts Receivable department’s objective to successfully invoice and settle intercompany balances.What you’ll be doing Ensure the timely and accurate monthly settlement of intercompany balances. This includes proactive communications with counter parties to minimize disputed invoices and timely investigation and resolution of disputed AP or AR invoices. Provide accurate and timely cash forecasts to Treasury.As the TEMA AR and Billing Control Owner, will confirm receivables modules are reconciled to the general ledger on a monthly basis and only authorized users have access to TEMA’s PeopleSoft Billing and AR modules.During Monthly close, will guarantee the accurate recording of TEMA billing, receivable, and Global Netting transactions.Conduct month end reporting to Management of TEMA Global Netting and receivable KPI’s.Provide User Training for Global Netting and Receivables.What you bring Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field.CPA and/or MBAExpertise analyzing relational databases utilizing ad-hoc queries.Work experience within Global Netting and receivable systems.Experience with large quality driven global brands such as Toyota.Detail-oriented, excellent verbal & written communication, and analytical.Excellent proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint and Microsoft Word.Added bonus if you have Experience with process improvements.Active participation on large I/T system projects.Experience with ERP and SAP.What we’ll bringDuring your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility and respectProfessional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursementVehicle purchase & lease programs Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire familyFlextime and virtual work options (if applicable)Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contributePaid holidays and paid time offReferral services related to prenatal services, adoption, child care, schools and moreFlexible spending accountsRelocation assistance (if applicable)What you should knowOur success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.Have a question or need assistance with your application? Check out the How to Apply section of our careers page on Toyota.com To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.

Name: Portfolio Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe TMX Finance® Family of Companies is looking for a Portfolio Analyst to join the team and extract data to create portfolio reporting used to identify risks and valuable business insights. Your ability to source, validate, and work across multiple platforms such as Excel, SQL, EIS, Hyperion, Great Plains, Google Analytics, and Salesforce will give you the capability to support the finance team. With critical thought processes and logic, your ability to make every report process quicker while maintain exceptional accuracy will be a great value to the team. Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesPartner with multiple departments and staff with varying degrees of data skills. Maintaining a service mentality to support of business partners. Identify data and process challenges. Solve them with tactical or strategic recommendations. Use mining tools across multiple database platforms. Contribute as a subject matter expert with the design, build, testing, and implementing of data/reporting solutions. Recommend based on your analysts, course corrections or risks to reasons for material business trend changes. Maintain report suites for distribution to your customer or analysis internally in the department. Assess competitive landscape of our stores and industry. Digest industry trends and localized impacts from various sources internal and external. Involve problem frame-works, develop hypotheses, and test, and analyze solution development, feasibility of operational scope, lead implementation efforts, and develop a monitoring plan. Collaborate with other departments across the organization to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability.  19001, CORP, Operational Finance & Per-19501, 19501, FIN26052-Portfolio Analyst Job RequirementsMinimum QualificationsBachelor's Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, or Engineering)6+ years of relevant experience in the financial services industry supporting 2 or more of the following: Finance, Accounting, Risk, Marketing, Call Centers, Operations, Portfolio, or other analytics fieldsAdvanced understanding of statistics and state-of-the-art data mining techniques that include, but are not limited to; Logistic regression, decision trees, neural networks, stochastic gradient boosting, random forest, survival analysis, and clustering analysisHands-on experience in data manipulation, data mining, statistics, web analytics, and descriptive analyticsStrong financial, strategic, analytical, and project management skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsSelf-motivated, independent but collaborative, organized, proactive, highly responsive, and flexibleLearn More About Us The Portfolio Analyst is a member of Performance Management, part of the Finance team, a group of trusted financial advisers who strive to ensure our business partners have the financial data they need to make the correct decisions as we continue to solidify our position as the industry leader. Name: SQL Programmer & Reporting Analyst, ACAP
Description: Do you excel at designing and developing database systems? Have you ever worked for a company whose motto is “Work hard, play hard, and love who you do it with”; who’s passionate about challenging you to think differently; and who cares about YOU the employee?  This describes Holmes Murphy to a “T” as well as one of our latest job openings! Plus, did we mention we also have a flexible environment and a competitive benefits and salary package? If this sounds like an awesome opportunity and you think you’re a perfect fit to join our team as an SQL Programmer & Reporting Analyst within our Dallas, Texas office, keep reading! We are an analytical, organized professional with technical expertise to serve in this role for our ACAP Health team.  Duties: Design and maintain database systems including development, testing, debugging and troubleshooting.Analyze complex data systems while documenting data elements, data flow, relationships and dependencies.Develop automated and reusable routines for extracting requested information from data sources.Compile detailed reports using data reporting tools and make recommendations based on findings.Work in partnership with assigned business unit.Write policies, procedures, and technical documentation.Be able to manage the interaction of data between multiple systems (e.g. Salesforce, Webservers, Data Warehouse).Other tasks as assigned by stakeholders in assigned business unit. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Strong analytical, quantitative and problem-solving abilities.Thorough knowledge of relational database theory and practice.Experience working with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with data systems teams.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Basic knowledge of business practices.Must be knowledgeable of and comply with HMA’s Client Privacy Policy, HIPAA regulations and E&O procedures and policies. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field preferred.4+ years of database analysis and/or design preferred.Strong knowledge of SQL, SSRS, and relational database programming. Knowledge of reporting/analytical tools.detail oriented.Advanced competency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook is required. If you’re ready for a new and exciting opportunity to work for an amazing company and you think you have what it takes to be an SQL Programmer & Reporting Analyst for ACAP Health, apply today!

Name: Jr.Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionUnderstands business objectives and problems, and identifies alternative solutions. The incumbent will manage the balance between business requirements and user expectations, while being a liaison between users and technologists to drive requirements to design.  Responsibilities include business process development, project work, troubleshooting and resolution of issues efficiently; identify areas of improvement, testing and special projects as required. Must Have Skills: · Business Process Improvement  · Ability to develop and implement quality assurance processes and procedures including test/use cases  · Understanding of SDLC  · Basic knowledge of databases and skills with database queries  · Standardized processes and procedures implementation  · Documenting business processes  · Requirements analysis  · Requirements gathering  · Develop test plans and procedures, BRD, SRS, FRD etc.,  · Manage systems testing and support user acceptance testing QualificationsEducation: Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Communications, Business or related area0-3 years working as a Business Analyst in a technical environment gathering and documenting requirements for technology projects.

Name: Senior Data Analyst (Product Analytics)
Description: We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics team! What's the team like? Our team's mission is to use data to deliver long-term strategic insights. We also provide short-term guidance on A/B tests, user behavior etc. We leverage data to understand our users: what they need, what they do, how to retain them and ultimately how to help them find the best dates.  We also work to support business trends/forecasting, model the impact of new product ideas on Revenue/EDITDA and other metrics. What's my day-to-day? You will help guide Match's product decisions by crunching large data sets, analyzing, building models and driving key insights. You'll also work with other cross-functional teams like Finance, CRM, Engineering and Business Intelligence. Provide internal consulting to product management, marketing and CRM teams on A/B tests as they move from initiatives from concept to marketIdentify strategic opportunities to apply data science where it will offer cross functional benefitsProvide key insights to internal customers on their specific ad-hoc needsServe as the subject matter expert on applying various statistical methodologies towards distilling actionable insightsResearch issues about customer behavior/changes by analyzing relevant metrics, trends etc. supporting enterprise level initiativesAssist with conducting member market research - design questionnaires, analyze data and provide meaningful insightsWhat skills is Match looking for?3+ years of SQL (T-SQL preferred)Exposure to applied statistics (descriptive statistics, statistical testing, design of experiments, linear modelling, time series analysis etc); Python/SPSS/SAS/R experience a strong plusHands on experience with ML platforms such as tensorflow highly desirableAdvanced Excel knowledgeExcellent problem solving skillsBachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering / related field, Marketing, or MBA with quantitative focusSelf-starter with good communications skillsExperience in consumer internet preferred*applicants will be required to complete a SQL and Data Analysis skills assessment testWhy Match? A lot of businesses say they change lives, but we actually do it. We've helped millions of people find love and happiness. You can wear jeans every dayOur benefits and perks are pretty amazingDrinks and snacks are on us every single dayWe have happy hours monthly, so there's always something to celebrate

Name: SalesForce Analyst
Description: Perennials and Sutherland, LLC is one of the most respected and iconic names in the exclusively to-the-trade, luxury home furnishings, textiles and accessories market. Our company has dedicated over three decades to working with the very best in the design world to create and market truly unique and exquisite products. Everything we do and the elite clientele we serve is dedicated to making life more beautiful. Environments for life, architectural, landscape and beyond are what we live and breathe each and every day. Ours is more than a life of producing and selling products. Our people share a passion for creativity, design and art that is central to our daily lives. Its not just what we do but what we love.  The Salesforce Analyst is responsible for the support and enhancement of internal systems and processes across the organization. This person will work closely with all teams and gain a deep understanding of how each one functions to ensure they have the appropriate tools and processes to focus on their core competencies.  Key Responsibilities: Serve as subject matter expert, and ensure projects are delivered on timeEvaluate existing processes, recommending and implementing solutions in/around the Salesforce platformDocument and evaluate business requirements to identify gaps, interdependencies and reconcile conflicts with proposed solutionsEnsures departmental visions are supported through proper use of Salesforce technologyPerforms administrative maintenance in Salesforce to ensure proper data collection and efficient usability for users and customersAdvise key stakeholders on best practices in Salesforce.com application configuration, security/permissions, workflow, customizations and data validation.Assist or lead Salesforce user training Qualifications: Bachelors degree required, preferably in Computer Science, IT or a business area discipline (i.e. accounting, investments, or marketing).Minimum of 5 years of experience in business systems analysis, with 2-4 years of Salesforce.com administrationStrong organizational and analytical skills with attention to detailAbility to accept and manage changing priorities and address issues quickly and professionallySalesforce.com Administrator or Developer certifications are a plus Whether its the executive who offers visionary leadership, or the sales professional who wont settle for less than perfection, a business needs great people and a collaborative environment to thrive. We maintain, develop, and inspire talented professionals and craftsmen. Our investment in people, equipment, and facilities results in a positive engaging workplace and gives our company a competitive edge in the marketplace. We believe deeply that the right people are our greatest asset. We offer careers for smart, creative, high energy people driven to contribute in a team environment where everyone can win. We foster potential, celebrate success, and support every colleague.  Perennials and Sutherland, LLC employees enjoy a vibrant office culture, welcoming and inclusive executive team, and fantastic work-life balance.

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: Job Description DomainBusiness Management AreaBus Val & Rel Mgmt TeamSolutions Estimation MgmtThe IT Agile Business Analyst will utilize Agile/Lean Methodology experience to help drive and deliver enterprise-scale projects requiring a technology solution  � Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop business cases  o Work closely with counterparts in IT and Finance to ensure technical solutions are  aligned with business needs  o Perform cost/benefit analysis of IT solutions  � Conduct appropriate level of research needed to help inform strategic priorities and funding decisions  o Communicates clearly and regularly with IT and Business stakeholders to make sure IT  initiatives are aligned with firm's long-term strategic goals and focus  o Coordinates with the business and internal technology teams to drive and document the completion of scorecards, estimation and business cases to communicate short and longterm solution needs, success metrics, objectives, cost and development estimates  � Assist with budget and forecast preparation and analysis  � Serve as liaison between IT and business end users  � Facilitate dialogue across functional areas and management levels  � Perform business and data analysis and assist in the creation of business case reporting framework  � Develop expertise in both our business processes and technology solutions/offerings  � Engage (elicitation workshops, etc.) with all stakeholders to determine, document and validate business and user requirements using relevant and applicable techniques (e.g. user stories & acceptance criteria, business rules, use cases, process flows, etc.).  Must have Agile certification, preferably PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) or  Scrum Alliance CSM/CSPO/CSD (Certified Scrum Master/Certified Scrum Product  Owner/Certified Scrum Developer)  Proficiency with Jira or similar Agile / Scrum tools  3 years' experience working as a Business Analyst  Knowledge of various technologies (Distributed, Mainframe, Cloud, etc.)

Name: Data Modeler/Data Analyst
Description: Team Daugherty is looking to add a Information Architect to the Dallas team! This individual will be responsible for translating business capabilities and requirements into enterprise data solutions. We are looking for someone who has a strong data orientation and can help develop an enterprise data strategy. Working across the spectrum of management consulting activities and industries, you will have greater opportunities to broaden your career and tackle complex stimulating challenges. This will enable you to accumulate the requisite skills and experiences to develop the functional and industry expertise needed to progress within management consulting and continue to deliver value to our clients.  As an Information Architect you will be responsible for the following:  • Translate business needs into long term information architecture solutions • Identify and document data quality issues and data patterns. Advising clients on data design alternatives and business process change opportunities. • Connecting user needs to emerging data technologies in order to acquire or design tools, techniques and approaches that allow client users to realize optimal project delivery results. • Delivering integrated business systems support to users (internal and external to IT), and applying an expert understanding of the business issues and the impact of technology. • Executing and managing moderate functional testing efforts. Identify and report risks throughout the life of the project and provide mitigation strategy for those risks.  We are looking for someone with:  • A 4-year college degree. • Big data and Hadoop experience • Understanding of one or more Cloud data architectures, preferably on AWS. Strong experience in data modeling/architecture (operational, analytical) • Deep understanding of data management concepts such as MDM, data governance, and metadata management. • 5+ years related experience in a business analysis role within IT departments and/or management consulting organizations. • Strong SQL skills with the ability to write complex SQL statements that analyze data and create prototypes. • Familiarity with several software delivery methodologies (RUP/Agile/Waterfall). • Strong knowledge of requirement gathering, use case analysis and user acceptance testing.  We offer members of Team Daugherty:  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance. • Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings plan. • Life, disability and long-term care insurance. • Little to no travel. • Robust career development and training.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce is looking for a Data Analyst for our client in Dallas, Texas (TX).  Summary:  You will be the performance specialist providing operational insights on multiple internal customers. You will do this by learning about the data models for our maintenance systems, understanding business challenges, discovering organizational tools that are available and then delivering a solution that is of best quality that can be provided. Our days are spent working with our Internal Customers to better understand their challenges and what can be done to reduce or eliminate those challenges.  Work Activities/Context:  Serves as the focal point for gathering requirements, designing, and scheduling reports Proactively looks for ways to improve current reporting and automation procedures Performs periodic, ad hoc queries as needed by the business Participates in special projects involving initiatives with the business, specifically with our Technology group when needed Ensures high-quality, daily deliverables by monitoring and communicating issues with our Customers and our Technology group in a timely manner Assists team with testing and authoring solutions when needed Serves as lead/owner for report publications and daily automation jobsREQUIREMENTS: Three or more years of broad-based relevant business experience, specifically in the areas of data aggregation, analysis, and reporting required Three or more years of experience writing SQL against enterprise databases (e.g. Oracle, Teradata, Sybase) required Three or more years of experience with an enterprise business intelligence platform (e.g. Crystal Reports, SQL Reporting Services) required Three or more years of experience writing automated solutions in a scripting language (e.g. VBScript, VBA) preferred Extensive proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially in Excel (e.g. macros, advanced formulas, pivot tables) required Previous experience in data mining, grooming, and aggregation from multiple sources preferred Strong math and statistical skills preferred Previous experience in Tableau and Alteryx preferred Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Lead Financial Analyst
Description: AT&T is leading the way to the future for customers, businesses and the industry. We're developing new technologies to make it easier for our customers to stay connected to their world. With a network that covers 225 countries, including more than 120 million customers, wed say were well on our way. Together, weve built a premier integrated communications company and an amazing place to work and grow. Team up with industry innovators every time you walk into work, creating the world you always imagined. So what do you say? Lets do great things together.  Overall Purpose: Responsible for conducting and documenting more complex financial analysis projects, works on problems of diverse scope including the analysis of financial reports, trend, and opportunities.  Key Roles and Responsibilities: Evaluates and makes recommendations relating to business opportunities, investments, financial regulations, and similar financial projects or programs. Gathers, interprets, and evaluates financial information. Responsible for the analysis and interpretation of financial and other data. Develops recommendations to achieve the organizations financial objectives. Determines financial consequences of alternative methods, plans and strategies. Evaluates financial performance including cost or budget administration. Performs complex data modeling and financial analysis.  Job Contribution: Uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in effective ways. Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in- depth evaluation of variable factors.  Experience: Typically requires 5-7 years experience.  Supervisory: No.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Science, Engineering, Finance, or a technical related fieldFive years experience in accounting, financial analysis, or financial reportingGood communication skills.Excellent interpersonal communications and project management/leadership skillsExcellent desktop skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, MS Access)Desired Qualifications:Five or more years experience in Financial Analysis, modeling and forecastingMBA in Finance

Name: Business Analyst (CRM / Customer)
Description: JOB SCOPE & PURPOSE The Business Analyst creates solution roadmaps and participates in the development of CRM platforms. They will be highly engaged with the client focusing on requirements definition and conceptual solution design. Name: Senior Analyst - Cybersecurity
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce is looking for a Senior Analyst - Cybersecurity with advanced knowledge of business analysis, process modeling and redesign in Dallas, Texas (TX). Name: Sr Investor Services Analyst

Your password must contain 8 characters, 1 upper case letter, 1 number and 1 special character.Check It Out!Ready to be a Cooper too? This might just be right up your alley!  Investor Services Specialist, Senior 8259  The Investor Services Department is responsible for the assigned monthly reconciling for investors which could include FNMA, FHLMC, GNMA, Private Securities or Special Servicing. This includes functions related to loan acquisitions, services releases, corporate and P&I Advance analysis, as well as timely and accurate completion of assigned special projects. The Investor Services Specialist, Senior is responsible for performing complex reconciliations and reporting to Trustees/Master Servicers, in accordance with the terms of the servicing contracts, and may also be asked to peer review work from time to time. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS​ Continuously reviews processes and procedures and recommends new ones to management and other departments within the company to improve the productivity and quality.Strictly adheres to the Agency and Private Investor Servicing Agreements, Regulation AB, USAP and other guidelines for timely and accurate reconciling.Performs reconciliations of the most complex accounts for Agency, Private Securities, or Clearing Accounts, including Test of Expected P&I and T & I.Reconciling accounts within 30 calendar days.Clears reconciling items within 90 days from the point of identification or earlier based on investor guidelines, either through internal wires, escalations or investor adjustmentsPrepares wires and GL entries as needed to clear aged items timely and accurately.Reporting and Accounting Analysts will conduct root cause analysis of issues on the most complex scheduled/scheduled, actual/actual, or scheduled/actual portfolios loan level and reconciliation outages. Provides recommendations to resolve within the Investor Services area and for up-stream processes that negatively impact Investor Services.Provides training on processes to staffMonitors portfolio performance and aged items to ensure that issues are resolved within established policies and procedures, and that P&Ps are updated to prevent recurrence.Performs detailed loan level analysis of loan exceptions, using Excel and various workflow and servicing systemsWorks with departments upstream from Investor Reporting to resolve and prevent breaks that are negatively impacting investor reports or remittances.Special projects as assignedFUNCTIONAL JOB COMPETENCIESIntegrity and Trust: Is widely trusted; is seen as a direct, truthful individual; can present the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner; keeps confidences; admits mistakes; doesn’t misrepresent him/herself for personal gain.Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills that are used in dealings with both internal and external business partners.Investor Service and Client Focus: Understands who the customer is including investors, borrowers and individuals from various internal departments. Takes time to listen and understand the needs of each and looks for ways to resolve issues and offers solutions to problems. Planning and Organizing: Gives suggestions on how to improve processes and/or create efficiencies, conducts daily activities in a planned, organized fashion, and deals with change effectively and able to adapt rapidly; Works with other business units in order to implement process improvements.Maintains positive approach to resolution of issues; Considered trustworthy by both peers and management team; carefully evaluates impact of own actions to Company, investors, employees, and self; Confirms course of action with management team regarding high visibility or sensitive issues. Willingly adds value to team, shares information freely among the team, and communicates with others in a direct, honest, and open manner while maintaining other’s dignity. Moves quickly from receiving information to decisive action; continuously seeks ways to contribute to the success of the team and company overall. Uses failures/mistakes as opportunities to lean and correct, anticipates issues and moves to resolve them. Takes ownership of ones accounts/duties and ensures that issues under their purview are resolved timely and in accordance with departmental standards.EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS5 years of Investor Reporting and Bank Reconciliation is required; Experience or related industry experience preferredBachelor’s Degree specializing in Accounting or Finance or a discipline related to the requirements of the position is preferred; Will consider the equivalent combination of job experience & education that demonstrates the ability to perform the essential functions of this job.High School Diploma or GED is requiredIntermediate to Expert Microsoft ExcelIntermediate in SQLKnowledge of various systems including LSAMs, Microsoft Access, SQL various Agency Applications,Knowledge of bank reconciliation process for test of expected cash, pool to security balancing, and clearing account balancing a plus.Knowledge of GNMA investor reporting a plus.
